description:
This place is very good. 
Food is fab.
The staff is in top of their shit and very nice. 
The food came out quick.
The environment is fab.
I'm so full. The pangang curry had me so wet. Best crab rangoons I've ever had to be honest. 
Maybe the meal was so good because I didn't pay for it.
author: Dylan T.

description:
Recently returned to this SF Thai restaurant, and it is still as savory and delicious as I remember.  The duck curry is spot on.  My secret...order the Crab Fried Rice and ADD DUCK....mind blown.  Brings back those fond memories of Infusion Lounge...

Four stars only because it is street parking only, and you might wind up wandering through some pretty rough neighborhoods to get there (i.e. the Tenderloin). Not exactly family friendly. If there's anything I miss about being a city dweller, it's high quality, hole-in-the-wall specialty cuisine restaurants like this one.
author: Lincoln T.

description:
Literally the only Osha that was able to be courageous enough to add the right amount of spice to my pad Thai. I've been a loyal Osha fan and have visited all of them, but would say that this one had one of the best presentation and portion size. Compared to the one located at 4 Embarcadero, I'd say this one is much better. 

Love a place that has tofu in their pad Thai along with your choice of meat :) they also have $3 beers during happy hour! Definitely can't beat that.
author: My N.

description:
Great food made fresh!  Mon_Wed from 11 am to 12 am offers $3 beers (certain beers)
Staff are extremely nice
author: steve p.

description: The food was very greasy and they give small portions. Osha is a little pricey. They were nice but a little creepy.
author: Leticia S.

description: There was hair in my appetizer that is not a good sign. Not to mention that I payed over $60 on my food but of course I guess that doesn't matter....
author: Gloria K.

description:
Very poor experience. I call to place an order for pickup at 11:05 pm (their website says they are open until midnight on Thursday) and am told that their kitchen closes at 10:30. They tell me I must place my order and then have it sit to wait until the 11:05 pickup (so 30+ minutes of food just sitting). 

This is very poor service and it's misleading when your website says one thing but your employees say another.
author: Chris D.

description: One word FANTASTIC !!! The food was delicious, the service was spot on and the peanut sauce was the best.
author: Greg K.

description:
I had the Spicy Rad Nah here and it was a bit different from the ones I'm used to having but still pretty good. Generally the ones I have are plainer with just a black bean sauce on top of the noodles but this one has a bit more spice as well as a few more veggies.

That being said it has some improvements it could make. The noodles could be cooked a bit better so that they are less broken before the sauce is put on. But other than that the dish was pretty good and I'm sure the other items are rather well made based on what I saw at my table.
author: Tyler T.

description: Best tom yum. Outstanding noodles. Fun staff. Reasonable priced. Clean. What's not to like about this place.
author: Guy S.

description: Holy yummy. This is an excellent place when you're starving and don't mind attacking a beautifully decorated plate. I had the volcanic beef. Oo0h Laawd. It was so delicious and different flavors and the presentation and the different textures. So good. I understand that some people wrote bad reviews, but I personally had a great time, was welcomed taken care of, and didn't get sick. THANK YOU. I'll come back for sure
author: Amin B.

description:
Good portion sizes but really just so-so thai food. I saw the line at the ramen place a few storefronts away and decided on Thai for a late dinner. I probably should have waited the 40 minutes for a really good meal. 

When I was seated the place was 1/3 full and I literally waited for 10 minutes before a server breezed around the corner - I had to flag her down to order. Between my mom and I we ordered the papaya salad (first option) with tofu - it was super tough and hard to chew the tofu! Next we had the shrimp pad see ew with the clear noodles, and the shrimp pad mee krao. The pad see ew was a 3/5, but nothing to write home about. The pad mee krao was the better option between the two, but the noodle to ingredients ratio was too big.
author: Tammy Y.

description: The approach to the restaurant is not the best. once inside the ambience is decent. The food is above average. The spice level is not the usual, lower than other Thai places I ate in. The options for vegetarian food, like most Thai places, are good. If in the neighborhood would go here, but not drive down for this place exclusively. The staff is friendly.
author: Premila M.

description: The best OSHA Thai in the city. Have been coming here for 8 years and not only is the food played gorgeously, it's just as delicious as fresh as it looks! The servers are so kind and it is incredibly clean. We love our neighborhood Thai place!
author: Amy K.

description: Found this spot while we were walking to china town. We love Thai food so we gave it a chance. Got in right when they opened so we were the first customers in there. Great options on the menu. We ordered tofu and shrimp pad Thai with Thai iced tea. Pad Thai was very delicious and portions was great. Thai iced tea was presented with a mason jar which was cool. My wife said it was perfect, but for me I wanted it sweeter. Great place for Thai food.
author: Dante S.

description: I wouldn't order from this place. The food is great, but it's quite infuriating that you call 30 minutes before they close, for an order for pick up, and they refuse to serve you. It's not like I'm asking to sit down and take my time eating. Usually it takes 5 minutes to make Pad Thai and the soup is already made. So why is it that I can't order past 10:30, if they close at 11?
author: Jason Y.

description: This place is our go to Thai place in the city! Delicious food and the Thai tea is amazing
author: Linda R.

description:
Its a great restaurant. Service is very nice and food is good. I ate here couple of times because my friend lives next door, so you can say it was convenient. I didn't know Osha was a chain restaurant, but I see that vibe in it because it doesn't feel super homie and comfortable. 

I would recommend whatever you order make sure they let you know how spicy it is even though on the manu it says mild. I ordered a salad, it said mild and I confirmed with a waitress to make sure its not too spicy, she said its little spicy but not too bad. I could barely eat the salad yet along taste the flavor. It was SUPER spicy. I ended up eating the whole thing because I didn't want to waste it, but I def learned my lesson by not fully trusting waitresses in Thai restaurants about spices. I know we all tolerate spices differently, but that salad was not mild at all.

The food is great but nothing too special or memorable.
author: Galya T.

description: Out of all the osha thais in SF, this is by far the best location. It is also the first restaurant out of all three! I came here with my coworkers and had an amazing lunch. The servers were constantly checking up on us and refilled our water without us having to ask. We had the raw shrimp and angel wings as appetizers. For the main dishes we ordered their volcanic beef, pad thai, and curry fried rice. The beef was tender and savory with a hint of sweetness as well as their pad thai. As for the fried rice, what restaurant messes that up? ‍ Price is way cheaper than the Osha at Embarcadero which I feel caters to a different crowd. Quality/ quantity of food is best at this location as well!
author: Sui N.

description: really fresh vegan food. try the lettuce wraps..tasty.
author: Todd S.

description: This is a gem, my girlfriend and i come here (an hour and a half drive) to enjoy this place together. The calamari is delicious and fresh (no picture cause we always devour it) and the dish we get is a little strange but we love the pad see ew but with silver noodles!
author: Angie B.

description:
Pretty tasty at the onset, maybe because I was starving and hadn't eaten all day, but not awful. The ambiance and cleanliness of restaurant looked much more appealing and inviting online. In the case of pictures lying, I'd venture to say that the pics deceived me. 

Not to mention, there was a couple inside with a hollering baby, and that did not help at all! No fault of the restaurant, of course. I'm just saying- it was awful. Ha!

I wouldn't spread the word about this place, but I'd eat there on a late night after a concert and drinks. 

Hope this helps!
author: Gynelle M.

description:
Wow, this place offers ridiculously excellent service. The food is also good, but the service is like no other! From the moment we walked in the door, we were greeted with nothing other than the biggest grins and kindness from the host and servers. Its almost creepy how seriously nice they all were! lol. 

We were hungry travelers and we ordered a panang curry, spicy eggplant w chicken, and pad knee mao with egg noodle (per our server's suggestion). My dude is really sensitive to spice bc of really bad heartburn, and he was assured that the pad khee mao has no chile/spice. When we were served, his first bite of the noodles (which he said were delicious) was quite spicy. I tried them myself and they had a slight kick. To my beau's sensitive heartburn, that really didn't fare well. We really reluctantly asked our server if there was anything we could exchange it for. He apologized for the dish and right away brought out a pad see ew since it is really without chile. The manager was so kind and apologetic and was periodically checking up on us. I had a coughing fit while i was eating my own dish (I was sick with a cold) and they nearly came rushing to ask me if my dish was too spicy. I can handle my spice and it was really my sickness that threw me into the coughing fit. We were really taken aback by how kind they were and how attentive they were to our sensitivities. Oh and I nearly forgot to mention that the plates are HUGE!!! Im used to paying a much lower price for thai food in Orange County, but bc the plates were so huge here it was really not a big deal. Highly recommend this restaurant!! Delicious, quick turnaround and excellent service from all staff.
author: Heidi A.

description:
After dining here, i can understand why this place has lots of reviews but 3.5 stars only. If you've never had Thai food before, you will like this place. The food is just okay to me. It's not the worst but not the best. You can get the same food elsewhere with a cheaper price. 
Roasted duck curry - sweet
Volcano beef - taste good but the beef was overcooked. It's sweet and spicy
Thai tea - mediocre
author: Ten D.

description:
Truly pleased and fully satisfied with everything that was ordered.
My friend and I ordered and shared different dishes, ALL were cooked well and beautifully presented.
I m quiet picky when it comes to sea food, for me it just has to be cooked well.
ALL of it was impeccably cooked to perfection yet they were extremely busy.
Service was fine, not extra attentive though, a bit rushed and cold , but their food overcomes it and still get me to give it 5stars without a doubt.


Coconut based sea food
TOM KHA,  it's delicious. Sea food was well cooked, various and abundant! Was my friend choice but I would probably reorder it!

Crunchy calamari 8$ish 
SO SO SO GOOD!!! Cooked to perfection! Asked for the siracha cream sauce on the side sauce on the side , it was a bit spicy but paired wonderfully with the calamari and was very pleasing. 
Would definitely Reorder this! 
In my honest opinion, A MuST try

Mango Salad:
Delicate , tasty, just an explosion of flavor in the mouth! Comes with abundant grilled prawns , also very well cooked. It's quiet spicy but balanced by the sweet and crunchy mango.
Would recommend and reorder it for sure!

Crisp Salmon ( chef specials menu ) 18$ish
Lightly fried , very well prepared, juicy and simply delish it's Crispy salmon topped with tamarind-caramelized onion sauce, cilantro. Have asked for the sauce on the side. And a side of STICKY RICE (definitely the stickiest rice I have ever had!!!) 
Would absolutely recommend and reorder it over and over again. 
It was really a party in my mouth!!!

Angry prawns , chef specials menu:
Sautéed river prawns with red curry paste, bell peppers, kaffir lime leaf served over 
fried eggplant. My friend order a side of brown rice (best brown rice everrr!)
Good dish , probably my least favorite though but prawns were impeccably cooked and good and eggplant were really really tasty, soft mouth melting like!

If you haven't tried this place, well you are missing out on a food experience made of tasty, colorful, perfectly cooked and artistically presented UNIQUE dishes!
Can't wait to come back!!!

Update!!
Went back during a busy busy weekend and well... this place still deserves its 5stars!!!

Tried new dish:

Special chef menu:
Spicy cat fish. Not so spicy for me and my Korean friend! However very good! Eggplant were soft and yummy , curry sauce was delicate but tasty! We both loved it.
SIDES :
She chose EGGS FRIED RICE , Yummiiii
I went for the COCONUT RICE , also very delish!!! 

Cannot recommend this place enough!!!
author: Hosna A.

description:
On a Saturday night at 2 am after a Halloween party. I guess this is where many party goers came to refuel. 

As expected and usual on a weekend it's packed . For a party of 3 we waited for 30 minutes for our table. 

Sat us in the back lower level eating area, last table next to the bathroom. 

Would have been a 4 stars reviews. Except when ever someone needs to use the restroom they line up next to our table. when the bathroom door opens and closes I can smell the stench of the bathroom odors. ;( and noticed every time the door is opened I can see the men's urinal , saw the garbage was over flow with paper towels scattered all over the floors.

With that I lost my appetite, didn't even eat half of my food. Yuk!!!!! My two other guests did mentioned the horrendous smells and they couldn't consumed their food either.

For any future patrons avoid sitting at the way back tables to your right hand side facing the toilet. 

You been warned!!!!!!
author: Vuoch. L.

description:
Food was a 3.5, but service was so good that I'm going to to round it up to a 4.0.

I came to Osha Thai on a Saturday night with a couple of friends who were craving Thai food. I was glad to find that the menu had so many vegetarian options! Yay :D I was so conflicted about what I wanted and was really torn between a noodle soup and tom kha and was super happy that they had a tom kha noodle soup! I went with the tom kha noodle soup with egg noodles. Portion wise, the dish was HUGE and super filling. Flavor wise, the tom kha was not as crisp as I would have liked and the coconut flavor was somewhat muddled and almost diluted. The egg noodles were also a tad bit overcooked. 

Service was great and our waiter dropped by multiple times, kept our waters refilled, and made sure that we had a great dinner.
author: Lakshmi M.

description: Had a great meal here a few days back, I had their signature Tom yum soup and it was delicious. The service was kind and attentive and my friend was well pleased with her meal as well. Will be back.
author: Lovely L.

description:
Starving after a late night out, my friends and I found ourselves here. Luckily we didn't have to wait - our group of 7 was seated immediately.

We ordered a bunch of plates to share:
- Several plates of pad khee mao
- Panang curry
- Green curry
- Pumpkin curry
- Pineapple fried rice
- Mixed veggies over rice
- Angel wings

Tbh I was starving (and still pretty tipsy) so everything tasted bomb to me LOL. The spicy pad khee mao was actually pretty spicy, so if you aren't a fan of spicy food then beware. I didn't try much of the curries or fried rice, but the angel wings were by far my favorite! They were sweet and sticky and delicious :3

I think our check came out to around $155. It's pricier than I would have liked to pay for late night food, but I can't say it wasn't worth it. The service was quick and I had leftovers to eat the next day.
author: Kathy K.

description:
Osha Thai is the perfect place to get your late night Thai food fix! I used to frequent this place after fun druken nights at the bar and club. There are several different locations in the city, but I've only come to this location because it's open until 3 am on Friday and Saturday nights (and until midnight on other nights)! Naturally the parking sucks around these parts, but it's nothing that a Bart train and a short Uber or Lyft ride can't fix.

My go to dish here is the crab fried rice and the mango and sticky rice for dessert (mmm!). Pair that with some sweet Thai iced tea and you're sure to die from a happy sugar overload! But really, it's just too good. The service is pretty standard and quick here despite it being one of the busier locations. Since there aren't too many food options available in the wee hours of the morning (other than fast food), this place can get packed. Be prepared to wait if you decide to come during the "after the club munchies" peak hours.

As far as price points go, I would say that this place is pretty reasonable for the city. The rice plates can run you about anywhere from $11-$15 and dessert about $5. I usually always end up taking leftovers home because eyes are always bigger than my stomach. They provide decent portion sizes for the price. If you're craving some late night grub (or some decent Thai food in general) and don't want to settle for fast food, hit up Osha Thai if you're in the Nob Hill area!
author: Shayla B.

description:
Came here for a quick team lunch outing and wasn't disappointed. Ordered the bacon wrapped scallops and the crab Rangoon for appetizers and I had the crispy chicken fried rice. 

The bacon wrapped scallops were awesome! Loved the sauce that they were sitting in and the Smokey flavor of the bacon. The crab Rangoon was decent, nothing extraordinary. My main lunch dish, which was the fried chicken with fried rice was alright. The fried rice had good flavor. but the chicken wasn't as crispy as I liked it-They were kind of flimsy and mushy. 

All and all, it's not a bad place to satisfy your thai cravings. Customer service was good. 

Would I be back? Most likely but I would like to try the other location.
author: Michael T.

description: They dont play peanut butter and country chicken is so great with the tom yun soup really appreciate all the work.
author: Ahmad M.

description: We had the best and quickest Thai  meal I've ever had outside of Thailand. Killed it! It was out of control how fast they made the food such quality food. Can't wait to return!
author: Ellary C.

description:
This was my first time at OSHA Thai and it definitely won't be my last. Everything from the service to the food was incredible. 

We ordered a yellow curry dish, some wings, a pad see yew dish (arguably the best I've had) and a few other things I'm forgetting at the moment. Bottomline, it was FANTASTIC. 

Would highly recommend if you enjoy Thai food.
author: James D.

description:
I ordered the green curry with egg fried rice and Tom yum soup. The soup was just brilliant !
Fresh rolls were bland !
Would definitely recommend this place for fine Thai dining !
author: Shristy A.

description: Local favorite. Been going here for a decade. The pad see ew and thom yum are awesome. You don't have to wait in line for good food, open really late which I like
author: Christopher J.

description:
The thai tea is served in a mason jar with crushed ice. Very pretty presentation! The tea was crisp, fresh, and had a good proportion of milk and thai tea base...making that scrumptious orange color upon stirring. 

The Tom Kha soup was ENORMOUS! There are two options for size with their soups. Bowl and cup. And I will say. The bowl is almost big enough to swim in. $13 buys a lotta soup here. The Tom Kha has white mushrooms with a coconut base and sprinkled with scallions. The soup has a nice amount of zing that one expects with Thai soup. 

I wouldn't recommend going to Osha too late at night (since it's in the Tenderloin). I was there in the daytime and my party was seated immediately. So there's a win-win with going to Osha earlier. Miss the crowds and the shadiness of being in the Tenderloin at night. 

Bottom Line: Solid Thai food in the Tenderloin.
author: Jaime W.

description:
The food was super fresh, and tasted great. The potions were HUGE for the price. Everywhere else in San Fran was a bit pricey so we were glad to have found a place with all day happy hour & 3$ beers. Our server was a pretty short woman who was super friendly. Or food came to the table in a quick fashion & our drinks were always filled. 

I am super happy to have found this Thai place in San Fran. Next time I visit I will be sure to go back!
author: Ana M.

description: Food here is really good. Both from its looking and taste. Best thing of this restaurant is you don't need to wait in line. Mensho Tokyo which recommend by Michelin is just next with a long queue. I tried both but I think this Thai restaurant is much better.
author: Yiqiong Z.

description: I would give it 3.5 stars...Came here on a whim. This place had great service. Everyone was really nice and helpful. The food was ok. We had their tuna tartare and Thai samosa for apps. The tartare was delish and had a kick to it. The samosa was good too with a slight curry taste and pastry dough was nicely fried and buttery. For our main entrees we tried the short ribs and pad Thai. The ribs were great tasting and a generous portion! I would recommend and would get again. The pad Thai was ok. Not worth getting again. Too saucy/greasy for my taste.
author: Daniela B.

description: Decent, quick Thai food available. Nothing spectacular, but safe and familiar.
author: Kimberly H.

description: I love this place! Every dish is beautifully presented and tastes so delicious.  Some of my favorites include the Volcano Beef and Pad Thai.  This time I ordered the duck curry and pumpkin curry with prawn.  They were perfectly seasoned, and definitely satisfied my curry craving!  I also like that it stays open late too, making meals there super convenient.
author: Phan ..

description: We just happened to run into this restaurant and we were so happy about it. The staff and food was amazing. I really enjoyed the presentation in the food but most of all the taste. I had the Tom yum with small rice noodles which was easily the best I've had. I can't wait to go back and try more!!
author: Selena P.

description:
Maybe it was an off day. But my favorite thai lunch place has fallen some. But then, the standard was high-- high high.
This place has been a pilgrimage and a ritual. Hike up Geary from Union Square and settle into the bench and engage nose and mouth.    I've sent many there for a great Thai lunch- real and vibrant sauces and flavors that leap.

But this lunch failed me there. It was good, it was fine, it was OK, but it was not transcendent.   Maybe it might be next time. Or maybe the era passed.    Undecided if i'll still make the needed detours, every time I'm in town.
author: Z H.

description: I ordered panang curry, which was super yummy! It was the best panang curry I've ever had. Although, I was used to having the bamboo shoots be cut smaller and more chicken in it. My boyfriend ordered beef pad see ew with no broccoli and we both thought it was really delicious as well and good portion. He also got thai tea, which tasted good but the mason jar was filled with ice. I would recommend them to put less ice. Overall, good service and delicious food.
author: Mae C.

description: Great Thai food, good selection of the national dishes. They keep open quite late which makes it good spot for a late bite. And they serve food with lovely Orchid flower :)
author: Diana B.

description: Amazingly fast service right in the middle of the city, and not to mention the classy decor. The Pad Thai is excellent, and the drinks are very affordable. Will definitely visit next time I'm in SF
author: Ben M.

description: I would say the food is a 3 and the service is a 5 star. The pad thai was decent and my friend ordered the green curry and I felt the same. BUT for a late night spot, it was amazing! Super great service. Quick, efficient and affordable. Better than eating late night junk pizza!
author: Christine N.

description: The Spicy Eggplant dinner was AWESOME!!  Great flavor infusion and a good portion size.  Staff was a bit slow as it was Friday night and it was crowded.
author: Denise G.

description: Veg noodle soup was horrible. I did not order anything else after that. The veggies were not cooked enough.
author: Nikunj K.

description:
Osha Thai is a pretty good option for Thai food in the city. However, I'm not here to talk about that--believe it or not. Ha. I'm here to talk about how Osha Thai came through for us in a real time pinch. They made it work, and for that effort, they deserve 4-stars in my book.

On a group lunch outing with my colleagues, we were having a hard time finding a spot for lunch that fit everyone's needs and could get us all in and out within a very short time frame. That's pretty tough to do during the SF lunch hour. After waiting in line at a salad/sandwich type spot, the group of us about 5 of us decided to cut our losses and walk down to Osha. When we explained at the door that we needed to be out the door in under 40 minutes, I was not expecting to be accommodated. To my surprise, they seemed totally down to make this happen for us. So, we headed in. 

I think I got something like pad kee mao. I don't think that's what they called it on the menu, but I knew that was what it was. It was pretty tasty, came out quickly AND the veggies still had a bit of a crunch to them. Yum. Everyone else seemed to like their food, too. Was it the best Thai food I'd ever had? No, but it was darn tasty! 

And, believe it or not, we were done and walking back to the office in just the right amount of time. The staff really went above and beyond to make sure we were happy and served quickly. That kind of customer service makes me want to come back again and again--when I'm in town, that is. Thanks, Osha!
author: Cara L.

description: The best of the best. I have been coming here for more than 20 years. Osha is the bomb. If you like sweet, spicy and sour, you must try the Osha tom yum noodles.
author: Irene T.

description:
I never knew this location of Osha Thai existed in SF until I visited late one night after a work event. It's much less ornate and definitely doesn't exude the same trendiness factor that its sister restaurants do. With hesitation, I dined here and was pleasantly surprised to find that the food quality and flavor is consistent and just as amazing as always.

Despite the food being memorable, the location is definitely a bit borderline in the shady area of SF, so just beware. Don't get stuck in the secondary dining room (like we did), because you will be forgotten (we were). We had to flag down the server to place an order, for water refills, and for the check. Kind of annoying. In addition, Heat didn't seem to exist in that secondary dining room - we were freezing dining here at around 10pm. Good thing we had bowls of soup and hot food on the table.

Three stars for location, service, and ambiance.
Four starts for the food.
author: Mansi A.

description: Nice environment. Tasty food. Generous helping and plated beautifully. A great Thai food experience in SF!
author: Sarah R.

description: Amazing service. They filled our water multiple times before we even got our food. We were a loud and drunk crowd but they still have us very good service! The waiter had great recommendations on what kind of noodles to order and the spiciness level we should try. This spot is a must go for Thai noodles! Quick, tasty and fair prices.
author: Davis K.

description:
I ordered delivery via Yelp Eat24, on a Friday night. That's likely where I went wrong. The quality of the food was spot on: as you'd expect from Osha. Pad see-ew was notably a high point, and the spicy green beans are good enough to be a staple for every order. 

The delivery was the issue here. Cramming food containers into a bike messenger bag is a disaster. One of the containers broke and leaked sauce everywhere. Probably worse for the messenger than for me, but this should not continue. Innovation is required. Maybe someone at Yelp can "hack" a solution to the stop-gap of delivering food in a backpack. Ridiculous.

But, I still ate everything, so, was it that bad?
author: Andrew H.

description: Something different, but filling and yummy! Ive only tried Thai food one time before Osha and wasn't a fan, decided to give it another try and Im glad I did! I ordered the Taretare and BBQ chicken over fried rice, delicious!! The tartare was veeeeeeery spicy, if you love spicy tuna this is a must try. It's served with these colorful chip crackers. The bbq chicken and rice were also very tasteful.
author: Victoria C.

description:
It works.  It's not the best place for Thai, but it works.  What you pay for convenience you sacrifice in ambiance. 

Osha Thai caters to the downtown folks who are in a hurry, who are drunk, or who just want good quick food that won't break the bank.  

Just don't tell my Thai friends I eat here.
author: Ron L.

description:
I am disappointed because I did not receive what I ordered. 

I ordered pad khee mao (via postmates) and I got something totally off! I also asked for it to be spicy and this was not AT ALL.
author: Pelumi A.

description: I thought that this place is nice, but then something unacceptable happened with me. Me and my friend ordered for curry and noodles and then got it packed because we wanted to have tom yum soup, all my excitement went down to drain when I found a small insect right in first bite of the soup. Absolutely unhygienic, moreover the staff wasn't even courteous to even apologise for the same. I'm so disappointed with this place.
author: Shubhi K.

description: I found this restaurant by typing "vegetarian" in the field. The menu has lots of meat, chicken, fish and seafood throughout. So, after finding out the curries all have crab paste in them, I ordered a tofu rice bowl that was supposed to be vegetarian. It tasted VERY fishy. I think it was the tofu, so I just ate around it. Too bad, because this place is kind of cool.
author: Julie W.

description: This is the best Thai place in the USA. When you first walk in, it can seem sketchy, but their food is the absolute best. So incredible.
author: Ashley S.

description: Yum! On a whim stepped inside. Really yummy pumpkin curry, pad Thai, and Pad see ew (sp?) Would have liked a larger cocktail menu or hot sake (the cold cloudy sake was a new experience), but other than that it was a delicious little surprise.
author: Lynda B.

description: Ate lunch at this Geary and Leavenworth location. Items ordered were just as tasty as their other locations. The Country fried chicken with rice was very good. The Tom Yum Muah was good. Decor relatively clean.
author: Clifford W.

description:
Me and my boyfriend are visiting from Sacramento for the weekend for my birthday. We just checked in to our hotel and yelp Thai restaurant up, and this one popped up. The pictures looked good, which that's what I usually look at for a restaurant. 
The ladies there are very sweet and friendly! Since it was our first time they were very helpful. One thing I really liked was the lady who took our order actually repeated the order a few times just to make sure everything was correct which most places don't always do. 
The food was very good! My boyfriend had the pad thai with shrimp and I had the Tom yum thick noodles. And a side of sticky rice. Everything tastes good. Very satisfied! We will be back!!!
author: Jennifer L.

description: The food was amazing and the service was great. Would definitely go back! The pad thai and fried ice cream tasted great.
author: Ana C.

description:
Not my favorite Osha location, but it will get the job done. I ordered Pad Thai with chicken, my boyfriend got curry. While the plate was displayed really beautifully, my dish was really runny and the sauce tasted more fishy than peanuty. Since it was so runny it didn't stick to the noodles well at all either.

Our waiter was often missing, we ended up having a few other waiters chip in when they noticed our drinks were in need of a refill. Overall it was an alright experience, but definitely not the standard I was expecting from the 2nd and 3rd street locations.
author: Kristen T.

description: The food here is pretty solid.  The Pad see Ew wasn't too salty like it can be at some Thai restaruants.  I'd say the food is on par with Thailand.  The Veggie Fried Rice was good too.  Although the prices are pretty high for the cuisine and location, we enjoyed ourselves.  The service was good.
author: Richard T.

description:
A salute to an SF institution, a true essential, a purveyor of Thai food so renowned it's famous for being famous--and almost equally famous for being unjustifiably famous. Among new arrivals to our fair city it's almost Pavlovian: Mention Thai food, and the recently self-styled expert will immediately bring up Osha Thai. Where else? It's almost the perfect tell for identifying people who don't know one one bit about what they're talking about, but very fervently want you to believe that they do. I would sooner go to Lers Ros, or iThai, or Lalita, or House of Thai, or King of Thai Noodle, or even roll the dice on that newish Tycoon place around the corner. And yet I wind up here often enough.

A few memories have accumulated themselves over the years, but perhaps my favorite comes from an ill-fated first date with a well-established professional perhaps ten years my senior who invited me here for an evening repast, then opened her laptop on the dinner table--after a suitable interrogation to establish needful details about the date and circumstances of my birth--to facilitate the reading of my star chart followed by stern advice on my impending future, all in advance of an invitation to chauffeur said professional and various friends from restaurant to party to home to cafe all over the city. (I hadn't offered.) A true gem of a moment that will stay with me through the ages...

Oh yes, the food. It is a restaurant, after all. Mediocre at worst, and at best. I really can't say enough about how simultaneously inoffensive and uninspired it is. It is truly the pinnacle of averageness, the height of moderate success, the Michael Jordan of mediocrity. I wouldn't take anyone here that I wanted to impress, or to offend. In fairness when it arrives at the table the food is generally very pretty, or at least above average, which is mostly true of the interior design, and of the other youngish patrons. Not bad to look at, and pleasant enough.

But it's still just not very good. One could call it the Dave Matthews Band of exotic San Francisco cuisine. On my last visit I ordered the pad thai with prawns, a standard $2 upgrade. Technically there were five or six prawns, on the smaller side of medium, piled atop the mound of peanut butter-tasting noodles. At first I thought the crushed peanuts made it taste like crunchy peanut butter, but after sampling the side without any crushed peanuts, the dish revealed itself as peanut butter all the way through. I didn't prefer the creamy to the crunchy, or the crunchy to the creamy, and the peanut butter didn't entirely dominate, except that when the sticky sweet peanut flavor finally dissipated it didn't taste like much at all. I torched the rest with red pepper sauce and mostly enjoyed not particularly enjoying my meal. It's hard to complain, and yet you're left wondering, why? It's like the Neil Diamond of Thai restaurant experiences--and that pad thai is its Sweet Caroline.

I should hasten to add that the people who work here are always very attentive, very cheerful, and extremely polite. And they're open mad late and have booze in a boozy neighborhood, so I can see a good part of the appeal. By all means go, have a great time, and then you can tell the next wave of new San Franciscans all about the Thai restaurant that they just have to try!
author: James D.

description:
Why 5 stars? In this sleepy city, any restaurant that serves edible food until 3 am deserves it. But this place is one star better: everything we've ever ordered (tuna tartare, Tom yum soup, som tum (papaya salad), duck noodle soup, pad Thai, spicy eggplant, pumpkin curry... you can't go wrong. 
Location is on corner of Geary and Leavenworth, easy to find. Service is fast and friendly. Ambience is bright. Booth seating available.
Lots of mixed drinks, wine and beer options. And try the mango and sticky rice for dessert.
And to top it off: won't break the bank!
author: Liana T.

description:
Osha on Geary & Leavenworth, most definitely owns Triple OG status when it comes to Thai food in San Francisco. This is the original Osha. The one that started it all. 

Truthfully, I feel that this Osha was one of the original Thai spots that got the Thai food craze if SF poppin off. 
Back in the day when I was living 2 blocks away & this place first opened I was in here at least twice a week. No lie. The food has always been delicious & on point every time. It's not the best (anymore) but it holds OG status so you gotta show respect.  

I have so many good memories of this spot I wouldn't know where to begin or end. 
Osha on GL Forever.
author: Gilbey G.

description:
Ordered angel wings and Tom kha w/ prawn for take out. Waited 2-3 min at front for woman to acknowledge me (she was counting money).

Angel wings tasted off (defrosted?) and were in a sticky sweet sauce-not spicy at all as I was hoping. Tom kha was tasty but needed more veggies and prawn. Was mostly the coconut milk broth. Also missing a kick of spice.

$20 later for two items and not really satisfied.
author: Semuteh F.

description: Decent Thai food. I didn't think that it was something that I couldn't get somewhere else. There was nothing wrong with the food it was pretty good but I didn't blow me out of the water.
author: Katherine C.

description: We ordered take out the other evening, this was the worst food ever. The beef was so rough to eat, chewy and had to fight with it. the rice, they even messed up. Soft and overcooked. Horrible.
author: The Style R.

description: This review is from a vegetarian's perspective. The choices are pretty limited and a lot of the seemingly vegetarian dishes aren't actually vegetarian because they contain chicken broth or fish sauce. So you need to ask very specifically. We ordered the vegetarian yellow curry and Pad see ew noodles. The curry was nice - great taste and flavours. The noodles were not nice. At all. They were super greasy - lots of oil on the plate, on the noodles, etc and pretty bland. You had to add a lot of chilli sauce to get anything out of it. We ended up leaving most of it because of the greasiness. For the price, the food and vegetarian options could definitely be better.
author: Anita S.

description:
This is my favorite Thai cafe so far!
I'm not a big fan of Thai food actually.
First Thai Restaurant was Be My Guest at Geary and it was awful!
Since my parents are Thai food lovers, so they usually buy the food from King of Thai noodle.
Yesterday I went here with my friends and I tried the chicken with fried garlic and pepper.
The service was great!
The food! Fabulous! 
My 4 other friends tried Fried Chicken (SO DARN GOOD), Thai Fried Rice (Tasty too!), Duck Curry (not a big fan of duck, and it's too sweet for me).
Conclusion, the best are Fried Chicken and Chicken with fried garlic and pepper.
I also brought home the crab fried rice and she loves it!
author: Candice L.

description:
I wanted papaya salad. Since my go to neighborhood Thai place has been a let down as of late, I wanted to try a new place. I realized I hadn't been to the Osha on Geary in almost a decade, so the roommate and I decided to order delivery for dinner. It was Sunday, November 1st. We placed our order through Caviar a couple minutes after 7pm. It arrived within the predicted time window, a little before 8:45pm. Prices below are what I paid using Caviar. All dishes were priced about 5% higher with the sides of rice being 6.67% - 7.5% higher.

*Tom yum: spicy and sour soup, lemongrass, galangal, kaffir lime leaf, mushroom and tomatoes ($13.65 bowl), Prawn (+$2.10)
*Pad thai: wok-fried medium rice noodle, tofu, egg, bean sprout, chives, no crushed peanuts, Chicken ($12.55)
*Som-Tum Poo: shredded green papaya, long green bean, Thai eggplant, salty crab, fresh garlic, Thai chili, tomatoes with spicy lime dressing, original Thai style ($10.50)
*Thai fried rice: egg, tomatoes, garlic, onions and green onions ($12.55), Duck (+$3.15)
*Pumpkin curry: kabocha squash, bell peppers, bamboo shoots and sweet basil in red curry, Chicken ($14.65 a la carte)
*Steamed white rice ($2.15)
*Brown rice ($3.20)

I loved the papaya salad, but it was a little too fishy for the roommate. I think they added fermented fish water? I love my papaya salad super spicy and fishy, so I thought it was great! The pad thai was also delish! The noodles were cooked perfectly. The pumpkin curry had great flavor, but it was a little too runny for me. I love thick curries. The soup was super sour so it brought out a sweetness in it I didn't really like. I wish it were spicier. I wanted to like the fried rice, but unfortunately it was rather mushy. The sides of rice were bigger than expected which was much appreciated.

I remember coming here to grab Thai food back in the day after clubbing. Osha provided sustenance after dancing the night away. Glad to know the food is still pretty solid. Even without my alcohol goggles!
author: Elena N.

description: Very clean restaurant with good service and good food.  Reasonably priced too.  My husband and I both ate dinner for $25.
author: Janean S.

description: We popped in at about 1045 because their hours online said they were open until midnight but they are only open until 11. They let us order Togo but we could only order fried food or stir fry. We order their crab Rangoon's which were a bit too crispy but would have been the best rangroons had it not been for that. We also ordered the chicken fried rice. Had absolutely no flavor at all. It was basically steamed rice with chicken, egg and onion. Decided it wasn't worth the calories to finish so we just threw it away. One star was for the Rangoon and the other star was for how polite they were and their customer service.
author: Denise I.

description: This is definitely the best Osha location in the city. The staff is super friendly and very quick. Their Panang Curry is the perfect level of spice and traditional flavor. Their Tom Yum soup is the BEST one I have ever had. So many restaurants can't get the right amount of sour in the soup but they have go it down perfectly. The Crab Rangoon is fully filled and worth every penny. Everything is reasonably priced for a Thai restaurant in the city.
author: Madison L.

description: I love Osha Thai! The food is above average and I love so many items on the menu. It is easy for me and my vegan daughter to eat here; there is something for everyone! The Tom Kha soup is one of my favorites, and I love the mango salad! It is a neighborhood gem!
author: Sheila K.

description:
This hit the spot on a cool night visiting. Veggie rolls were so good, but beware of how hot they are, don't burn your mouth! 

The Pad Thai was terrific, and the Tom Yum hit the spot!l. Perfect in between for tangy and rich. Wish we lived near here to enjoy it all the time!
author: Sarah S.

description: My friends and I loved this place. We were trying to find a place to eat late at night on a Friday and we were going to the sushi place next to it but there was line. Osha was open, no line and looked good. Staff was super friendly, food was done super fast and was delicious. Recommend. My friend had the green noodles and I had a rice plate. A+
author: Gabriela G.

description: SO delicious. People are waiting out the door for ramen restaurant next door but this place is definitely the place to be! So underrated. Had the Tom kah noodle and it was perfection. Five stars for sure!
author: Sarah D.

description:
Mensho was too packed so we came here instead for a late dinner. My bf got the chicken pad see ew and I had the osha tom yum noodle soup.

Portions were good and taste was ok. Super average in my opinion. I felt my tom yum soup wasn't as flavorful as some of the other Thai spots in the city. It was also extra sour.

Prices were ok, probably on the higher side for Thai food in the tenderloin. I wouldn't go out of my way to come back but would be down if it was for convenience.
author: Sophia H.

description: I recommend you stay away from here at all cost. I work around the corner and instead of going to grub stake I drove over to Osha. I arrived at 2:35 and their employees informed me they were already closed and may only get to go. I'm only writing this yelp review because this is not the first time their employees have told me this and others should know about this experience.
author: Judith R.

description: Very mediocre. It was not terrible, but I would recommend you try another place. You're not missing anything here.
author: William Z.

description:
Generally had a good experience but one incident with undercooked chicken means I can't recommend this restaurant in good conscience. 

We ordered the Som-Tum Thai salad and the 5 spice chicken. Drinks were great (and reasonably priced) and service was prompt. The papaya salad that came with the chicken was great, but the disaster struck when I turned my attention to the chicken. Partway through eating it, I realized the texture was off and looked down to see that the middle was completely red and raw. The restaurant was quite apologetic and took my plate, and brought it back fully cooked (erring on the side of overcooking, so it was a bit tough) but it kind of ruined the mood and I'll be spending the next 48 hours praying that every stomach gurgle is my imagination, not the precursor to something worse. 

Outside of this though, everything else was great, and accidents happen!
author: Marcus S.

description:
This place is delicious! Then again, I'm still sobering up after the rave, but still good. Service was on point and they made my papaya salad Thai spicy, just the way I asked for it. Yum!! Definitely a place to check out!! 

Pro:
** Vegetarian options available
author: Nicole S.

description: I am always happy with this place! Their green curry with Thai pumpkin is bomb.com and they always have friendly service. Warning on delivery: if you ask for it spicy, it's going to spicy AF! Not mad though :)
author: Scarlette T.

description: Been here after a night out several times, and once pre-drinks. Good either way! Not amazing thai food but definitely better and less Americanized than other places.
author: Preet C.

description: This place is so amazing. The food is fantastic. The drinks are fantastic. The wait staff is fantastic. They take your order and the food comes quickly. The food is amazingly fresh. The ambiance is amazing. The aesthetic is to die for. Unlike other restaurants in the area, there is always a seat available.
author: Matt V.

description:
I loved it-!
Had the red curry and tom kha. 
Certainly wished I lived closer. 
Thanks.
author: Clyde C.

description: My friend took me there after a viewing a film.  My friend had the green curry rice( not on the menu). I  had the Pad See Ew with prawns.The food was very good however there were very few prawns. The service was okay but one of them was a tad bossy with her coworker. I think the seating  and decor was cold and uninviting.
author: Lydia V.

description:
Came here for a later dinner at 9pm on the weekend. I got the Tom Yum noodle soup, which is my basic noodle soup of choice at any Thai restaurant. The soup itself was slightly on the salty side but generally very flavorful. Included a decent amount of meat but not much in the form of veggies. For $14 a bowl, it's okay for San Francisco prices.

I can see myself coming back here if I was hungry and nearby but I won't go out of my way to come here again.
author: Cassie Z.

description: Great Food with authentic taste and definitely great prices !!! We had the fresh spring rolls, chicken pad thai and chicken pad see ew. All ingredients were fresh and the presentation was flawless. We arrived a little after 1pm so it wasn't too much busy. After a long morning of traveling from Chicago this place hit the spot. Must try for sure!
author: Diana R.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here from Toronto and decided to just walk into the first restaurant we saw, not really expecting much. We were quite happy overall with the food, service, and decor, but the portions were on the smaller side and slightly pricier for what they're providing.
We ordered a chicken noodle in soup ($10.95) and crab fried rice (14.95). The noodles lacked a bit in flavour but we fixed that ourselves with their condiments that we had full access to at our table which was very convenient. The fried rice was absolutely delicious. Flavours were amazing and the rice was cooked very well, not too soggy and not too hard. However, I wish there was more crab in it, though the flavours did make up for it.
The service was very quick, with a welcome the moment we walked in and were seated immediately, and the food arrived promptly once we ordered. Overall good experience, but we probably could have ordered a starter to fill us up a bit more, but considering the price, that was not going to happen.
author: Melanie Y.

description: I have been here many times because is close where I live, experience a great service all the time and the food is good but here comes the BUT for my birthday my brother in law invited me for dinner and I choose this place, everything perfect until my in law payed the bill , were sitting preparing to leave when one of the guys told us to leave  because they guest waiting, that is very rude, because we were not killing time there we just paid the bill, definitely I am not going back
author: Manfredo R.

description: From what I remember, had a pretty ratchet drunchies experience here after a night out. Pad thai was really bad, flavors were really off for the dishes I tried but portions were big. Worse than the Soma location.
author: Chelsea W.

description: The bacon wrapped scallops was the highlight of my experience here. Bacon was cooked too perfection and the scallops were not overcooked. I ordered Pad Kee Mao and my friend ordered Pepper chicken. I tried the pepper chicken and it was very simple yet very mouth watering. Pad kee mao was not as flavorful as I have had at other Thai places. For that reason I'm giving 4 stars instead 5 stars. Really good waiters here.
author: Billy N.

description: I can honestly say that any Osha restaurant (not including "After Osha") is the best Thai food restaurant chain! I prefer this location particularly because it is priced lower than the other Oshas (like at Embarcadero & 3rd Street), while still maintaining the high quality taste and preparation of the food! Be sure to order the mango sticky rice here for dessert, you won't regret it!
author: Victoria T.

description:
Elena N. teases me how I will only crave pizza after a night of drinking.

That's not true.

This review is proof that I crave for other foods other than dough that's covered in cheese and sauce.

In fact, a well prepared, made to order food that's not sitting under a heat lamp is exactly what you need to put in your stomach after assaulting it with abrasive liquor (I love you gin!!!)

This is Osha Thai's first location ever in SF and since 1996, they've been serving drunkards til 3am on Friday and Saturday nights. Yes, the food DOES taste "authentic" but only when tipsy. DO get the pineapple fried rice, the pad see ew and throw in some starters like crispy tofu and chicken satay. The presentations are pretty, but you probably won't even notice in your drunken stupor.

Don't worry about the so-so service since the staff is hustlin to feed the late night crowd. But thanks to them, you won't have to settle for $5 microwave Digiorno's pizza at home.

P.S. 
Psst. Milano pizza is only 0.3 miles away from here...
author: Janice C.

description: I love Thai food so i cannot complain. This is always a great place for Thai food. I love their noodle and rice dishes. Papaya salad is great as well. No complaints here!
author: Meishi M.

description:
You know a restaurant is not that great when you're drunk and can still tell that the food is meh. The only times I've ever been to this Osha have been in that situation.

The other day, we left the club a little early and got to Osha before 2am. I ordered Tom Kha Noodle Soup, thinking that it would help soak everything up. The positive is that medium spicy actually felt like Thai-level spicy versus Americanized spicy. It almost made me cry. The negative is that the soup tasted bland for Tom Kha. Unlike most Thai food I've had, this soup clearly lacked depth. It was disappointing. Luckily, it was also free to me.
author: Yi Z.

description:
This place is absolutely delicious!!!! Don't hesitate any longer, go eat. 

The service was 5 stars. Everyone at the restaurant paid attention to us. It was a wonderful atmosphere.
author: Lukasz P.

description: Very bad pad ki mao with seafood i would never order from this place again. The seafood was very bad quality and cooking, the sauce was bad the noodles were tasteless. I ordered thai tea and coffee without ice so they sent me the package with less liquid to compensate for the volume of a few ice cubes!!!
author: Marten P.

description: The food is always good here, but also over-priced. We came here last weekend and the service was ok, although at times we felt rushed to order and that the waitress was impatient. Additionally, my entree came out 10 minutes before my boyfriends, which is really unprofessional.
author: Sabra M.

description:
Last night I had the tom kha noodle soup with pork. The noodles were in a big over cooked lump in the middle of this very sweet coconut sauce. The pork was in white strips. There were no vegetables or other seasonings in the soup at all, except for one piece of lettuce. 

This soup was not just lower quality than what you'd get at any of the many other Thai places nearby, it was one of the worst things I've ever had in a restaurant. There was no seasoning in the broth or the on the pork. All you could taste was sweet and poorly made coconut. If you asked a 12 year old kid who had never cooked before to just to pull a recipe for tom kha off the Internet and make it, you would get a better soup. This was stunningly bad.
author: Oskar B.

description:
It's a decent little spot for the price. Good portion sizes. 
Warning: spicy is 
I usually love spice but this was like fire in my mouth. 
Still ate my Phad Thai though
author: Maggie A.

description:
I came back home late after my dance classes and needed something to eat - this place was calling me with the colorful led lights. I decided that it would be perfect late night dinner place. 

My favorite Thai dish is papaya salad, and I just came back from Ko Samui (Thailand) last week too, so why not to honor my recent travel destination by ordering what I love the most? 

I asked for medium spice.

What I got was a mediocre salad that had so much red chili pepper in it I could barely eat it! And I was just in Thailand eating the same salad with traditional Thai heat, and still this salad burned my mouth and I am sure ruined my stomach lining. 

I think they just did not give a *bleep* to what I asked for - which is poor service. 

I would not come back and will not recommend this place to anyone.
author: Anelya S.

description: I'm rating this based on my dish, my friend's Pad Thai was way better. I got the Tom Yum noodle soup. It was supposed to be without any coconut milk in it, but I swear it was in it. :( I dislike any curry style foods so I was hoping this would be a clear broth like most Tom Yum soups. I think if it weren't for this, I would have given them 4 stars. The service was really friendly and fast though. :)
author: Linda W.

description: I've been coming to this restaurant forever! Love their food and the stuff is super friendly. The food comes quick literally no long waits. Did I mention their food it's the best Thai food in San Francisco.
author: Joselin M.

description:
This place was a recommendation so I thought I would give it a try. It wasn't really anything special. I enjoyed the Thai samosa but the rest of the food was very meh. I had the volcano chicken in lava sauce for an entree and it was just beef in sauce with a pile of onion rings on top! 

Probably won't be back here during this stay but worth a try. I would stick to the classics like a curry or something.
author: Mike T.

description:
Very VERY poor service, I got a confirmation call for a Togo order that was placed during business hours. The hostess called me to confirm that my order was completed as I made my way to the restaurant I come to see that I was locked out to have a rude man come to the door to say they never made my order and that he was sorry!

they stole my money, lied about the food order being ready for pickup, and made me Travel to them just To turn me away at the door. They must've been hiding it for some apparent r aspen 

be careful!!  When choosing Thai restaurants here they got the tenderloin stereotype down pat
author: Tyler F.

description:
The best pad see ew I have ever eaten in my life. I order mine with tofu and no egg. My dish was perfectly seasoned and very flavorful without being overly salty or greasy. Came here with a group of friends who ordered a variety of vegetarian dishes, all of which looked amazing. It was the perfect foundation meal for an evening of heavy drinking. 

Fast and friendly service. Reasonable prices. Beautiful neon sign outside. Highly recommended for Thai in San Francisco!
author: Alyssa F.

description:
This place is just ok. It's the first OSHA Thai they opened in the city. So it's been around for a long time. I used to come here a lot but I noticed the quality of the food at this location is not so great anymore. 

Today I stopped by for lunch with a friend who rarely comes to this side of the city. 

I ordered the Pork Satay with Sticky Rice. The pork was good, but the sticky rice was so hard, I could barley eat it. It was more like 3day old rice instead of sticky rice. The Thai iced tea was really good though. That was the best part of the meal. 

The next time I'm craving Thai food, I will go to one of the other locations in the city.
author: Edie G.

description:
I had a Groupon for this location and decided to use it for Take Out.  The location and atmosphere for this restaurant don't seem that great and I probably would avoid it for a sit down meal. 

The food order included a Cucumber Salad, Wonton Soup, Thai Fried Rice (pork), Pad See Ew (chicken) and Cashew Nut (beef). 

I forgot to add the noodles to the soup until it was almost too late. W/o the noodles, it tasted alright. With the noodles, it tasted bland.  Not bad, but probably wouldn't order again. 

Im not sure how good Pad See Ew or the Cashew Nut are supposed to be. Both were decent.   I love fried rice and it was alright. No complaints.
author: Andrew H.

description: Judge as you will- wed night ordered takeout at around 10.30pm. Pan fried noodles with chicken for $12.50- not a whole lot of chicken in this dish. Friendly staff, good portion, but mostly the rice noodles
author: James C.

description:
I haven't been here for a couple years so this review is long overdue but I love OSHA's! Late night delicious Thai food. Service has been good when I've gone. 

Street parking only. Place can get super packed especially late at night after club hours. 

I'd come here more often if I lived closer. I wish they had late night Thai food back in SJ.

I absolutely love the yellow curry here.
I also love the Pad Thai and Pineapple Fried Rice.

The papaya salad here is bomb! But it's more spicier than what I'm used to but it's freakin' delicious! Lol 

Also, you can't go wrong with Thai tea!
author: Jasmine N.

description:
Osha Thai has some tasty dishes, although for this particular location, the tastiness isn't worth the extra dollars. The neighborhood has SO MUCH amazing Thai food for a few to several dollars cheaper, depending on the dish. Plus, I feel that this location is a wee bit lackluster compared to the other locations in the city, such as the ones on Embarcadero and in SOMA. The food is a bit more bland, and they don't seem to have the amazing happy hour that other locations have (although I may be wrong, perhaps I've missed it?).

I'd be down to spend the premium tax at one of the other Osha locations since the food and ambiance are definitely higher quality there, but here, I'd rather go to a local place down the street. However, I will award them points for their crazy hours on weekends. The hole-in-the-wall place down the street will probably not be open at 3am.
author: Kelsey S.

description: It never fails ! They keep raising their prices and the service sucks .... you don't receive all items unless you check your bag . I don't know why I trick my self into thinking that if I try it late the service is going to be different . #disappointed
author: Bionka S.

description: The hours at this place are amazing, open till 3am! Perfect for a late night out in SF. I highly recommend the volcanic beef.
author: Chris L.

description:
Nice place , drinks only and decoration food and stuff little bit slow !
Not that good of impression from this place worth going there one time )
author: Askhat E.

description:
Tried this for the first time over the weekend and it was amazing! The noodles were great, the calamari was really good and me and my friend also ordered some Tom Yum soup and it was out of this world!

The only downside was that the duck fried rice was just a little dry but I think if I added some sauce on my own or maybe they added some sauce - I would definitely give a five star review next time!!
author: Alaia L.

description:
Mehhhhh.... Not so crazy about the chicken claw in our Angel Wings.... The chicken just didn't look or taste right. 

My boyfriend really liked the panang curry but my chicken noodle with Moroheiya green noodles was just kind of... Basily, if you will. Pretty bland but not bad.
author: Erin W.

description:
They don't respect your reservation. We made a reservation and they gave out our table due to an Oracle event. 
We arrived on time. 
We left the restaurant at the end.
author: Tania G.

description: ok i got a 35$ lyft all the way out here to have some food.... yelp says its open till midnight, there own web site says its till midnight... the closed sign was up at 11:30 asked if i could get some food togo they said no. really mad about this  i will never waste my time wt this food chain again... you guys suck!!
author: Heather G.

description: Expensive, but no quality. Nothing is delicious. Just a place that open up late. Service is good, but not great. Just the food is sad.
author: Che K.

description:
I came here with a large group for dinner on a Sat night around 7, the restaurant was not crowded at all which was great since we were able to be seated immediately. 

We ordered a large amount of food which I was oh so happy about since I was able to try everything I wanted.

We ordered angel wings ( crispy chicken wings with sauce and basil) raw naked shrimp medium and extra spicy ( raw shrimp with crushed garlic lime and spice ), papaya salad ( shredded fresh papaya, chili, tomatoes, crushed garlic, with a spicy lime dressing), volcanic beef ( grilled steak, with onion rings, basil, black pepper, garlic,) crab fried rice (real crab meat ) and a plate of ribs. 

The raw naked shrimp were so spicy and tangy that I ended up trying to make them at home. The papaya salad was a must - order and was fresh and tasty.  All the food came out within a reasonable time and was reasonably portioned.  

Many people eat here after clubbing since they don't close till 3 on the weekends.  I am not sure if I would come here that late since the restrooms probably get really nasty....
author: Tiffany Y.

description: Worst Thai food I've ever had. It's a pretty place that puts more emphasis on the presentation of the food than the food. Pad Thai was made with the wrong noodles. They used thin noodles and didn't have the right taste to it. The spring rolls were made with a thick rice paper and not tightly rolled. The green curry was the best part of my meal. It was an ok curry. Pretty spicy. The service was pretty lame. The waiters always forgot about us and my dad would go up to them and ask for something. It was also really hard to understand the lady's accent.
author: Kristyn G.

description:
We found out why Tom is so yummy. The Tom yum and ka are amazing. We have been there everyday for the past few days and have to say its our favourite noodle house. The green Thai eggplant curry, spicy eggplant, and soups so delish. I love their plating, every dish is artfully served. The lazy Susan on each table provides you with pickled jalapeños,Sriracha, pepper flakes, sauces, ground peanuts and sugar. You won't be left with a wanting bud in your mouth. 

I asked for a side of green curry for the plain rice and they brought a huge 32 oz bowl of the sauce. So smart as I had to order another round of rice and veggies to accompany this amazing sauce.  
I love the fresh flavours of lime, cilantro, and peppers.
The tofu was cut in a fun crinkled fashion and this added to the overall visual loveliness of the dishes.
Come here.  They have a happy hour on Monday and Tuesday, all bloody day $3 beers.
Enjoy
author: Kristopher H.

description:
Thai food that's open until 3am?  Sign us up!

We hustled our cold booty in here after clubbing in the city.  We got in before the after-hour rush of clobbers came in so we were promptly seated at a nice table with a view by the window.  I ordered the Pad Thai bc any legitimate Thai restaurant should be able to cook their staple dish right?  

My dish came out almost immediately.  My first impression was depression.  They say you can taste with your eyes.  Well my eyes said "where's the flavor"?  The few pieces of chicken was unseasoned and white.  The noodles had absolutely no tamarind flavor nor spice.  Are these people related to the owners of Siam Taste in Sunnyvale?  I had to sprinkle the chili powder onto it to give it some flavor to make it barely tolerable.  As I continued to eat, I kept pulling out hard pieces of uncooked rice noodle out of my mouth.  

Mrs Slumdog, aka "Miss 1/3 Asian" convinced me to just have them take it back, which I reluctantly did because the last thing I want is to taste some Thai Phlegm in my next dish.  We flagged a guy down to tell him of my dissatisfaction with this and asked for a menu to replace this disgusting heap of grass.  He disappears and minutes later I had to flag him down again.  Did he think I was kidding?  

After I finally flagged him down to drop off the menu, the pad prick never came back.  Whatever I didn't like the taste of your spit anyways so I decided to share my gf's Thai Fried Rice bc obviously they weren't going to provide any type of service tonight.  If you like the taste of tart green unripened tomatoes in your food, you should definitely order this (see photo)!  

Service:  0 stars
Food:  0 stars
Location and the fact that they stay open until 3am:  5 stars.

My recommendation:  If you're hungry at 3am after clubbing, head over to Harrison and go find yourself one of those vendors that cook a bacon wrapped hot dog for $4.  That's where you'll find the slumdog and I.
author: Alex L.

description:
This restaurant was well below out expectations. I know some people say that expectations reduce joy but our server Nadia  was beyond sub-standard. 

Service was very rude... This was  something that I expected better of. Server said there was a $20 cleaning fee. Our group did not . I could tell the server did not care about making the restaurant a better experience for consumers. I've eaten in chicago, philly , NYC, LA, and this service was the worst. The restaurant was able to take off the $9 auto gratuity. We left a gratuity at our discretion. I hope this restaurant hires servers as good as the food here. Overall we liked the food here but perceived  the service was terrible.
author: Mihir G.

description: I've always noticed this Thai restaurant. My friend lives above it, but I didn't know it was an Osha Thai until I ate here for the first time tonight. I got the green curry over rice with chicken and it was really good..very satisfying meal. My friend got fried rice and a pomegranate juice.
author: Denise C.

description:
Pretty good tasting Thai food at 2am.  I am glad we got seated pretty quickly even though it was prime time out of the bar, I am hungry time.  We also had a party of 8. 

The volcano beef was very tender. The sea bass however is not Chilean even though that's what they said on the menu. The service was almost to none (but I don't blame them being a late night spot). My biggest complaint of this place is I ordered chicken pai thai.  But they ran out of pai thai noodles. Instead of telling me this, they just went ahead and used the thin glassy noodles themselves.  They did not ask me if that is what I wanted, or give other suggestions of replacement noodles.  That plate was almost not touched because it tasted disgusting.  We were also too tired to even complain at the time, or was too scared because all of the servers looked like they want to kill people already.
author: Lilly W.

description: OSHA Thai is not what it use to be. Bland food and when asked to fix pad se ew they just put so much chili it was inedible plus no brocolli in it. Waste of $40 dinner for 2.
author: Niketa M.

description: Food is really good , fast and service is very friendly.There is nothing much to say i think they deserve 5 stars.
author: İsmail Cem E.

description: oh snaps!  this time is the worst food i had from osha.  i've been going for 15 plus years at least.  ordered the spicy eggplant with pork.  can't really mess that up but it came with the pork overcooked, dried up and jerky like.  holy snaps!  what happened!  are you letting some 14 year old cook your food.  super disappointed and pissed off because my food was nasty and i was super hungry.  at the price you charge, every dish better be above average.  this is a major epic fail.  how you suppose to mess up spicy eggplant.  the rice was dry like it was recycled from yesterday.  unbelievably inedible.  i rarely write bad reviews, i just let it be but this was the worst i have tasted.  ozone's spicy eggplant was bad but this is 10 times worse.  raise your standards.  if you see the meat being dry like jerky, please don't send it out.  eggplant was unskillfully chopped.  it was bigger than bite size.  i can't believe i have so much bad things to say about my favorite dish from you guy for this many years.  smh
author: Ben L.

description:
Had a really bad experience with Osh on Geary and Leavenworth branch- service was good and food consistent with previous experiences over the years. 

Problem was addressed and it was taken cared for by someone who is in- charge of the day to day business....... I was definitely impressed
author: Aaron F.

description:
Lost my appetite while eating papaya salad with crab. Little did I know it would be hammered raw crab legs hiding in the salad. It looked like it had just been mangled. No wonder the delivery only took 20 minutes. 

Afraid to even throw it in my trash can...

:(
author: Fiona Y.

description: The food was so meh , did not taste authentic at all . We came here at 4/20 so that speaks for itself . I ordered just a regular pad Thai with chicken and the sauce was so acidic and just drenched throughout the over cooked noodles , eating it was just kinda like simultaneously choking down food since It was just kinda mush at that point . My friends ordered a fried tofu appetizer and it was just so basic , we all regretted it after we saw the price . My other friend ordered a mix veggie rice plate and got the same results . Food was not good at all . But the icing on top of the cake was from this one male server that kept screaming at us . We were meeting another person and since we saw them outside , one of my friends stood up and walked towards the door on the right side of the restaurant where we were seated and before she even got to the door , there was this nasally shrill voice screaming " WHAT DO YOU THINK YOURE DOING EXCUSE ME !!" Coming from a tall male server . Like whaaaa? We didn't know that door wasn't meant to be used , it wasn't clearly marked or anything but okay not a big deal just a weird way to handle things . Your first reaction shouldn't be to scream at a customer but this isn't going to be the last time he screamed at us this night . After eating for a while , I had to use to restroom . I got up and starting walking but yea I suck because I was looking down on my phone the whole time while walking in the direction to the restroom . There were 2 doors and when I looked up from my phone all I got was " EXCUSE ME EXCUSE ME WHAT ARE YOU DOING GET OUT OF THERE ! " apparently I was standing too close to the room marked employees only even though it's right across from the restroom . Talk about an overreaction . I wasn't inside the room just happened to be standing by it , it's almost like he has a dead body in there by the way he screamed at me across the room . I told him I just had to use the restroom and I'm sorry and he starts waving me like I'm some sort of idiot like really ? I know it's 4/20 but you seem more out of it than me . Overall weird experience and some not so great food and got yelled at by a weird man all night . I still can't get that voice out of my head , very shrill and bird sounding , I hear it in my nightmares . Oh and I ended up throwing up most of the pad Thai that night since it was stuck in my esophagus for hours and couldn't make its way down to my stomach .
author: Carmen V.

description: Ordered the Duck Fried Rice. Dry and tasteless. Service was decent. They're open late
author: Binh D.

description: Great food great service!! They have bombast naked shrimp dish in town! Come here in a random sat afternoon. When we walk in the waitress was very friendly saying hi to us. And when we ordered they come back check see if we are ok. I told the waiter the backed shrimp is good but it's very spicy, I wasn't trying to complain but it's really good dish just can't take spicy. The wait came back with Thai ice tea! He say it's on house coz they should ask us what spicy level we want! I was very amazed by his reaction! Very nice and thoughtful! I will totally come back!!
author: Judy T.

description:
I've been to this OSHA Thai twice now, and though I'd give them 4 stars for the food, service and price brings them down to 3 stars.

Here's what I have tried:

1. Crab fried rice - Yum! Bits of crab in the rice. Must try.
2. Volcano beef - Chunks of steak in dark brown sauce with onion rings on top. A bit on the salty side, but still tasty.
3. Duck curry - So fragrant and delicious. 
4. Pad kee mao - Noodles were cooked well. Not mushy or suck together. 
5. Tofu green curry: Meh.
6. Coconut rice - Loved it. Bits of coconut included.
7. Mango papaya salad - iceberg lettuce with cashews, under ripe mango slices, and papaya. Please skip.

Drinks: Thai iced tea, Thai iced coffee, and (lychee?) iced tea were all pretty standard.

Service is pretty bad. Food comes out very slowly. A big turn off is that vegetarian substitutions are still the same price as meat dishes!

Expensive. Both times I've been here, spent about $25/person. So many better, cheaper Thai options.
author: Michelle K.

description: I have been here 5 times already. I like this location because it is few blocks away from my home. Customer service is amazing. Last Sunday, My kids kept accidentally dropping the glass of water like three times. I felt really sorry for the person who was cleaning. They still were very nice and helped us. They made us feel comfortable. I am very thankful for their kindness. This place is family friendly. Highly recommended!! :)
author: Mila N.

description: One of the few places which was open late into the night . The food is average over here and is a decent place for anyone who doesn't want to have pizza late night .
author: Anand S.

description:
One of my favorite after club spots.

I recently came here with the husband after a couple of drinks. It was actually my first time here a bit sober so I was a bit more excited for the meal than normal.

Since we weren't too hungry, we ordered Pad Thai and split the dish. The flavor was amazing. So much more flavoring than other pad Thais I've tasted. The ingredients also tasted so fresh.

It has got to be one of my favorite Thai restaurants.
author: Maria L.

description: Osha to the rescue! After a long night of partying we ended up coming back to our hotel quite late - we were drunk and hungry, so off we go trudging the butt busting hilly streets of San Francisco, as to be expected many of the soup houses we want to go to have already closed their doors for the night (morning to be exact) but like a glimmering light and a buzzing busy crowd Osha was still bustling and buzzing like a fresh bushels of flowers mobbed by hungry bees! I was surprised how quickly we got seated, the place is quite chic, clean with efficient servers, we glanced at the menu and no less than a few minutes we knew what we wanted to order. I had the Osha Tom Yum spicy noodle soup and my buddy got the Beef Noodle soup. Not sure if we were that drunk and hungry or maybe the food was just irresistibly yummy but we devoured the humongous bowl of noodle soup rather quick! My Tom Yum was nice and tasty! An intermittent huff and cough follows from time to time as this soup has a really nice spicy kick! My friend devoured his noodles and the nice hunk of beef like a hungry beast and like a drunk sailor picked up his bowl and simply chug down the soup hahaha kidding aside - I was so happy to have stumbled upon this place! Awesome soups to refresh the otherwise inebriated half conscious drunk minds! The perfect way to end a night of partying and drinking!
author: Neil G.

description: Been coming here for years! Always delicious food and wonderful service! Tonight the Pad Khee Mao with a Substitute of egg instead of mushroom is absolutely fantastic! Tons of veggies, perfect noodle consistency and amount, and really great texture and construction of the entire dish! Also, the staff are totally super duper! Just perfect! Thank you Osha Thai Geary Street! You nailed it!
author: Forest G.

description:
This place is located on a busy street where most of the restaurants have long lines and no bathrooms. 
This one was empty which made me a bit apprehensive.
