Since I wanted to healthy I felt like Thai was the way to go. It was a cold day outside so I ordered some spring rolls and samosa for starters. (Don't order these when you're calorie counting) 
Both of them were extremely oily and must have been sitting in the kitchen for a long time only to be deep fried for the nth time before being served to us. 
The filling was a let down as well. Barely anything in there. 
Since the appetiser was a disaster and I felt nauseous with all that oil I just ordered a veggie noodle soup bowl with glass noodles and tofu as my choice of protein. 
My my! 
The bowl completely surprised me. The tofu was soft and fresh and the portion size was pretty good. It was loaded with veggies and did what it was supposed to do- made me feel warm on the inside on a cold day- Slurp slurp. 
Don't go if you're looking to have something that blows your mind away.
author: Yoshita S.

description: I was never a fan of Thai food, tried a couple of times in the past and didn't enjoy it. Our friends suggested Osha for dinner as they were Thai food lovers, so we went along and I was impressed, maybe in the past I didn't know what to order, but this time we let our friends order and really enjoyed a nice meal, will definitely try Thai again.
author: Gus S.

description:
5 stars for food. 
2 stars for price. 

Since when does Thai food break the bank? Way better options close by for a much reasonable price.
author: Rachael P.

description: They're yummy and open late but food is oily. So much so that I had a stomachache after. They no longer have Mint Leaf Duck on their menu. Loooooove their crab fried rice but if you're. It into spicy food, stay away from the papaya salad.
author: Julie L.

description:
This is not the Pad Thia you're looking for. We ordered for pickup so we have no idea how the service was... However I did have to track down a server to get our meal. The pad Thia wasn't the worst I've ever had, but it's certainly not the best in the neighborhood. My boyfriend got the yellow curry - it was spicy enough but lacked flavor. It said it comes with potatoes and there was just one hunk of potato in the whole thing. 

I would go to this place again only if it was the last one open.
author: Crystal L.

description: pricey but worth it. Foods were beautifully served. Can be reached by public bus or car with pay parking (and sometimes very hard to find empty space). Wheelchair friendly.
author: Loena Loeloeh L.

description: Great spot and open til 3am. Fresher food than king of Thai noodle (although that place is cheaper and still decent). Mango sticky rice and noodles is really good here.
author: Ben L.

description:
Walking by you would never know that this is an actual osha thai.. Or perhaps I just never noticed. I recommend this osha if you don't want to deal with dressing up or going to a fancy osha. 

The prices are the same and the menu is condensed. Think of this as osha's younger rebel sister. I ordered the pad se ew with chicken, it was tasty but I prefer the regular osha. 

Service was excellent and the food came out extremely fast! They also have a happy hour special, $5 for a beer & fried appetizer. Not bad.
author: Natasha S.

description: Why would they not provide spoons and forks in a delivery order, someone please explain to me. The food didn't taste that well either. I had hoped that the large number of reviews meant that people like their overall experience here, but mine was shitty. Had to run down to get forks and spoons in the middle of a full day of business meetings. Super embarrassing.
author: Blooming F.

description: Came here late one Friday night and it was packed, but luckily got a table. Prompt service, ordered the Tom Yum soup and it was soooo good! Very delicious, maybe one of the best I have had. A little bit on the pricer side though.
author: Tiffany T.

description: I still like the osha thai on market street better~~But the one is also good in terms of noodles.
author: Yunzhu C.

description:
We were super happy with the food. It was tasty and satisfying.
Crab fried rice - yum! Bits of crab in the rice.
Volcano beef - chunks of steak in dark brown sauce with onion rings on top, tasty but don't care to order again. 
Duck curry - so fragrant and delicious. A must! 
Pad kee mao - noodles cooked well. Not mushy or suck together. 

Expensive: $75+$20 tip. If I wasn't paying with a gift card then I probably would go somewhere cheaper.
author: Rena J.

description: Smashed a cockroach once with the napkin dispenser and showed it to our waiter who blamed it as being from the neighboring restaurant.  We still had to pay for our uneaten food.
author: Bailey N.

description: Accidentally got our pineapple fried rice order wrong, as in the dish came without any pineapples. However server was quite friendly and apologetic in immediately replacing our dish along with a lychee drink on da haus!
author: Dorothy Y.

description:
I didn't know that it would be possible to be pissed at a plate of fried rice, but I was.  I got the duck fried rice which tasted aiite, but was extremely disappointing due to the fact that the yummy roast duck skin was stripped from the meat. Yes. To reiterate, the fatty part that was directly under the brown, roasted top layer was still there, but said top layer was gone.  Soooo...you can even argue that they were trying to be health concious by removing the skin cuz the fat was still included.  Did they use the skin for the curry in someone else's order?  Did they accidentally burn the top part and decide to only include the part that wasn't spoiled?  I don't know. But what I do know is that to have to pay +3 dollars for miniature, incomplete pieces of duck on top if the normal $14.95 (which isnt expensive...but isn't worth the quality of the product)  just ain't right.

PS. The servers were nice.  So I blame the system, not them.
author: Frances L.

description: I had a little dinner date with my best friend and we were both equally impressed with not only our meals but also the staff. Our first place we initially wanted to go to was too long of a wait so we ended up going here. This location was full of friendly smiles and the drinks were strong and tasty haha. And they say chains don't know how to keep up their services. Kudos!
author: Christine J.

description: Noodle soup was delicious!  Veggies super fresh and tofu good as well. Waitress forgot my tea but the super fast and friendly service made up for it. Open until 3 AM on Saturday nights
author: Jingo Django J.

description:
Came here last Friday with a group of friends.

We ordered:
Osha spaghetti
Crab fried rice
Pad sew ew
Pad thai
Salmon
A couple of cocktails - Kiss Me Please and Lychee were among the delicious ones.

My first time trying the Osha spaghetti and it was really delicious! Kind of an Asian fusion dish. I had a small bite of the Pad Thai as well and it had a large egg taste to it.

The decor here is more simplistic but still trendy.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
I'm a little baffled by all of the negative reviews. I love this place and have always had good experiences there. And I've probably eaten there...20+ times ( I live very close by). The only downfall for me are the tables that are so low you can't cross your legs underneath them. lol. 

We regularly get the pumpkin curry with tofu and green curry with chicken. It's the perfect amount of spice. Not enough to burn your mouth but enough to make your nose a little runny.

When we order carry-out the food is always ready when we get there to pick it up, even earlier than expected.
author: Sally D.

description:
OSHA is an amazing little restaurant that we found. The food is delicious and moderately priced for San Francisco food.  I had ordered the combination fried rice and my boyfriend had a noodle soup dish. Honestly I think I got the better of the two because my fried rice was flavorful, rich, and had plenty of chicken, squid, and shrimp.  The soup was delicious too because it had just the right amount of spice and peanut flavor. The best way to end this meal was the fried ice cream. It was incredibly crispy and the ice cream in the middle was soft. It was much better than some other places we went to for fried ice cream. 
I would definately recommend this restaurant to anyone that enjoys Thai food.
author: Saphyre N.

description: Amazing place for Thai food. The chicken satay is amazing, sometimes they run out so get there early. The naked shrimp is also tasty. Good sized portions. Good service. A must for any person who likes Thai food.
author: Michelle T.

description:
This was a fancy Thai restaurant. I'm more partial to the hole in the wall because the food is more authentic but we were meeting a group who chose this place so why not try it out? 

The decor is beautiful. Lots of reds and golds. Good place for groups since there was long bench seating. There is a bar with 3 TVs so you could easily watch sports there while eating. 

The food was good. I ordered the panang curry and for the first time in my life I felt like I had too much chicken! I got so full and all the sauce was pretty much gone. Never have I had this issue before. It's not a bad issue to have, just an unusual one. I wouldn't say the dish was special or amazing in any other way. Flavor was what I would expect from a place like this. It was a bit on the expensive side, about $12 for my curry. I guess it's ok since I had tons of chicken. 

They offered a lot of vegetarian dishes. Half of the people in my group were vegetarian. They seemed very happy with their dishes. There was a list of exotic cocktails too that looked good. 

All in all a good experience. It's not somewhere I would be dying to try again but it's not a bad place to go if you're craving Thai around the financial district.
author: Eva C.

description: This was my first visit. I was seated in the bar for lunch. The couch was very comfy. We had the spring rolls which were very satisfying. The peanut sauce was delicious. The. Beef and broccoli rice noodles were delicious. Flavorful and not greasy. The yellow curry was not as flavorful and potatoes was undercooked. I would definitely give it a second try.
author: Stacey P.

description:
My favorite Thai restaurant in SF!

I did the lunch special for $13 bucks because I decided to be a baller and got seafood instead of chicken/beef. Actually, the company paid so I ordered the most expensive shit on the lunch menu! Lol 

Anyways, lunch special is a three courses meal. So I got the Tom Yum soup, chicken satay and seafood sweet basil leaf! They have tons of options you can mix and matched.

Once again, Osha never disappoint me! Oh Thai tea is a must!
author: Linda L.

description:
Really disappointed in the meal. Was starving and still the food tasted mediocre. Ingredients weren't fresh. Ordered spicy catfish and spicy eggplant and it was truly mediocre. 

Two stars is pretty high for the meal but it's more like a 1.5 stars. Service was okay but the execution of the meal was bad. $32 for a dinner for two. 

Wish we could have a redo on this. Can't wait to crap this meal out. 

If you want decent Thai food don't come here. It used to be good years ago. Now it's one of the worst Thai food restaurants in the Bay Area.
author: lester h.

description: Very oily good. We got the pad kee mao and the naked wings. The wings were drenched jn sauce and oil.
author: Preetha A.

description:
This place I'd say serves the best Thai food I've eaten in the USA. Second time here during a business trip.
Today I had the scallops wrapped in Bacon (to die for) and the Red Duck Curry (so good).
I washed it down with a lychee fruit martini (they have real lychee fruit). 
Excellent food in a fun casual environment.
I'll be back for sure.
author: Peter V.

description:
Checked out this place at 10:30 on a Saturday night. They were busy but not slammed. A good ambience is important to me. I drove past this place a few night before and I was excited because it looked like a 60s/70s chill vibe, but when we actually sat down it wasn't that neat. It read a little more like The Waffle House, but not in a bad way. I read the reviews on Yelp and got the Volcano Beef. It was fantastic. The beef was tender(loin. HA! Get it? Anyway...) in a savory sauce with veggies and it was served with onion rings and a side of steamed rice. Presentation was beautiful. My husband got the tofu pad thai, and it was delicious. 

Customer service was very nice. I was a little cold (you guys know SF gets cold and windy as hell at night) and the waitress offered to shut the door for me, which I thought was kind of her. The food was served quickly. No fuss. A great place to eat anytime, but it's good that it's open until 3AM.
author: Kat R.

description:
We rolled into Frisco late and I was starving. Walked through SOMA after midnight, and was glad we did. 

Service was fine, but we weren't in a picky mood at all so I guess they could've been more friendly? But really, no issues. 

Place was pretty clean for being a drunken after-bar mecca. 

Great little gem with veggie options. Fast, hot and well priced food - did not disappoint. 

Jeff had a chicken fried rice dish, I had a veggie soup - both were great. Would return for sure for late night noshes.
author: Sasha W.

description:
Image versus reality: 9 out of 10
I would never see this place as a fancy Thai restaurant; this is just a very lively Thai eatery that generally--more or less--delivers what it promises.

Menu versus execution: 8 out of 10
Their menu ideas are fantastic, but their end result is just...good, not excellent, or almost bland. Their cocktail drinks are actually very good and somehow original, trendy, and innovative, in a Thai manner of speaking. Food quality is generally good or acceptable; it's much better than mediocre, but not as refined as the establishment portrays it on their menus.

Level of cleanliness: 4 out of 10
In the customer areas is way too low! The floors are full of the restroom liquids (I hope it's just nothing more than urine) that are brought back and forth by the shoes of people who use their only bathroom. So far, I have not been unable to determine or estimate the level of cleanliness in their kitchen. The management should be more concerned about monitoring the restroom and cleaning it regularly during shifts, especially during busy hours!

Customer service: 7 out of 10
Their customer service manners lately have improved--they used to be terrible (inexperienced, young staff). Overall customer service still tends to be inconsistent. But food is served quite promptly.

Atmosphere: 6 out of 10
The place is a trap for late night drunk, young people who come out of the clubs, so it stays open late, which is convenient, but not awesome, because of late night drunk young people's behavior.

Condition of facilities and setup: 6 out of 10
Their setup is not bad and their style is cool and trendy, in a Thai manner of speaking, but the place is dirty and not thoroughly maintained, which inevitably reveals the inherent tackiness their management doesn't want you to see.

Pricing: 9 out of 10
As of now, their menu prices I believe to be fair, very fair for a San Francisco Thai eatery.
author: Raymond F.

description:
This is the 4th time that I come here. I always bring my friends from Brazil to Osha and i did the same this time with my mom, as her last night dinner in San Francisco. But I had an awful experience this time with the girl named Phianphichan. 

I requested one of the noodles and asked if was spicy because my mom is allergic to spicy food. She said we could take the bell out and would be fine. So we started to eat and it was burning. So another guy helped us out and suggested another noodle that was not spicy at all. For our surprise, it was worst than the first one. So the guy came to us in a really nice way suggesting dishes that would be ok for my mom and this lady interrupt him and said she could not change out dish again. I explained to her why we were doing it and she said that there was nothing she could do. So I asked if we should pay and leave, for something that the staff didn't help us with correctly.. And she said "yes, you should leave". 

Well.. I had noodles here before that were not spicy and a fried rice that was delicious. Not once, but 4 times. And this girl said "well, everything here will be spicy. Maybe you don't know what is spicy". And I said that we didn't want anything burning our mouths. So I ordered the rice and she said it was the last time that she was doing that for us. And it was delicious, my mom loved it!!! 

By the time she brought the check, we had the second and the 3rd dish on it. So I asked her why, since she said she would exchange the second one. And, as before, she was not pleasant at all.

Result.. We paid the bill, one dollar tip, and probably I am not bringing anyone new to the city here again. Bad experience!!!
author: Natasha S.

description:
I had a friend over yesterday and he wanted to have Thai food. Osha just happened to be the closest Thai spot to our place in the area. After ordering through Eat24, and was told we had a 10-30 minute wait til it was time to pick up, we figured "sure, why not... let's go!" We got there 20 minutes into our 30 minute wait, and the food was not ready yet. The wait staff told us to sit off to the side and wait.  Fast forward 20 more minutes, is when our take out order finally came......... *smh* We did have entertainment as we were watching a homeless person enter the establishment and ask for a stick of butter to eat...... 

Now, onto the food. The 3 of us ordered a lot! We got the samosas, chicken pad see ew, Thai veggie fried rice, tom yum soup, and basil chicken. This was way more than our bellies could handle. I had asked for my veggie fried rice to be the spiciest of spicy, however the pad see ew was the spiciest of spicy and the rice was just regular American spicy.  Overall, I feel like there's way better Thai spots out there. Maybe I'd come back......... After a night of many drinks.
author: Tracy C.

description:
I just realized I haven't wrote a review on one of  my favorite Thai spots in SF.. let me start off by saying I love coming here after hitting the bars lol The only thing that sucks is the line after 12am!! Patience is the key, especially waiting for their crab fried rice and pumpkin curry? Totally worth it. Among the chain of Osha's in SF, the Geary location is the only one that serves till 2am ish? I happened to come here last night and order all my faves. 

Pumpkin curry, Angel Wings, Chicken pad thai, Pad See Ew, Spicy eggplant, Fried chicken with fried rice, Crab fried rice, and Spicy catfish. All for 6 people. What a delight =)
author: Kathy V.

description:
A very mediocre place that has the vibe of being better.  I have eaten at the location in the tenderloin a few times and while the staff has always been attentive, the plating excellent, the food has always been so so.  A recent trip had me ordering spring rolls which while pretty and nice looking were quite tasteless (don't know how shrimp supposedly from the area can be so tasteless) and noodles that looked extremely pretty but were unbelievably oily and tasteless.  Whole mini tomatoes were strewn in the noodles which were really impossible to eat.  I tried to skewer one with my fork and because of (a) the fact that the skin is quite smooth (b) it was crazy oily, I very smoothly shot it towards a group of diners sitting next to me!  They were too busy laughing at my antics to really take offense, so all was good.

The staff, while nice, is obviously not trained to pay attention to uneaten food that goes back.  if a diner is not eating, there is an obvious problem, so go ask to see what you can fix!  

I have been told that the food is good in other locations, but as far as I am concerned, this place is a no go for me.
author: Sunay P.

description: I tend to eat here put of convenience when I'm out with friends, but I always end up a little disappointed. Tycoon Thai is a much better option these days., and it's only a couple blocks away.
author: David S.

description: Pretty good noodles soups here, got a really good variety and the different broths are really tasty. I recommend the wasabi beef roll appetizer too.
author: Jake B.

description:
Dropped in for an early dinner. Got a som tum salad and the sea bass they had on the specials menu. The som tum was very good, prolly the best tasting I've had in the states, but doesn't compare at all to what I've had in Thailand and that's totally expected tho. It was very spicy which was perfect.  Lips, mouth, throat on fire.  Head rushing pain. Sweating and runny nose.  Intense punch in face that lingered for 10-15mins. Almost a drug like high.  I LOVED IT : )   

The sea bass was very good too. Came with bok choy and mushrooms in a coconut flavor cilantro sauce that was bursting with flavor as thai food should. When it came out i was surprised at the color of the fish, had some red tinge to it. I forgot what the menu said so I have no clue what they did to it , but it was amazing and cooked perfect.  Bok choy and mushrooms (which were hiding under the sea bass) soaked up all the flavor of the cilantro coconut type sauce and was very light refreshing not greasy or heavy at all.  It was the perfect dinner and I left satisfied and feeling great !
author: George M.

description: Really good food and quick service for dinner time on a long weekend (I had gone the Sunday of the 4th of July weekend)! I suggest the pad sew ew or the volcano beef and definitely the chicken satay!
author: Chloe N.

description:
This is how I ended up at this awesome THAI place!

ME = ME,     MF = My Friend

ME:  I'm Hungry, any good place to eat?
MF:  Let me take you to this thai place, Is really good
ME:  I don't think Thai food is better than NY?
MF:  Are you Kidding me?  This place is always Busy
ME:  Maybe they are Fusion food?  totally different
MF:  Can I take you there, you can give it a try.  If you don't like it, I will never BRING you to ANY other Thai places!.

ME: (convinced)  FINE!, This better be good!.

Arriving on a Sunday Night around 9 PM, 4 Starving kids came to the restaurant, and 2 empty tables left (perfect timing).  Sat and stared at the menu and examined what to order.  Food came out within 10 minutes at the same time.

My favorite Thai Dish - Pad See Ew with Tofu.  I really Enjoy their Flat Noodles, It was made perfectly!, The noodles were soft and long enough.  Not oily and dry at all!.  A little hint of sweet sauce in it.  Tofu was pretty good, Chinese broccoli was fresh and crunchy!.

My friends dish Which was WOON SEN PAD THAI Was also tasty, Ordered Mild spicyness since he didn't know how Spicy can they be.  Meat was tender and sweet.  Flat noodles are the same, TASTY!.

Spicy  Basil was another great dish to try.  Mild spicy, added an extra egg to mix with the rice and the meat.  

Prices were not super expensive, Portions were made perfectly that we didn't have to stuff our face to death!.  Service was a bit confusing but overall, their reaction was super quick!.  MY friend convinced me at least Thai food is good in SF too! (meaning pretty authentic).
author: Helena H.

description: BEST late night munchies, lunch, or dinner!!!! Ever. Fave Thai food place in San Francisco. It's also located right in the middle of union square, which is perfect. They decorate your food so cute too.
author: Joy H.

description: I feel like Osha Thai has gotten too big for their britches. Used to be some of the best Thai food throughout the city and it was affordable. Now they have too many locations the prices have been raised too high and the quality seems to have gone down at some of the locations. I think the main thing is the prices have gone too high especially for the Geary location. It should not be $14 for pineapple fried rice in the tenderloin.
author: Jeremy R.

description:
I used to like this place for after hours eats but they have been disappointing me lately.

I'm big on presentation and it seems like they just plopped the food right on a clean white plate. The pad thai was everywhere, very messy looking. 

The food also has been tasting bland lately.

Please improve!
author: Chantal P.

description:
I'd been to this Osha Thai on multiple occassions in the wee hours of the morning in various states of intoxication, but this was my first time there sober.  Clearly, this shows how alcohol and skew my opinions about places . . .  Based on my late night visits, I would've given them 3-4 stars, but after visiting sober, I've downgraded them to 2 stars.

My friend and I shared the Papaya Salad, Tom Yum soup with shrimp, and Pad Kee Mao with Duck.  Papaya Salad was just okay.  Tom Yum soup was too sweet (yup, too sweet, weird, right?).  The rice noodles with duck were just alright.  But, the red hot sauce that was on the condiments caddy was not hot; it was pretty bland as far as alleged hot sauces go!

Next time I'm in that 'hood, I'll head back to Thai House Express for some Thai goodness.
author: Christina L.

description:
Tried their prawns are delicious with rice and eggplan they call it angry prawns. 

Most delicious Thai food i ever had and good service as well.
author: Konstantinos M.

description:
I live a few block from this place and it has become my go to. I have never had to wait for a table, and when I order to go it has always been ready by the time I get there. Everything I've tried on the menu has been good, but my favorites are the Kao Mun Khai and Crying Tiger. The Crying Tiger is one of my favorite steaks I've had anywhere. A tip for ordering, hot means hot, and if ordering to go stay away from the battered and fried dishes as they aren't quite as good as when you eat them there. Definitely check out the Chefs suggestions too. 

Otherwise, I'd say that this is a good restaurant for people who are interested in trying new Thai flavors but don't know what to order, because you can just order anything on the menu and know it will be good!

UPDATE: I have now gotten food poisoning here twice. The first time I thought it was a fluke, and gave it another shot because the food is so good. After getting sick the second time there will not be a third.
author: Andrew W.

description: Clearly Osha is banking on its brand these days because the downright average food leaving their kitchen isn't worth the time or money it takes to eat it. I can get much better and less expensive Thai food within a couple blocks of my flat and I will from now on!
author: Jeremy A.

description:
I recently reviewed "OSHA'S" 2nd Street location which in retrospect -  I liked it better -- especially for its overall customer service.  And just to let you know - I am a big FAN of OSHA!! 

I don't know if they changed their recipe or chef at this location-- but their dishes are just "blah" and their signature dishes have somewhat gone down the drain!  I don't think I will be coming back here anytime soon. 

I also noticed their service has gotten below average too! It's ashamed because this was the place to be especially after "clubbing" or after watching a show in downtown San Francisco.  I am hopeful that this location will spring back up and bring back their "wow factor dishes again" and provide its customer a good and a memorable experience.
author: Edwin R.

description:
This used to be THE go to late night spot. And for the most part, it still is. I just don't go out that much anymore. But prices have gone so high from what it used to be! And I don't think it's as good anymore. Just average. 

One thing is for sure, the wait staff deserves a huge pat on the back for being able to deal w all the drunkards that walk in late night. Maybe that's why they're charging more ;P
author: Tea Lyves ..

description:
I've always loved this place since college.  Every time I come visit in SF, I'll stop by and eat here.  

Last night, I've ordered the crab fried rice and Tom Kha soup with chicken.

The soup was amazing!  But the friend rice had too much fish sauce in it this time, so it was a bite fishy this time around.  If not, I would have given OSHA a 5 star rating.  

My bf ordered the chicken yellow curry and he said it was delicious! 

Mon & Tuesday's beer special for $3 hit the spot!
author: Diana C.

description: I ordered the tum yum noodle soup, which is usually my favorite and it was extremely sweet! My BF ordered the chicken noodle and it lacked flavor,definitely no balance. Not impressed!
author: C G.

description: Service okay.I ordered the pad see ew, and I got it right away no even a minute. I was expecting for my food to come out at least about 10-12mins . So If you're looking for a "quick/fast food" this is the place for you.
author: Aisha C.

description:
Went to San Francisco late on a friday evening to hit up a few bars and after having a good-fun filled night with friends and making new ones, you tend to get a bit hungry. I have never been here before but people I was with have been here before and kept talking about going here all night, and what's really good about this place is that it is open until 3 am. We ended up coming in at about 1:30-2 ish am maybe. And the place was packed! 

I remember thinking to myself that any place that is this packed at this hour MUST be good! We put our names down on the waiting list and before you know we got a table fairly quickly.

After everyone had ordered, the food came out pretty fast and our table had been taken over by Pad Thai...Beef Pad Thai, Pork Pad Thai, etc... 
I have never had Pad Thai before but now I can say that I am a true fan! It was so good and now I know what the rave was all about for this place.

We also ordered a side of Wontons and they were pretty good, I just wish they would give you more of the dipping sauce. They give you a bunch of wontons and not a lot of sauce. But they were still good with no sauce on them.

The biggest complaint I have which to me isn't the worst thing is that they only have 1 bathroom! And if you are there late people who are intoxicated and have to go to the bathroom could be in there a while and if they are in front of you could be bad..and having only 1 restroom, both guys and girls have to share it. And the line could get pretty long too.

Overall, I had a good experience trying a new place with new friends and I am a fan and would be going back!!
author: Jason D.

description: Foooooddd wassss delicious!! Not a lot of space in restaurant but I ordered to go . Everyone inside seemed to have a nice time . Crab fried rice I would suggest and don't forget the wings
author: Kayja A.

description: We originally were going to Mensho Ramen, but upon seeing the long line out on the sidewalk we changed our mind. There was no wait and we ordered right away. The food was delicious!
author: Justin R.

description: Ordered food for pickup over the phone. I spoke with Karen who took my order. She was rude and impatient, and pretty much didn't show any customer service. I asked her questions about the menu, she refused to respond and ignored my questions. When I got home I had the wrong order. When I called and complained she interrupted me and was extremely rude and hung up on me. The wrong soup They gave me I tried it and it was so disgusting. Worse customer service ever. I'm not sure how this restaurant hires these kind of unprofessional employees.
author: Izzy A.

description:
Zero star if Yelp allowed me to do that.
So after the incident 3 yrs ago, I haven't been back until last month when my parents came to visit and this is the only place that still open after their delayed flight.
I ordered crab fried rice and tom yum kung soup with shrimp for to go.

Prices: pretty expensive for thai food.
Portion: the soup is ok, but the fried rice is very little with almost no crab insight.

Taste: the soup is not as good as before so does the fried rice. But what happen after you eat to me and my parents is rather disturbing.
So after just finished eating, all 3 of us experience a sore muscle all over our body. It feels like I have been running for miles and come to complete stop. All my muscle is aching. Which is weird, all of us doing something different prior and the only common denominator is the supper from this restaurant. Me and my dad experienced the worst. I believe the amount of MSG and vinegar is too much for our body to handle.
Mind you, I'm not that person that eat only organic, non GMO, free range chicken kinda type of person. I ate pizza, hotdogs, ribs, tofu, non organic cheap fruits/vege that most people eat. 

Anyhow, after this experience, if you have baby/children/seniors/love your health, you might want reconsider some other alternatives.
author: Icey M.

description:
Ordered Osha Thai for delivery on a Sunday night and it was fantastic!  The people on the phone who work there were so nice and helped answer questions on the menu.  The portions were huge!  I wish we had known this before we ordered but at least now we can have some leftovers for the next day.

The food tasted great, the packaging was on point and spill-proof.  We ordered 2 curries, and 2 pad-thai dishes which were clearly labeled, came piping hot, and wasn't too salty.  What more can you ask for?  This is our new favorite thai restaurant in SF.
author: Louise Z.

description: This place is below mediocre; the first thing I noticed was overwhelming smell of rotting food throughout the restaurant. The tables were in very poor condition and the seating was uncomfortable. The food itself was OK, I ordered the green curry plate and was overall disappointed because I could have made a better quality curry at home. I was excited about the coconut rice, but it also turned out to be disappointing, it was dry and flavorless.
author: Maya B.

description:
After a night at Ruby, we decided to get some food to soak up and sober up. The food was not bad but it wasn't the best I've ever had. Now the taste buds might be a little numbed from the adventures of that night but the food was mediocre. 

I got the Pad See Ew and it wasn't all that great. Standard stuff. Nothing special

The catfish was pretty good.

The service was quick and we got out of there for under 15 a person. Not a bad place if you're looking for a late night place for decent thai.
author: Bobby K.

description: A little pricey for what I'm used to paying for Thai food. But the mango salad and crab fried rice was so worth it. I was a little skeptical at first since I live in Thai town, but I heard such great reviews that I just had to come try for myself. Pad Thai was mediocre and the boat noodle was pretty good, but incomparable to the ones I've tried at home. The highlight of my meal was the mango salad, NO DOUBT. Definitely going to crave it once I get back to LA.
author: Mercede D.

description:
So, I'll start by saying that the portions were enormous and well worth the price assuming the food is palatable, but mine was not, so my friend got a really nice free dinner. I'd ordered from this place a decade ago and seem to recall having issues, but I wanted Thai food and everything else was closed, so I hoped something had changed in ten years.

I ordered pad Thai but specified no onions. They got the pad Thai right, but it was bland. There was little flavor, and it wasn't that great even as is. I gave it to my friend because I couldn't stomach the lack of flavor, neither could he, but he planned on dousing it with sweet and sour sauce to make it edible when he got home. 

As for the pineapple fried rice, this was my mistake. I missed there were onions in it, but this is where the difference between a great restaurant and one that never gets visited again occurs. See, I put no onions on the pad Thai, and in my experience as a restaurant manager, this conflict in ordering requires a follow up call to the customer. A customer who gets a call to clarify that the ingredients was missed gets an order they're happy with. The customer who gets an order where the chef just followed a bunch of items on a piece of paper is the one that delivers a customer the order they'll throw away. 

At the other end of that order is a person, and when restaurants forget this, orders suck. I know I would never allow my staff to make this mistake or even consider it acceptable that no contact was made with the customer to clarify the order. Needless to say, I will not be frequenting them again as a result of this and the fact that even onions aside that the rice was also disgusting as my friend agreed who liked onions. 

So, I guess this is a reminder to the restaurant that the customers who walk away and never come back are the ones who've likely had similar experiences where the service was meh and not worth going to again.
author: dAvid s.

description: This place serves the most amazing Thai food I've ever had especially their yellow curry and lamb shanks. The only reason I give this place 4 stars because on more than one occasion I found hair in my food- which of course I had to throw it out but other than that they're pretty good!
author: Cameron M.

description: Food food and great service at a good price. Anger shrimp was good and the steak was cooked perfect.
author: Jeff B.

description:
Oh, Osha, how you've changed!
I used to go here regularly when I lived in San Francisco 9 years ago and it was consistently great.  Late last night, after a concert, I took my fiance there for take out, telling her how fab it was, but wow, what a disappointment!  I got the mixed veg with tofu, over rice (which is what I always used to order).  It was mostly rice, and the veggies didn't have much sauce on them, which meant not much flavor on the veggies and plain rice without sauce. Meh.  My lady ordered a mixed vegetable red curry which was more like soup, with almost no veggies.  The veggies they did put in looked like scraps from the compost bin, and the red curry was overly salty and tasted strongly of fish sauce. The whole thing was yucky, and she threw it away. 
It was late, and they were getting ready to close the kitchen for the night -- I'm not sure if that was a factor, but it shouldn't be.  Sad experience, after all the good memories there.  Get it together, Osha.
author: Dean H.

description:
This is the first time I tried Osha Thai Restaurant and I loved it! I ordered my food through Postmates and the order took about 1-hr to be delivered to my apartment. I ordered the pumpkin curry (with duck), pad kee mao (with beef) and osha fresh spring rolls (with shrimp), which was more than enough for 2 people. 

You MUST try the osha fresh spring rolls. I ordered mine with shrimp and it was delicious! The peanut sauce it came with was also on point. I will definitely order from this place again.
author: Amelia C.

description: It was just ok.  My expectations were high after reading the reviews.  I had the green curry chicken with coconut rice and coconut soup.  It wasn't bad, but I've had better.
author: Amy M.

description:
Where to start with Osha. This place is a block from my friends apartment so needless to say we tend to end up here on most late nights. While conveniently located thats not the only reason I go here, I think its some of the best Thai in the city. My partner always, always, always gets the Pad Thai which is amazing and its one of my recurring meals too. But everything else I have tried from the Pad See Ew to the Volcanic beef (wasn't as spicy as I would have thought) to the Green Curry is all amazing. Every time I try another thai restaurant I always compare it back to Osha. 

I work in hospitality and when people ask me for recommendations for dinner this is the first place on my mind every time. And when my guest come back and I ask them how they liked it, nothing but rave reviews! 

This location is my favorite of all the ones in San Francisco. Each Osha location seems to resemble the neighborhood its in. The one on Geary feels like a small neighborhood restaurant, not pretentious or trying to be trendy and modern. Its just about a fantastic meal with the people you are with. Looking around everyone always seems to be enjoying themselves with the people they are with, and whats better than that!
author: Aaron D.

description: Very good Pad Thai and they're open late. Would recommend. Located in Lower Nob Hill, very active area during the late hours!
author: Chris B.

description: I love this place. The Geary one is the best, in my opinion. It's the original and it doesn't have the flashiness that some of the other locations have.
author: M K.

description:
After a night of celebrating, my cousins and a took me here for a bite to eat. This is my very first encounter with this place. We didn't wait long for a table which was a good thing since we were hungry. The waitress that served us didn't seem to be hospitable. My cousins already knew what to order but, I wanted to try the crunchy calamari and fried chicken wings.

My cousins ordered the pad thai, a beef and chicken curry. The first order that came out was the pad thai. It tasted very good. It had different noodles in it that I never had before. Next were the curries. Kinda spicy but, I like spicy food. Next was the calamari. It had a glaze of hot mustard on it. It was good as well but, next time would have the sauce on the side. Lastly, the chicken wings came. They were good until I reached for the last wing. It was NOT cooked fully. It still had blood running from it. I couldn't request for a new order of wings since I was stuffed already.

In summary, the food was good but that last wing ruined it for me. For that, I would have to give this place zero stars. I just have been having stomach problems from eating here last night =/. Sorry guys for TMI, but got to keep it REAL!
author: Jay G.

description: Low quality ingredients gives this restaurant 1-star for me. Not worth the trip or the money.
author: Kelly B.

description:
The only other Osha I have visited is a fancy one in SOMA, so I was surprised to find this location much more, eh, relaxed. This isn't to say its interior is shabby, it's not off-putting, but you ought to adjust your expectations should you chose to visit. And you should. The servers and staff of the lunch crew were kind and professional without being overbearing. Missing was the syrupy ceremoniousness one often finds in a $$ or $$$ Thai restaurant, and I was happy for that.

All of the food we ordered was fresh and delicious, and a good value. We ordered two curries over rice (actually comes with the curry beside a neat square tower of steaming  rice, not literally one atop the other, if that matters to you as it does to me), and two spring roll appetizers with one iced tea. Came to almost exactly $50, which my Groupon covered perfectly, except the tip. 

I'm not often in that exact location, but if I am again I will not hesitate to stop in.
author: Gary P.

description:
I love Osha! I'm reviewing this location because I go to the one on Geary the most. The food is delicious! I'm vegetarian and there are so many options, and let me tell you- they are all amazing! My favorite dish is the pumpkin red curry with veggies instead of tofu, but I would also recommend the green curry friend rice! 

I love the Geary location because it's open late & you can typically get seated quickly & the food is prepared in a timely manner. My only downfall is that the service kind of sucks, but the menu at this location is larger than the others & the food is cheaper- it's kind of a trade off. 

If I don't go to this location, I'd recommend the one on 2nd.
author: Nicole S.

description:
Lunch special!!  get it with soup! its A-MA-ZING!!
Their food is just so perfectly spiced and savory! I like the cleanliness of the place and the service is good too! 
There was just a fly roaming around our table that we were not very fond of. But overall a great place. We will definitely be returning.
author: Luis and Yona V.

description:
I would give this place 0 star if I could. Came here on a Sunday night with my boyfriend around 11:30pm.... place was pretty empty.
 
I can't even say we had bad service because we barely got any service. There were two other people at the restaurant that literally had to get up and walk to the waiter to order food. My boyfriend had a dirty fork too..

The food was a huge disappointment. Everything was so salty! We ordered 3 appetizers because we weren't too hungry- angel wings, fried calamari, and tuna tar tar. The angel wings were salty and not crispy. Calamari was just dry and chewy. Tuna tar tar was the worst...this was my favorite dish!! The tuna looked like left over fish and the mango was hard and sour...and where's the avocado?! They replaced the wonton chips to fish chips (it tasted like plastic). Even King of Thai is much better quality then this and much cheaper! 
My boyfriend went to their bathroom and told me it was the most disgusting bathroom he has ever been too...even worse then Chinatown bathrooms. It smelled like a porta potty. Gross!!!!

What a shame! We use to love coming here...but now we will never return. What a waste of time and money!!!!
author: Em Z.

description:
LOVE THEIR FOOD!  My boyfriend and I ate here for lunch before leaving San Francisco. They made our last day pleasant.  The server was attentive and their food is just amazing.

Must try the mango ice cream and sticky rice.  It's delicious!
author: DJ P.

description: Our order came late, people who had sat down 20mins after us got their food before us. That pissed me off, cause I'm starving and had been waiting for my food. My soup was extremely hot, I burned my tongue (not to pleased about that), after came the steak salad and the steak was cold, then came the pad Thai which came 30mins after we had received the other dishes but it was cold and it's suppose to be a hot dish. The waitress ignored basically not once did she check in or did she acknowledged that we had not received one of the dishes. She was so busy talk to her friends, that she completely ignored us. The service was terrible, food is just okay.
author: Cassandra G.

description:
Osha is the quintessential late-night munchies type place for food lovers. Let's face the cold hard truth - when you find yourself at a place like this at midnight, it's usually because you're not caring about anything much, you just need food, and quick. But Osha delivers the goods well above and beyond what would normally be expected from a place that exists solely to help one soak up alcohol.....space cookies....both? Within stumbling distance of where I was staying (albeit stumbling up some pretty steep hills), how could I resist? I also couldn't resist making Occupational Safety & Health Administration jokes (hey, you tend to remember *some* things from business school).....

Anyway, this is some smokin' gourmet Asian Fusion stoner food. Temptation Rolls were certainly tempting, with coconut curry mousse and sea bass. Japanese meets Thai in a torrid embrace. Then there was a mango curry with prawns and calamari, which kinda reminded me upon first glance of something that might be found back home with our ubiquitous mangoes - but instead of taking the Caribbean/Creole tack, it went with coconut and jasmine rice. One foot in Thailand, the other somewhere else. An interesting dish.....but dessert was even more interesting, a colorful coconut jelly with tapioca. It was oddly colored....looked like no dessert I'd ever had. A little gooey, but I was expecting that - and the pieces of corn "baked" in throughout gave it some textural pop. 

I almost feel that this place deserves better than its apparent reputation as a late-night hangout. Why, if I lived near here, I might even be tempted to make this place the main event for a Friday night....could easily see myself as a regular.
author: Patrick L.

description:
We came here at dinner time for a small birthday meal on a Sunday. It was not empty, but not full. The place has a very modern feel with white "plastic-y" walls with hot pink decorations on walls and tables, and white plastic "scoop chairs". It is not your traditional hole-in-the-wall thai restaurant with thai decorations everywhere. 

Service was good, though we didn't love how the first few dishes came out one at a time. Our group of six finished the first two dishes (which were not appetizers) seperately and waited in between for more food to come. 

Presentation of food was very nice. But the quality: not the best thai I've had, though there is much worse. I love eggplant in my curry and was disappointed that there was pretty much1 single piece in the whole dish. We also ordered one of the beef entres, and just thought it was too sweet/sugary. Pad see ew and friend rice were ok. The best part of the meal was their larb chicken salad. It was definitely the highlight.
author: Elyse N.

description:
After a long evening of scrumptious cocktails, my friend recommended we check out Osha for a late night meal.  It was a close walk and I trusted her opinion, so I figured, why not?

   The interior was a more modern take on Asian, nothing particularly noteworthy.  I did however love the wide wraparound windows, to people-watch while we ate.  Since we were there a little later in the evening, we had absolutely no problem grabbing a table.  Although they do have your more typical Thai choices, like pad thai, we opted for their more unique offerings.  We quickly put in an order for temptation rolls, a mixture of Chilean sea bass, coconut curry mousse, and fragrant herbs, rolled up in seaweed.  I don't remember too much about this other than to say we gobbled it down nearly as soon as it was placed in front of us.  Next up we chose one of the monthly specialties, a Golden Mango Curry with prawns, calamari, coconut yellow curry, fresh mango, carrots, onions, and bell peppers served with jasmine rice.  It was unlike any traditional thai curry I'd had before, but it was really flavorful and quite tasty.  For dessert we went with the rainbow coconut, which was described as rainbow-layer thai coconut jelly served with tapioca.  I don't know quite what I expected but what we received was so stunning and whimsical it reminded me of something out of Puff the Magic Dragon.  The "jelly" was almost custard-like, smooth and rich.  I really enjoyed the textural contrast of the tapioca.  Plus, they added pieces of corn, yes corn.  It was completely unexpected but added a phenomenal burst of flavor that really worked with the silky coconut.  I've never had anything quite like it and I hope that they make it a regular menu staple.

   Good service, delicious food, I really couldn't ask for much more!  I loved the innovative twists and stunning presentation!  Yum!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
3 stars if I got anything else, 4 stars because I got the pad kee mao and I love how there's so many vegetables! Very seldom do I find pad kee mao that loads it up on bell peppers, mushrooms, those green bean looking things use in Thai dishes, basil, (I requested no bamboo shoots)... plus there were hella chicken on top of that! Very good and flavorful, they made it within 10 minutes. I love the pickled jalapenos on the table along with the very spicy red flakes (wish they had serranos). Loaded my dish with those and enjoyed a good spicy meal. 

My friends got 3 other dishes: crab fried rice, yellow curry, and pad see ew. The crab fried rice turned out very good, strong in crab flavor! A bit pricier than other Thai restaurants, $10.95 for a noodle dish. They open till 3 AM on Saturday, we went there after the bars on a hungry stomach and it def hit the spot. OH! The presentation is pretty. Big plates with sriracha decoration on the rim. Win.
author: Rita K.

description:
Horrific Host
substandard service/ hella rude b****
I was hoping to find some pressed duck or a crispy at searving;
my friend and I were "greeted" by a barking ambiguous wait-staff. I ask about the duck and she continued by gritting her teeth asaulting us with her tone and everytime "wait-staff" couldn't answer my question but kept repeating 'non of the duck is crispy only cooked."  ??? we ran out, across the street and had gelatos, a brie and avocado sandwich and hella desserts..!
author: Karina P.

description:
In a nutshell: passable, overpriced Thai food that's really just ideal for padding your stomach before/during/after drinking at the many quality bars in the surrounding area.

The Moroheiya Pad Thai was an interesting change of pace from the usual dish.  Healthier?  To an extent.  Tasty?  Not so much and especially lacking in flavor.  My friends had Tom Yum Noodle Soup and Lamb Chops, both of which were standard fare with upcharges.
author: Eric F.

description: Everything is overpriced... Portions are also small... The favors are just ok...The place seems to be empty... I would not return here again!
author: Wilson T.

description: Ordered Tom Kha and all I could taste was the coconut milk. The curry rice was over cooked. The grains were all sticking together. Too much water. I cook and I'm in culinary school. Their standard definitely dropped!!
author: Do L.

description:
After walking through streets that smells like piss and fart, I almost turned back and headed home. But I didn't.

I went with my sister, my girlfriend, and my best friend. We loved this place unanimously. Here's what we got:

Drinks: Kiss Me Please, Osha Volcanic Mojito.
The Osha Volcanic Mojito is good to have when you go on dates with a shy asian girl who doesn't like to drink. It'll get them hooked right away, and you'll thank the social lubricant. It's REALLY tasty because of the sweetness. You can barely taste the alcohol, it's like drinking an exotic fruit punch.

The Kiss Me Please is for the more intense person. It's a little spicy! If you like a special exotic taste that's not very sweet definitely get this. For the entire time, this drink had bubbles sizzling through the drink. Very artistic, and very tasty.

Dishes:
Pad Kee Mao: This tasted like every other Pad Kee Maos... I don't understand why everybody loves it. I will go eat more of these and maybe I'll understand it better...

Mango Curry: OH MAH GAWD! The taste went into my mouth and then the smell went up my nostrils and everything combined and exploded in my head. I simply love the taste. There is shrimp in there and other seafood meat, which was beyond my expectations. I thought I was just getting mango in my curry!

Crap Fried Rice: Hmmm.... I really liked the crab meat. The first 2 bites weren't that great, but after awhile I started lovin it. It's an acquired taste I guess... I'm glad I started liking it. As we were eating, we saw  TWO crab pinchers! Not one, but TWO! 

This restaurant was great, the total for everything was $60.60

From my one experience at this place, I got the impression that it's the kind of place that goes beyond expectations.

AND THE PLACE is pretty nice! Sharp contrast with the Janky neighborhood. If you come here on a date, take a cab here. 

When you leave, call (415)333-3333 and order a cab right when you get the tab.
author: Song Z.

description:
I took my friends there and they all loved it. They can't stop talking about it now. My friend said Volcano Mojito was the bomb. We tried crab fried rice, golden mango curry, and pad kee mao. They were so good!!! Golden mango curry goes well with all the rice-kind. I mixed the curry with crab friend rice. It was heavenly. 

You won't regret going there if you have never been there.
author: Fong C.

description:
So spicy food, the best!! Yummy.
For me he best alternative when I don't have time for make dinner. Also perfect for a relax gnite if you want to eat there. Everybody so friendly!!
author: Arturo R.

description:
After several very heavy (and somewhat pricey) meals during a week in SF...we were on the prowl for something a bit more "realistic." When one of my dining companions suggested the Osha located right next to Rye (duh, perfect) we were sold and headed over. Something fairly uncomplicated, reservations not really necessary, and could seat a medium sized group. 

They easily accommodated 7 of us at a table...quickly informed us it was $5 cocktail night (Thursday), we all ordered a diabetic-coma-inducing cocktail (seriously, nothing smooth or subtle about any of these!) and then got to work ordering things to share. I had the "I love lychee" and after about half couldn't finish. Stick to Rye for the cocktail magic. 

Orders of Tom Kha rice noodles (yum!), pepper lamb, garlic chicken, beef wasabi rolls, spring rolls, mango salad all arrived in succession, hot and tasty. We were all able to split easily, and there was surely plenty of food for all of us. Actually the lamb sticks were my favorite. 

For $138 with drinks/tax (roughly $20/pp), this was a steal in SF. The food is fairly average Thai, but certainly not disappointing, the drinks are super sugary....the service AOK. It's open late and next to Rye, so right there you've got a win.
author: Colleen C.

description:
Every Osha in the city just feels right to me. The Osha in the Mission was the first restaurant I patronized when I moved back to San Francisco.  I was obsessed. Every day I would venture over and indulge in a massive serving of pad-thai and pumpkin curry.  It's no big surprise that the Thai food here in San Francisco far exceeds all Thai food experiences in Boston (where I lived for a couple of months).

The Geary location is the original Osha location and you can feel it. The place just feels lived in and I can only imagine the debauchery that has stumbled in here since 1996. Situated right across from The Clift Hotel and right next door to Rye, it's prime real estate for those looking for some affordable quality grub before or after a late evening of cocktails.

I always love coming to this particular Osha for their spicy string beans and for a side of brown rice. They don't mess around when it comes to their beans. The portions are seriously what's up and they always bring the spice. Their brown rice is great too. Fluffy and full of substance.

If you have yet to go to this Osha - try to fix that as soon as possible. It's a testament of how good food and hard working business owners can flourish in this city. The countless other Oshas which have opened up across the city -all stemmed from this one. And though the newer locations have added an air of modernity and chicness to them - this Geary location is historical and just go with the flow. And with a closing hour of 3:00am on the weekends and free delivery till 11:00am it exceeds what's upness in the restaurant landscape in San Francisco.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Like Denny's, but Thai-style.  Total midnight munchies for the inner party girl in you.  What I CRAVE after a night of dancing, drinking and debauchery.  Super cheap, super late-night eats for you and 20 of your closest friends.  Think sticky-icky Pad Thai (yummm!), crunchy-fried tofu (drools!), and a hot piping bowl of traditional boat noodle (dank!).  They are extremely accommodating for large parties and don't even mind that your bestie's throwing up in the bin beside your table.  Now that's what I call service y'all!  I'm only kidding...she was throwing up in the bathroom beside our table, not the bin ;D  With 7 locations sprinkled throughout the city, experience traditional meets new-age Thai right around the corner from your hood!

Bon Appétit my beauties!
author: Julie K.

description:
It's one of those reviews..

Quick and painless (hopefully)..

- DON'T serve alcohol at 1:35AM if you do NOT want your dine-in customers to consume them.

- DON'T give your customers simple mixed drinks TEN minutes later and deliver the drinks while strictly stating, "YOU HAVE 3 MINUTES TO FINISH THESE [THREE MIXED DRINKS]" *wtf!?!?*

- DON'T come back within the minute and nag, "YOU HAVE TWO MINUTES LEFT". *our "three minutes" didn't pass and it has not yet struck 2AM*

- DON'T forcefully take away our TWO UNTOUCHED drinks and ONE SLIGHTLY sipped drink away and scream, "YOUR TIME IS UP". *STILL not 2AM, might I add*

- DON'T charge us for three drinks when two were untouched.

- DON'T argue at your customers and think everything is fine just because you remove 1 drink order off the bill, but still charge us for 2 drinks.

- DON'T keep the change if the bill is $47 and we gave you $60 flat.

- DON'T over tip yourself $13 because you truly DON'T deserve a single cent for your outstanding service.

- DON'T argue with your customers (again) and deliver back some "change", pissfully, by grabbing a handful of coins from your tip jar and shoving it across the table. 

- DON'T work here anymore, your out of your god damn mind, lady.
author: Albert L.

description: I have been here quite a few times because I work in the are and have always thought the service was alright and that the food as well is good. However, today you receive three stars for your service. I paid the 2.99 delivery fee plus .10 bag fee. After waiting past the delivery time I called to check and see what the hold up was considering you only had to go 5 blocks to drop it off to me. When I called they stated that it had been sitting there waiting for over a half hour to be picked up. They did not call to tell me my order was waiting (which seems to be just proper etiquette and good customer service), they were not even trying to deliver it. They told me that I should contact eat24 to complain (which is awful customer service) because they had not been informed by the third party that the order was to be dropped off. I feel that as a customer it is not my job to contact the third party a business uses about service errors. It is not my restaurant. If you as a restaurant are having technical problems with your third party service it should be your responsibility to rectify the situation. If it happened to me then I am positive that others have had the same experience.
author: Samantha S.

description:
Not impressed, 
Not impressed. Osha Thai is always disappointing me like a bad lover, I just keep coming back for more.  You will not trick me again.
author: Coco J.

description:
Food is so basic. Also saw server using his barhands to top of plates wolith garnish. He then wiped his hands on hos shirt and I continue to see him touch the phone, dirty plates, and handle the bill without washing his hands. 

I got the boat noodles that felt over priced for how much meat they gave and also the broth didnt taste authentic.
author: Evan L B.

description: Definitely great service! However, I was disappointed in the food quality. The tom-kha noodles which I had ordered was too sweet, it served more like a desert instead. It seems as though their main ingredients were nothing but salt and sugar.
author: Sherry L.

description: I'm not usually a big fan of eating after a big night of drinking but oh man was this good- I want to go back to savor it all. The pad thai was ridiculous, I can still taste it a week later, and the samosas that I ordered were killer.  Everyone in my group needed a carbo load and this place definitely fit the bill. Can't wait to go back!
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Our food was brought to the table 5 minutes after we ordered, the waiter brought us refills of water several times, and the food was generally awesome. Not to mention the happy staff, this made us feel very welcome. 

Also, most dishes can be made vegetarian as well as vegan. Great place!
author: Espen H.

description:
The first option that comes to mind after clubbing or bar hopping in the city, and I'm hungry: "Mmm, Osha?"

Osha is good for a few simple reasons. 
1) It's open late.
2) It's consistent in my book. I think theres always been an order of Pad Thai on the table when I eat here and each time, it's neither better nor worse than the last. It's just as good.
3) There are plenty of menu options to explore.
4) Staff is usually on the go and in a rush to get other people seated, so our check is usually taken care of quickly.

That being said, it isn't the best Thai food I've ever had. On a scale of Terrible to The Best Ever, it's fairly median to me at Well-to-do. And there's nothing wrong with Well to-do.
author: Emmeline A.

description:
One of my all time favorite Thai restaurants. 

After gallivanting in the city, Osha is always a chill, fun, late night option. 

I've been coming to this original OSHA for years, before any of the sister locations and before this goth style remodel with all black walls, ceilings, and tables. But you know what? I'll throw on some guyliner and look like Hot Topic's spring collection because they have one of my all time favorite dishes here. 

" Pad See Ew "  --  Rice noodles, Chinese broccoli, egg, garlic, with a black soy bean sauce. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vsNXAscvm-FIU423Cy874w?select=MAjQnwMryIv6-ugvkXzHzg)

I don't know exactly why it tastes so good but it's perfect to share and been known to prevent hangovers. 

Pad See Ew, Papaya Salad, Pineapple Fried Rice = FTW 
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vsNXAscvm-FIU423Cy874w?select=PedD-SLfKla-GHjMDh0Kag)
author: Earl G.

description:
No way does this restaurant approach a four star rating.  One and a half stars at best. I'm giving it one, and that's being generous.  Come on Yelpers?  Are you kidding?  A four star restaurant has the service, ambiance and presentation it deserves.  This is a quick serve restaurant with a courteous staff. I had dinner here on 12/20/15. I ordered hot tea (Jasmine) on this cold, rainy night, but they were out!!  So green tea was delivered and it was not worth mentioning.  Next I ordered Tom Yum soup - a bowl. It was good.  Not great, but acceptable.  It was pricy at $16. Ouch, but it had 5 shrimp.  I also ordered Pineapple fried rice.  Gummy and totally without any flavor.  I found only two small shrimp for $14.  They are really stingy with the contents.  So overall, I would not recommend this restaurant.  There is another Thai restaurant about a block south that was packed.  Even on a rainy night they had a line out the door.  So in going there next time.  

To the management:  You can do a lot better.  The cooking and flavors need to be substantially improved.
author: Chris D.

description:
As a frequent customer at this Osha i have had a great experience, yet today I shall see just how tacky the workers are. Not eating the whole day because of school work my friend and I thought that Osha would be a delicious late dinner to have. we both shared a dish and payed and sat there for about five minutes after they took the bill. We did not leave a tip due to the waitress not doing anything special, she didn't fill up my friends glass of water, she didn't check up on us and she snatched the menus from our hands after ordering. 

     She came over and circled the tip guide and told us that the price that we payed didn't add up to what it should have been. she then said that the manager would get upset with them because they didn't get a tip and it reflected their performance. I explained to here that we are students and quit frankly don't have tips to spare for the night, we need to take the bus home and we need the cash. 
      
      She then told us that it was traditional to give a tip and i told her i understood but that the manager needed to realize that not everyone eating there would have a tip to just hand out and that in reality we are not obligated to give you a tip). It was just so tacky and mediocre to get in our faces and circle the tip guide as if we were blind and didn't realize that it was even on the bill. I will never go there again and mind you, i go there just about every week to get dinner which i spend over $20 on each time plus a $5 dollar tip when i have extra money to spare. 

      Word of advice, the food there is good, but the staff isn't anything to rave about , they need to take their heads out of the gutter and check that nervy attitude of theirs.
author: Mike D.

description:
It's 2am and you're wandering around the city looking for a place to soak up all the drinks you've sipped on...

I ended up at Osha Thai and it was packed! Parking wasn't too bad in this bustling area. People come and go so often i was able to snag a spot just a block away. Put our names on the list and waited less than 10 minutes for a table. The food comes out fast and it's always satisfying eating late night food. The price is right and you'll find your favorites like Pad Thai, Pad Sew Ew, and different thai curries.
author: Samantha L.

description:
I'm from LA and in Thai town (Hollywood Blvd) a handful of great Thai food lives there.      

This restaurant exceeds my expectations in a Thai restaurant.   I understand every restaurant has there own style and tastes but this stands out 100 percent!   

Ordered: tom yum = great. Phad see ew = awesome. Beef basil over rice = fuggetaboutit!! Thai iced coffee = the real. Arnold Palmer = bomb.com.  Spring roll = peanut sauce (I wish I had some right now). 

The waitress thought I was crazy ordering all of that for two.  I almost finished the entrees too.   Shhhhhhhhhhit.
author: Steven D.

description:
The only location of theirs that I've been to and I love it! I'm glad they serve alcoholic drinks now, even though I don't get drunk too often. But, anyway, their pad thai is always on point. The calamari is bomb and my bf really loves the fried wontons and the volcanic beef. The tom yum is good too as well as their yellow curry dishes.

I love how they're open late and the service is good and the food usually comes out pretty quickly.

Parking can be tough, but we usually find a space after circling the block 3 times.
author: Fallon P.

description:
Probably 2.5 stars, but I'm in the mood to round up today.

We were looking for some late night grub, and this place happened to be open.  I cracked open the menu and prices were about a few dollars more than standard Thai places.  Meh.  I ordered the beef Pad See Ew for $11...the portion size was OK, but I felt like it was a tad on the smaller side.  Taste was OK.  

Overall, I probably won't be back.  Higher prices for mediocre Thai food....I think we can do better than that.
author: Laura C.

description:
AMAZING food! Seriously came out with ten minutes of ordering. We got the calamari - really fresh and hot & also the cashew chicken. We ate every single bite.

Side note - I used the bathroom and was mortified when there was no soap. I told our server and she escorted me back to the colleague bathroom. I had to walk through the kitchen to get there. It was VERY clean along with the bathroom. They refilled the soap immediately as well.

Great service, delicious food and chill ambiance.  We'll definitely be back!
author: Katherine E.

description: Good food and decor was not fancy. but bathroom conditions were smelly and not clean.
author: Matt R.

description: ...i've been eating here for years...and up until the other night...i never realized that gratuity is added to your bill!!!  seriously?!  we only had a party of 3!!  so...that means i've been tipping 40% all this time?! ...minus stars for that!
author: Nancy T.

description:
Thai food with great presentation. It is located near lots of nightlife activites. So I recommend this for a tasty bite before going to trek the bars and lounges and dance clubs in the neighborhood.

* TOM YUM Spicy & Sour soup with lemongrass, galangal, Kaffir lime leaf, mushrooms, and tomatoes (chicken) $9.95 (3 of 5) Too salty and too strong of fish sauce. I would skip the soup. 

* PAD THAI Pan fried rice noodle, egg, tofu, bean sprouts and crushed peanut.$10.95 (3.5 of 5) Surprisingly very good here. Looks pretty and tastes great. Great noodle texture and great flavors. 

* VOLCANIC BEEF (served with rice) Grilled steak, basil, bell pepper, garlic, black pepper in lava sauce with ring of onion. $15.95 (4 of 5) Tasty. Steak is cubed and cooked to medium, so it is still juicy. Goes great with their rice. And looks so pretty with the onion rings stacked up to look like a volcano. Yummy.
author: Janice T.

description: I love Thai food and have tried different restaurants where Im now able to tell the quality between restaurants.  I'm not impressed with Osha and feel almost like the staff is just no longer in love with cooking Thai food. It almost feels like the food was cooked in such a rush just to get it out of the way., that lacks that complex flavoring that I have learned to love in Thai food. I think I'll pass.
author: Karla D.

description: Very very delicious Thai food. Perfect for late night food. Man be careful. We ordered the medium and our mouths were burning. Ordered the Papaya salad and the volcanic beef. Really tasty
author: Sam N.

description:
I recommend the mango curry. I had it got lunch today and it was fabulous. 
Service was quick. It seems to work well if your in a hurry or have a laid back schedule. 
It's a good place.
author: Dan R.

description: Okay food. Silly servers too busy gossiping. Much better when it was King of Siam. I tried to ask for what I wanted but the server just laughed & turned away to talk to her friends. Won't be back.
author: Scott F.

description: Everyone needs a sudsy lair to regroup from the night's festivities and add a little carbo loading against the demon rum. The devil here is the crab fried rice, maybe the best pre-hangover dish I have had, outside the eggs and waffles while being parked at Waffle House at 3 in the morning bombed out of your mind. Fluffy rice with the perfect ratio of crab and veggies. Yes, you want this dish.
author: Richard B.

description: It's A-okay. I had the pad see ew, which was not bad, and they gave me a large portion - I couldn't even finish it. Service wasn't bad for a to-go order, but it was nothing I haven't tried before. Will be back if I am ever in the area, but parking is pretty hard around here.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Came here after a girls night out.  It was pretty busy but we were fortunate to get seated quickly.  

The food was great, especially the pineapple fried rice which helped with the alcohol. Service was good too.  Osha Thai just made the night even better.

Will be coming back.
author: Amy C.

description:
Food was just blah!  The best thing here I recommend would be the RAW NAKED PRAWNS for $10.  That's about it.  The rest is overpriced and service under delivered.  We paid $20 for KOBE beef and they overcooked it.  Portions of the Kobe was really for one.   It was dry and had no taste to it.  The $8 grilled scallops, they only gave two pieces serving  for one and again, no taste other than it was grilled. The deep fried bananas was soggy and the only saving to this was the coconut ice cream.

What bothered me the most about this Osha Thai Geary location  was that service really suck!  Even the tables next to us and the ones behind us waited for a long time to get their bill.  We had to raise our hands just to get service to have our tea refilled which they used this cheap version of green tea.  In other words, once they hand your meals, they don't comeback to checkup on you.  It wasn't even that busy.  I'm disappointed.
author: Nate L.

description:
This is the place to go when you're hungry and drunk at 2am!  It's pretty crowded here and the food always seem to taste oh so good when you're buzzin!

A great end to a fun filled night, my tummy was quite happy after some crab fried rice- this is delicious!  A must order for all your trips to Osha's!  I also inhaled the Volcanic Beef- very tender and tasty and it comes with deep fried onion rings in a shape of a volcano.  Very creative!  The sauce that comes with the beef is exploding with great flavors!  The Pad See Ew is a traditional favorite-you can't go wrong with this order.  However, the Papaya Salad with the Salty Crab had to much fish sauce in it.  

Would love to come here again and again!
author: Melanie N.

description:
Let me start by noting that the food was generally good - I quite likely my Pad See Ew, which had the high temperature wok aroma and decent to good quality beef. The scallop appetizer, on the other hand, was disappointing. There were only two pieces, and for $10, they should be damn good. While they were large, they were also flavorless. Still, I would eat here again.

Why 2 stars, then?

I came in as a party of five and they seated us. After five minutes or so, they asked us to move to another table so that they could seat a party of ten. Uh ... maybe you shouldn't have given us such a large table then? Annoying, but sure, okay.

When our bill came, I was quite surprised to see that a gratuity had been tacked on already. Parties of six or greater, sure, that's common enough. But for five people? Alright, fine, whatever. I don't like when restaurants assume a tip for themselves but if that's your policy, that's your policy. However, when I get my credit card receipt to sign, they were asking for tip on top of the gratuity! What really upsets me if there are probably people who don't even examine the original bill and add an extra 15% or 20% on top of their already paid for tip. I really don't appreciate being tricked.

This is a really terrible practice and they should stop.
author: Chris C.

description:
Men, this location is like the red headed bastard child of this restaurant chain.It's so terribe.  ( no offense to red heads =).

However, I' making a plug for the Osha  in the Embarcadero, I love that place!. They appetizers are soo good they even come with edible flowers.  

Now, let's continue talking about the Osha in the TL. I ordered the Tom Ka, a soup that I'm obsessed with I love it so much, I dream about it at night and my mouth waters by just thinking about it. Unfortunately, I got a watery tasteless wanna be Tom Ka impostor. It had the texture of water down cow's milk, not even coconut milk. Sick! 
It had a bit noodles and 1 piece of chicken. It was so gross, I didn't even finish it. How dare you butcher my favorite soup!

Well, I though, how worse can it get? 

Then, my husband's yellow curry with beef came. Not only the potatoes were rock solid--raw-- they were unpeeled and were bruised purple in some spots, as if they had taken a beating from the chef! After that, my husband could not eat it.

Then I tough shit, really this sucks, but keep a PMA, the green papaya with crab, that I was going to split with my friend, is coming. 

When the server was dropping the salad, he said to my friend "wow, you sure eat allot"???? "Did he just say that?" I asked, thinking I might have miss heard him. My friends we flabbergasted and said "yeah he did" WTF??
My friend was embarrassed, but I said to him "let's just eat it and forget about the jerk server". 
The salad was so spicy I could even pass my first bite. And the crab was soft shell blue crab, I think, the one that you have to eat with the shell. This place is gnarly.

NEVER COMING BACK TO THIS PLACE! IT HAS STUPIDLY TERRIBLE FOOD AND SLOW RUDE SERVICE!
author: Angela R.

description: Oddly overpriced for food quality and quanity.
author: Fanshu B.

description:
I don't usually eat curries but when I do-I make sure to stop by Osha for the Pumpkin Chicken Curry! I could LIVE off this stuff. The pumpkin is cooked perfectly EVERYTIME. And the amount of spice verse coconut milk is spectacular.  

Basil Chicken is great too-but that pumpkin curry!! :-p
author: Stephanie G.

description:
OSHA's is literally one of the best Thai places to go in the city. I have been to multiple locations but this location in particular has been great for late night food after the clubs because they are open till 3am.
