My friends and I have come here multiple times shortly before closing and proceed to order a ton of food and they are always so gracious and speedy with the service and putting up with multiple tables of drunken idiots!

The food is delicious too which is the best part - especially the Roasted Duck Curry, mmmm my favorite! But all their dishes are pretty darn good, maybe not the best I've had across the whole menu but with its warm, unassuming atmosphere, diligent service, and tasty food its a definite 4 - 4.5 stars.
author: Giordan P.

description:
First off let me say the food was great according to standards at all of the Osha restaurants in Bay area. Review is for service at this particular location. 

When we ordered we asked for our order to be made a certain way. The server said it will be an extra charge of $2 for our request which I readily agreed. When the food came to our table it was prepared the standard way as it's generally served. When i questioned, the server claimed food was customized as we had requested but clearly it was not. There were no apologies rather there was an attitude of "eat it and leave". I let it slide and didnt make a big fuss of it although i was going to get charged extra couple bucks for the customized order.

The big surprise was when our bill came. A gratuity of 20% was already added to bill and ours was party of 3. I asked another sever (since our server was not in sight for over 10 minutes) for an explanation from whoever prepared the bill and automatically tacked on a gratuity whatever they feel they deserved. They finally fixed it but there was no explanation given on why the error occurred in the first place.

Please note another reviewer below had the exact same thing happen to him not too long ago. This is CHEATING, Osha management please take notice of your staff behavior or you risk losing your customers and business..
author: Hoabie S.

description:
I am a big fan of Osha Thai, and I used to love Osha Thai Noodle Cafe. The duck noodle soup and the Thai Boat noodles were consistently amazing. This noodle cafe was my go to place to bring people to when I ran out of ideas to go, but now I don't know if going here is worth a trek through the Tenderloin. 

I came here on a Friday night around 9. Me and my friend ordered a Volcanic Beef, Papaya Salad and Thai Boat noodles. We had dinner around 6 and weren't super hungry, but who could resist a second dinner? All the food disappointed me. Everything lacked flavor. The Papaya salad didn't have the tartness that it usually has, it felt like it was watered down. The rice with the Volcanic Beef was limp and soggy and the beef lacked flavor. The sauce was the only thing that saved the dish. It didn't just stack up to the Volcanic Beef that I had at the Osha Thai Embarcadaro.

My go to noodle dish, Thai Boat Noodles, was depressingly bland. The soup looked dark and thick, but the taste just wasn't there.

You've impressed me so many times in the past, but last week's performance was very disappointing. Hopefully next time you'll be the Osha that I remembered.
author: David C.

description:
Fantastic food but rude staff

I visited Osha last night for the second time (I've been to their other location on the Embarcadero). I again loved my food but the staff was unbelievably rude!

The restaurant wasn't that busy and we had already ordered appetizers and drinks so we weren't lolly-gagging, but our waitress "Gipzy" came over to hustle us into ordering entrees. When my friend asked for her entree to be made spicy, Gipzy rolled her eyes and said that my friend did NOT want her entree spicy. My friend insisted that she liked spicy Thai food, and after some negotiating Gipzy finally agreed. Gipzy then told us that if we didn't like our food, the restaurant would NOT be making us any other food. 

We thought that she had to be joking but she was dead serious. Luckily we found humor in this interaction, but I will not be returning to this Osha location.
author: Lauren G.

description:
First, I have to mention...I feel like most people don't write reviews for "popular" spots like Osha Thai unless they have something to complain about. I know seeing over a thousand reviews for a restaurant, I usually feel like...eh, my comment isn't really going to help anyone. 

BUT....NOT THIS TIME!!! OH HELLLLLL NO!

I live couple of blocks away from this Osha. It's one of the few sit down places open around here. I'm not a regular, but I feel like I've been here enough times to know the place pretty well. I don't know the staff by name, but I do recognize if the servers are new or if they changed up their menu...

Basically, this review is a 2 for 1. 

TONIGHT...my party of four was seated and immediately my friend and I was wondering if our server was having a bad day. Dinner proceeded and she NEVER came by our table. Another server came by and cleared some of our empty plates and offered to pack up our left overs. Then, POOF! Our server appeared with our check. Wow, she must be having one of those days...

Then I looked at our check....a gratuity was added. I immediately called her over and had the following conversation:

ME: "I see a gratuity has been added, when did you start adding gratuity to parties of four?" 

SERVER:  "it's new, we add gratuity to parties of four or more." 

ME: "Okay, when did you start doing that? And where does it say that in the restaurant or the menu? So even THAT table over there will be charged a gratuity? 

SERVER: "Okay, I will fix that for you" 

UM....why are you treating me like I just ordered one appetizer and four waters for four people? I didn't know I was being a horrible customer ordering two drinks and four entrees. Did I offend you for coming into a restaurant to eat dinner? Or did our loving relationship just end when I put my fork down, therefore you and I will never see each other again???? 

This is some shady behavior ladies and gentlemen! And when I asked for the manager, another server (because she disappeared again) told me, that it was the manager's day off. 

Because this place is close to my house, I really really really don't want to hate the place. Another time, when I went about forty five minutes before closing time, they asked me if I could order everything at once so they can start closing the kitchen, I said sure! They want to go home as soon as the closing time, yes I understand they want to start closing the kitchen early. My roommate and I ordered couple of dishes and  fried bananas with ice cream. THE DESSERT CAME BEFORE ANY OTHER FOOD. 

Of course what I say here is solely my own opinion and blah blah blah...but honestly, Osha expanded the crap out of themselves and it seems there's NO SOLID MANAGEMENT. These servers do whatever they want, like start closing the kitchen early and adding gratuity to tables they "don't like".

Servers, customers, restaurant owners....we are all the same. You eat somewhere and the service is horrible, it puts you in a horrible mood. I don't go into restaurants thinking of ways to piss my server off. I'm not being overdramatic when I say that the server ruined our party's evening. What could have ended with a 15-20 percent tip with a, she must be having a bad night, comment amongst ourselves...it ended with an uncomfortable discussion with the staff.
author: Hanna K.

description:
We went for lunch here. Had a Yellow Curry and Beef Pad See You. The food came pretty fast and was decent, but they charged us an extra $7 for a fresh roll tofu appetizer we did not even order. Unfortunately we didn't notice this until late in the afternoon and couldn't go in to complain. There were only 3 or 4 other tables so I don't know how they screwed things up.

The decor isn't that great compared to other Osha chains, and the seating isn't that comfortable.
author: Elisa L.

description:
The food at this location is quite good: fresh, flavorful, plentiful...

The music at this location: makes me feel like a club kid circa 1995, when we were *all* cooler...

The seating at this location really sucks!  My dining companion is over 6 feet tall and of normal weight.  He could barely fit into those hard, wooden booths!  His thighs were being smooshed under the table as there was not enough room for his legs. On top of that, the back of the booths rocked back and forth, so it was nearly impossible to relax, sit still, and enjoy the meal.  I am not sure who designed those booths, but they are horrible.
author: Heather S.

description: Perfect after a long night of partying! Their wonton soup was really good! And their service was quick and accomodating!
author: Rio F.

description:
Short review: Waitress was a biatch & couldn't speak proper English, food was decent (nothing I can't get at any other Thai restaurant) & the food is over priced.

Overall, I'm never coming back.
author: Phoebe T.

description: I had the BEST coconut soup here and I try it almost everywhere I go and this was my favorite. I am giving it 3 stars because I thought my entree was a little bland, but I was able to spice it up with the spices and siracha they have on the table. I am used to Thai dishes being on the spicier side and this was much milder than I am used to, but the overall flavor was good. Also, the dinner entrees are huge and definitely big enough to split. The service was good and polite.
author: Faith A.

description: Osha is consistently good thai food (although not the best in SF). My husband and I like ordering from here. We usually get the combination fried rice and a pad thai or other noodle dish. also pretty quick delivery which we appreciate! Worth a try especially if you live in the neighborhood!
author: Lisa B.

description: Nothin beats the original! This place is great for lunch dinner or late night. No matter when and no matter how many times I've been here the food has always been good and it's prepared fast. Basically the same menu as some of the fancier osha's but the location and the ambiance makes this place way cooler to visit for me.
author: Anthony M.

description:
i remember osha back in the day...torn up chairs, nasty stained carpets...roaches joining you for your meal...but even with all the gross oddities, osha was always crazy busy.  why?  cause the food was just that good.

now, osha is poppin...it's all cleaned up.  new chairs, table, floors...although the bathroom is still gross...but what else would you expect from the TL?  haha.  and they've got numerous locations throughout the city...

service is decent...better than your average asian restaurant.  oh, and your best bet is public transportation to get here...parking sucks.  be prepared for a wait!  

i've always ordered the same things when i come to osha...i normally like to venture out...but i just can't get myself to do such a thing here.  princess wings and crab fried rice...can't go wrong with that combination.  

good back then...and still great now.  not sure how everything else tastes...but for my usual...4 stars!
author: Jen W.

description:
I generally stick to only Tuk Tuk Thai, in North Beach, and Couriander Thai, in the Westfield Mall as my only choice of Thai food spots. I always saw that Osha Thai on the corner of the block my house was always packed and open until 3AM on the weekends. So one day, me and my girlfriend after hanging out across the street at the Ambassador decided to have some dinner at this location

We were seated quickly upon entering and seeing how lucky we were to get the last table before it got more busy. I was used to looking at what thai food I would be eating before I ordered so I was a bit reluctant looking at the menu and unsure of what I wanted based on all the descriptions of each order. Luckily, eventually i found something I liked.

I ordered the fried chicken with rice plate and my girlfriend ordered a peppered chicken over steamed rice and we were both happy with our selections. Also, we ordered spring rolls as an appetizer to start off the meal and I must say, all the selections were very fresh and delicious. I was full by the end of the meal, so was my girlfriend and the atmosphere is nice and friendly and the staff helpful and quick. 

It wasn't expensive at all totaling about $30 for us two so it was a good affordable meal and I look forward to returning to this place real soon. 

Plan ahead if your looking for a late night eat because once the bars and clubs start emptying in the area, people will flock here and pack this place making it almost impossible to eat here.
author: Jesus A.

description: OSHA is as good as it gets after a night of drinking in SF. The food is delicious, and it comes out FAST! Their pad see ew is my favorite and can easily be shared between two people. Other good dishes are their fried rice and wontons. The service is always excellent. Keeping their doors open so late is a smart move in such a high traffic area. I will continue to visit OSHA when in the city
author: Liana H.

description:
Great place for lunch. 

The lunch specials are exactly what I'm looking for when I pick a lunch spot: Good portions, great flavor, balance of meat & vegetables.
author: Brian Y.

description:
Second time at one of the Osha Thai chains. Ordered the Spicy Basil Leaf rice plate w/ chicken. 

I don't think I've ever NOT particularly liked the basil rice plate dish at a Thai restaurant. This was the first. Pad Thai differs so much at each restaurant that it's always a bit of a risk to try - but the basil dish is usually consistently good. 

I wouldn't be opposed to coming back, but that's two almost meh strikes for Osha.
author: An Y.

description: Went out looking for a dessert place. Our options were limited as it was late on a weekday. We saw this place and thought mango stick rice sounded good. We ended up getting the stick rice and a fried banana. The mango sticky rice was disappointing. The rice was too hard, the mangos weren't very sweet, and there was barely any sweet milk ok the rice. The fried banana on the other hand was delicious. The breading had good texture and consistency and the coconut ice was lit.
author: Joon S.

description:
A bit dirty. 
Sloppy service. 
Dishes were ok. 
Nothing special.
author: Melody M.

description:
Definitely a great place to go eat late night. Came here close to midnight and was seated right away. 
Was pretty much just after a chicken pad seew and papaya salad and that's exactly what I got to perfection. 
I've been to the other Osha's and the quality of food is the same.
Being on Geary in this part of town, of course it's not as done up as the other Osha's but you're here to eat! 
Nothing to complain about.
Just that the place is old, diner style seating areas/booths and more cramped but remember, it's the food you're here for.
author: Van-Anh N.

description: The food was so tasty and they close at 3 am !! If you are looking for a good Thai restaurant for late weekends' nights, I would recommend this place :)
author: Sara K.

description:
Why Osha must you be SOOOOO expensive? Am I saying I can't afford it? No. I am saying I miss the days when this place was a seedy hole in the wall andI would get a plate of combo fried rice and Thai ice tea for less than $10. Now just pad Thai is $12? This prices can fly on union street but not when i have literally seem bums fighting outside. 

Do you know there are 4 other places within blocks of you that now have BETTER food at better prices. And their servers don't have attitudes.... 

I used to love you soooo much...... 

When I m craving angel wings or beef wasabi rolls... I might come back....but wouldn't feel like spending $9 for an appetizers.....
author: Ashley H.

description: Best Thai food in the city and if you don't like it you're wrong.  Pad Thai and Pad See Ew an Tom Ka Chicken soup and Green Papaya Salad and Yum Woon Sen are what I like
author: Tommy W.

description:
This place was hoppin when I arrived on a Thursday night just after 8pm. Trendy music and a bustling but very friendly waitstaff make for a great start. 

I asked for an appetizer recommendation and was told the crab rangoons. I just left Boston so had to resist, but was surprised to see this outside of a Chinese place. Wikipedia says they're popping up on Thai menus now, so go figure. 

Food was meh. Pad se-ew was a big portion and piping hot, but a bit bland. Wasabi beef spring rolls were terrible, had one and couldn't eat the rest.
author: Gino D.

description: The place is no-frills restaurant that is mostly just painted black with a few orchids throughout. The food is very good authentic Thai food that is cooked/served quickly. The prices are reasonable and the place stays open late. The ambiance has a food court/fast food feel so it doesn't feel like a place to hang out. I recommend!!
author: Serina J.

description: Amazing food, but not happy with the spice in the soup. I ordered Pumpkin curry & I burned my mouth. I would appreciate if they put the hot spice out. Despite the two stars review I keep on visiting them tho, I like their thais tea.
author: Allan S.

description: I went to Osha recently a little after 10PM on a weekend night and I honestly can't recommend eating here that late. Their late kitchen severely messed up a chicken pad thai, which I didn't think was possible. The noodles were dry, clumped, and didn't have any flavor. A lunch or dinner order may have been better with a better kitchen crew.
author: Eric H.

description:
What I ate: Curry puffs, Pad thai with tofu, Lychee moonlight
Visit date: October 12, 2011
First time? Yes.

O, I was so excited to try this place; maybe it was just too hyped up. The curry puffs were decent, but they didn't seem fresh. They were room temp which I thought was odd for something that is deep fried and supposedly made to order. The curry potato filling was tasty though. The pad thai was...interesting. The noodles were wider than normal and al dente. Al dente, really? For pad thai? The lychee moonlight beverage would have been good if it was so darn sweet. However, the whole lychee fruit on the bottom was a good ending for the meal.

Maybe the other locations are better?
author: Erin G.

description:
I'm debating between 1 vs. 2 stars for this place and ended going with 2 stars.  Here's why.

The food was hit and miss.  Pad see yew was superb, possibly one of the best in SF.  Panang beef curry came as a red curry but it tasted really good.  Crab fried rice was terrible.  It was red and soggy, definitely not crab fried rice.  Maybe they put ketchup in it?  (That's called American fried rice.)  

There's only 1 "shared" restroom at Osha that can use more frequent cleaning.  And the restaurant had many flies inside (at 11PM!!)  Not sure how it happened.  My drink even came with a fly.  Good thing that they replaced it or at least took it back to get the fly out.
author: Menoride Y.

description:
Of the local spots for late night grub, you really can't beat a jaunt with Osha. It's quick, always tasty, and always a great place for amazing people watching.

The wait sucks once closing time hits, so if you're hungry, don't wait until the ugly lights get flipped.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
Thank you to my friend, Luigi B. for the brilliant idea of dining at Osha right after Bay 2 Breakers. 

The cucumber salad is perfection- if you want a light, but zingy dish to start off, order this. Other winners: Padseew, fried chicken over fried rice, and the volcanic beef (tad spicy, but still yummy). I can go on about Thai food because it's one of my favorite ethnic foods; but to describe this experience, it was like a parade of flavors going on in my mouth.

I'll be back!
author: Tricia A.

description:
We went to Osha because we had a coupon and it was nearby. Honestly, didn't check the review till now, which was a mistake. 

The service was alright, but the food was really of bad quality. My partner ordered a fish dish, which was Dry, badly seasoned and over priced. I ate a spaghetti-based stir fry dish. The waiter was kind enough to see to it that the meal was vegan (no fish sauce, egg, etc.), but the dish was poorly made: spaghetti was over cooked, sauce was badly seasoned. It was no more than fast food quality. 

Too bad. We were really hoping for a nice place close to home.
author: Yael F.

description:
Chicken and peanut sauce was really good. I had the yellow curry with duck. I asked for very spices and it was not to bad. The duck was sliced with skin on. Nice fatty chucks in the curry. Curry flavor was mild but slightly better than most.

It did not have a, "I've got to come back to place" experience so I am giving it a three star. 

My wife is a very picky eater and tried all the dishes. They present very well to the non-foody. I would recommend trying it.
author: Daniel S.

description:
Came here for brunch on a Sunday and we were the only group of 9 there so the food came out pretty quick. 

Food:

 I ordered the beef pad thai and it was pretty big portion. The sauce was REALLY sweet, TOO sweet and I felt like it got sweeter and sweeter as I kept on eating that I couldn't finish it. I'll have to say I definitely had better. 

Service:

The service was great. Our glasses were never empty...not even half empty when the waiter kept filling it up (maybe cause we were the only ones there?). Whatever we need, we got really quickly. 

Although this particular Osha wasn't AS great, I'm down to eat again at maybe a different location to compare.
author: Eileen Z.

description: Not great.  Below average chicken pad thai, below average service, below average ambiance.  The pineapple fried rice and the papaya salad were pretty great, but I wouldn't go back.  Overall the whole experience was sub-par and a little weird.  Multiple flies circling our table the whole time.
author: C J.

description: I ordered spicy fish to go today. When I got home the first bite into the fish I can tell the fish was bad. It had bad odor of stinky rodent old fish. I called the restaurant and let them know. The manager came over and argued with me that it was ok.  This restaurant should be closed. I will be reporting them to the SF health dept. they are serving rodent food and not accepting the responsibility and arguing with the customer.
author: Jennifer Q.

description: The closest Osha to my home and the original in the chain, but often underwhelms.  Others in the chain have better food and atmosphere.  It also has a more limited menu compared to some of the others.
author: Michael M.

description:
2nd time here over the weekend! Gosh my friends and I ordered way too much food and it definitely did not disappoint! Papaya salad, larb, pad thai, pad see ew, and a bunch of other goodness! I can't even explain how de-lish the food was. 

Now please open one in LA! So I can enjoy the taste of HEAVEN!!
author: Lisa D.

description:
This place is my go-to place for Thai food. I absolutely love the shrimp pad thai and crab fried rice. I always order to-go at this place and the portions are HUGE. It's a bit pricey ($13-15) but... like I said, the portions are huge and you can usually eat the leftovers as another meal.

This place is always packed and the food has been very consistent. I like how the noodles are not too greasy or oily. Definitely recommend this place if you are looking to get your thai on!
author: Anna G.

description:
"Hmm... I wonder why this place is so popular..."

These were the first words out of my mouth upon tasting my noodles.  I didn't mean this with any spite or cattiness. I was truly perplexed.  The place was full (with people waiting outside), but the noodles I had just been served were oily to the point of making my mouth feel coated in a thin film of grease.

D. ordered crispy catfish.  This catfish was not, nor had ever been, crispy. The only saving grace was the red curry sauce, which was, I guess, fairly good.

Food here is not made with love.  This is assembly line grub, cooked with veggies from a can.

At one point, D. looked around the room and, nodding contemplatively, said, "They do look like nice people... They probably dunno better... mebbie misguided a lil'."  I think this restaurant has somehow cultivated a hip vibe (I don't think I fully got it), but, certainly the people there did seem to give the appearance of believing themselves to be somewhere cool.

Granted, this review is based on two sub-par dishes. Perhaps another order or another night would have meant for a better meal.  However, based on the meal there, I can't fathom why anyone would choose Osha over Thai House Express, Sai Jai, Bang San or Ler Ros if armed with the knowledge of their existence.  

When we got home, I found myself mumbling to D. in disbelief: "I can't believe you took home the leftovers."

He sighed, and with resignation said, "It's not the food's fault."

Amen. 

Yelpers, I urge you to choose another Thai place.  Save the food from itself.
author: Smog R.

description: Super cheap, fast, late night food. Conveniently located in the sketchier part of town next to the places you will drink heavily at. Large portions and very cheap sake ($5 for enough to make you go from awesome to awesomer). I dig the volcano beef ($15.95 for enough meat for 4).
author: Christine L.

description:
I'm not sure what the OSHA people put their in their food that makes it taste so good and its clear the other Thai restaurants don't know either.  Its no wonder Osha has opened a gazillion locations in SF and continued to raise their prices over the years. Their food is very tasty.  Keep in mind that I think I've only been to the Geary location after a night of debauchery so take my Yelp review with a grain of salt. I didn't have my "Michael Bauer" taste buds on as its usually 2am when I'm here.

Nonetheless, the food is delicious and service stellar as far as I can recall.   I usually order the Pad Thai (which is one of the best I've had) and a tofu panang curry.  So good.  The Geary location is their original and while its not modern like OSHA's new locations it has a charm to it.
author: Ash S.

description:
Came here right before celebrating my friends Bday!

Prices were pretty good and service was up to par. The vibe was good with a  modern look. Nothing out of the ordinary but a good place to go get some Thai food. I stuck with the Pad Thai and it was pretty good. For Dessert we had friend plantains with ice cream and it was yummy. Rolls were yummy and I recoomend them.
The restroom was small and eh. Then again SF restrooms are not 5 stars, right? Good thing all I had to do was wash my hands =P


If i'm ever in the area it's a spot I'd definetely come again!
author: Ernesto D.

description: Didn't like the style or flavor of the fresh rolls. Food was decent but I prefer other Thai places in the nieghborhood.
author: Kyle T.

description: I got the Thai boat noodles and it wasn't that great plus the portion was small. Not very appreciative on the tip and was forced to tip higher and asking me if there was "something wrong with service" didn't even have the nerve to say thank you once I tip hire. food was bad and way over price service was not even that great would not recommend.
author: Benjamin L.

description:
What can I say that others haven't said already?  I go cause it's decent food at an undecent hour for food. LOL

When it's late and we don't know where to go, somehow this place is always picked by a certain group of friends.  Gotta love nocturnal eateries!

Usually get a "I love Lychee" for the bubbly while I'm here but if no alcohol is needed then I'll order something like their mixed juiced drinks which are really good. 

Food is pretty good, usually end up getting a salad or some sort of meat dish, but it always ends up turning out that all the dishes i order are all really bitter...still good, but bitter! Dishes that others have ordered have all been pretty good though...maybe I should start having them order for me instead.

Service is always on point so no complaints here! =)
author: Ninja H.

description:
They got more expensive at this location after the remodel but it's still a good deal overall. Their pad thai, crab fried rice, and soups are  balanced and hearty especially after a late night out drinking. Excellent choice for the late night crowd but I wouldn't confine it to just after bar food. I've tried all of their curries which are all delicous and if you can take extra spicy get the papaya salad which will help clear your sinuses before your main dish arrives. 



note: I've had this happen too much in my lifetime. If you can't  handle spicy food then why the (censored) did you come to a Thai restaurant?!? Take your (bleep bleep) to panda express or something!
author: Norris T.

description:
Consistently great food with reasonable prices.  Open late for all you people clubbing downtown at night!

Green Curry:
- the perfect amount of spice and flavor 
- generous portions of meat and veggies in the curry

Pumpkin Curry:
- my favorite curry!
- pumpkin has a good fresh powdery/starchy texture - not stringy at all
- veggies compliment the curry perfectly, and they are not stingy about the amount of food that goes into their curry

Pad See You:
- a little greasier than some other places
- good balance of sweet and salty!  
- i would rank this higher than King of Thai's, but lower than Thai Place II's pad see you

Pad Thai:
- perfectly executed noodles
- blander than most other places...this is not their best dish

Volcano Beef:
- certainly premium flank steak convieniently cubed for you [most of the time it is perfectly juicy, but on occasion they overcook it just a little...]
- onion rings is a nice compliment with the meat
- the marinade/sauce is delicious and light

Crisp Salmon:
- non-fishy salmon grilled to perfection
- topping of sweet, sour, salty mango/pineaple/tomato/caramelized onion is delicious!  and dont forget the crispy fried basil.. mm....
- portion is a little small for the price however

Osha Sea:
- THE BEST SEAFOOD DISH
- SO MUCH FLAVOR - good balance of sweet/savory curry/coconut milk with a mix of seafoods sautee'd with bell peppers and eggplants.  even if you do not like the veggies usually, the sauce will make it soooooooo good
- i would highly recommend this dish to anyone!  even my friend who is never impressed with any food was impressed with this dish

Fried Ice Cream
- hot, crispy, fried exterior - they time it just right so that none of the batter is soggy at all
- vanilla ice cream is always a safe bet
- coconut ice cream has a very strong fragrance compared to others, some people may not be too fond of this

Service:
- fast and friendly
- takes both cash and cards!  unlike most other thai places

Overall, a great restaurant to come with a few friends to do a family-style type dinner.   It is convieniently open early and late so you can come for lunches, pre or post clubbing, it will still be the same great food.  Osha Sea, Volcanic Beef, and Vanilla Fried Ice Cream is a must.
author: Tina A.

description:
A regular vegetable fried rice, no meat, no tofu, picked up and $12!
There's rice and there's rice; and there's many a tasty Thai restaurant in San Francisco.
author: Corinne d.

description:
I love Osha Thai...I really do. But the only time I'm ever coming back to this specific location is late at night after I'm good and liquored up. Their service is excruciatingly slow, there are flies EVERYWHERE, their tables are abnormally short so if you happen to be blessed with long legs don't expect to be very comfortable, and there's only one bathroom for the entire place (that's never, ever clean). 

With that said they still have the best crab fried rice out of all their locations - hands down (trust me, I've done my research).
author: Kristy M.

description: This place sucks. They said they are open till 3am and I sent a very important client there an they were closed. Stop lying. Just be honest.
author: Derek G.

description: Have never had Thai before and this was my first attempt. I am a VERY picky eater and this place surpassed all expectations. Drinks were amazing; food was even better! Very trendy atmosphere. Prices were very reasonable.
author: Heather C.

description:
While visiting San Francisco, I ate at Osha Thai Noodle Cafe with my boyfriend, his dad and his dad's wife. It was just a few blocks away from our hotel so we thought we would give it a try. While it wasn't my favorite place for my staple Thai dish, pud see ew, it was decent. Everyone else seemed to enjoy their food although I recall one of the dishes being not what we had expected. 

I liked the simple, modern decor and loved how the sun streamed through the big window next to our table as it helped to warm me up after visiting the Golden Gate Bridge earlier in the day. :)
author: Abby W.

description:
Curry empanadas? Shut up!  Well they aren't called that, they are called curry puffs and damn they were good.  I'm salivating over here in SoCal. Being that I've only had Thai a few times prior, my taste buds didn't really know what to expect.  My friend Roxy who has a knack for selecting the best eateries chose this one.  Parking was better this time around. Maybe we got lucky and we even had our own valet. Oh Tenderloin!

Whoever suggested the pumpkin curry on here, kudos man.  My hubby and I enjoyed it very much.  Well he did more than me, since it was a bit spicy for my liking. The shrimp pad thai I ordered was quite tasty I must say. Leftovers lasted only the ride back to the East.  *nom, nom, nom*. Usually I am disgusted by Thai Iced Tea but Osha made it just right and I didn't feel like my teeth were going to fall out.  I wasn't a fan of the plates though.  I know, I know.  Mexicans just love to mix their food, so there you go. I can't wait to go back to visit the Bay again! Fried wontons por favor!
author: Elle A.

description:
I can't visit San Francisco without eating at Osha Thai at least once. And, I think the Geary outpost is the third location I've ate at/ordered take-out from.

This time, I tried the pumpkin curry with beef. I'm not sure what they do with their rice here, but it's always perfect and even a bit creamy. The curry was filled with tons of beef, red peppers, pumpkin and the flavor was bold even though I designated 'mild' for the spice factor. My friend loved her pad thai and with its loads of crunchy vegetable business, tofu AND chicken, how could one not?

We ordered take-out from the car and only 7 minutes later, it was ready! Osha Thai may be a bit more expensive than other Thai restaurants, but its consistency and fresh, hot food make it worth it in my book.
author: Jelena Z.

description:
I went here with my friends on 6-22-14 1:30am'sh.  I ordered the chicken pad thai $10'
sh, it's good, we went here after singing at Pandora.  I waiter/waitress are cool, they actually split the bill to nine persons (surprised they weren't miffed about it). My friend said to the cashier, "we're sorry".
author: Jer W.

description:
A quick lunch with my friend. A block from my place. It used to look a lot more run down. I came here around 6-8 years ago and I hated it but I think that was before it was called Osha. The new look is much more welcoming. 

I always see people in here grabbing a quick eat. My friend ordered the 

Combination Fried Rice
Shrimps, squid, chicken, pork, beef, tomatoes, onion, egg and green onion. - It didn't look too appetizing... but my friend thought it was pretty tasty. Big portion.

I ordered

Yum Woon Sen Salad
Silver noodle, ground pork, shrimp, chili paste, red & green onion with spicy lime dressing. - It was pretty good and like I mentioned before good portion. The dressing did make my breath smell for the entire day. =[

Thai ice tea- yum yum. 

Average at best. I do like the downtown oshas better. This is a good place for a quick laid back meal.
author: Sarah C.

description: Service was awful! Portion was too small and prices dont concur with foods quality. Moreover after we paid for our bill server was begging for tips. Ridiculous!!!
author: Boris K.

description:
God. Sometimes I hate eating at restaurants that are tourist friendly. I know this is a Thai restaurant but I think they need to have their Asian card revoked on account of them not understanding what "spicy" means. I always always ALWAYS get flack for asking for my dish spicy and then it comes out sweeter than my soda. I think the cooks have it out for me when I ask for a dish spicy there. 

"I'd like my spicy eggplant super super spicy please."

"Are you sure?" the server asks incredulously.

"Very spicy please. I mean, mouth burning spicy."

"We don't make things spicy."

"What?? You're a Thai restaurant" 

"Ahh...we'll bring you sauce on side."

"Fiiiine."

And what happens? The dish comes out, no sauce is on the side for me and I have to track down my server and wait an additional 10 minutes for sauce. And my food gets cold, my friends are done eating, and I'm pissed, hungry and getting gawked at the servers for putting chili sauce on my eggplant. It's called Spicy Eggplant people, but the taste doesn't live up the name! Epic fail Osha. I'm bringing Siraccha in my purse next time I'm strong armed into going to Osha-you guys have been warned.
author: Jessica K.

description:
The food at Osha on Geary used to be the most authentic of all Osha restaurants. I feel every time I came back here the food quality has gone down while the prices became more expensive. 

I ordered stir fried sukiyaki and it's not what I expected at all. It's basically silver noodles and some sauce. They don't even use real Thai sukiyaki sauce. Overly salty and bland. 

I also had a bite of my friend's pad kee mao. It's also disappointing and lacks the taste and color of black soy sauce.
author: Saran R.

description:
First time to this location, yet I've lived 2 blocks away for almost a year. Go figure. 

Started with Kobe beef bites. WOW. Incredible taste. Highly recommend these. Followed that with yellow tofu curry and Pad See Ew. The curry was really good, and a nice presentation. Just the right amount of medium spiciness. The chicken Pad See Ew was very smooth and creamy tasting, and was quite good. 

Beers are pretty cheap as well. 

Will most certainly come back on a regular basis.
author: Matt S.

description: The service and the food both really bad, and it's not even 10.30pm. Won't be coming back here. The first entree came out 15 mins before the second, so if you don't mind eating while your partner stares at your food, this might work out well for you. Haha!
author: Karan A.

description: Best Thai food in a hip, fun, atmosphere and with the best service around! I highly recommend the Thai Samosas - those are our go-to appetizers every time.
author: Eric F.

description: Food was decent but had to eat it in 5 minutes because of all the gnats.  They were everywhere and the waiter was killing them with some kind of electric fly swatter.   I would avoid unless you like bugs flying in your face all the time.
author: Miles M.

description:
I've always been a fan of Osha, but never came to this location before. I hear it's the original location, no? Didn't even know there was one here! Oops. 

Regardless, compared to the many others I have tried, I am very fond of the flavor they manage to get with their "Pad See Ew". It isn't too oily, not too salty, not too bland..... it's just right for my taste. 

The atmosphere was alright. It seemed to want to be upscale like the other newer locations, but the exterior does not match the interior. Unfortunately, big neon signs do not really scream sophistication. 

Overall thoughts : Taste of the food was consistent with what I expected. It is good that they are open late for those who want their Thai fix.
author: Stephanie K.

description: This was a quick stop- we are hungry and have no idea where to go-type of a dinner. But surprisingly enough, it was great! We walked in on a Friday night at about 8ish and was seated right away. I had no idea what to order, so i asked our waitress if they had "drunken noodle's"...she suggested what she thought i was looking for. Although tasty, it was no where near the drunken noodles that i was craving. However, my friends really liked their dishes and the tropical mock-tails were refreshing and tasty! Waitstaff was also very friendly, but busy.
author: Heidi S.

description: Love the food.  Large portions - outstanding service - nice ambience.  Definitely getting a bang for your buck.  Highly recommended!!  And the kitchen is open until one!!
author: Madison G.

description: I was in the neighborhood and decided to give this place one more chance. This time I liked the experience, the food was onetime and tasty. Servers were friendly and I loved their new attires with bright ties.
author: Julia G.

description: I have been going here for many years, but last night was my last. Sat down and the first thing i noticed was a dirty fork...Nvm that, I ordered my 3 favorite appetizers and every one of them not only shrunk but the quality of the meat used is of shameful quality. My favorite Thai restaurant was disappointment beyond repair. i honestly felt like i was robbed. Then you have poor service or rather no service. to top it off the restroom was something you would expect in a porta-potty, lucky for me i used it after eating. Shame of you for making a long time customer feel upset, disgusted, and betrayed.
author: Tom T.

description:
A lifesaver on a chilly evening after a few drinks! Their crispy wantons were so yummy (even though they weren't cooked through and had to be sent back), as were the Thai boat noodles. 
A perfect stop when craving for hot/ spicy/ soupy food in generous portions.
Definitely going to make my bookmarked list for SF.
author: Eugenie Y.

description: We walked in and ordered 5 different meals to go. It took them less than ten min to get it to us- which means it was not made to order. All the noodle dishes looked like they had been sitting in a bowl all day. Barely warm. Awful quality meat and to top it off I have felt sick to my stomach ever since eating it. I typically love Osha Thai but I won't be back now.
author: Madie H.

description: Their food are okay compare to other Thai Restaurants and I found nothing really surprised me. And I think its food are over priced in terms of their food quality, service size and overall environment. The Osha Thai on Union St. is much better because at least it has better environment (and I don't know whether it is still open cause last time I was there it was closed).
author: Jay J.

description:
Walked in here to enjoy some soup but the overwhelming smell of urine and old movie theater was too much. 

Thanks but no thanks.
author: Ren B.

description:
This is my absolutely favorite place for Thai food in San Francisco! I've came here twice and it already has my vote. Waiters were friendly and approachable which I love :)

I ordered Beef Pad See Ew and oh my god... it's heavenly DELICIOUS! The spice and sweetness of the pan fried noodle was PERFECT to my taste. I also got the Thai iced tea and what I love about it is that they didn't add too much milk and ice like other restaurant.. *uhem* like King of Thai?! My boyfriend ordered some beef with rice which came along with 2 onion rings (I know.. kinda random huh?). And he said the beef is perfect. I took a bite of the onion rings and I must say, it's better than burger king's! 

The bill came and it was only $36 for 2 dinners & 2 drinks. What is there not to love about that?!

Another plus is that this place opens until late night so if you ever have the late night munchies, this place is the place to GO! What are you waiting for? This place is a must unless you want to miss out ;)
author: Anny W.

description: Delicious Tom Kha Soup and thai iced tea!
author: Kate G.

description: Ordered pumpkin curry with tofu for delivery. Received pumpkin curry with chicken. I called the restaurant and was told I could come pick up a replacement but they couldn't deliver it.
author: Kathryn H.

description: Great cashew chicken and great pad see uw! A little more expensive than makes sense for portion size but it's a quick option.
author: Liza S.

description:
Decent Thai place in the city. Very nice inside and the service is generally attentive. I got the Pad Kee Mao and it wasn't as spicy as I would have liked, but I quickly corrected it with some Sriracha!

Coming from Berkeley, this place is a bit expensive for Thai food, but the portions are generous so you wont leave hungry. It's a good location for late night eating after hitting up the bars! Honestly, I was pretty buzzed when I ate here, so I don't remember many of the details.

Solid Thai place if you're in the area and you got the craving!
author: Josh Y.

description:
I'm definitely a fan of this place!  Great food and open late, so after a night of lounging or going clubben, you can always count on this place being open til about 3AM.  The prices have gone up a bit though in the last year or so...and I feel as though the quantity of food has gotten smaller as well.  They need to bring back their old prices and give more food! 

It seems that we always get the same thing when we come here.  One of those, stick to what you know, kinda things.  

Green curry paste fried rice with chicken=BOMB...so good, tell them how spicy you want it though if they don't ask.  Otherwise, it will come up super spicy to the point where you can't even eat it.  

Fried Wontons as starters...just the right amount of crisp and goes well the sweet chili dipping sauce!  

Tom Yum Goong (with or without noodles)  Has just the right amount of flavoring and so hearty.  I prefer it with small noodles...just delish! 

Beef Pad Se-Ew:  It's like a Thai Chow Fun...so yummy!  
Thai Iced Coffee...how many places can really go wrong with this?  Just to my liking.
author: Mary T.

description:
I stopped in here one night.   I had noticed it before and decided to give it a try.

It was busy.  and even though I was just a single, they seated me quickly.

The service was very polite.

I ordered the Volcanic Beef and some Thai Fish Cakes.  The server tried to talk me out of Thai hot but I stuck with it.

When the fish cakes came, I was a little disappointed.  They were pretty dry.  I did not really enjoy them.

However, the Volcanic Beef was very good.  It actually wasn't that volcanic.  Not sure if they made it Thai hot or not.

The room isn't anything fancy but it is a step up from plain.

I had an enjoyable meal and will return. A lot of the time if you are eating alone in a busy restaurant, you get ignored while the servers concentrate on the larger parties, this was not the case at Osha.  I had excellent service throughout.
author: Mark D.

description:
Tasty but expensive for what you get. Better Thai food is available nearby in the Tenderloin (Lers Ros, Sai Jai.) However, if I were piss drunk at 2am I would pay anything for a hot steaming plate of pad see ew. So, I do understand the appeal in this place.

Surprisingly good: Catfish curry with rice.
author: Josh K.

description: Pad Thai was great.....until we found the roach dead under the noodles. So disappointed.
author: Allison A.

description:
My family and I went here for a late night dinner when we took a trip to SF for the weekend. 

Since many restaurants in SF are pretty small it was kind of hard to accommodate our big group, but luckily for us Osha Thai takes reservations. My family and I got a bunch of different items to share.

 Some of my favorite dishes were:
-Calamari: very good and so pretty! The sauce was really good with it as well. One of the best calamari dishes that I have ever had. 
-Osha Thai Spring rolls: so good. I liked that they didn't use traditional rice paper for the spring rolls in this dish. 
-Tom yum: Probably the best Tom yum I've ever had. It had a really good kick to it and was very flavorful.
-Thai Fish cake: I love Thai fish cake! the sauce that comes with it is very delish as well! 
-Papaya salad: Had a good spice level to it and very very good.
-Pad Thai: One of the best pad Thais that I've ever had. 
-Thai Fried rice: we also got duck fried rice (& I LOVE duck) but I liked the regular Thai fried rice over the duck fried rice...the duck fried rice was really greasy. 

Overall, the food here is was good, but it was not the best Thai food I have ever had; my favorite is still Lotus Siam in Vegas. But this place is one of the top Thai places that I've eaten at. The presentation of the food here is sooo pretty and creative.
author: Phuong K.

description:
Tons of Thai in the area. Choose another.

I love Pad See Ew. Ordered pick up. Beef was crazy tough, broccoli had a harsh sour flavor that was awful. Noodles were average. Flavor is lacking, had to put extra sauce on at home.

Staff were not very friendly. 13+ dollars for one simple take out dish.

I got 2 nan bread, beef kabab and Chicken tikka masala for 13 even one block down at chutney and it was delicious...

Third time I come here. Last for sure.
author: Derek B.

description:
osha!

okay service. gets crowded at night. closes late. not the best thai food i've had, but overall it was good. ordered the curry puffs (highlight of the night) and beef panang (good flavors and spice)! must try the curry puffs. 

will come back again and try other things on the menu! check out the picture i posted.
author: Karlo S.

description:
Open until 3 to 4am?!?! On weekends when you are out late drinking?!? That is the 5 stars for this Osha location!

-Right in the center of everything especially clubbing downtown
-They serve the same dishes. same menu. cheaper prices
-Decor is less formal than the other branches but still is clean and modern!
-Booths available!
-Fast Service

Bored of pizza? Denny's? Fast food? Noodles?  THAI FOOD IS HERE FOR YOU to soak up that alchy or just if you are craving for thai in the middle of the night for the city residents :)
author: Kathy D.

description: What happend to osha??? I used to love their pad thai.!!!!! Either they changed the cooks or this place is falling apart. Food is bland..bland.and..bland  is not even good enough to fed my dog. Huge portion but no flavors. If ur drunk and tired of pizza maybe this is the place to go to.... OSHA SUCK...!!!!!! Dont go here unless you were shit face or super high....
author: Nita D.

description:
After a failed attempt to get to the Ambassador in time (which ended up being too loungey and not foody enough anyway), we walked across the street and went to Osha Thai.  It was pretty busy and we thought that the prices were reasonable (for SF) so we decided to have dinner.   

Osha is nicely decorated in black and white; modern and chic dining furniture and wavy patterns on white walls seem to be a trend with Thai Restaurants that we've been hitting lately.  Osha seems to have a thing for chandeliers, too.  The environment is cool and minimalistic, but not uppity, as the servers are humble and direct.

As usual, I ordered the Pad Kee Mao (my favorite noodley plate!).  I asked for a few modifications because I thought that there were too many vegetables and I wanted a simpler taste.  They accommodated my request without hesitation and it was pretty damn good :)  The beau had the spicy basil leaf chicken, which was also good, but quite a simple dish that I don't think you could really mess it up.  Then again, what am I saying because people seemingly can manage to mess up anything.  Bottom line: Good chicken!

Osha's decor gives it an air of an upscale restaurant, but the food is humble (fried rice, noodles, regular Thai food) and our service was great, so it's just a lovely combination of all those things together.  Props for opening late!
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Oh Osha... my long time friend.... Its been 3 years since my visit and today I must admit was bittersweet. Oh those days where we had $7 plates of Pad Thai and $4 appetizers are so missed. Your sweet and spicy green curry still makes explosions in my mouth and tingles down my spine. The offerings of condiments are always such a delight one day i will return and I'll be hungry to ignite  our relationship. 
**bows**
author: Wendy C.

description:
i wouldnt say that this is the best thai food i've had but it was pretty good. being from NY, i came here on a trip to san fran and the food wasn't half bad. we were seated right away and my friend needed his phone charged so the staff was nice enough to let him charge his phone behind the bar. 

we ordered the o'viche, which was a special for the night, and the calamari as apps. the ceviche was super spicy and i liked it a lot. the downside of this was that there was hardly any seafood and i felt like all i was eating was mango and onions. the calamari was good except for this mayo/honey mustard sauce thing they added on the top and it was not my favorite thing. at all. 

as entrees, we ordered two pad thais (one with beef, the other with pork) and the shrimp paste fried rice. the servings were HUGE so i definitely left the restaurant full. but...the pad thai was just ok. the rice dish was good though. the noodles for the pad thai were thin and i usually like the noodles wider. the beef was also kinda rubbery. i didn't taste the pork noodles but i would assume just the same. the shrimp paste fried rice has mostly chicken and only two pieces of shrimp, even though it was supposed to be a combo. what a combo! not really. but it was tastey!

the overall decor of the place was nice and service was good.
author: Katrina B.

description:
Sir Nicholas arrived in San Francisco on Thursday night to meet up with me as we had planned a Napa Valley vacation for the weekend. Due to odd winds and weird weather however his plane was delayed by quite a bit. So when he arrived to meet me at Rye it was fairly late and he was fairly hungry. We stepped outside to find food to remedy his sitch and shining bright right next door was Osha Thai Noodle Café. After a quick check on the Yelp app we went in and secured a table for 2.

From what I can tell Osha Thai is sort of a late night haven for revelers looking for a bite to eat. It sort of has a diner-ish feel, but maybe a higher-class diner. Nick and I decided to share a couple of appetizers and a main course and so we ordered fried wontons (pork and shrimp wrapped with wonton), beef wasabi rolls (carrots, celery and mint wrapped with sliced grilled steak served with watercress and an awesome wasabi sauce), and Thai fried rice. While everything was fairly good the beef rolls were our favorite part. They were just the right amount of each ingredient and the spice was perfect for our tastes.

The service was good and even with our 3 shared foods and 2 drinks (wine and beer) our tab just barely crested $40, which I find quite reasonable for a "dinner" meal anywhere, but especially in this city.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
What's going on here, Osha???
I've been eating here for more than 10 years. Back then Osha was a fantastic Thai restaurant with unpretentious ambiance, delicious authentic Thai dishes and great prices. Over the years I saw the food get progressively bland and the flavors watered-down, while the prices kept going up. Lately it seems, they paired it down to just one generic sauce blend that they pour over everything. The same sauce which I believe they now bottle and sell. Two days ago, I ordered the spicy eggplant with chicken, which used to be one of their delightful signature dishes, and sadly,that was mylast dish there as there was nothing but salty pieces of chicken over some rice. Lers Ros, Thai House Express, Chai Yo are all nearby restaurants where wonderful Thai food can be enjoyed.
author: Loubna M.

description:
A good place to go late night after the club. This location in particular closes at .... 3AM on the weekends! It's pretty packed since everywhere had just been returning from the club.

I had the Osha Tom Yum Noodle (11.95) It was pretty good but the tom yum soup was not sour at all. It's a very Americanized version.

Our party also ordered the Pad Thai (10.95) and Combination Fried Rice (11.95). I'm not a huge fan of Pad Thai so I thought it was mediocre but the combo fried rice was quite tasty. 

The interior of the restaurant definitely fits a date location and the price surely makes reflects the decor!

It's not cheap for Thai food (vs. King of Thai) but I suppose, what do you expect, SF is expensive in general!
author: Joyce M.

description:
Thumbs Down. We have ordered from Osha Thai Noodle regularly and enjoyed
the menu. Last weekend however we ordered through EAT24 and the food that arrived was awful. A Sea Bass entrée ($20) came with two wedges of uncooked cabbage! The fish was paltry (1/2 x 4 inch filet) and overly seasoned. We called Osha Thai and they blamed the problem on EAT24 who were good enough to give a partial
credit despite the fact that it was Osha's responsibility to give a credit for the bad food order. Osha Thai were rude and ugly about it all.
author: Louise A.

description: I live nearby and go here all the time. They're open late and have pretty good food. I like the vegetarian spring rolls especially.
author: Allison R.

description:
Went here after a late night at the clubs. I ordered the duck noodle and my friend ordered the pad see ewe. 

What I liked about this place is that the service is super fast which is a plus. We got our food in like ten minutes. They have a wide selection of things to eat and drink. I loved the osha punch. SUPER YUMMY!

What I didn't like was that my soup was a little bland. I like the broth, but the noodles did not seem like they absorbed any of the flavor. My friend's pad see ewe was soggy and salty. 

I would recommend this place because it's better than Denny's and where else can you find thai food at 2 in the morning?
author: Hang T.

description:
This is the best Osha. Over the years I've managed to visit all of the other Oshas in town, and I can say with conviction that the TL version wins. It's partly that the food is reliably yummy; partly that it's open super super late; partly that they have perfected the art of handling large numbers of drunken patrons with grace, speed, and finesse; and partly that they will actually make your food spicy if you ask them to. Yep, that's a motley assortment of reasons, but can you argue with any of them? 

Protip: cashew tofu. If you have a cold: green curry fried rice, extra spicy.
author: Janna M.

description:
Volcanic beef. Hold the onion rings (unless you go for fried things). 'Nuff said.

The volcanic sauce is not spicy at all. It's delicious!! Makes the beef amazing. I order the volcanic beef for takeout every chance I get, and it always hits the spot when I dine at this location.

Prices are better here than at the FiDi location, and the food tastes better than at the Osha Thai Express.
author: L. E.

description: I have been going here for a decade now somethings change in preparation but the flavor is always there. And this locations food is better for me over all the others in SF...
author: Iwishihad A.

description: Best Thai restaurant I found so far. Great green curry and I love the mango splash there
author: Reinhard S.

description:
I went here on Friday i believe.. Wanted to explore the city with my friends and they said this place was good. if i can remember correctly, we ordered the volcanic beef, pineapple rice, chicken curry, and something else. the volcanic beef was on hit, it was my favorite dish. all the dishes were neatly prepared and we couldnt help but take pictures... :)

btw, my friend was in love with the water.... after walking so much it was all he wanted.
author: Emily W.

description: I ordered five dishes and 3 drinks. My family was very disappointed. We found hairs in the dishes not 1 but 4 in the dishes. We got stomachache after we got home. We will never put ourselves in food poisoning again!!!!
author: Ka K.

description:
My friend lives in the city, and she was constantly raving about this place. So when my friends and I visited her, she took us to Osha. She told us it was right down the street, so we decided to be San Franciscan and walk... Yeah, right down the street according to her meant like 10 blocks. By the time we got there, it was already sunny and warm, and I was not in the mood for HOT noodle soup. She promised us that it'd be worth it. She was totally, and completely RIGHT. We all ordered a bowl of the Tom Yum Noodles, all different levels of spicy, all different meats.

My mouth is already salivating at the memory of this.

One bite of that soup and I was HOOKED. I love tom yum soup. But to add noodles, and bean sprouts, fried garlic and all that other goodness in there? HEAVEN IN A BOWL.

OMG I'm drooling right now.

It was the right hint of everything. The sourness, the sweetness, the hotness.. the GARLIC. OH MAN. YUM. We also ordered the papaya salad as in appetizer.. I do remember it being pretty good... but my memory is muddled by the deliciousness of that bowl. Why must they be all the way in the city? WHY???!?!?!
author: Chi N.

description:
Their seats hurt my butt. And I have a soft butt. So what does that tell ya!?

Oh yah their food was okay too. Nothing crazy or special. Kind of expensive for Asian food but I'd come back and try different dishes next time.
author: Catherine W.

description:
FOOD POISONING!!

 A few years ago, I use to live two blocks from this location and use to love it. Last night however was a very disappointing experience. My family and I had dinner last night and woke up this morning with TERRIBLE FOOD POISONING, including my poor little 2 year old nephew! We will not be tempting our fate here again!
author: H M.

description:
Stuck on Polk street looking for drunky munchies, because the bar bouncers kicked you out at 2am? Well, this is the BEST place near the Polk bars to get some quality carb-filled food to soak up the effects of your soon-to-be-hangover. (It's not like you're picky at this point, but hey, at least the sober ones are happy too.) 

Here are my recommendations. First, evaluate yourseld on a zero to ten drunk scale: 

If you're at a 0 through 5 (meaning if you can distinguish between who you can touch and who and where you certainly cannot touch), GO FOR THEIR FRIED RICE! Chances are, you are sober enough to appreciate its savory goodness. The rice is never over-cooked and sticky. You'll get nice firm grains every time! :P

If you are at a 6 or 7, please, get the soups! They've got a large selection of soups that will keep you hydrated, but I'm not recommending them because they really suck. The best one they have is the Tom Yum, but trust me, the sour and spiciness will NOT sit well in your stomach... especially not in your state.

If you're at an 8, 9, or 10, don't bother coming. This place does NOT offer medical attention to the passed out drunks. 

Take home message: 
Good place when you're low on late-night options. 
Don't bother getting anything other than their rice plates.
author: Rose W.

description:
My fav Osha location. 

Every time I have Osha, I leave totally satisfied. Whether I'm having the spicy string beans, pumpkin/panang/yellow curry, pad thai, crab fried rice, curry puffs, fried chicken over fried rice...I mean I can go on and on. 

Thai iced tea is bomb, as well as their coconut fried ice cream and mango with sticky rice. 

Sure, they've skimped down on their portions and raised their prices....least they're consistently good.
author: Lydia L.

description: This place is passable for late night eats if you happen to be in the Tenderloin. We dropped in here after drinks at Rye next door and there were quite the characters dining all around us. Probably saw a couple drug transactions go down in the bathroom during our meal. I was pretty hungry, so the pad see euw was decent, but the beef was pretty tough. Spicy eggplant with tofu was fine. Country chicken is a must not. The hostess/waitress was a bit gruff but I really couldn't blame her. On the flip side the rest of the waitstaff was very pleasant and efficient. While I admire the owner and the staff's tenacity for serving this neighborhood, but there are better Thai options in SF.
author: Lisa H.

description:
I guess there has got to be some sort of a reason why Thai restaurants in general are so expensive. 

I've been here only once for lunch. I ordered the crab fried rice, thinking that ill get some fried rice with some crab meat in it. It was fairly expensive for fried rice at around $15. My logic was very simple. If there are hundreds if not thousands of japanese and chinese restaurants around where you can get something like shrimp fried rice for $6-$10 that actually contains shrimp, you are bound to get some crab in a $15 rice plate. Rice costs nothing right?

The dish came with rice... that was fried, traces of egg, and two teeny tiny miniature baby midget crab claws. I think they were there just for the decoration but i still tried eating them. There was enough meat to get stuck between your teeth, but not enough to actually bite into it and taste it. 

The fried egg and rice tasted just like fried egg and rice usually do. Contrasting the crab in this crab fried rice, the rice was plentiful. I would prefer some sort of a balance, like, enough of each ingredient to actually make an impact on the dish. 

Instead of getting a crab fried rice dish with no crab and lots of rice, i'd prefer either of these two scenarios:

- A fried rice dish with lots of fried rice
- A crab fried rice dish with lots of fried rice... and crab.


I guess they would charge $50 for something like that. Each time i eat in an overpriced TL restaurant, i try to remember what i pay for. 

Hordes of the filthiest homeless people asking you for anything and everything. Give me a quarter, give me a dollar, buy me lunch, give me a cigarette, give me a lighter, give me a hug...

It's a true San Francisco experience this is. Like, there is no better feeling than spending a ton of money on rice (that cheap white thing that billions of people in the 3rd world eat all the time) while observing the lowest point of human decay and misery through the glass. 

Oh, i love that green metal box thing outside, you are guaranteed to see at least one person urinating or defecating there while you eat. MMMM yummy.





Bottom line:

Don't get me wrong, i do understand what supply and demand is. San Francisco is full of smug snobs who won't eat anything unless its like $50 a bite or something. 

(Thats why i dream of opening an Italian restaurant here. Cook some pasta in some water, make a little bit of sauce pour it over, sell it for $$$$ and make gazillions of dollars. Might do a thai place now instead, need to see which ones cheaper, rice or pasta.)

But there are also the less fortunate who live here. Not the lazy tit sucking crack smoking bums of the TL, but us last suckers on the bus. Hard working young people who were unfortunate enough to have to move here during this new dot com craze. 

When i was looking for an apartment the best deal i could find was an "efficiency" studio. It's basically a tiny converted hotel room, so you have a bathroom but no kitchen. No kitchen means that you have to eat out all the time. When paying a $1000 for a sardine can like this, you can't really afford $50 a bite, or $15 for two tiny crab claws.  So if you weren't fortunate enough to land cheap rent control and have to live in the TL and eat out all the time, or if you don't work for google, i'd avoid this place. Thai house express actually has better food.
author: Dusan B.

description:
2 reasons I got to come here:  It's open late and it's cheap.  

Service was lacking the night we came.  My friend had to ask them for the menu, then it took them some time to come get our orders and check.  Nevertheless, the food was great.  I got the chili basil chicken.  Not as spicy as I would have liked it but the table offers you chili sauces to get that kick you want.

Over all not a bad place.  The mix of people makes for an interesting people watching time.
author: Pam S.

description:
Came in late one night and ordered the duck pad see ew and a lemonade. The pad see ew was so flavorful and the duck cooked to perfection. My boss ordered coconut-curry chicken and we both just sat there gorging ourselves and waxing poetic about how absolutely amazing everything tasted. 

The service is fast, very polite, and everything was very clean.
author: Liz H.

description: I  think there is a better thai place in the tenderloin called Lers Ros. BUT this place is good and has some sushi type dishes for people who don't feel like noodles. I usually get the Tuna Poke which is a raw tune salad with avocado and mango with a side of won ton crisps. Very yummy.
author: Brittini S.

description:
I don't care what anybody says.  I love this place! YUMMMMMM

I used to work down the street at the Curran Theater and frequented Osha at least once a week for lunch (dinner time for everyone else).  When I'm in the neighborhood I like to stop in for a meal and feel nostalgic about the old days.  I've taken friends and family there, and they've all had a pleasant experience so far.

My favorite dish: pad khee mao
my mom's fav: pad see ew (yeah, she's a simple woman when it comes to food)
honorable mention: tom yum (with or without noddles), fried chicken salad

Words to the wise: 
1) Do not go during peak if you're famished because you will be waiting for a while(this has been an issue as far back as I can remember).
2) When they ask how spicy, stick with medium unless you want to exfoliate your mucus membranes.  Seriously, I love a challenge but I gotta admit when I'm outdone.
author: Hester B.

description:
This joint had me sweating balls last night although I have no one to blame but myself.

I've been getting screwed out of spicy food on the regular, no matter how I word it the food is not even close to spicy. It's frustrating. So I roll up in this and look the lady dead in the eye and say "Make it hot. I mean it, I'm not fucking around here, I want it hot" Lesson here folks is that Osha Thai will listen to you, presuming you stare at them dead in the face and talk with intensity akin to a crazy person.

So as I'm chugging rice milk and ice cubes at home trying to nurse my swollen and fried tongue back to health I sat rethinking this plan yet again. Is there no happy medium? Can I not get a little kick of spicy, does it really have to be blandsville or on fire? If someone has the super top secret Thai code phrase or hand signal for what I'm looking for please PM me.

The food though, ignoring the fire was so-so. The portion was small and my pumpkin curry had all of 3 pieces of pumpkin in it. I got a huge thing of rice and a much smaller portion of the actual dish than I'd get at neighboring Thai joints. The flavor was good, but again, why would you call it pumpkin curry if you're just going to put in three little cubes. It was basically all tofu and that's fine and all, but then call it tofu curry, not pumpkin.

I'll be back, I mean I'm a Thai junkie and this place is open until 3am on the weekends which is huge. I guess I'll just need to perfect my spicy request technique for round two at Osha, I seriously could not even talk right last night.
author: Justin N.

description:
Great food & amazing prices. Been here 3 times now & I always walk away impressed!

We were seated at the same time the servers were having dinner so getting our waiter's attention became impossible. But great food nonetheless.
author: Johnny O.

description:
Osha Thai noodle on Geary is the best Thai food in the city! I say so and people from around the country say so. I meas it! I get folkfrom Chi town, the big appple, bean town, the big D, the big Easy, The City of Brotherly love, The emerald city  . . . they are all enamored with Osha Thai; it's varzy shit!
I go here about once a month, sometimes after midnight, sometimes at lunch and it's always great!
Yo' this is the original Osha, so it better be rad!
I likes some Pad Se Ewe, Pad Thai, larb, yum woon san, kom ta soup, the deep fried tofu, the crab fried stuff, the  . . . everything man!

greatest Thai place in the USA!!!!

Service is curt but whevs!
author: Alexander R.

description: Whoa! So good! Try the steak salad extra spicy! And the Thai fried rice too! New fave in the area for sure
author: Xavier G.

description: A good spot for decent Thai food, Osha has a few joints throughout the city and this one is definitely the most casual of the outlets I've been too. Good service and consistent quality as the other restaurants, the only disappointment was that the Volcanic Beef was overly salty, otherwise it was a win! The Pumpkin Curry was sublime, a good blend of spice, creaminess and flavor. Will be back!
author: G C.

description: Came here as a recommendation from the paniq room around the corner (super fun!!!) best curry I have had in a long time awesome pad Thai and the only thing I didn't really like was the satay... A little too tangy for me. Other than that perfect!!!!
author: Lindsay S.

description:
Osha Thai has always been one of my favorite places for cheap, delicious Thai food. But I have to say that two stars were docked after yesterday's dinner there for two reasons.

First, the most serious: the quality of the bathrooms. My friend held it the entire time because she just could not bring herself to use the bathrooms here. And she is NOT a high-maintenance person. We tried to rationalize it, saying that they must get a lot of bar/club traffic and it might be difficult to keep them clean, but keep in mind, this was a Sunday night at 6:30. No excuse. 

Second, less serious: We ordered a spicy noodle dish and they asked us how spicy we wanted. We said medium. Now, I know medium means different things to different people, but it set my mouth on fire. We also ordered the string beans with beef, and she didn't even ask us how she wanted it, and that set our mouths on fire even more. We couldn't finish the dish because we were in so much pain. 

But besides those two negatives, I've always had a good meal at Osha. Last night I particularly liked the fried chicken. And the prices can't be beat.
author: Christina P.

description:
I went here with a party of 8 people.
This was my first time here and it was horrible from the start.

1st: they seated us (8 people) in a 6 people table with addition of 1 chair.
2nd: Food was pretty good if it wasn't too salty and one of my friend complained that tom kah tasted like pure coconut milk, not like tom kah (she is a regular here).
3rd: No service (asked 3 different waiters nicely for water refill and our glass was still empty for 30mins or so).
4th: They charged us 18%.
5th: Restroom was full of sh*t (literally)
6th: They were not even busy.
7th: After hour diarrhea.

Definitely this would also be my last time.
I rarely rate anything 1 star (unless it really really deserves it).
author: Andrew T.

description: We had pad Thai, red curry and angel wings. Food was standard Thai food..tasty and flavorful.We ordered a thai tea without ice, but it came with ice filled to the top. Not what I wanted.  We ordered brown rice with red curry but got white rice.  All in all, they were apologetic and friendly. Service was slow. Would I come back, yes because the food was fine, but I'd be prepared to wait. The restaurant was cold so I never felt warm enough to take off my coat.
author: j. l.

description: A bit on the pricy side, but good quality good. The green curry fried rice and roast duck curries are my favorites here.
author: Donny S.

description:
ive only gone to the other Osha locations (embarcadero and market) before coming to this location and I was expecting to order my usual but the menu are pretty different. This is a cheaper version of the other Osha (both in prices and quality).  

They tend to cook two of the same orders at the same time, therefore skimping on portions. 

Service is alright, nothing spectacular. We came as a group so they were already entitled to the group gratuity tip and didn't seem to do much after serving our food. We didn't get any refills on our water until we paid for our meal (a little too late if you ask me). 

Calamari: batter is too heavy, mostly eating batter than calamari
Pad Thai: nothing special 

Try their hot noodle ramen, its a good portion and pretty solid.
author: Amy L.

description: We had OshaThai on a recent trip to San Fran and thought it was ok. We had the Panang Curry and Pad See Ew. They didn't ask the spiciness level like I am used but it turned out ok. The portion of curry was a little on the small side an wasn't the best I have ever eaten. The pad see was good but it was my first time having it so not sure what to compare it to. I also had a few bites of the pad Thai that was about 2.5 star worthy. It looks like a nice option late as its open til 3am on Fri/Sat.
author: David C.

description: At this OSHA it is about the food.  Delicious Thai food that has all the flavors and aromas that you expect from authentic Thai food.  It is somewhat "California-ized"...in other words, the servings are slightly smaller on large white dishes...beautifully arranged and colorful...some dishes garnished with an orchid.  We were impressed by the variety of ingredients used in each dish.  Everything was fresh, fragrant,  and full of flavor.  The desserts were amazing.  I have had Thai fried banana soooo many times...but this is the first time it came beautifully skewered (and with a good-sized portion of mango ice cream).  The wait staff was shy, but their service was adequate.  Only real drawbacks -- the restroom was full of graffiti (the mirror is so scratched that you can't use it) and there is a definite smell of stale urine from the neighborhood outside.
author: Izzy B.

description:
Ordered takeout from here, they don't deliver so we picked the food up. 
The egg rolls were fantastic! The calamari was great as well. I had the orange osha salmon, pretty good but nothing special. My boyfriend ordered the volcanic beef which was so good! Had a bit of food envy!
Really good food for decent priced, definitely would have again.
author: Elyse C.

description:
Cute little restaurant, but I got takeout with a friend. We got  pad kee mao and pad thai both with tofu. Both were average at best. This place is only a few blocks from me so I was hoping it could be a regular thai spot... I will not be going back soon. The food, while not pricey, is overpriced for what you get.

Originally I gave them 2 stars. I just went again for lunch and am updating it to 3 stars. While the service wasn't great, the pad thai was very good. (However, I would recommend asking for no mushrooms if you get it with tofu, they dont go with the meal.) Anyway, they also had $3 beers and the crispy wontons were delicious. I was much happier with my meal the second time around. Seems like it can be hit or mis.
author: Jess K.

description:
BIg osha thai fan (been here for 4 months and probably been to the chain about 20 times).

but this is probably my least favorite location. the area isn't great, the service is ok, the food always seems to be the most average of the chain. overall, i would give the chain 4 stars. but this location gets 3 for me. i would recommend the embarcadero location if you r looking to try some osha for the first time!
author: Thach N.

description:
Bad service.

Was given appetizer, we finished it. Waited a little while then waitress comes and ask if we were ready for our entrees. Um really? 
SO we waited  quite a while for our entrees.
