We also ordered to go food, that came and we were ready for our check. We had to ask for it. then it took them FOREVER to give us change. There were like 2 or 3 servers plus busboys  in that tiny place, and I couldn't get either of them to get me my change for the longest time. How annoying. 

Do your self a favor, go to the other Osha locations. This one on geary is so dirty compared to the other locations. The prices of dishes are the same so you might as well go to a nicer place.
author: Erica L.

description:
Pineapple fried rice never disappoints at Osha.

I prefer this location over the others.
author: Anthony N.

description: Love love love OSHA in the tender nob. I'm a regular here. This is Thai with a modern spin. For example: you can get green "healthy" noodles. I think the only thing I've ever not liked here was chicken noodle soup- a little tasteless and plain. Everything else- the fried rices (the mix if chicken and seafood is my favorite), the currey (I've had pumpkin), the noodles (I can't even pick a favorite)- is simply delicious. A plate will run you about $12 give or take a few bucks. Come for dinner or late night. Every table is taken at 2am bc there are so many bars around. OSHA on Geary def gets a recommendation from this girl.
author: Viktoriya Z.

description:
This was the original Osha Thai location and I do believe this location still has the best food!  This is a step up from King of Thai. Both are quick eats and open late.  But Osha has some special dishes that King of Thai doesn't offer.  I also dont think the service here is that great...wasnt bad, but could be better.  A bit friendlier would be nice and it would be nice if the waiters checked on us and serve a little faster.  There was only about 5 tables and 3 tables got their food already.

I ordered the Tom Yum noodle soup which I thought was good.  I ordered it medium spicy which to me was not spicy at all.  Not even a little burn on the tongue. Plus it wasn't sour enough.  It was still tasty, but not the typical tom yum flavors. I made the mistake ordering the thin noodles.  TOO THIN!  I was expecting like vermicelli noodles but this was like super thin floss like rice noodles.  Should have ordered the thick "fun" noodles.  Dont get me wrong, I still enjoyed my dish minus the bean sprouts which took up half the bowl.  (fillers!)
author: Gina S.

description:
Hmm...I don't know, all the times I've been here I've either been drunk or buzzed.  With that being said, I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and say the food is decent.

One thing I DO remember though is the service can get pretty shitty at night.  Waiter tried to take away my group's table after seating us because he saw a larger group come right after.  Um WTF? I was the least intoxicated in my group so don't go trying to pull that shit just because you think we're "under the influence".  Needless to say I gave him a stern "no" and continued to order our food, WTF can he do?

Oh, and they try to clear the tables quick by taking away your plates without even asking if you're done.  Slow the eff down!
author: Ken L.

description:
Whaaaaaa...? I haven't updated my review since 2008?! 

Pad see ew: Typical but good. Nothing special but flavors are on point just a bit greasy.

Curries are always good and they give you a decent amount of meat to sauce to veggie ratio. I think the yellow is the best and has a nice kick to it.

Now onto the only thing you need to know.... Osha Spicy Pan Fried Noodles. Oh man I love me some duck noodoh when I'm drunk. The noodoh's are crispy, the one's in the sauce are saucy and soft, the duck is well spiced, tender and delicious, sauce is spicy and this is just damn good. Especially when you're trashed.

The wait staff is bitchy. Most of the time they're sexually ambiguous looking little shemales that yell at you and make you wait a looooong time to eat. But shit, wouldn't you be a raging bitch if you looked like a 10 year old boy and had to deal with drunk starving dumbasses all night long? 

Side note: SPICY PAN FRIED DUCK NOODOH!
author: Beverly T.

description: Food poisoning still sick after three days.  Here on business. Puking in a hotel room is not fun.
author: Alan B.

description: Dude this place is across the street from me.. so yay! I like it. Had calamari for appetizer, very good. I had green curry with rice.. yes, good! Partner had the Osha Tom Yum soup.. very good as well. I wanna go back soon and try some other things. Good portions, good prices, great location.
author: Vol T.

description:
Came here late one night and was seated pretty quick.  Although we were a bit cramped in the booth-like seating.  The server came to our table and took our orders within the first 5 minutes or so of seating us.  We ordered our food and about 10+ minutes later it came to us hot from the kitchen.

I asked for my food to be spicy and it wasn't spicy at all, but rather more sweet(-1 star).  So I had to add the chili flakes myself, from the container on the table.  As I ate my pad see ew (sp?), I realized that it wasn't the way it's always tasted at the other Thai places I've eaten at.  Even at the other Osha location the pad see ew tasted much better(-1 star).  Also the prices are a bit high (-1 star) ... 

I must say that I probably won't ever come back here again, and probably wouldn't have even tried it this location at all if it weren't for my friends.  But I'm glad I tried it, and now I know that their food taste a bit different then the other places ... MAYBE I'll go back and try something different.  Hopefully I can at least bring their rating to 3 stars ...
author: Pia V.

description:
I've only been to this Osha location. I've been five times now - the most recent time being the dinner stop with some out-of-town friends.

Osha offers all the basic Thai dishes, as well as a couple of strange ones, like the, what is it, Purple fried rice? Oddly enough, the purple fried rice is awesome.

I won't review every dish I've had in particular, but I've had at least a quarter of the menu, and never once been slightly disappointed. The steak appetizer is really nice, although not terribly Thai by any stretch of the imagination (steak and wasabi? wha?) I was in Thailand last year, you don't want to eat beef there...

The soups are particularly good. The portions are gigantic.

Thai teas are huge and well priced. Always a check in my book.

I've had to wait a couple of times, but they usually find a table for you pretty quickly.

Props to the management for recently redoing the once disgusting bathroom.
author: Conrad B.

description:
The food was good and the location is right by downtown and in the tenderloin area. I had no problems with this place and the booths were cozy. The place seemed a little cramped though.

The yellow curry is a good choice to get with brown rice!
author: Tim M.

description:
The perfect post Bar, little tipsy spot for some tasty grub.  The bars are right there, just a convenient stumble away and the staff know how to handle drunkards... by throwing food at them, lots of water and leaving them alone.  The bathroom smells like someone decided to pee on the walls for kicks so I hope you ladies have strong knees for the "hover n pee" manuever.  Horrible segway, but moving from urination to food...

Can't go wrong with the tom yum, beef salad, pad see ew and papaya salad.  

Thank you come again
author: Two P.

description: Ordered takeout recently for dinner and food quality was significantly lower. Next time I'll just walk the extra few blocks to get takeout from ler ros instead.
author: Mai C.

description: Their food deserve a four-star rating. However, the service were terrible and their server showed so much attitude that we couldnt enjoy our meal their. That's why I give it a 3-star. You should definitely try the duck fried rice and the volcanic beef here. Those are the 2 good dishes.
author: Ly P.

description:
Mmmm Osha Thai.
Let's see, it stays open late, it's clean, the service is overly attentive, and the food is bomb (duck fried rice anyone?). It might be a little on the pricier side for Thai food, but for reals, the food here is pretty damn good.

4 solid stars for Osha Thai. I'm a fan.
author: Tom P.

description:
I came here when I visited SF. It is really close to my hotel so we just walked there.
We ordered mango salad, volcano beef, tom yum soup, and pork basil.
The mango salad (2stars) -- the mango is too sweet. Usually they use the green mango so it will be sour and spicy but their mango is too ripe to be a salad.
Tom yum soup (4 stars) -- got a pretty nice kick to it.
Volcano beef (4stars) -- at first we want to order it as a side dish but the waiter said they only have one portion that came out with rice and then I asked her whether it is large enough for us to share (3of us) and she said no so we ordered the pork basil. When the dish came out, it was pretty big!! it is more than enough for us to share.
Pork basil -- the server recommendation. It just okay nothing special.(2 stars)
Definitely not the best Thai food I have ever eaten.
author: Diana A.

description:
Food was okay. I've yet to find a good thai place in the city. 

Came here late night with some friends (there was 11 of us) and we were separated (6 on one and 5 on the other). I was in the table of 5 and only 3 of us wanted food. "Plov" was our waitress and I ordered two dishes (pahd see ew, tom yum soup) and my two other friends ordered a rice dish and noodles. That is 4 dishes for a table of 5. "Plov" says there's a minimum of 1 dish per person. Really? One dish per person? I have never heard a restaurant do that to anyone before and felt forced to order a dish that none of us even ate. After the dinner I talked to my friends that was in the table of 6 and had a different waiter an they were allowed to order 3 dishes. They told us the waiter never told them about the 1 dish per person bs. 

Had terrible service, food was overpriced and only okay. Will never come here again.
author: Samson L.

description:
The restaurant was pretty full around 8 PM when my party arrived. We only had to wait a couple of minutes for a table, though. Crab fried rice was suggested, so that's what was ordered. It came with an abundance of real crab meat cooked into the rice along with a couple of meat-filled crab claws ($10.95). My girlfriend ordered calamari, mushroom soup, and rolled beef slices.

$4 beers and $8 specialty cocktails. The bill came to about $30 including tax and tip.

Downside is that parking really sucks, so we parked at a parking garage just down the street and around the corner ($8 for the first two hours, $10 until midnight, and $15 until 2 AM).
author: Angela H.

description:
Of course this being in the Tenderloin, maybe it's all perception. The OTs at the Embarcadero and 2nd Street are nicer=fancier, with bigger portions, and even taste better? Not saying this locale is not good, because it still is, and worth a stop-in if ever nearby. 

$32+ can get you: fried chicken wings (mix of bland/dry wings and mini-drumsticks with a sweet&sour dipping sauce), seafood fried garlic & pepper over rice, laht nah=fat rice noodles w/Chinese broccoli, garlic, and mushrooms in gravy, Thai iced tea and a Stella.
author: Peter L.

description:
I just ordered the Vegetable Pad Thai, very disappointing  I must say.
          A Thai restaurant should have good noodles right. 
  The Pad Thai was soaking in water, it seemed that the chef blanched the veggies in water for 5 seconds, then dumped them into the noodles with a cup of the blanching water. The veggies were raw, and the noodles overcooked, under seasoned, and no tofu. wtf? 
   If you can't get a simple dish like this right, why should I waste more $$$ to try something else on the menu. King of Thai on clement around 7th is cheaper and more authentic.
author: Fat ass g.

description:
Osha Osha Osha! You are just so delicious!

Came here Saturday night around 8 pm. Surprisingly we were seated right away. We ended up getting thai iced teas and chicken basil with brown rice, yellow curry, and lemongrass chicken with brown rice and some shrimp appetizer. Everything was very delicious. 

Our friends that we were with have never been here before, so they enjoyed themselves and loved the food. Success!
author: Karina A.

description:
Two famish people who walked around looking for this place based on yelp reviews. 

It was nice and warm inside, they have great service with plenty of water refills and checking up on us to see how the meal went. 

We ordered the Roast Duck Curry, Pad Thai and Beef Eggplant. The Roast Duck Curry, the pineapples had a funny taste to it but curry wasn't so bad; Pad Thai had a lot of bean sprouts (silly me, mixed in everything too quickly); and the Beef Eggplant that was probably the best, since the eggplant wasn't smushy and the beef had a good flavor to it. 

Would I come back, maybe?
author: Haley C.

description:
I was a bit skeptical when my friend told me he wanted to come to Osha, because I worked right around the corner from the one in Union Square, where it was pre-prepared food. I mean, that place wasn't bad, but... hey this review isn't for the one in Union Square!

Anyway, so when we walk in, the first thing I notice is the layout of the restaurant. The tables seemed oddly placed and cramped. So when the host, who was sitting down at a table, offered us a table, we asked to sit elsewhere and he kindly accepted. So we chose our own table.

Looking at the menu, the selection was vast and not only that but the dishes were unique. The one thing about a restaurant that always catches my eye is whether their dishes are unique or not, because if they're just like any other restaurant, why bother coming to this specific one? So anyway, my friend and I picked out two appetizers and two mains, and we were going to dine family style. Sadly, they were out of the short ribs that we wanted, so we decided to just get some chicken wings.

The chicken wings came first, before the other appetizer, which was a tuna tartar. I was expecting just some plain old fried chicken, but these ones weren't just ordinary. They were lightly fried to perfection, nice and crispy, and were accompanied with a savory sweet and sour sauce. Personally, I would have never come up with this combination, but the balance of flavors was absolutely perfect.

Second, the tuna tartar was presented in a tall martini glass. It was an elegant display. Lightly spicy tuna tartar with mango and cilantro on shrimp crackers. Again, this mix of flavors isn't something I would ever think of, but it was another perfect balance.

Then our entrees came, one by one. Volcanic beef and Spicy Laht Nah. Volcanic beef was another artful dish, prepared with a flower in an onion ring "vase", with white rice on the side. Mildly spicy beef steak, grilled to perfection. Chewy like it's meant to be, but not the tough kind of chewy. Then, the Laht Nah: the menu said that it was pan fried, but it was more like a stew because of the "gravy". There was a nice little design made with Sriracha on the rim of the plate, which gave it another artsy element to the dish. Add the peanuts on yourself; they're on the platter of condiments.

I was absolutely impressed by the artistic nature of the dishes here. And for a great value at that. More than the average person would spend if they would dine alone, but certainly a great option if you're out with friends or in a party. A couple notes that I have to point out though: the timing of the dishes. Meant to be a two-course meal, because the dishes arrived at different times, it turned out to be like a four-course tasting menu. Second, even with appetizers, we weren't given share plates without asking. A minor detail but it should be mentioned nonetheless. Conclusively, this is a great restaurant.

Service: 8.5/10
Food: 9/10
Atmosphere: 9/10
Overall: 9/10
author: Darren H.

description: Service here is spotty, but the food is pretty good. I got the Tom Kha (coconut soup) which I thought was overly coconutty. I know that's probably not a word, but it really was definitely sub par. The pad thai is very chewy and I like the pineapple fried rice was delicious. Kinda pricey for a late night hole in the wall spot. Omg, the bathroom was disgusting. Like I felt like I was transported to a gas station restroom. It reeked of urine and was plastered with graffiti and trash everywhere. Do they ever clean it? So disgusting. Minus a star for the restroom. Absolutely disgusting!!!! It would so not pass the health inspection grades they have in LA.
author: Caroline L.

description:
everything is delicious here, the papaya salad, (if u can handle spicy go ahead and eat spicy but might i say i can eat REAL SPICY but this made my heart stop a few times.) ,pad see yew is good and duck fried rice is my favorites. I heard this is the only location where you can order the "naked prawns" and its not on the menu. It's basically raw prawns with lemon, chilli pepper, like a ceviche. A++++++++++++++ great appetizer with a beer!

THEY OPEN LATE TOO!
author: Tam T.

description:
After working up an appetite throwing back delicious cocktails down the street & around the corner, the girlfriend & I came across Osha's Geary location. We had no idea it was so close to where we already were, but knew instantly that Thai food was the answer.

We were seated immediately, ordered & the food arrived quickly. We were eating mere minutes after walking into the place. I had pumpkin curry & the girlfriend had noodle soup with duck. My pumpkin curry was yummy & came with a Mayan pyramid-shaped mound of rice that was much bigger than I really needed. The duck noodle soup was tasty too, but the noodles were a liability. I told the girlfriend I thought the noodles were like overcooked Top Ramen. She would not declare the noodles to be Top Ramen, but did agree that the noodles were a bit overcooked. Even so, the soup itself & duck was good enough to compensate & make the overall dish decent.

Osha on Geary has nice clean decor, fast service, food is up quickly & hits the late night craving spot. Being a short stroll from a favorite bar of mine, I will be back for more after-drinks yummies.
author: John M.

description:
My friends recommended this restaurant right after we went the SF Auto show. This resturnat is open late night so its good for those late night outings in the city. 

Their Angel wings appetizer was okay, nothing fancy. I did like their Pad Thai. Their Panang Curry was up to par. Overall, I wouldn't mind coming back here after a late night in the City.

This restaurant would have gotten four stars, but the Erawan Thai in Walnut Creek is just a notch better.
author: Paul V.

description: Their soups are the best. Been here many times for dine-in and togo. Friendly and happy staff with great service. Food tastes the best in class. Highly recommended.
author: Hems B.

description: It's great that they are open late so that you can drop by for dinner after a long night. The food is good and is one of my top choices for Thai food in the city. I have always left full and happy.
author: Daniel C.

description: I came here after the club sober, I think.  I'm sorry to say, although I wanted to like this place, but I just didn't think the food here was all that.  It was OK, but this place won't be my "go-to", " gotta my Thai food" fix type of place.   And as I compare my yelper friend's reviews from before 2011 to now, I guess quality has gone down.  So, going forward, I tested the new place by of course trying the Pad Thai.  You just can't mess up Pad Thai, or I'll never go there again.  It looked good, but it just lacked flavor.  It wasn't overly greasy which was good, only I was expecting that Thai kick, and I didn't get it.  I also had the gf try the Fried Chicken Plate.  Man, now if anything, that was the plate to get!  The chicken was soft and crispy.  Maybe I should've ordered the Duck Fried Rice that a couple of my friend's just devoured, but unfortunately I don't see myself returning anytime soon.  I really would've given this place two stars, but an extra star goes to the servers were nice and always smiled even with all the drunk asses that night.  They even made rounds to refill water glasses and hydrate everyone.  Good job!
author: Ron R.

description: Although the service was slow the food was great I recommend the lamb chops and the fried bananas good place to go eat with the family
author: Beto G.

description:
I've been here so many times mainly because I live right across the street. I've ordered many things and nothing seems to disappoint. 

Service is great! Very friendly and attentive! 

I highly recommend the green curry fried rice and any of their curries. The Pumpkin curry with chicken was great! I ordered it to go and it only took them about 8 min to make! Get the brown rice as well to go along side your curry. Some of the best brown rice I've ever had!

Friendly and customer service oriented!!! Go here!!
author: Kelly B.

description:
I think this place is best in sf, but this time I had good time but, why 1 star? 
 Because ,yesterday we order 2 noodle soup,one is beef ,another one was seafood combination ,and chicken and beef rolls .everting was testy but beef soup was difference ,not like before,and we eat all, and at the night all of us couldn't eat anything ,and all night we all had nausea, pain in the stomach. and today the same thing. We happened poisoning.I think something was not fresh.lol
author: Mary M.

description: Customer service here is on point! Would have rated it 5 stars but docked one off because their bathrooms are a bit on the unpleasant side. Overall, service is great. Food is quick and delicious! Very presentable. Atmosphere is very sleek and modern. Been here a couple of times, and I always order their curry. If you're ever craving Thai curry, this is the place to go! So far, my favorite Thai cuisine in the city!
author: Daphne A.

description: Rude host ignored us on a busy night said they called our name, but I hadn't moved from the same spot the whole 20 minutes I waited. Food is OK, a bit over priced. But one measly star for this particular location.
author: J A.

description:
I will never EVER tell anyone I don't know where to eat in SF.

Osha caught me by surprise mid rager on a Friday night. After an evening of dinner and drinks I found myself hungry YET again. 

In we go. Table for 4. 

Lychee Drinks 
Tom Ka Soup (Highlight of the night)
Pad See Eww (Good to the last noodle)
Spicy Thai Fried Rice (and I mean SPICY)

Ambiance was kickin and alive. Music, People, Food and Fun!

Everything we had was delicious, I don't have any complaints on flavor or quality. For the price and time of night I can't wait to bring friends here for some super party munchies!!
author: Lily M.

description:
It's not their fault that this was the first Thai food I had since going to perhaps the best Thai restaurant in the country (Lotus of Siam in Las Vegas).  I wasn't expecting this to be near that level.  I saw the yelp reviews here and knew what I was getting into a 3.5 star Thai place.  However, Osha Thai Noodle was right by my hotel and I needed some quick takeout, so I gave it a chance.  Perhaps I ordered the wrong thing but the food was pretty flavorless.

I had the Chicken Stay Appetizer.  It was 4 tiny pieces of chicken no bigger than 3 inches long.  The marinade didn't do anything for the chicken and even the dipping sauces of peanut and cucumber seemed bland.  Main dish was Chicken and Shrimp Silver Noodle, also sometimes called Pad Woon Sen.  This is a noodle dish done in a walk with veggies.  The onions were under wok-ed, fairly crunchy and strong tasting.  It was served on a whole bed of rice that took up most of the to go container.  Now this is a noodle dish, so while I still like some rice with it, it's the noodles that should be the main event here rather than just a topping.  There were 3 overcooked tiny shrimp curled up in the fetal position to the size of a penny and a couple pieces of chicken.  It's a good thing I wasn't that hungry.

Ordering over the phone was almost a screw up.  I felt that I didn't have the person's attention on the phone while they were taking my chicken satay, silver noodle order, with long pauses of silence, that made me think they were talking to someone else and I was interrupting their conversation.  Turns out, they weren't paying attention because they quickly read back Chicken Pad Thai and Silver Noodle.  "Did you just say Pad Thai or Satay," I asked?  Again muffled conversation followed by "Huh?"  So I asked again - and was told Pad Thai, you ordered Pad Thai right?  So I corrected the order and the guy on the phone thanked me for catching that and hung up before telling me how long until the order was ready.  Now sometimes these things are lost in translation, but he had no accent and as soon as I walked in Osha, I knew this wasn't Mom and Pop in the back of the kitchen.  Everyone working there was very young and more interested in talking to one another while doing their job than making eye contact with their customers.  I'm guessing a lot of mistakes get made here,  but I won't be back to find out.  Bad food and not friendly service is a losing combination every time.
author: Dave G.

description: This spot is solid, it's open till 3:00 am and the food tastes just as good at lunch time as it does in a late night stupor. I love their pad see yew and the crab Rangoon is amazing as well. They lose one star because the wait staff is unpredictable, I've had fantastic service when the place is packed and have felt invisible when I'm the only customer there. They've always been nice but are often inattentive or forgetful...
author: Ryan S.

description:
Spicaaaaay! When they ask you here at Osha if you want spicy, they mean it. Not like most places where you have to add additional hot oil/chile flakes/sri racha to boost the flavor. 

I ordered the spicy string beans with chicken. They asked if I wanted it spicy. Of course! Everyone else at our table was ordering spicy, I love spicy food, and no restaurant ever really makes it too spicy to eat. Plus I was beyond hungry at this point...this was after drinking at the bar down the street from 5-10pm & me finally getting my wish of going out to eat. I was happily eating my delicious string beans with chicken, when about halfway through I realized how goddam spicy it really was. I kept trying to eat more but my mouth was in flames. This is some crazy creep-up-and-bite-you-in-the-ass spice! But it was flavorful too and the chicken was cooked just right. I had to stop at some point & take the rest home cuz I just couldn't handle it anymore.  

Osha Thai saved me that night. The spicy food satisfied my appetite & all the water I drank helped keep me hydrated after all those drinks earlier in the evening. Great place to have a late night dinner.
author: Erin S.

description:
Oh hell yes.

We walked into this place starving! Not only does this place stay open really late (2 am I believe) but they are fast! By the time we stopped drooling over the menu, we ordered, and our food was at the table in five minutes! 

So heres the things, I can't remember the name of all the dishes we ate, but I tell you every single one was great! I ordered some soup, which is what I craved from the start, and it was awesome!

I am  new to eating Thai food, and I will be back there to eat soon.
author: Reyna O.

description:
***Rating is based on this Osha location only****  I'm honestly more of a fan and returning customer at the Embarcadero and Valencia locations and I realize that this location is the "Noodle Cafe". 

The food is just as good (4 stars), but the service here really is horrible especially on a busy night.  It's unorganized and slow. I give it to them for being open really late for the nocturnal people and the lushes that come straight from the clubs but this Osha is totally different from the others.  I haven't returned since my first time but I hope they stepped up their game a little.
author: Resa N.

description: Ordered from eat 24 . Scheduled delivery was 55 mins . Food arrived 45 mins late. When I called eat24 they said side car had picked up the order . When it finally arrived by a guy on a bicycle dripping with sweat. I just looked in the bag the boxes were open and the food was cold . Also I noticed the order was wrong . Could not eat after seen how it was delivered. There are so much better Thai restaurants to choose from.
author: Marie J.

description:
FOOD:
1.) Spring Rolls = Good. Skin kind of thick. But yeah if I didn't grow up in SJ with REAL spring rolls... I would say this is great spring rolls lol. Peanut butter sauce was yummy though.
2.) Fried Tofu = Dipping sauce was good.
3.) Orange Salmon = O my, so soft. Yum... Out of everything, this was the best.
4.) Crab Fried Rice = bleh, maybe my pallet got ruined by the other stuff, but I really didn't care for this dish. But regardless, a good dish should still make you want to engulf it in its entirety. This, I barely even touched.

*Next time, going to get the Volcanic Beef! I was debating between that and ... a noodle. The photo looked enticing! Will try.. and will come back! But to another location that looks nicer. ;P

SERVICE:
Wish they would smile! Jeesh!!! Are we really that much of a chore?? jk... They had good speedy service, but they just seemed stressed. lol. And I felt rushed. If I had time, I might've made the better decision of VOLCANIC BEEF!


ATMOSPHERE:
Very simple. Wooden tables and booth seating. Not bad, but definitely pretty casual. This location is in the ... ghetto.  . . ? Sorta. . . . lol.... So yeah. Not much to be expected any way. Damn you, convenience of proximity!!
author: Angela L.

description: Very disappointed considering all the positive reviews. Boat noodles were flavorless, basically brown water. The same with the pork larb. Could not taste any of the typical ingredients of lemongrass or toasted rice.  The calamari salad was actually pretty tasty, good flavor.
author: Reiana G.

description: Had Volcanic Beef and Pan Fried Noodle with Duck. Great presentation, it surprised me! Because from outside it doesn't look like an upscale place, and price is very reasonable. Volcanic Beef is good, a little too salty. The noddle has many pieces of roasted duck, but the duck is not the freshest. Overall, it is a good neighborhood restaurant for quick meals.
author: Emmy P.

description:
WARNING: just because this is a late night place that's open after all the bar/club crowd come out, DOES NOT make this place good, 5 star, or sanitary.

I just came here for late night two nights ago and had the pad thai and fish cake. the next morning, i had the worst case of the runs continually for the ENTIRE day, stomach cramps fever, and body aches. It is one day after and I STILL can't eat anything without it running through me. This place is NOT sanitary.

Not to mention, their service is terrible, they're the type that doesn't look you in the eye when you ask for something or smile back when you say thank you. They don't even give you utensils or plates!

On another occasion at their other location at embarcadero, my friend made a reservation for her birthday for a party of 8. we all got there at 8, but she was still looking for parking and they refused to seat us. 10-15 later, my friend came in and asked why we weren't seated, the nasty hostess rudely said to her "next time you're gonna be late, you have to call us yourself and tell us." then finally seated us. the night continued with poor quality of service and mediocre food.

why people come here? i don't know.
author: Trevor L.

description:
Nice quality, reasonable price and perfect medium spicy!

Walked by this place when I was up at Moscone for a conference and from the outside it didn't look too appealing, but peoples plate through the windows looked damn good.

So we decided to give it a try and were very pleasantly surprised. The seafood dish we had was extremely fresh and a good level of spicy (assuming you are okay with a little spice and enjoy some heat) w/o masking the little sea creatures we were devouring. 

Definitely recommend for those looking for something in an area were a lot of the restaurants don't look very appealing from outside on the street....
author: Dave S.

description: So, the good thing is, there is no other restaurant around it thats open so late on a weekend. Bad part is the strong fish smell that is inside. It could be a one day smell and I happened to stop by on the very same night. None the less, I ordered a chicken fried rice and had nothing to complain about. I expect other items on their menu to give more detail into how they are but the chicken fried rice makes me feel they know how to cook.
author: Ambu S.

description: Pretty good thai food. Been here once during a business trip and was the best tasting place i could find within walking distance from my hotel. They didn't dissapoint, the dishes were good and I can't say anything bad about it.
author: Marlon P.

description:
TLDR:
- Good pad thai.
- Pork was not.
- Heavily priced for disappointing meal.
author: Christopher L.

description:
In general, I'm a big fan of the Osha's. However, this Osha managed to disappoint me even when I was super hungry and a little tipsy...

First, we had to wait and wait and wait. It was around midnight or 1 AM and this place was packed. When we finally got a table, we greedily ordered a bunch of dishes expecting the same rich, deliciousness we've come to expect from Osha. However, everything was just a bit drier and more bland that it should have been. Even the pad thai which I usually wouldn't order next to my peanut-allergy bf was missing a certain je ne se qua... what a bummer?!

Next time I'll venture to 2nd Street or Union for sure!
author: Meghan P.

description: Osha is great! The prices are very reasonable, you can never run out of things to order off of the menu, it is very vegetarian friendly, the restaurant is pretty big, and it's not even packed on Fri or Sat night.  There are a few different locations of Osha. The atmosphere here is nice and intimate, so I think I like it best!
author: Robin K.

description:
Ate here for lunch with the gf, and it was quite solid. We got the lunch special and it was that gave you a little spring roll and soup appetizer, followed by your choice of main dish. This was all pretty well priced for the amount of food you got and for its location in the marina. I had the spring rolls, which were light and flakey, and the eggplant dish, which was pretty good but yet seemed to be lacking a real kick. I am not going to rave about the flavor, because to be honest, it was solid but nothing really grabbed me and made me want to just sit back in my chair in a bout of flavor overload. The flavor was more restrained, timid almost, and it was closer to standard fair then amazing production. Don't get me wrong, its above average food, but not amazingly so.  The best analogy I can put is, once I was listening to a song by Melody Gardot (AMAZING SINGER), and through the whole song she kept this beautiful yet quiet and restrained low tone with hints of the brilliant high notes she could bring. It drove me mad, I just wanted her to belt it out as high as she could, yet in that song she never did. That is Osha, its good and you can see hints of brilliant and you want them to run with that and hit you with something amazing, but you find yourself waiting for the flavor knock out punch that never comes, instead you just get jabbed by pretty good flavors.
 
 
On another note, the décor....LOVED IT! Very well decorated and loved the little flowers that came on every dish. A very welcoming and nice feel.
author: Tom O.

description: Ordered the chicken fried rice. Big-ass bowl of the stuff. Delish!
author: Koogmo ..

description: Staff is very friendly, helpful and patient while you try to figure out what to order. The food is average but you can serve yourself Thai tea and Thai coffee with cream-yum. The place has minimalist, green interiors with techno music blaring which is kind of weird but it doesn't matter. Bonus: All "to go" containers are eco-friendly.
author: Diana D.

description:
Fast service, great spot for a late dinner after arriving from Texas. 

Food:
- spring rolls wrapped in rice paper - fabulous
- pad khee Mao - stuffed with fresh veges, ordered with chicken

Drink:
- hot sake - cant go wrong
- Sapporo - reliable favorite
author: Sam P.

description: Not too bad actually. We came on a Sunday night and got a table with no wait. The place was clean, service a little patchy though. We had the thai green and red curries - both good. I also like the fact that they're open so late. For ambience you're better off going to Osha on Embarcadero though.
author: Pooja S.

description: Service is so slow.  It's always chaos and confusion.  Think they have one cook who works at a snails pace.  Don't go there if you're hungry because it will be a while. With that said, food is good.
author: Eric C.

description:
I came to this location for the first time while spending a weekend in the city. I was craving some noodle soup and this place was near our hotel. 

I ordered the thai boat noodles and really enjoyed it. The broth tasted fresh and light. It was the best tasting thai boat noodle that I have eaten. 

The ambience of this place was cute and casual. It is not as fancy as some of the other locations. The service was fast and friendly. I wish we had a place like this in the south bay.
author: Tran N.

description:
I have eaten here more than once over the years I have been visiting San Francisco. This is a nice, clean, inviting restaurant in the middle of the Tenderloin. God bless it, I feel safe having a meal here alone any time of day and have found the staff attentive and friendly. 

Get the crab fried rice, I like the Chicken Satay, and (I know it's passe) but I love the Pad Thai - chicken,tofu or shrimp. If you're there in the evening, you can order wine but it only comes in 2 vintages - white or red. I have not tried the specialty cocktails, but have tried the Thai Lime Ice tea, unfortunate choice that it was (sticky sweet and bitter at the same time.) 

Good food, clean, inviting restaurant right in he Tenderloin, go for it
author: Christine T.

description: Worst customer service ever. The hostess was so rude. He asked us to go wait in the cold and pretty much told us he rather go and eat somewhere else.
author: farigol b.

description:
I wish they had this place in LA and NYC.  They have two of my favorite things in life...fried chicken and fried rice.  The fried chicken has a great crispy texture and they use white meat, but it's still juicy.  The fried rice is great and wet, but not greasy.  I avoid all other carbs when possible, but this fried rice is just fantastic.  They also have a solid pad see ew.

I put this place up there with the best Thai in the US including jitlada, renu nakorn, lotus, and sripraprai.
author: jamie N.

description:
Not a fan of this place. I dined here for lunch while on a business trip in SF. I ordered prawn spring rolls and chicken larb. I really enjoyed the prawn spring rolls which were wrapped with thick rice noodles, very different from what I've seen before. The chicken larb was disappointing. The sauce was very pungent and had an unpleasant taste. I'm used to eating fish sauce, so pungent fish flavors don't bother me. The pungent smell from this dish was something else.

The service was mediocre. My friend ordered a main dish and appetizer as well. We ordered everything all at once, but I received both my dishes way before she did. About 5+ minutes after, my friend got her main dish, which was later followed by her appetizer. Definately not the proper order of things.

On the upside, they were playing Britney's new album, so I enjoyed the atmosphere at least.
author: Linda T.

description:
I used to really like this place.  The food is fantastic!  But the service is TERRIBLE.  I came here for a friend's birthday on a Saturday night.  Six of us were squashed into a four-person table, and the waitress (named Rit) kept asking us if we were done.  Fine, I get it.  There are people waiting.  But to make matters worse, I just checked my credit card bill and she ADDED A THIRTY PERCENT TIP (!) to my bill which already had tip included!!

  I tried to contest it by calling the number listed on their website, but no one picks up the phone.

In short, EAT HERE FOR GOOD FOOD, BUT PAY IN CASH!!
author: Rao P.

description:
So my friends, who live at my dorm, always order from this restaurant. And I say ALWAYS, for they loved their food and was always treated right. Well, they just told my friend that they will not deliver to our dorm because my friend did not tip her. My friend was using her boyfriends card and was going to grab cash to tip her, so she would cover something instead of him always paying.

The woman walked away and when my friend tried to call her, she refused to pick up.

All and all the service here is a bitch, when they don't get their money.
author: Nicole G.

description:
I highly recommend Osha! Great drinks and food with a very fun atmosphere. The mimosa's and Thai iced coffee's are wonderful and the pad thai is amazing. 

This is a great place for bigger groups, but make reservations if you can. There are also several locations throughout the city, all of which are great, but I'd recommend going to the one off the Embarcadero since the view is gorgeous. Either way, you can't go wrong.
author: Ashley B.

description:
Open late. Not too expensive.  Late night line and service is terrible, but hey it's the only game in town at that time of night in that area.  I don't think i would come here for a sober meal.



The only Thai food i like is Pad Thai and Pad See Ew.  And i've only been here once so i can pretty much only review off of one dish.

Pad See Ew with Duck:  Tasted great, Good portion.  Only down point was that it was a little greasy.  But still would get it again.


Took a sip of my Friend's Tom Yum Noodle Soup - I was not a fan at all....  That sour taste almost made me gag....  Maybe it was just a bad batch.... but bleh.
author: Steven F.

description:
So compared to my favorite inexpensive thai resturant, King of Thai Noodles in Union Square, Osha's food tastes waaayyyy better!!! 

I had the Chicken Satay, and although I hated the peanut dipping sauce here for some reason...the chicken was really good! The pieces were big, and juicy. Yum! 

I also ordered the Chicken Pad See Ew! When I saw they used crumbled up pieces of chicken, I was a little bummed. But, oooohhhhhh man- When I took that first bite, it was delicious!!! I had some type of beverage called Osha Punch...or juice...or something like that. It was pretty tasty as well. 

I'm taking off one star, because they forgot to put my friend's order in. SO everyone at the table is eating, and she's not. THEN they come by and bring us the check and when we tell her, she never got her food. The waitress stands there and looks at us all crazy. @_@ Then she asks our original waitress, who took our food, and she starts panicking because she realized she forgot to put the food in. However, after my friend's food, finally, arrived-she said it was really good also.
author: Lauren H.

description:
I gobbled the huge platter of crab fried rice, lad na, and sticky rice with mango! Total foodgasm at minimal cost. Certainly a good bang for your buck and the service was fast (lunch time).

One little down side, when you're across the street from the restaurant in broad day light, the place looks like a store that ran out of business. It's not welcoming. I wish they would do something at least with the exterior.  Maybe some window awnings. They'll prolly attract more customers. Just a suggestion.

Anyways, we enjoyed our food and would definitely come back here again. Their fried rice is phenomenal and has varieties.
author: Lora M.

description:
They don't take reservations here but they did for us since we made reservations for 12.. Place got really packed around 8 and while we were waiting outside, my friend and I kept looking in the window staring at people's food since I only had a string cheese the whole day! OMG.. 

Service was pretty fast and friendly. I like this OSHA more then others. Even though they're not as upscale, they have more options, like fried rice with fried chicken.. AND the prices are lower then the other ones! AND they're open late!!!

I ordered the usual pad Thai with chicken ($8.95) . The food came literally a couple minutes after ordering. Lightening fast! Good, since I was starving! Portion was pretty big and I only finished half of it. Everything else that I saw on the table looked so good.

- 1 star..... NO COCONUT RICE?!?!?!?!?
author: Juliane N.

description:
Some items at this location are good like the green bean rice entree, but the tom yum noodles is NOT good! The base was too sweet. Since when was tom yum sweet? The last time I ordered this was over 3 years ago and it was too limey so I never ordered it til now. 

In addition, inside of their water cups, there was a layer of unknown film on the cup. I know because I scraped some of it off. This is where I ask the waitress for bottled water. 

Not to mention their overpriced dishes. I paid over $10 for this entree and I wasn't very pleased with the taste, although the presentation was appealing.
author: Kissy F.

description:
I've been to the Osha in SOMA, was quite surprised how delicious the thai food was and the lounge vibe was awesome. Then I went to this one which didn't look like it had that vibe but it delivered on the food!

everything I tried was delicious! 

duck fried rice - bomb! 
pad see ew w/ beef - yum! the noodles were just the right greasy for after drinks. ( I was not drunk only slightly buzzed, and I thought the food was scrumptious!)
Duck noodle soup! - a bit too salty but very tasty. Lots of duck flavor.

Get duck everything here!
author: Mary M.

description:
Another one of my favorite Thai places ever!  I've been coming here since high school, when this was still janky and ghetto.  This is the original Osha, before they started expanding into the nicer areas throughout the city.  They are taste really good, don't get me wrong, but this one is particularly my favorite. 

I always order the Pad La Nar, which is kind of a Pad Kee Mao with a twist...with gravy.  It's sooooo good!  It's one of my favorite dishes in the whole wide world!  You must order it!

Now that it's been remodeled and closes late (3AM), a lot of people go after clubbing...so it's good to be there before 2AM if you're out and crave a late night snack.  Asian food is just my favorite and I can never give it up...and Thai food is one of them!
author: Nancy S.

description:
There was a point for 2 years where I'd refuse to go to any other Thai restaurant but this one. To me, this Osha Thai in particular was fantastic---it was moderately priced, the portions are generous and lack of flavor was far from the issue here. 

Their food is pretty good, I mean it meets 'good thai food standards'
They have a huge menu to choose from so you'd be a real big b _ _ _ _ for not liking at least one thing out of 60, you have your basic appetizers, spring rolls, fried tofu, potstickers, satay, wontons, fish cake. Soups, Salads, Curries, Pad Thais, and different varieties of rice plates you could eat without anything else haha

I usually order  panang red curry (red curry with green and red bell peppers, pineabpple) with duck, fried tofu (served with sweet and sour sauce and crushed peanuts) 

The servers are attentative and friendly but don't expect the interior of the restaurant to look as good as it does on their website -_____-

Lots of homeless guys call the outside of this restaurant their home. 

Parking isn't too terrible, it varies, usually I don't spend more than 5 minutes looking for parking but once in a while I'll end up circling the place 4 times and still have no luck.
author: Olivia Vanessa R.

description:
The neighborhood around this particular Osha location is more than questionable. This is not a place you want to visit alone but if you happen to be out late partying near by they are open late and the food is great. 
My favorite thing to order here is the Crab fried rice and Volcano Beef.

If you feel uncomfortable with crackheads and transients attempting to bum ciggarettes every 5 minutes you should do as I do and place an order for pick-up.
author: Hannah A.

description:
3.5 stars. I was thinking that this was now my favorite Osha location, with nice servers, unpretentious decor, and cheaper prices... until the server asked me if I had another credit card/debit card "because the magnetic strip was broken." Normally, I wouldn't have batted an eye and would have just given him another card. But the card was literally, BRAND NEW, I've had it for a week. And I've used it several times in that week, so I know it worked. In fact, I had just used it a few doors down at Rye. WTF! I tried not to laugh in his face and asked him to run it manually. He must have figured it out because a short time later he returned with the card receipt for me to sign.

Maybe it's his first week on the job and he doesn't understand how to use a credit card machine... Maybe he wasn't paying attention during that part of the training. Whatever, I hope he learns how to do his job soon so I can go back. The quality of the food is also better than the posh one in the Marina.
author: Dani D.

description:
A few years ago eminent translators and linguists convened to make a list of the most difficult words to translate.  Number One was: ilunga, a Tshiluba (a Bantu language) word for a person who is ready to forgive any abuse for the first time; to tolerate it a second time; but never a third time.

This interests me, and make me think of my two food poisoning related incidents at Osha.

One: duck curry.  That came back to haunt me 0 hours, 46 minutes and 2 seconds after eating it.  It also scarred my coworkers, clients, janitors, and drycleaners.

Two:  3 months, 14 days, 5 hours, 16 minutes and 4 seconds later.  Pan fried noodles.  Surely this can't make me sick, right? I usually have a steel reserve stomach.  30 minutes later: back to the bathroom.  Ugliness ensues.

Psychosomatic? some might say. I think not.  I just know: t am not going to give Osha a third time to kill me.  (giving two stars because the food was decent when I was taking it in....as opposed to...you know, taking the trash out.)
author: Joanna M.

description: This is a reliable place for greasy mediocre Thai food that opens late.
author: Byron L.

description:
The original Oshas, and the best.  Get the crab fried rice, pad sew ew, and any curry you can get your hands on. 

This is the best post clubbing late night place for food, as they are open until 2am Sunday morning. The food comes out hot and fast, for all that post-buzz metabolism. 

Tip: ladies, try to pee before you come here. All us guys miss by a mile here. BYOTP also.
author: Mark M.

description: Super friendly service, huge portions. I stopped here for takeout with some fam - we took it to go and sat down the street at Union Square park to enjoy lunch in the sunshine. Amazingly flavorful curries and everything tasted fresh. Absolutely would return here.
author: Stefanie J.

description:
Best place to go after a drunken night out in the city! 

I've only been here in the wee hours of the night, but each time has been an excellent experience. I love their pineapple fried rice here, and their angel wings are delicious! 

The best thing about this place is that it's open 'til really late, like 'til 3am on the weekends.  

The worst thing about this place is that there's only one restroom so you sometimes gotta wait forever to use it =/
author: Cat P.

description:
SAVE YOUR RECEIPTS!
BEWARE OF SHADY PRACTICES!!!
(Read the last paragraph if nothing else. You need to know this!)

I've been boycotting this location for several years now. Lucky me, the Bang San (now closed) on Jones Street opened up around the same time I decided to boycott this place. It's the first Osha location and one of the first Thai spots to open up in the area. Many other Osha locations have opened up since then and for good reason, the food is bomb!

I remember when they first opened. I remember when this location was half the size, before they rented out their neighboring space, remodeled, and expanded. My money has assisted them in their renovations! Seriously, I used to go there all the time! If I have to credit any one location who introduced me to Thai cuisine and helped me appreciate it, I would point this place out.

Alright, here's the big BUT...
The service is shitty. Well, it was at the time. I was going there for years, YEARS, and the service was ALWAYS shitty. I can understand being super busy and being all over the place, but do you have to be such bitches? Yes, bitches! I dealt with the attitudes...for YEARS! The food was worth it to me. 

Here's where they tried to play me...
Here's where they lost me...
It's called "gratuity." I give gratuity when the servers are gracious. I am a good tipper! Again, I can kinda understand if the service is bad because the location is busy and servers are stretched thin. I wouldn't take that personally, BUT when you have such horrible attitudes (almost all of them) and you act my simple requests are a burden, then you don't deserve a good tip. They should be happy I tip them at all. I give them shitty tips because that's what they deserve. So what do they do? LOL...they take it upon themselves to change the tip amounts. Most of us may not save our receipts to compare to our credit card statements, but I do! And I know how much I tip! Doubling and tripling my tip? You didn't think I'd notice?! This happened not once, not twice, but three times! Three strikes! I took the receipts back with my statements to let them know I know what they do, but that obviously didn't make them feel bad enough to stop this SHADY and illegal practice. They refunded the tips in cash, but still. It's fucking shady! They tried to make copies of my statements...are you kidding me? Fuck that!!! As shady as you are, you think I'ma give you more personal info on me? Can you imagine how much they've skimmed off their customers? A dollar or two or three...added on to several customer receipts, several times a day, several days a week...that shit adds up. 

*** SHADY!!! SHADY!!! SHADY!!! ***
author: Helen L.

description: I want to get back to my delicious Thai food from Osha, so I'm going to keep this short --- SUPER AWESOME AND SUPER DELICIOUS! Go to Osha right now and check it out yourself!
author: L T.

description: Osha is good thai food. I tried the fried garlic & pepper chicken, Pad Kee Mao, Calamari and a Salmon dish. Overall food is good here. I prefer this location to the Osha restaurants in Soma. Much more casual and kick back. Service is good. Bathroom isnt so clean and is shared between Men/Women.
author: Dave C.

description:
AVERAGE THAI FOOD IN A NOISY SETTING

The restaurant was packed so we decided to try it.  We were seated in a booth with hard wooden seats.  It felt like I was sitting in a church pew.  I thought the menu was pricey compared to other Thai restaurants in the city.  We ordered the following:

Papaya Salad--I thought the papaya was too crunchy and did not have time to absorb the dressing.

Spicy Basil Chicken--This dish was bland, had to spice it up with the generic hot sauce on the table.  The rice on the side was hard and tasted like it was reheated.

Osha Spaghetti--Noodles were tossed with basil, bamboo shoots, tomatoes, and onions.  It was topped with the most anemic, tasteless chicken I have ever eaten.  The noodles were good but not worth the $12.95 price tag.

The food seemed watered down to appeal to a wide audience.  We assured the waiter we wanted spicy but all of the dishes were mild.
author: Rob L.

description:
I finally found a Thai restaurant worthy of revisiting! The place was incredibly clean and the service, lighting fast--our food came out within 7-10 minutes of ordering it.

I had the Pad See Ew with beef and my friend had the Pad Thai with chicken (both $8.95). I always order one of the two on my first visit to a Thai restaurant because they're a reliable measure of the whole menu (at least that's what I like to think). The Pad See Ew was perfectly seasoned with bits of flavorful and tender beef. The Pad Thai was a bit too sweet for my sweet tooth, and it had a strange underlying peanut taste. I like my Pad Thai made with fish sauce, tamarind pulp, palm sugar, and chili powder--no peanut butter, please!

Both noodles were really good. They were soft, chewy, and not lumped together. The Thai iced tea ($1.75) was tasty and refreshing. The portion size was generous for the price. I'll definitely return to try the various other dishes.
author: Liz T.

description:
Best thing is that it's a great late night place as it closes at 1 AM and 
parking was easy that late in the night, and no meters have to be fed either (double win).

I had the special moroheiya pad thai, made with wheat noodles instead of rice noodles, to give you a blast of fiber for that digestive system. I enjoyed it and finished my entire order. It tasted just like a regular pad thai, no after taste or weird texture. The differences between the noodles were that this was softer and it looked like green ramen.

What is moroheiya? I googled it later and found out that it's a vegetable grown in thailand that has more minerals, vitamins, and dietary fiber than the common veggies. One serving has 32% of your daily dietary fiber, 20% vitamin A, and dot dot dot. I'm glad I decided to give this a try.

However, my friend that got the regular pad thai thought it was too sweet and my other two companions didn't say anything about their dishes...therefore, I take that as it's average.

This OSHA looks different than two others I've been too (Glen Park and 3rd street). This one was cozy with a dark wood interior and as small as the one in Glen Park.

Despite the neighborhood, I would come back here for some late night eats.
author: Jayme N.

description: My Fiance had Crab Fried Rice and he enjoyed it a lot. As for me I had Chicken pad thai and it was delicious! THe portion was big, though a bit on the pricey side.
author: Aniko N.

description:
OPEN LATE NIGHT AFTER THE CLUB?! YES PLEASE!
SUPER SHMACKIN? YOU BET! SO NO MATTER HOW DRUNK YOU ARE BE SURE TO GET YOUR ORDER STRAIGHT AND GET YOUR FOOD TO GO AND DIPPP!

Calamari, yum. Pad Thai, yum. Curry puffs, yum. Everything, yum.
author: Rosh E.

description:
You wouldn't know it's Osha unless you look at the menu... the restaurant has a different name in neon (Thai Noodle Cafe). 

The food is simply good here. Definitely order the CRAB FRIED RICE as suggested by many other reviewers. Fried rice with (REAL) crab meat, crab claws, egg, onion, and green onion. 

Avoid combining it with Pad Thai- too many carbs. Try combining it with the SPICY EGGPLANT with prawns or seafood, tofu, chicken, pork or beef stir fried egg plant with garlic, basil, chili, and bell pepper. 

For a chain in the city, it's amazing how different each location of Osha is. This is the dive near the loin that you should go with your friends or if you are drunk- not on a date. The restaurant is way too bright with track lighting that makes you look like a zombie from night of the living dead. There is no bar to wait so you end up shivering on a line outside since they don't take reservations at this location. 
I would suggest the Union St. or Valencia for a more upscale and intimate atmosphere. 

If you have one too many beers at a local bar, it's past midnight and you're with buddies, this would hit the spot.
author: Noel H.

description: Don't let the exterior of the restaurant put you off. The doors open up to a fairly large restaurant with dark wood tables comfortably seating four. The menu is extensive and ingredients are fresh. The grilled squid salad is a winning dish (medium chili for those who can handle some heat). I ordered it twice in one week it was that good!
author: Amy M.

description: Great place, great value! Ordered the go-go off the special pride drink menu which was delicious. The lemonade is also amazing! The lamb was the greatest thing I have ever eaten! I will definitely go back every time I'm in San Francisco!
author: Brooke H.

description: Osha is good. Nice interior. Good customer service. Food is good. I recommend this place.
author: Winnie L.

description:
So, where to go, where to go after a late night of hanging out with good friends and starving after some serious dancing?

OSHA THAI.  Oh my gosh, despite the cheesy diner ambiance and steel stools and banquettes, it was the welcome place for sore feet and hungry eyes.  

The menu consists of the typical Thai fare: lots of noodle dishes, Pad Thai, soups, and appetizers.  We had the rice noodle beef and broccoli dish with brown gravy.  As unappetizing as that description sounds, it was the perfect salty noodle dish of the evening.  With lots of tender beef and crunchy broccoli, it hit the spot.  To balance out the salty with something sweet, order the Thai ice tea.  The drink should waylay the absorption of sodium and starch into your system and keep you awake for the drive home.

Recommended for the late night hours (open until 2:00 AM!!!), cheap prices and plenty of parking.  Keep an eye open for street cleaning hours though.  A ticket after a good meal is a killer  ;)
author: Miika M.

description:
125 reviews? Is there anyone in SF who hasn't eaten at Osha? Michelle B (the Seattle Community Manager for Yelp) was having a craving for some Osha Thai Noodle Cafe soup so we set off to satisfy her craving. On the way to the restaurant Michelle described Osha as a total dive, but it was actually a really cute atmosphere (apparently they've done some remodeling in the past year). 

I wasn't even hungry and was just going along to chat, but the food looked too good to pass up. Before I knew it we had a very tasty (and very large) bowl of soup in front of us (enough to feed 4 people), some green beans with shrimp (the best green beans I've had in a long time!), and fried tofu (not my thing, but Michelle seemed to enjoy it).

 I can see why so many Yelpers seem to enjoy this place- the food is great and the food came out faster than it does at Mickey D's. Osha needs to open their next location in Chicago!
author: Andrea R.

description:
Maybe it was the awesome company of 9 who I ate with, or it was the late hour of the night that we were eating, perhaps even the intense round of Karaoke that we had just finished, but whatever the reason, this meal was DELICIOUS!  

Although everyone claimed, "I'm not that hungry," we still ended up ordering one entree per guest.  Running down the list- we had duck curry, pad thai, spring rolls (real ones.. not the disgusting fried things.. which are technically eggrolls), crab fried rice, papaya salad, and some deep fried dumpling thing.  I got my teeth into everything except for the deep fried dumpling thing, and it was all WONDERFUL.  

The duck curry was a perfect mixture of spicy and sweet and the duck was perfectly cooked.  The crab fried rice actually had real pieces of crab in it with the hint of yummy fresh crab fishiness.  Papaya salad and pad thai- typical fair, but good, none-the-less.  

The highlight of the meal was the Lychee Ice Tea!  Intensely refreshing and a perfect compliment to the savory meal.  

Service was prompt, professional, and polite.  Food came out with the quickness!  The restaurant was lively, comfortable, and clean. 

Definitely a place I'd return to if I was in the neighborhood but not a place I'd drive out of my way for.  Keep this restaurant on your list of staples if you're an SF resident or are passing through and need some quick grub.
author: An N.

description: I love... love... LOVE Osha Thai Noodle Cafe! There are a few of them in SF but this is the one that I always go to! The food is sooooo GOOD!!! I highly recommend Osha! The selection is good and you can't beat the prices!!! Plus, they are open late and always go home full. So make your stomach happy and go try Osha real soon! Enjoy!
author: Matt C.

description: OMG.. a friend recommend this place if we were ever in town. so we gave it a try.  It was ok the sum tom was not all that great.. the man bathroom was dirty all tagged up. server not to friendly. so i didn't want to leave a tip. and the guy behind the counter said " you have to leave a tip " I Was like WTF in my head. and left a dollar tip. That was the last last last last did i say last EN-how last time we are ever going back there. "Till next time my food lover.. till next time."
author: Rcd M.

description:
Out of all the food places open really late in the city (til 3am on a Fri night in my case), this is definitely one of the best to go to. Diners are always pretty reliable, but if u want some real food, this is definitely a good choice. Always liked osha, and this location is actually not bad for a late night restaurant. The parking isn't too bad, and it's super easy to find. i was expecting some kind of super casual setting, but it's actually a decent bar/restaurant type of place. 

My friend and I shared the tofu & prawns spring roll as an appetizer, which was pretty good. I loved the sauce, but the roll itself could be a bit more moist. The crab fried rice was super delicious, while the pad see-ew was just all right. I didn't really like how the spinach was kinda bitter...
overall I'm glad I discovered this comfy lil thai late-night restaurant in the city. Finally somewhere else I can depend upon besides Mels or Dennys :P
author: Louisa L.

description: Decent happier hour. Delicious crispy calamari. And I had two lychee martinis. For being a Monday night they were over staffed with slow service, which lost them a star. That wouldn't  stop me from going back though.
author: Jacqueline O.

description:
Not sure if its because i've been deprived of good food since i was in college all year, but this was pretty good! I usually don't eat at places like this, but my sister was treating, and im there whenever there is free food o-o

Started with a calamari salad, which was kind of flavorless until we got to the bottom. Maybe we had to mix it around or something? But big chunks of calamari so it was good.

Wait wasn't too long, always fun to stand outside and watch the people walk/drive by.
Their fried rice is really flavorful and not overcooked. The crab one was really good, however the pineapple one tasted a bit bland. Also ordered Pa ke mow (SP!?) which was also pretty good. Standard as far as thai food goes. 

VOLCANIC BEEF, YOU SO DELICIOUS. Once again, not sure if its because i haven't eaten steak in forever due to the high price of beef. The onion rings on the top were also good when dipped in the beef sauce. I don't like bell peppers -_- so there was just a huge mound of them at the end.

Waiters were like hawks with the water, every time i took a sip someone was there to refill it. A bit creepy, but Thanks for the effort :D Also maybe a good place for drinks ?_? A lot of people had various drinks.

Btw, Visit costco for giftcards to save $$!

Lisa if you are reading this, don't hurt me
author: Jeff L.

description:
Osha Thai....you continually please my palate every time that I come to eat here. The last time that I was here I had brought my friends my Florida and they looooooved this place. I have been coming to this place for 5 or 6 years now and I am never disappointed. I've seen this place change its decorations and paint and walls and everything of the sort about as many years as I have been going to this place. Haha. I love that this place is open late so I can get my late night fix or I'm coming our of a bar. 

The only downside is that prices have gone up considerably since I first started going here. 

However, I have become a loyal customer and will continue to frequent this place for years to come.
author: Kathy B.

description:
My experience summarized in these simple terms: good tom yum koong, undercooked pad thai noodles, average papaya salad. 

Service was quick and friendly.

PS Their spicy foods are NO JOKE. Their 'medium' spicy level caught me off guard.
author: Kat K.

description:
Came here late at night for some food and was impressed by how nice and clean it was instead.  The menu selection was extensive and everyone in the group ordered some sort of noodle dish.  

I ordered the Tom Yum Chicken with Egg noodles and I was not a fan of it.  It just did not taste like Tom Yum soup that I'm used to.  However, once I tried a bit of my friend's Pad See Yew, I was pretty in love with it.  The veggies were crispy and the noodles were wonderful.  I really wished I had ordered that instead.
author: Anna V.

description:
DEEEEEEEE- Licious!   Some of the best Pad See-Ew i've ever had!   

you might have to wait a bit for a table, but it will be worth the wait...

My bestie and i have eaten here several times and they never let me down!  We usually have the Pad See-Ew and whatever the waiter/waitress recommends for the night...   recently it was Pumpkin Curry and it was so good!

OH they actually have Tsing Tao which i have a hard time finding at Thai places in the southbay...
author: Phoenix D.

description:
This particular Osha location is definitely the hot spot after having a few drinks in town and for me this is no exception.  Osha has a few locations but I've only been to this one and the one on 2nd Street.  I prefer the Geary location when it comes to the quality of the food.  I always leave here satisfied.

My favorites are the chicken pad see ew, pumpkin curry over rice, crab fried rice, fried won tons, mango with sticky rice, cashew nut chicken and a cool thai iced tea.
author: Erich D.

description: 4 stars for Crab Fried Rice, Chicken Larb and that eggplant-beef bites... it's our late night thai go to place...
author: Mara G.

description: If they had lemongrass tea (which is common in Thailand), I would have given this place six stars.
author: Hans M.

description: Thai boat noodle soup always get me to come back to Osha!!! By far the best in the city!
author: Julie F.

description:
This place has really gone downhill since its heydays. Went there for lunch on Friday and spent $30 for two dishes (Pineapple fried rice and Pad Thai). Both were subpar, lukewarm and a big disappointment from years past. 

The prices have gone way up. If we had known they were charging $12 for a plate of rice at lunch time, we would have gone somewhere else that charge half that. Not surprisingly, the place was nearly empty.
author: Pat Y.

description:
I love this place! I've been coming here (and recommending it) since 2007.  The best items on the menu are the noodle soup bowls.  Seriously, I've done trips to the city simply to eat some noodle soup here.  The Long Island Iced Teas are pretty good as well.

I love this place for lunch, dinner, or late night eating.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Really good thai food for cheap! The food comes out fast. I was reallllllllly hungry, so we ordered a ton of dishes and ate family style, but it has always been very cheap per person. Despite being cheap and fast, the food is actually really good and flavorful. The beef salad is my favorite.

This place is great, unfortunately it is in a tough neighborhood & there is never any parking.
author: Stella C.

description:
**BEST DUCK CURRY IN SAN FRANCISCO**

After my dining experience at Luce, I was left starving, so Osha Thai salvaged the night with its roasted duck curry at 11PM. 

OMG. So good. The best curry I have ever had. Yes, that good. 

It's open until 3AM, awesome.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
author: Betty N.

description:
Lawyer P, the professional party girl of the crew knew to come here before the 2:00 AM rush.  And so the 8 of us came here for a late night snack after a few hours spent at Bourbon & Branch.  I don't have a particularly finicky palette, I am aware and have come to accept this of myself.  So while the presentation of the food at Osha was nice, and the service was pretty good - as the 8 of us guzzled water like camels (did you know they drink upwards of 8 gallons a day?) the food itself was rather bland.  I had the tom yum noodle soup and like a Monet, good from far, but far from good.  Ironically Van was craving my food several nights later ... and this is ironic because she lived in Thailand for a year.  

I'll probably go again because I'm sure I'll be too drunk to resist (or remember).  Next time though, I'll get appetizers and fried food.  You can't go wrong with fried food.
author: Kathleen W.

description:
Good food at affordable prices. However, in order to dine here you need to be willing to brave a crowd of partying hipsters and the most soul-crushing party soundtrack possible. Even at 3 p.m. in the afternoon on a Wednesday you'll be treated to Ke$sha's latest dance mix about getting wasted and having unprotected sex with random dudes. 

I have yet to find a bad thing on the menu, but my plan recently has been to get it to go. Otherwise I leave happily full but with a headache due to either the blaring techno or from being seated next to a table of hungover 22-year-olds who alternate between trying to out-volume one another about how awesome they are and texting people they'd rather be hanging out with. 

If you really want a good show, though, stop by around 2 a.m. in the morning on the weekend. The place stays open late to satisfy the booze-woozies of the party crowd, so there's a slew of wasted people outside, bumming cigarettes from each other and swaying back and forth. Hang out for a few minutes and you'll get to listen to two bombed girls in micro-miniskirts yell at each other about how the other one is, like, a total bitch or something. Who wins that fight? WE do, society. WE DO. 

Also, the Asian employees seem to hate everybody who walks in, but with that crowd I don't blame them.
author: Drew H.

description:
This is the fourth Osha I've been to. It is the original location and is easy to get to if you're downtown or near civic center. 

S and I met a good friend here for dinner to catch up before she saw a show near by. 

We started off with a round of drinks. A mango rita, pom pom rita and a singha. 

I ordered the pad thai with tofu and no peanuts or bean sprouts (don't ask). S ordered the pineapple fried rice and L ordered the chicken panang curry. Everyone enjoyed their food.

The restaurant got crowded fast and was filled by the time we were done. This location isn't as nice (decor wise) as the other locations. 

I'll be back if I'm in the area and in need of some reliable thai food.
author: Erica C.

description:
After a night at my staples, Ambassador or Rye, I love that I can walk next door in a drunken stupor and get fed.  There's always a super long line if you're going after drinking, so be prepared to wait.

I always have to order their Pad See Ew and Volcanic Beef, the perfect combo when drunk!  The beef is so yummy and tender and it's served with onion rings!

However, there is a HUGE WARNING!  Beware of the Osha Thai food stealer!  My friends and I were eating there one night and some guy just stole a dish off our table and walked out the door.  A server ran after him, but he wasn't able to catch up.  They were nice enough to replace our dish, but apparently this has happened before since a girl at another table informed us.  Ridiculous.

But besides all that nonsense, I still come back because of the great food and convenience.  Also, I secretly hope he comes back and tries to steal our food again cuz then I'll be ready with fork in hand.
author: Jane N.

description:
Had the tom yum noodles. it was alright. I wished it was more spicy. i should probably go back and try the rice dishes. that's what i remembered about it from college. 

It's a nice place for food after a night out at the bar or clubs :) opens late!
author: Ai L.

description:
Downnnnhilllll.. My husband and I used to come to this Osha location since it opened up. Yes, a LONG time ago. The portions were bigger, and the food IMO tasted better. 

The last time we went to Osha before last nights visit, is probably about a year ago. Since then the signature dish we ordered was the spicy string beans with beef. Usually we order 2 of the same dish because we both enjoyed it THAT much. We would also occasionally order the squid balls. 
Last night the beef was so tough, it was like chewing on beef jerky. The string beans had a nice consistency. I ordered, and was charged extra for tofu. Of course I wanted fresh tofu, and in my order I got fried tofu. Really? Oh wells, we took it to-go so I couldn't send it back to the kitchen. 
The squid balls were funky. No other way to describe it. 

The place was jam packed tho, they must be ordering different dishes than me.
author: Alice E.

description:
Man, I think my trip to Thailand in 2005 spoiled me as far as Thai food goes, because I'm hardly ever satisfied with whatever I eat here, whether it's for taste or authenticity reasons. 

I ordered this dish (I think it was called Pranam) made of tofu, veggies, and beef covered in peanut sauce, and normally I love peanut sauce but I couldn't even stomach the idea of finishing my food. I'm polite, so I had my food boxed up to go rather than leaving 3/4 of it on my plate like some people, but I definitely will not be ordering that in the future. 

To be fair, my friends' dishes - pad thai and this noodle dish that looked and tasted like pad thai except with different noodles - were pretty good. I might be better off ordering something like that if I ever come back here again.
author: Aivy C.

description:
I love Thai food, it is my favorite! I liked Osha (not loved). The food is good and it is served in these very cute asymmetrical plates. The vibe is good with a very modern look (one thing: I hate going to places that wreak of the food I am about to eat and this place does, it is not a bad smell I just hate smelling like I was in the kitchen making the food when I leave). They are open until 2:00am so this is a great place for a late and nice sit down dinner. 

I ordered the usual Thai iced tea which was up to standards. I had the veggie tom kha soup which would have been great if they did not add scallions to it. Then I had some spring rolls which were supposed to be appetizers for everyone but there were only three of them and they were tiny. But hey they were good. Then we had some yellow curry chicken with jasmine rice which was pretty delicious. We topped dinner off with fried bananas and coconut ice cream which brought these guys back up to four stars for me. Overall the food and service are good, the late hours are great, and the prices are reasonable. 

Side note:  the bathroom is gross!!!..but hey it is SF.
author: Caro S.

description:
Great customer service - brought over a high chair right away for the baby and took care of the stroller. then they got water for us.

Great food - the food was awesome. no idea what we ordered, but this chicken dish was soooo goooood.
author: Lee E.

description:
Pros:
I think this is the original Osha and it is marvelous.  Try the spicy beef salad here--of all the locations this one does that dish best.  Spicy eggplant is always great as is any of the curries.

Cons:
