The location is... "challenging"

Fun:
Watching the interesting characters stumbling around this particular neighborhood late at night (Osha is open late, maybe 1am or 2am)
author: Mike G.

description:
Went on a rainy weekday for a bowl of spicy chicken coconut soup and some spring rolls. 

Loved the big wooden seats at the booths. Place seemed clean and lots of good light with giant windows and a corner location. Certain amount of homeless activity outside though, as this place is on the edge of the Tenderloin.

The soup broth was creamy and super-rich. Unbelievably delicious. However there were several slices of tough/inedible lemon grass inside, and the chicken, even though soaking in the liquid, was kind of tough. Should have been cooked differently before being added to the soup.

The spring rolls were odd. I am a fresh spring roll aficionado and have tried them at probably a hundred restaurants. This was the first time I'd had them wrapped with something other than rice paper. The wrappers were an opaque thick egg-noodle type sheet. It wasn't unpleasant... just unexpected... and a little odd. The ingredients inside were fresh, the presentation nice, and the peanut dipping sauce was good too.

I was served by two different people -- neither who made any effort to connect with me... to smile or be extra-nice. But they were efficient enough, and I can't really complain about the service. I just like waitstaff who seem to want me to be happy...

So overall... I'm not sure if I'd go back. I didn't really have a bad experience, but nothing was so compelling to urge me to go back.  Reviews say they're open very late. Maybe that would be a better time to come by when my standards were a little lower -- than for a workday lunch.
author: Zoe H.

description:
I Love the Crab Fried Rice!!

..I always order to go because its always crowded, but the to-go containers are deep in depth, so I'm still satisified with my to-go portion.

..the employees are also friendly  ^_^
author: LoLa L.

description: Yellow Mango Curry. Word. The item was on the Specials list, and my gosh it deserves to be there. It was sweet, yet savorful to the max, and i wished that bowl was like Mary Poppin's bag. Their OSHA Volcano Mojito was freaking godzilla as well. Best i've ever drank in an Asian restaurant. Crab rice was good as well, and their Pad Thai was alright.
author: Eva Z.

description:
Went here for lunch on a weekday. Not many people so service was fast. The menu was easy to understand with detailed descriptions of everything. I ordered the papaya salad, which didn't impress me as much as I expected. But as far as the other items on the menu, everything tasted fresh and clean. 

My friend mentioned that this place does get packed around evening time, so just be aware of that. I have personally never come here at night.

Nothing to really complain about with Osha Thai. If you are in the area and want some Thai food, this is definitely a spot to check out.
author: Jenny B.

description:
I ate here last December at 2 am, shortly after besting my friend Andy in a drinking contest.  Singing David Bowie loudly, Kathy and I stumbled through the Tenderloin, looking for our hotel when the smells of Osha beckoned us inside.  Even at the late hour, Osha was packed. The service was superfast, and the food was uniformly good.

Now I must admit I was very drunk, but I was very impressed by the kee mao and the fish cakes, which were smaller than average, but fresh, crispy, and full of kaffir lime leaf.  Many thai restaurants make these on the large side, and they don't get them out fast enough, so instead of a hot, crispy bite, you end up with a soggy, leaden, overly chewy fish cake.  The kee mao was very spicy, very good.  We also had some chicken sate that wasn't that memorable, but certainly not terrible. I'd definitely return.
author: Anthony R.

description: Easy location to find and parking was good on a Sunday night. Service was quick and cordial. Portions were enough to fill everyone up. Soups were delicious. Pad Ke Mao was excellent.  Flavor was great.  Will come here again. All attendants were very polite.
author: Lance K.

description: I came here for dinner on Valentines Day, it was trendy and sweet! Our table had cute little candles and  fresh roses. The food was great and the service was quick.  I had the cashew chicken which was more memorable than my date that night!  I withheld one star because of the disgusting bathroom.  I have been back after a night of drinking and they stay open until after most clubs close!
author: Lisa A.

description: $50 for 2 champagne flutes of a weird cocktail and 2 orders of pad thai?? Really? This place definitely falls in line with the rest of the Oshas about town. Mediocre food that is way overpriced. I got shrimp pad thai (had to special order due to my pepper allergy), and it was meh at best. The shrimp was overcooked, there was no flavor to the sauce and the noodles were cooked to death. Do yourself a favor and go to another Thai place, you won't be hard pressed to find one around here.
author: Erica C.

description: This place is in a scary neighborhood and did not look like much from the outside.  Inside is yummy spicy food. I had the spicy noodles with Duck. This place is easy walking distance from union square and the lower nob hill hotels
author: Carmen D.

description:
I miss this place. Used to live two blocks away in the tendernob and come here all the time, usually drunk around 1-2am. It really hits the spot when you've had a bit to drink. If you're coming in after bar hopping or clubbing and reading this, get the pad see ew (instead of the pad thai, trust me, i love american favorites like pad thai but the pad see ew is superior here) and the panang curry. 

Don't worry, this review isn't just based off of drunken experiences. I've gotten takeout for dinner and it tastes good sober, too.
author: Sylvia L.

description:
If you're in the city and you want some good and authentic "fast food" thai dishes, come here!!

I discovered Osha 10+ yrs ago when I was waitressing for a pool billiards on Geary.  After working all nite and getting off at 2am, there wasn't much choice besides fast food or burritos, which probably wouldn't sit too well in my tummy before bed time. And then I found Osha!! Mind you, I loveeeeeeeee thai food, so after ordering my first dish from them (crab fried rice with fried chicken on top) it was all history...i was hooked. 

Despite the manny locations they staryed to open up as time went by, I vow to only go to the one in TL on geary and leavenworth. Its the best! Its funny how they had maybeee 20 (exaggerating) remodels, hehe...but of course the food remains the same.

So this is the best after the club, big group of friends, really good authentic thai food restaurant in sf! My favorite dishes are green curry fried rice, spicy string beans, any of their curry..esp the duck curry, their noodle pan fried dishes, volcanic beef....you know? ALL their dishes are reallly good, lol. So if ur not afraid of visiting TL, go get some realllly good thai food here!
author: CoCo V.

description:
I understand that there are several other Oshas in the bay area, and was told that the other places were cleaner and had better decor. Well, I personally think the place is decent enough, we'll see about their food.

We ordered quite a few items:
- Som tum salad: okay
- Tom kha noodle soup with glass noodles: excellent, but the coconut milk was a bit thick, I was they thinned it down a little.
- Crab fried rice: good
- Osha thai fried rice: good
- Spicy cat fish: okay

I would say that their food did not disappoint, but did not wow me either, but I would come back here again. My rating for them is between 3 and 4, more like 3.5.

My mom and my aunt were complaining about how gross their bathroom was, but when I checked it out, it was not that bad (I've seen worst), it was just plastered with a lot of stickers and graffiti, that's all.
author: Arie R.

description:
Good, really pretty food.
Pricy.  I'd like to give it fewer stars because I wish it were less expensive, but the food is good.  Generally good service.  Generally good waitstaff.  Sometimes during very busy times it's hard to get the staff's attention to place your order.

Tip:  If you're only there during your lunch break, ensure you let them know so they understand you're under time constraints.
author: Wyman L.

description:
Highly recommended. Amazing food, prices and service. Best of all, it stays open until 3am. What more could you ask for?

If you're in SF, you owe it to yourself to check this place out.
author: Jimmy B.

description:
I LOVE Osha! They open late and their portions are huge! My three favorite food from here are:
- Naked Prawn: fresh raw prawns with garlic, chillies, and lime juice. You can adjust the spiciness to your liking but I'll stick to my extra spicy-OMGThere'sABombInMyMouth spicy. 
- Duck Fried Rice: A bit greasy but totally delicious. Half a portion of this normally will leave me in a food coma, but happy that I still have leftover. Yay!
- Duck Noodle Soup: Lately this has been my new obsession. Something about the broth that makes me super happy. 

Oh, did I mention that I LOVE Osha?!?!?
author: C T.

description: I met a friend at Osha last week and my dining experience was something of a mixed bag. First, the ambiance. The dark wash on the benches, the large windows, the friendly and attentive staff, that all appealed to me. I even enjoyed the chicken wing appetizer we ordered as the chicken was crispy and succulent, and the sweet and sour sauce offered at delectable accompaniment. I'd say it was good, but not great. The problem for me was the entree. I ordered a pad thai-like dish that was supposed to contain soft shell crab, but there really wasn't any to be found. Given the price, I was rather disappointed. I would probably return to Osha, but I would likely only do so if suggested by another person, otherwise I need to try some of the other Thai restaurants in the area to see if they offer something more for the price.
author: Tory A.

description:
Osha's was surprisingly busy for a late dinner on a Tuesday night. My girlfriends & I stumbled upon this place & decided to try it out; it was around 930PM but almost all the tables were filled. The outside definitely doesn't do justice for the inside. It seems like a take out place from the outside but inside the black furniture & dark decor make the place look sheik & clean.

The food & prices were also surprisingly good. We got an order of the pad thai, thai fried rice, & bbq chicken with a round of thai iced teas. Those three orders were enough to fill us three with some left overs to spare. 

My only reservation for this place was that it was VERY loud. I said it was a packed restaurant but I've been to many packed restaurants. It seemed like everyone & their parties were yelling at 3-4 octaves louder than regular. I say its more of a mid-twenties to thirties crowd at night. Everyone seems like they were going somewhere else after dinner.
author: Kris B.

description:
Service was bad this Saturday afternoon. Not sure why since the place was little under 1/2 full and with 2 servers for a small place.  Had pumpkin curry and mango salad. Curry was not curry. It was so watery that it reminded me of a Thai iced tea (and same color too)! Mango salad was extremely salty and sour. Bad. 

I don't understand why people love this chain. It is only decent. There are so many great Thai restaurants in SF. 

Taste was decent but you can't go wrong with curry powder since another company makes it. Recommend trying other Thai restaurants that are family run.
author: Linda C.

description: I love the Kai Kua, (garlic chicken noodle) a hard to find dish and pretty good here'
author: Trevor M.

description: Great portion size, but personally I like more veggies in my spicy basil. But the flavor was fantastic and the staff friendly.
author: Douglas T.

description: This was one of favorite restos when I first came to SF many years ago. My favorite was their Tom Yum noodle soup. Over the years I found other places that made more authentic Tom Yum noodle soups. But this place was still a dependable favorite even though it basically caters to the late night crowd now. Soooo disappointed now as I had the noodles last night and it's totally gone to the dogs. The soup is made from soup base cubes now. Probably Maggi brand. I know that exact taste. Never thought these guys would get this bad. I just had to write it up. I guess they don't really care anymore as the clientele doesn't either. The o Viche I had was good though. But how do you go about making soup from artificial maggi stock cubes??
author: Shaowen L.

description:
Had dinner here yesterday with our best friend and a date. This was due to recommendations on Face book by my network of friends. I heard so much about this place so I just had to try it myself. Our idea was to hit the one on Embarcadero because this one I hear has better menu and a few items that are not listed in this location are there..I should have tried that one first, but hay this was the closest we can get to.. as a group I suggest you do Ala cart so you all can have a try on everyone's dish of choice.

Our appetizers were blaaah (could have gone without it)
we had the THAI FISH CAKE seasoned with curry paste and green bean with cucumber sauce ( love the cucumber sauce salad on the side but the fish cake was ok... and FRIED CHICKEN WINGS
which were deep fried chicken wings topped with homemade sauce and crispy basil,,(don't order this, personally my own home made friend chicken tasted better.) there was nothing special about both of these dishes.

Main dishes I ordered the  beef stir fried with cashew nuts, onion, garlic and bell pepper, surprisingly good, It had a bunch of dried red chili yet it was not spicy.  Best friend's date ordered noodles (flat) or the LAHT NAH which is fat rice noodles with Chinese broccoli, garlic, and mushrooms in gravy sauce, this was also tasty. Best friend ordered DEEP FRIED PRAWNS with a home sweet sauce.

Of course we had to have rice.. BEST SUGGESTION is the CRAB FRIED RICE..truly flavourful and good. We also got an extra side order of steam rice just in case

Desserts: I suggest the 
STICKY RICE WITH MANGO (my fav)
FRIED ICE CREAM  (my group fav)

you can't go wrong with either of those.. price is reasonable a tab of almost $20 per person (including tip) . their Tai Ice tea was just ok too.
author: Ateh M.

description: I love OSHA! I used to work in financial district so I would go to the one in embarcadero center more but I ordered from time to time from here :) I love their Tom yum soup wit chicken since I'm allergic to shrimp. And one tip never ask for Very Spicy...i love spicy food but I couldn't finish it :| after that painful experience i ask them to just make it spicy and not "very spicy"
author: Rio S.

description:
The 'original' Osha.  I actually liked this spot better than their more trendy locations around the city.  The food was pretty good and the service was adequate.  It was what I was looking for at 930 on a Monday night I suppose.

Food: Volcanic Beef - very good, Fried rice - pretty good, Tham Yam Soup - not bad.  

I was not floored by anything in particular here but it got the job done.  It is on the pricier side so you could be spending about $20-$30 with drinks and appetizers which will definitely make you shake your head.  

My search for the best Thai restaurant in SF continues....
author: Aasim K.

description: OSHA Tom Yum soup, volcanic beef and Kobe beef and eggplant skewers are my faves.
author: My D.

description:
I've dined here a few times already, and the service and food have been pretty decent and sometimes really tasty. But, tonight's experience was not okay. Half of our party received their orders within 15 minutes after ordering. The other half of us were waiting around, twiddling our thumbs. We had to ask random servers if they forgot about us, because our rude server was busy rolling her eyes somewhere throughout the restaurant and didn't get a chance to see her for the rest of the night. 

We ended up asking them to put our food in to go boxes, because literally 45 minutes had already past, and the half of our party that got their food early, were already cleaning off their plates. Lol. I understand slow service when it's busy, but um there were about 4 empty tables around us. No one was hustling and bustling or anything. All they had to do was inform us that our food would take awhile, instead of ignoring the issue.

So disappointed.
author: Valerie N.

description:
It was so so , nothing spectacular about the place. The taste ,decor, portion was decent. The place was packed though.
Our orders came quickly, but the waiter forgot to write our friend's order.
They didn't have any proper baby chair , so if you happen to bring your baby ,expect to put your baby seat  awkwardly over a wood chair.
For us, we would like to explore other Thai food places if we visit SF again!
author: Mr F G And Mrs M S.

description:
3.5
Great service! They refilled my water 5x without having to ask and promptly served our food and took away finished dishes

The food was either hit or miss. The lamb although somewhat tasty, was very small portioned. 4 pieces for $16 isnt really worth it. The osha sea curry was really flavorful and had a variety of seafood and vegetables. I highly recommend this dish. The osha spaghetti was pretty terrible. It tasted as if they mixed a bunch of canned mushrooms, vegetables, and bamboo shoots together with spaghetti noodles. 

For dessert, I highly recommend the deep fried ice cream! Its a must try for those who have never had it before as the ice cream felt as if it was frozen to -100 C before it was deep fried as it was brick hard although the outside was crispy. 

The location is convenient for clubbing as its within walking distance. Bottomline: One of the better thai places ive been to for taste and service but the portions are kinda small and its a tad more expensive than other thai places. I would recommend this place. Read Tina A's review as it has more details on other dishes here.
author: Robert Y.

description:
Don't bother coming for dinner. Take out, great. Lunch, maybe. The food is what keeps me coming back. It is delicious, and I like a lot of different things on the menu. Also, I used to live practically next door so it was convenient. 

But the "service" if you can even call it that, is atrocious at night. I know it's an Asian place, and Thai restaurants have notoriously bad service, but where do they find these people?! The times I've been for lunch when there's almost no one in the restaurant I get average service. Sometimes they even get my order right and give me a water refill! 

My point in two brief stories:

I tend to get the fried prawns pretty often, and it has always come with fried rice. But one time I go in, and it comes back with steamed rice. I told the server I wanted fried rice, and she acted like it was a HUGE deal that I hadn't specified that before. Then today I came for lunch, and I made sure the guy knew I wanted my rice fried and he acted like I was crazy because it "always comes with fried rice." Maybe you should tell that to everyone who works there.

Another memorable time was when I came with my Asian boyfriend. The server approaches the table and immediately looks at him asks "Are you Thai?" WTF?! Not even a "hi", but lemme just find out first, what race are you exactly? Do you go up to a black person and say, "Are you Kenyan?" NO! Because it shouldn't fucking matter where your ancestors came from! Why do people EVER think this is an appropriate question? Is it because you're going to treat us differently if he is Thai? Maybe my race is why I get such shitty service here. I seriously wouldn't be surprised.
author: Miranda M.

description:
The food was a 3 but since they live up to their tag line of "speedy service, generous portions, open late" I gotta give them 4 stars for delivering.
As others mentioned, Papaya Salad was awesome, could not stop eating it! Didn't care so much for the Tom Kha.....tasted strange?
Pad Thai was just ok, Pad Khee Mao was really good as was the Volcanic Beef and fried rice.
Overall, it was a memorable experience and I would recommend to anyone.
author: Carmen C.

description: This is the only place that i know of with thai noodle soups!! Not authentic enough for my liking but good enough to satisfy a Thai craving. Get the noodle soups!
author: Dorcas T.

description:
Oh my
Splendid
Hella good
Ah, heaven.
author: Shinny L.

description:
Always a good backup place to go-- usually come here after a long day of work, or need to find some late night food.

The food is cheap and filling. What I can't quite comprehend is that no matter how spicy I order the food, it always comes out super spicy!

Recently the Thai Iced Tea is getting more and more sugary which I have stopped having.

Seating is ample and people pretty much eat and go. The takeout is also pretty fast.
author: T L.

description:
OK. Great for late night meal. Crap service. Always gets take out order wrong. Too commercial. No character.

Like i said, ok food, great for late night. There is also a lot of drunk people from the bars and clubs at this time causing chaos inside and ruckus outside. Once while getting takeout I saw a fight happen right at the entrance.
author: Dilip R.

description:
Love Love Love!

I don't why they're so underrated here, but I love this place.  It's way better than King of Thai.  What's even better is that they open late on the weekends and their price is less than their other restaurants.

I love their Pad Thai here, best I had, the noodles don't clump up like how other places do, also they give you a lot. 

I tried other dishes here too, from their Volcanic Beef to their Catfish and they were all win win dishes.

Hands down, if you're craving for some Thai and it's late at night, you should definitely come here.
author: Mimi P.

description: Awesome late night Thai food.
author: M T.

description:
Ive been to this location 2 times and BOTH times, the food has not failed me. I think hands down, BEST, PENANG CURRY!!! My last visit was on Saturday and we stumbled in around 2am, the wait was about 30min... long but worth it. We ordered Pad See EW (Good as well), Penang Curry (BEST)- chicken, and a fried rice. All the dishes were flavorful and the prices are pretty reasonable. For 3 dishes the total came to about $34, we had a party of 4 (but only 3 of us ate) and we had enough food left over for another meal!

I will definitely come back for the PENANG CURRY!!!!
author: Elisa T.

description:
This is the spot to go to after the bar and clubbn. Food is delish! Just make sure to head over there before 1am on Fridays and Saturdays. The wait gets long after. 

Favorites here:
Beef Wasabi Rolls
Fried Wontons
Pad Thai
Pad See Ew
Yellow Curry with Duck
Pineapple Fried Rice
Fried Chicken (A MUST)
Thai Iced Tea
author: Jenny P.

description:
The food here is totally better than in some of the other Osha locations (def better than Union Street, maybe SOMA Osha is a little better). But O.M.G. the service sucks.

We got seated. 20 min later, I go to the bar to try and place an order, the "lady" there tells me to "go back to my seat, someone is coming". Another 10 mins, I see a waiter approaching, but unfortunately another table saw him too and they started yelling to get his attention... and got it. 35 mins just to order!
author: Mira S.

description:
Best Thai Food on the Planet... It doesn't get better than this.
This is the Original Location, all other location is just for the
aesthetics, but the cooking is not the same.

Hands down to the chef who never left that kitchen.

I've been to Thailand and all over southeast Asia, and still this is one of the best Thai place on earth. I've been religiously going here for over 10 years since I learn of this place.

Must gets:
1.) Nake Prawn [ Thai Spicey ]
2.) Penang Chicken
3.) Crab Fried Rice
4.) Pad See Eww

Don't get:
1.) Fried Tofu , seriously?
2.) Spring Roll, come on...
3.) Satay.. not so good.
author: Calvin C.

description:
This is my GO TO place for Thai food when I am in Downtown/TL. I've been coming here for years, and the food is still just as good as when I first ate here. If you have not tried this place...you have to come here and try their food.

When you say you want the food spicy...they give you spicy...not like other places where you can barely taste any heat. They also have some Chinese Red pepper sauce and Saracha if you want to add more. 

Recommendations:

Volcanic Beef (I ALWAYS order this. The beef they cook with is SUPER tender, the flavor has a nice sweet, spicy, soy sauce, and ginger flavor to it...sooo good!)

Angel Wings (If you like Chicken wings...you will like these wings. They glaze them with a honey and garlic sauce that taste amazing.)
author: Nick C.

description:
I honestly couldn't afford to become a 'regular' here, so thank God I live far away.  Almost $14.00 for one order of Tom Kha Noodles?  Ouchie.  

But on the real, that coconut noodle soup was dreamy.  Sexual.  

Maybe I'll come in here more often if I get a raise, ya know, so I can afford it.
author: Rachelle P.

description: Expected more from Osha based on all I'd heard. I'll cut 'em some slack for it being takeout as opposed to eating there, but the pad thai was weirdly textured and kinda hard. Eggplant was oily like at most places, but usually that oil is a tradeoff for taste. Here it was +oil, - taste. Same with the crab fried rice. Tone it down with the oil!
author: Kevin L.

description:
I was just reading over my old review below, since I was at the original location last night. It's funny, a lot has changed since then, and we're now in a city that is nearly thai'd up with too many Osha outposts. And while there is something to be said for the sleek and modern aesthetic in their newer spots, this Geary one is a classic and reminds you of why Osha is so successful in the first place: pretty darn thai-riffic Thai food. 

I can pass judgment on a Thai establishment based on how they prepare their pad thai and pad see ew dishes, and Osha has it down pat. My group also dove into their Angel Wings, a nice and crispy rendition of chicken wings with a tangy, sweet sauce all over them. 

So while I have yet to be at this location during daylight hours, I can tell you this with some authority: If you're looking to thai one on after a night of revelry, the original Osha will satiate and satisfy even the most thai-tanic of appethaites. 

And by the by: If you don't care for my puns, that's just too bad 'cause it's my party and I'll thai if I want to.
author: Nish N.

description:
There's something to be said about this Osha Thai. This is one of the earliest locations, you know, before it became a big deal to serve everything on soup spoons and in delicate little piles atop rectangular plates. Before the razzle dazzle decor of the Marina and Embarcadero locations. 

Conveniently parked between the border of Tenderloin and Nob Hill, down the street from Ambassador and Rye, this grubby place manages to stay fairly packed from open to close. During the daytime there are many a family that dine here with their children, and as nightfall comes and goes, the crowd gets quickly replaced by drunk people looking for some quick grub. 

They've raised the prices over the years and the rice dishes remain inconsistently hotter than the noodle plates, but there's still a certain satisfying quality to eating here with your fellow wasted friends. Big steaming bowls of soup, plates mounded full of rice noodles, and coconut-rich creamy curries. Who cares if you look like you were run over by a bus with too long a night out on the town and one too many rounds at the bar? Everyone else is just as weary-eyed, loud-mouthed, and sloshed as you. Service is always fast and to the point. The long, thick, dark wooden tables easily fit small and large parties of people. 

The downside is there is only one bathroom and it's unisex. I still remember the night when one poor drunk was swaying, his hand over his mouth, his head bowed. His friend was holding him up by his arm, both of them desperately waiting for the bathroom to empty so he could clear his stomach. But the person inside took a long time, and the guy couldn't hold it any longer. Out everything spewed against the door and floor. Finally, when he was done retching his guts out, the door finally opened and the surprised bathroom patron had the ugly task of trying to step back into the dining area without stepping on the goo. 

To the staff's credit, they cleared the mess away pretty quickly. 

Just another rowdy night at Osha.
author: ChiYan T.

description:
I say follow the drunks. I find it amazing if you can be piss drunk, unable to form a complete sentence, manage to mispronounce the simplest of words, not remember a damn thing the next morning, and still be able to know exactly where you want to eat and exactly what to order in the middle of the night. With their stumbling and slurred speech, these guys and gals might seem to lack credibility, but I've learned to entertain their suggestions, as long as they don't yack in my back seat.   

Here you will find characters from all walks of life (showtimes from 1-3am).  I've been here day and night. Only late night patrons require the following instructions to avoid getting bitten by the wild animals. #4 applies to everyone.
1. Get your name on the list ASAP with the EXACT amount of people in your group, arriving at different times? Good luck.
2. Don't wander off, people like me will deny your name was ever called as I take your table. 
3. There is actually a small waiting area with 2-3 chairs inside, down the small steps. Waiting on the curb or in front of oncoming traffic is highly discouraged. 
4. Noobs: Order these dishes and thank me later
 -Duck Curry
 -Duck Curry
 -Duck Curry
 -Crab fried rice
 -Volcanic Beef 
 -Pumpkin Curry
 -Last but not least, Duck Curry

The service has always been fast and they'll get you what you need when asked while doing the same for 10 other tables. Don't expect to chit chat with your waiter, go find a shrink on your own time. if you can't deal with the crowd and the energy it brings, come during the day, it's a lil more mellow. I haven't been disappointed yet so lets hope it stays that way.

O and parking is a bizzznatch so be prepared to circle around the block a few times or take a little stroll.
author: Phu H.

description: If I wrote this review 5yrs ago it might have been a 4 star spot, but since then they've opened up shop all over the city and the prices got higher and the food got worse. What greedy little bastards.
author: Camille R.

description:
Osha is one of SF's most known names in Thai food. They own a large conglomerate of restaurants, each differing in quality, price, and selection.

The Noodle Cafe on Geary is a simple dinner spot. It's location near the TL isn't that appealing, nor is the ambience/decor, but the food does it justice.

Everything on the menu is between $9-15 (avg of $11) so don't be fooled into thinking it's a cheap/pricey Thai spot. It's right in between.

It was a freezing July day in SF so I had to get some jasmine tea. To my dismay, they came out with it in a tea packet that I had to open and make myself with the hot unfiltered water. I was not happy to see that. At least make it for me, it's a restaurant. But the brand they used was really tasty at least.

* Tom Kha Noodles - Spicy coconut soup lemongrass, galangal and bean sprouts. It was way too sweet. The ingredients were high quality, but at least make it coconutty/sour and not like eating a jolly rancher. 2 star.

* Osha Spicy Dice - Salmon, red chili paste, coconut milk, string bean and crispy basil. The coconut milk and chili paste made it perfect. The fish was cooked perfectly and was extremely tender. Even the veggies were perfect in this sauce mix. I highly recommend it. 5 star.

I'd come back to try their other Chef's specials that you don't get at the usual Thai restaurants. 3.5 star.
author: Chuck N.

description: good location, but mediocre food. My disc was very bland, I had flat wide noodles with beef which tasted very dry and did not have much flavor, I had to poor bunch of hot sauce to make it interesting. I definitely had better Thai dishes. Does not worth a stop.
author: Nat S.

description: Modern decor. Nice waiters and attentive servers. We got seated as soon as we arrived. I ordered the Duck curry and button had the papaya salad, everyone else ordered fried calamari, pad Thai, and crab fried rice. I loved my duck curry. It was sweet and filled with tons of duck. Great golly guys!! I wasn't... Well I was expecting it to be delicious. ha ha the crab fired rice was pretty good as well. You get real bits of crab in it. The portions for a party of seven were huge!! The prices weren't bad. Each plate ran from 7.50 ~$13 yes guys it is SF we are talking about here. I would definitely recommend this place. Yummy Thai food!!
author: Vanna Y.

description:
Glad they decided to keep the modern chic decor of Bong Su. This location differs a little bit since it is segregated into different rooms (seating/bar/private room) unlike the 2nd street location where it's one big room, so the noise level is much better. Otherwise, the menu is the same as other locations and is both tasty and visually stimulating. Service is always friendly and quick, even though we had a large party.

We made reservations for new year's eve and got the private room since we had 16 people. The room is beautiful from the amazing chandeliers to the large wooden table that can easily seat 20+ people with plenty of eating space. Excellent place to have a large party. The only downside is the restroom is on the other side of the whole restaurant by the bar so its a bit of a walk.

- Crab Wontons: too creamy, but lots of crab meat, crispy
- Grilled Sea Bass: delicious! soft, good portion, sauce is a bit salty and tangy, bok choy good, and comes with coconut rice
author: Linda C.

description:
Glass in the food and rotten salmon for the win!

I have been to all the different OSHA locations in san Francisco and I usually eat at the embarcadero OSHA once a week for work, I love OSHA, I think it's excellent Thai food. This one however I went to the other night with my girlfriend and was I for a surprise. 

I ordered the same things I usually do so I know what to expect;
OSHA spicy dice ( salmon pieces in curry with string beans )
Fresh spring rolls (soooo good) 
And lastly a tom kah soup with shrimp. A favorite I've had probably 100 times before at various Thai restaurants. 

The spring rolls were the first ones to come out, I ate 2 of them, loving them like I usually do- they're really so good.. My girlfriend takes one and takes a bite- I hear a crunching sound like she's chewing on rocks. 
I look up at her as she's pulling little pieces of glass out of her mouth and hands them to me. she was bleeding from the gums and complained that something was stuck in her throat. 
One of the waiters accidentally walked by just as she pulled the glass pieces out of her mouth and he saw the whole thing and was very apologetic and asked if we wanted new spring rolls to which of course I said no thanks... 
At this point we should have probably left but I've never had a bad OSHA expiernce before so we decided to stay for the rest of the dishes. 

Next came the Tom Kah soup which was as good as ever, we shared that and then came the spicy dice.
We took one bite of the salmon only to realize that it was obviously old and rotten. Salmon is the one fish that's not supposed to taste fishy. And it was really really fishy. Gross. 

We finished up the soup told them about the rotten fish and asked for the check. 
They brought out the check on which they had taken off the spring rolls  and given us a 10% discount on the spicy dice + soup.
Seriously?? 10% discount for glass in your food? 
We paid and left. 

Next day I wrote an email to the general osha management explaining the situation to which I never got a reply..

For the next week my girlfriend was experiencing pain in her throat - undoubtedly because she had been cut by a piece of glass from the spring rolls.

That's my review.
Bon appetite.
author: Adam O.

description: Been coming here for years and still ranks as my favorite Thai restaurant in the Bay Area. The place is open late and gets very crowded all the time. The portions have remained the same and the prices are very reasonable as well. This place has remodeled so many times since 2000 and continues to change except their food. Their food stays true and continues to give me cravings after a night of clubbing in San Francisco, karaoke, or a long day of sightseeing. This place rocks literally with loud music and crowds of people waiting inside and outside. The flaw about this place, one bathroom for one person hahah...bbq chicken, fried chicken, won tons, yellow, penang curries, and so much more are offered here and are the best in town! I remember they had the coolest business cards too, printed on transparencies!
author: Danster L.

description:
After a few concoctions at Rye, my friend and I were ravenously hungry.  Though the bartender at Rye told us that Osha closed at midnight on Tuesdays, we discovered they are open until 1 a.m.  SCORE!!!

Pad See Ew (?) - rice noodles with chicken - so delicious and totally hits the spot.  Any Thai place that serves decent food and is open late night is good in my book.  It's the perfect location for late, late night dining.
author: Wendy L.

description:
On a chilly Sunday evening, my boyfriend and I hurried over to Osha on Geary/Leavenworth as I have been wanting to try it ever since I passed it while riding Muni 27 home one day.  It's an unassuming location that you would pass without blinking if you didn't know where it was exactly -- the restaurant sign is tiny so you really have to know the restaurant is there or else you'll never notice it on your own.  

We got a table right away by the window - score!  We ordered vegetable spring rolls, crab fried rice (yum!) and chicken with spicy green beans, cucumber salad, as we sipped water and tea.  It was tasty, yummy (although the green beans were a bit too spicy for me - I should've ordered it "mild" spicy) and the prices really weren't too bad.  All of that for about $30 + tip (it was on my boyfriend so it was free for me!).  The service was ok - they were attentive if you waved them down as they are a busy joint.

I'd definitely come back, especially since it's so close to my home.  

One tip:  If you're going to order a spicy dish, "medium" spicy had me sweating and my boyfriend was sweating too (his tolerance is higher than mine) - so make sure you know what your spicy tolerance is.  I am still building mine, so next time I'll order it "mild" spicy for sure.
author: Maile N.

description:
THE BEST THAI FOOD I've had on the West Coast. It was a latenight meet up with friends in the Mission District. We walked into Osha (all 10 of us) and was seated right away during a busy night. Loved that! The ambiance of this place (19th & Valencia) was chique and I loved it. We ordered many dishes and the flavors hit my palate in all direction. 

After that night, I was sold. I came back every week to try something new on their menu. It was to the point where I'd go and eat there by myself... it was that delicious.
author: Jane A.

description:
I expected really good food and was slightly disappointed.  It's good, but it's not as good as I was led to believe.  I expected horrible ambiance and was happily mistaken.  Although it's very clearly in the TL, it is an actual, honest-to-goodness, you-don't-have-to-sit-on-a-stool-at-a-window-and-watch-people-peeing-on-the-sidewalk sit-down restaurant.  Meaning there are tables.  And odd booths that are more like benches because there's no padding and when you lean back you might be annoying the person sitting with her back to you.

This place is actually fun.

To recap

Food:  three-and-a-half stars
Atmosphere:  four-and-a-half stars

Plus it has ramps.  Who doesn't love ramps?
author: John S.

description:
This place is legit. 

I walked in 4 inch boots to get here and it was well worth it. Once i got my food, my mouth started to water and i couldnt stop eating. 

I didnt care about the 'hangover' look alike hitting on my boo. I was too busy eating my tofu pad thai and veggie spring rolls. 

Best Thai food. Period.
author: Aidan V.

description:
Another awesome place to go if you are sober or drunkess because they open late!

This place is yum! Loove their crab fried rice..lots of crab lumps, no skimping here and not too salty...Green curry was spicy and yummers as well as their pad see ew.  Def a fan!
author: Kimberly C.

description:
Excellent Thai food.  Excellent location.

Service can be lacking, but prices are reasonable, so 4 stars.  Go for lunch.  Don't miss the grean beans or the spring rolls.  I've had great scallops here, too, as well as great curries.
author: Amber S.

description:
The best place to go after a late night of partying and drinking.

I've been here on numerous occasions and it never seems to fail me. 
Always consistent with their food and my favorite Thai restaurants. 

Things you need to order: Volcano beef, amazing. 
Pad Thai, awesome! 
crab fried rice, they use real crab and mix it up real nice. 
Pad see ew, is a flat noodle with chinese broccoli and eggs- I know it doesn't sound all that appetizing, but don't knock it until you've tried it. Fried chicken over rice is also very good.

Well, all I have to say about this restaurant is that it's cheap eats, great food and definitely bring good company to share this amazing food with. 

Their service can be a bit slow sometimes.
author: Jessica L.

description: OK, I'll give you that this is supposed to be 'upscale' Thai cuisine, but this is probably the worst Pad Thai I've ever had. I rolled the dice and lost. I give them 1-star cause they got me to the table.
author: Wesley P.

description: FOOD POISON....that's all I have to say. 3 days deathly sick
author: Liz A.

description:
Love this place, but parking is horrible. Just decided to pay for a garaged spot. 

Everything we tried here was great. 

The pad Thai, yellow curry, pumpkin curry, papaya salad, a noodle and beef dish I can't remember the names off. 

Service was super friendly and attentive. 

It was a great dinner and Would make it on the regular rotation if I live in the city.
author: Eric H.

description:
I have been coming to Osha for years and now that I work closer to it I have been there more than a few times in the past 2 months... And I come here for one thing and one thing ONLY!!! LOL the Osha Tom Yum Noodle Soup (w/combination seafood). I love NOODLES! (Rice noodles only!) It never disappoints me. BUT coming here for years I watched it grow and change. From bigger portions to smaller portions, now it has a drink menu and the prices keep going up for the food!!! 

I do like a few other things here thou... Like the Duck Curry, the Blood Sally and their Spicy Chicken Wings... All wonderfully satisfying. I like em all spicy as well. 

I don't have much to complain about this place besides the prices and portions. I have been to other Osha's but none of them are as delicious and the one at Glen Park is even more pricier by a few bucks per dish. Insane.!!! 

I love the food and I always had... There's nothing really bad about it. The service is always great and friendly. I only took away a star because of the prices... what can you say? You're paying for quality?!!! Blah blah!! haha
author: Lynna N.

description: Okay so the food is good and I've been here quite a few times before and never had a problem. I think that their prices are way too high for what they're making, considering I can get the same items other Thai places and pay at least 1/2 the price if not less. Either way, it's close to home and when I'm really hungry I don't worry about the price and just enjoy the food. HOWEVER tonight, i was super hungry and decided to eat here. The service, food, everything was normal, but when I tried to pay the server came back and explained that the other server charged my table with another guests card and I would be paying for the other table....but they would fix it for me. It was a little confusing but I decided to just leave it alone and then when the receipt came I just decided not to tip. There's no RULE anywhere that you HAVE to tip. I get up to leave and all of a sudden when I'm halfway up the block I hear someone yelling "sir!! Excuse me sir!!" It was the server....and he said to me "you forgot to leave us a tip! So maybe you could leave us like 3 dollars or 4 dollars" feeling very uncomfortable, I didn't want to say that I didn't mean to leave a tip so I added 3.00. I'm usually a tipper, but I honestly felt that the mistake they made and the extreme prices just didn't make it necessary. Never in my entire life have a been chased or seen someone being chased by a waiter/server when a tip was not left. Because of this, I will not be eating at this location again.
author: Khoi L.

description:
My favorite Osha in the city. I love how it is always busy with a random crowd. Never had to wait longer than 10 minutes for a table and the service is quick and efficient. 

I normally order the duck panang medium spicy which is delicious. The duck isn't too fatty which is perfect. The bf orders a couple of things which are always good but his fave is the Pad-see-ew.

The only if-y thing is the bathroom..  I do my best to avoid.
author: Seema M.

description:
A friend recommended that I go here on a recent trip to SF. And boy was it a great recommendation!

We came in for a late lunch around 2PM, the ambiance of the place was great. Please note me and my friends were seriously hungover from the previous night and yet the food was amazing.

Ordering was kind of a pain because there were so many things on the menu that we all wanted to try. But in the end we ended up with Pad See Eww with Shrimp, Panang Curry with Tofu and a Spaghetti dish with Chicken. 

All of the food was delicious. I have had many different versions of Pad See Eww and this was by far one of the most authentic that I have ever had. The Panang Curry was very good too. The Spaghetti dish was delicious as well. 

They have a really good Thai Iced Tea as well. I could have had 3 of them!

All in all, I plan to return to Osha Thai on my next trip to SF.
author: Vineet T.

description:
Not too shabby....

Modern, clean decor.  Food - fresh and tasty.

Taro rolls - $5 - thin like taquitos, fried like eggrolls- yummy, but more taro please.

Pad thai with shrimp - $13 - good, but a little too sweet.

Pumpkin chicken currey - $10 - looked small in the bowl, but tasty.

White rice for 2 - $3.75

With a water, thai ice tea and a 5 spot for tip, we got outa there for $41.  Not a cheap work lunch at all, but made a good tasting and filling lunch for my sis and I.  I gave the leftovers to my sis for tomorrows lunch.  Watch out for the crakHeads around the corner!
author: Jon W.

description:
one of my favorite Thai restaurants in the city. 

Cheap, trendy, fast, excellent service, tasty food. 

Crab fried rice with duck meat- oh my, it is so out of this world. The rice is super moist, the large pieces of carb/ duck meat is out of this world. 

The pad thai- excellent! beef meat is a little bit rough, but still good. 

lychee thai ice tea- SOOOO GOOD!!! burst of real lychee flavor and 2 huge lychee chunks. go try it :)

Pro: excellent food
ambience- trendy great for food
fast/ excellent service
good price

con: bad neighborhood
bad parking

however, love the atmosphere. love that it opens super late
author: Juan C.

description:
Where do I begin?

I'll start with the cucumbers.

Yes, the cucumbers. The ones they use to decorate your plate so that it looks pretty. EAT THEM. They are scrumpttttious! They're thinly sliced, and sweet! Cucumbers usually taste really bland and cucumber-y. Like if water was a fruit, it would be a cucumber (and yes, cucumbers are fruits. Not vegetables). But these cucumbers.... Boy oh boy are they delicious. So upon discovering that these decorative cucumbers were magic in your mouth, I ordered a cucumber salad. It's cucumbers, sweet red onions, and carrots all thinly sliced into a sweet, tangy, syrupy dressing. YUM.

I've had...
Pad Khee Mao: Stir-fried rice noodles, tomatoes, mushrooms, bamboo shoots, basil, Chinese broccoli, bell pepper, onion, chili and garlic.
Pad Thai: Pan fried rice noodle, egg, tofu, bean sprouts and crushed peanut.
Pad See Ew: Stir-fried rice noodles, Chinese broccoli, egg, garlic and black soy sauce.

(Obviously I'm a fan of the "Pads")

They were equally satisfying and worth the money. I'm sure with how greasy all of the food is here, the carb/calorie intake is probably up the wall... But I have this theory that the 2 block uphill walk back to my apartment will allow me to at least eat here at LEAST once a week. Guilt-free. :)

5 stars!
author: Charmaine A.

description:
Osha Kee Mao!  This is the first place I have experienced this dish, and all others get compared to theirs.  It is hard to beat, as they use duck, a favorite of mine, and balance the flavors beautifully.  If I am at another Thai restaurant I will seek it out and try it to compare, and Osha's is hands down the best.  If I were on the food network show "the best thing I ever ate" and Thai, or noodle dishes were the theme, This dish would be it!  

That being said, I have not had a bad food experience here in numerous visits.  Everything I have eaten has been delicious.  Service, quick, and friendly, and they are open late.  Normally a solid 4 stars, but I'll give them 5 for consistently producing a dish I consider one of the best things I've eaten.
author: Vance J.

description: I love Osha Thai for always being there.. like a beacon in the dark dark night.. satisfying all drunken induced hunger pangs (and all non-drunken ones of course too). When I come here, I always have to get at least the pineapple fried rice and a Thai iced tea. The pineapple fried rice is perfectly made.. a little wet, with chicken, shrimp, eggs, raisins, cucumbers, pineapples, cashews, and green onions. That shit really hits the spot.. especially at night. Finish that shit off with a Thai iced tea and you're golden.
author: Henry W.

description:
I frequent the Glenn Park location and can say the food tastes just as delicious at the Geary Street location.  I really liked the interior, but after about 10 minutes I didn't. The wooden seats were uncomfortable and the music was terrible.  I prefer Asian lounge music with my Thai food, not booty poppin' rap beats. 

Service was much slower at this location. I don't think dining parties who arrive after yours should get their food before you and your buddies.  All three people in another dining party who arrived after us got their food first - not fair!  Ten minutes later, soup comes out for one person in my dining party. Within the next 5 minutes, 3 pad Thais come out one by one for the rest of my party. It would be nice if all our food came out together like that other table. I know I keep talking about that "other" table. Okay, you caught me; maybe I'm a little jealous. I just wish I had the 3.5 star experience it looked like they had. 

For now, I'll probably continue to frequent the Glenn Park location instead.  Their service is lightning speed, food portions appear larger, and free parking is much more accessible.  The pad Thai portion at the Geary Street location looked much smaller; there were more sprouts and less noodles here than at the Glenn Park location.  This makes me sad.  I was unable to reach a full on food coma here.  Therefore, my night was incomplete.
author: Jaime L.

description:
My other fave late night spot.  Arrived at 2am and was able to get a table for 2.  Beef fried rice and Duck noodle soup hit the spot.  
But everything here is money...seriously.

The only thing is you have to deal w/ drunkards.  You just never know at this hour...
author: Meredith K.

description:
I am big fan of this place... I like to go there.... Must gets

1.- Chicken Pad Thai
2.- Spring rolls with prawn 
3.- Mango Salad (My wife loves this salad) 
4.- Osha Tom Yum Noddle (My favorite dish) 

PRICE: 
 You could be spending about $30-$40 with drinks and appetizers 

ATMOSPHERE:
Very simple. Wooden tables and booth seating. Not bad, but definitely pretty casual. This location is in the ... ghetto.  . . ? Also you can walk around and go to many pubs around...
author: Domingo B.

description:
Saturday night, after Cat Club, our tummies were rumbling. 4 girls with an appetite and its around 1. The only nice-looking Asian restaurant near my place is Osha, and I have been meaning to eat there... So.....

We came in, and it was still busy! Ordered Duck Noodle, Chicken Wing appetizer, Pad Thai and Pad See Ew. All of them are pretty good! 
The only reason I give it a 3 star is because.... $13 for a duck noodle soup??! RIDIC! 

I usually go to Bahn Thai Noodles and it's cheaper and better. Bigger portion too. But I guess Osha wins cause the place is nicer. 

Other than that... I have no complaints...
author: Miss C.

description:
This is the original Osha and it's got the hole-in-the-wall Tenderloin griminess to prove it. It's delicious! The Thai iced-tea, the curries (whatever the color), the pad see ew, the soups, the little appetizers all so good! Except, they don't make the pumpkin curry--my favorite Osha dish--at this location. Doh. You can't win them all!

Once, very recently I took a friend who was up here visiting me from San Diego for the Treasure Island Music Festival and for the Treasure Island Music Festival to this Osha and we sat in the corner booth and looked out the window and saw a pigeon eating fresh throw-up when there was a perfectly good apple right next to the throw-up. But then  again, why chew your food when someone's already done it for you? Pigeons are really just filthy rats with wings. Okay, that was  a gross tangent. Never mind.
author: Dee I.

description:
2 stars for food, 4-5 stars for service and cleanliness.

I don't like going to Thai restaurants in general because I'm half Thai, have lived there, and know the real deal.  But last night after my rowdy birthday bash at the Ambassador across the street, a couple of my friends and I ended up here.   Luckily I had no expectations, so it was okay.

Pros:  Friendly service, quick food. 

Cons:  This is not Thai food.  It is California cuisine disguised as Thai food.  We had frien egg rolls (not Thai), beef kah poh (not at all spicy), pad kee mow (no, not really), and some Salmon/Pumpkin hotpot that you would never find in Thailand.   The food was edible but not authentic  And way too expensive for what it is.  

I would never consider this a destination restaurant, but if we were to stumble in once again due to influence of hungry friends, I would survive.
author: Lisa X.

description:
Where do I go to fulfill my thai food cravings? Osha!

Admittedly, the Embarcadero one is way nicer, this one is way closer and more convenient. Parking can take you a few minutes to find, but it's not too bad (Park a little farther away and walk some of your food off after stuff your face). 

Tom yum soup and a toss up between the pad thai and pineapple fried rice everytime i come here. 

What's kind of unsettling for me is how fast the food comes after you order it. I mean...doesn't it have to..you know, cook? Nevertheless, I've never had problems with their food.
author: Jeanette P.

description: Of the local spots for late night grub, you really can't beat a jaunt with Osha. It's quick, always tasty, and always a great place for amazing people watching. Expect a wait, and spotty service late night cause they are so busy.
author: Raul R.

description: 5 stars for the drunk bathroom!  I've never eaten here.  I just pee here at 2am on the weekends.
author: Fatty A.

description:
Got into sf late so we needed to find a nice late night place and we stumbled upon osha.

There were people waiting outside but we were quickly seated for a table of 2. The prices are adequate.
Started with the calamari appetizer. It was served with some kind of spicy sauce on top of thinly sliced apples. Very interesting and tasty.
Ordered pad thai and pad knee. Overall fairly americanized plates but still tasty. Not the best I've had but that's expected for a late night restaurant.
The portions were much larger than I expected so I was very pleased.
Service quick and friendly pretty much. Nice location close to bars and whatnot.
author: Aaron C.

description:
I really like Osha. It's a wonderful place for hangover food (but yet again I think any Thai food is).

I've been here a handful amount of times. My favorite here is the coconut curry. I loved it from the first time I tried it. 

I also love the ambience and the decor inside. It's always pretty quiet in here, which I like because I hate having to yell at my dinner date to speak to them. 

The prices are great, comparable to King of Thai.
If you're in the area and want to eat a good Thai place that's not pretentious, head over to Osha.
author: Debbie P.

description:
Food: 4 out of 5
Customer service: 4.5 out of 5
Ambiance: 4 out of 5
Cleanliness: depending on time you arrive
earlier/midday: 5 out of 5 
late night: 3-3.5 out of 5

Osha on Geary St. is a great restaurant because of three main reasons:

1) Hours. Osha is open much later than the majority of Thai restaurants in SF. 

2) Food. The prawns are huge, deveined and very delicious! The Thai food served here uses finely chopped garlic and other aromatic ingredients such as basil, cilantro and fish sauce just to name a few, the flavors in the food are authentic so don't let the abundance of sweet sauce deter you from trying this location's great food prepared by these skillful chefs and cooks. While this particular Osha location does have a tendency to prepare some of their dishes overly sweet e.g., Angel Wings and the Salmon dish too, however this is not a reason to not come to this location because the food they serve actually is really, really good--so keep in mind that there is a workaround in case you prefer your Thai food less sweet--you can just order the dish's sauce on the side and dip your food into the sauce that way you can choose your own personal level of how much of the restaurant's special Osha sweet and sour sauce you prefer to have with your meal, otherwise the baseline seems to be a substantial amount of extremely sweet special sauce. Also, if you love eggplant be sure to ask for extra eggplant in your dish ($2 extra) because some of their dishes that have eggplant as a component don't add too many pieces so it's worth requesting extra eggplant in your dish so that you will be sure to have at least 10 pieces and be fully satisfied because Osha's eggplant is very delicious as well. 

3) Customer service. The Osha employees are kind and really great even the dishwasher is all smiles and friendly too! If you interact with these hard working employees giving them the utmost respect that they all deserve, they will treat you even more respectfully. They genuinely care about cultivating customer loyalty and ensuring that their customers (new ones too!) are enjoying their meal before/during/after your dining experience at Osha. Even when it gets really busy in the restaurant, I am so impressed by how professional, warm and friendly the staff all is even in the most hectic busy times, you can't help but leave the restaurant a little bit happier due to the kind demeanor of the great staff and relaxed atmosphere of this restaurant. 

After eating at Osha, you'll come to see for yourself this restaurant's recipe of success still going strong by going above and beyond for almost two decades now of providing great food and service to us all here in SF.
author: C K.

description:
Went here with my former co workers to catch up and chat.  We ordered the fried rice, green curry, and pad thai among other things.  The food was okay, the place itself had nice decor.

An overall 3.5-4
author: Jacqueline D.

description: Pad khee Mao is good with shrimp. Service is whatever. I prefer the embarcadero location
author: Julie T.

description:
Best Thai food I've had so far in SF.

Ordered the Pepper and Garlic with Chicken dish. Delicious - had no problem finishing it. Definitely would return. Ask for the complimentary hot tea - yummy.
author: Nancy B.

description: Everything here is decently good and I like that they are close to home and open late. But it is a bit pricier than than the average Thai restaurant. The pad see ew used to be really good whereas now it's okay. One time I ordered noodle soup for take out and found a roach in my noodles. Called them to report it and brought it back for exchange for another menu item. They could have done more to compensate for this, such as apologize and/or comp this item, but they barely even acknowledge the problem. Oh well, such is Osha. And the reality is that there is a lot more roach and rodent infestations in restaurants than we realize. Just because we don't see it on our plates doesn't mean it's not there!
author: Al B.

description:
Came here by accident (both for takeouts).
Brought the food to Cairo Nights so we can smoke and eat at the same time. LOVE how it opens til late!!
Yummy.
my eyes usually look like this when I smile:  n_n
but this time my eyes looked like:  ^___^

As you can obviously see, there is a big difference.

Upside: Yummy food
Downside: Yucky bathroom
author: Frankie W.

description: Not my favorite place any more. Now that they have opened up numerous locations which all look like Las Vegas Hotel lobbies. The old place stayed the same for a while, but they at some point replaced all the cushy diner booths with oversized wooden benches that are too long for your knees to bend and have your back supported and you know it's a board not too comfy. Prices went up as well. Was cooler before.
author: Darren K.

description: One of the best spots in sf. All you need is the bomb ass volcanic Beef and the pad see ew. The volcanic beef is sweet but savory and with the onion rings on top adds a salty aspect as well, in general it provides your taste buds with greatness. I love this place, it's my go to place. The pad se ew is also very good because it is a good change from pad Thai. Straight up bomb ass Thai food, you can't go wrong when you come here.
author: Luigi B.

description:
Late Night Thai Food? Yes please! I'm a huge fan of fan of Thai food -- and a place that serves it late night is heaven sent. 

Osha Thai is a great place to go to after a night on the town. Osha Thai closes at 3am. The prices aren't too bad and they give you some generous portions. 

I absolutely love Pad Thai especially with extra crushed peanuts. They brought me a whole extra container when I asked for extra. 

Service is decent and the food is good. It's hard to go wrong with anything at Osha. Of course the Pad Thai is a favorite, but the curry is good too. 

Hit up Osha if you're looking to satisfy a late night craving. You'll be glad you did.
author: Matt H.

description: Ain't the best Thai food around but it's open 'til 3AM Friday-Saturday, so the pad thai can do your belly good after a night of drinking. It's close by the bars and clubs so watch for the inebriated! I witnessed a man having a full on shouting match with a group of girls for the bathroom. Really? Lol.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
I LOVE the food at Osha. The 3 stars is because the service is so strange and the comfort level is so bad. (should be 3.5)

Food here is never ever a problem. Everything you get here is fabulous. We were here on a busy night and they told us they couldn't seat us, even though there were clearly 4 tables available that they just weren't seating people at. I get it, but staff your evenings properly and you'll be okay. Our server treated us like we were idiots and kept repeating herself over and over and over, but did it so fast that we could never understand her. I've been here long enough that I'm used to the accents, so this was just difficult. We ordered medium spicy on a dish and it came out so hot that we were both coughing and couldn't finish the dish. My date really loves spice and can handle the hottest of the hot, but this was too much. It was inedible to me. I admit that I can't handle my spice...that's why I go medium. Service was slow and it took us forever to get a side of rice. Ordering was very complicated. The seats are extremely uncomfortable, and they were seating couples at double tables for 4-6 people all night while leaving a line waiting. It was just a strange experience.
author: Monika M.

description:
A friend of mine introduced me to Osha in TL back when I was a visitor to SF.  I remember that I was just crazy about their noodles and fried rice.  Now that I live here and have been there a few times and also have visited Thailand, I still think their rice and noodles are decent, but their other items (curries and stir-frys) are quite ordinary.  

The other locations are newer, bigger, nicer, but the prices are also higher.  For some reason, maybe due to nostalgia, I feel the food is simpler but tastier at the original location.
author: Paul K.

description:
Late-night Thai food after drinking and dancing at The Ambassador. It's right across the street, so it's convenient. And it's not all that bad. I think it's just a little bit pricy though.

Not too shabby for a "chain" restaurant.
author: Jae A.

description: As some others have noted it's not really authentic Thai. Sadly, they only had one Isaan inspired item on the menu, papaya salad with glass noodles and bitter Thai eggplant.  The waitress kept asking me whether I liked it, probably b/c it wasn't your standard farang dish.  I have yet to find a Thai place in the Bay that rivals some of the hole in the wall places in LA; it's a shame.
author: Michelle P.

description: Very nice restaurant especially the entrance.  We ordered quail for appetizer.. really tasty but they were the smallest quail I have ever eaten.  Pad Thai was really good besides the tofu was so dry and hard.  Curry duck was VERY very good... thats probably the main reason why I give it 4 stars.
author: J L.

description:
I'm not sure I would go again due to my experience. We had a group of 6 on a Friday and called ahead to make a reservation and they took the reservation. Then when we got there they basically put us on the list as if we were walk ins. When we did finally get sat, the service was really slow. In fact, the bill was paid for by credit card and it was ridiculous how long that credit card was out of our hands.
Our "reservation" was for 8:30 and we didn't get out of there until 20 after 10. We all had a single drink with our meal. We probably would have drank more if the service was better.
I got Pad See Ew and it was good enough, but I misread and was actually looking forward to a bunch of broccoli, but it was chinese broccoli and kind of bitter.
There are so many better thai places in the city, and in this neighborhood that I would say just skip it.
author: Erica F.

description:
What happpend to this place????? I used to eat here for years and years, and it used to have a huge line of people outside waiting to get in! (Mostly Asians BTW).
My partner and I went last week and ordered. Then were joined by 3 more friends and not only did they add the 18% gratuity to the bill, they did not tell us. And next thing you know the bill for two people was almost 50bucks??????!!!  For Phad Thai noodles???  We can get better noodles somewhere else for under 8 bucks. This is in the Tenderloin for God's Sake!  I can see why the lines of Asian dinners are not here anymore, they moved on to the cheaper places and i will follow them! We almost pay 60bucks for a dinner that we can get somewhere else for 20dlls! It's the same gritty location with the same crappy chairs and dirty bathroom. The serving dishes are new, and the waiters are new but other than that, they jack up their prices for no reason at all. Almost 17bucks for a curry????? Ridiculous! Find yourself that restaurant with all the Asian people in line and join them. BUT AVOID THIS PLACE! Too expensive for what you get! Shameful!
author: Jose A. P.

description:
It was above average Thai Food to be certain. There was one difference I noticed from all of the other Thai restaurants I've ever tried:  Ordering Thai hot actually means what you think and you will be sweating chili oil for the next 24 hours.

This coming from a spicy food fanatic and heavy-handed Sriracha connoisseur. 

So just beware: If you've ever scoffed at what a restaurant calls spicy, save your scoffing and definitely don't order  more than one, "Thai hot" dish if you have any doubts.
author: Jacob N.

description:
*This particular* Osha Thai is my favorite in the city.  The others I've been to are more posh/expensive, not as good, and have a different menu.

I usually get take-out here once a week.  I've had the Pad See Ew, regular Pad Thai, Woon Sen Pad Thai, Cashew Nut Chicken, Duck Noodle Soup, and Thai Boat Noodles, and have liked them all.

I tend to think that most Thai food is good, but this is the only place that sticks out in particular to me.  This one is open late too, although it's in Tenderloin, which is a pretty sketchy neighborhood.
author: T.J. H.

description:
This really is one of my favorite Thai restaurants around.  My buddy introduced me to their pad see ew w/chicken and I immediately fell in love.  I live in LA and I have yet to find pad see ew this good.  

A perfect late-night spot in the heart of San Francisco.
author: Joe K.

description:
I heart Osha Thai. This spot holds a special place in my SF history as the destination for first proclamations of love, rendezvous with old friends, late night drunken debauchery and second dinners. The location is in the heart of the tender nob flanked by some of my favorite bars (rye, edinburgh castle, whiskey thieves) and walking distance from Union Square. 

On my shortlist:
- The pad see ew is superb. It's always a hit and never a miss. 
- the crab fried rice = delish
- the fried crab wonton thingies are totally dangerous
- the yellow curry is plate-licking good

The service is typically fast and subtle - not too much chit chat from the servers here. The atmosphere isn't great as this is the oldest and most run down of all the Osha's so don't go expecting the chic wallpaper and dim lighting you'll find on 2nd St or in the Marina. They're open quite late though and in a city devoid of late night grub spots (relative to lovely NYC) it's a true gem in the rough.
author: Jane K.

description:
I've probably eaten here about forty times before I realized I should write a review. One thing you really have to take note here is inconsistency. The staff, food, menu are all variables that change according from day to day.

An example would be the Tom Kha soup. It changes accordingly from day to day as from chef to chef. No chef makes the food alike and sometimes it pretty much blows. Sometimes theres a certain style I adore which can't be repeated because I have no idea who did it or what day he works.

It's pretty sad. But either way, the food is definitely edible. This is right smack down in the middle. Very convenient from where I live. Rather curt service. (Always helps when you speak Thai so go learn.. :))

This is an example of a restaurant right smack down in the middle of the curve. It's not the best, but its rather far from the worse.
author: Denise T.

description: Fusion restaurant. Had the Spicy Catfish and papaya salad, both were tasty. I will be back to try out other dishes.
author: Henry C.

description:
It's 2:30am, you forgot to eat dinner before drinking, and now you're paying the price. Rather than waking up feeling like someone took a sledgehammer to your head, get some food in that belly. 

Head to Osha and join the ranks of drunk clubbers. You have to put your name on a waiting list typically, but you probably won't be left stranded for too long. I put my name down right after a drunk prima donna put her name down. The moment she heard me request a table, she turned to me and slurred, "heeeey, that's sooooo not fair of you. You're not a good person." I just had to laugh.  Once I joined my friends outside to wait, she proceeded to heckle us as though we were trying to take her place on the list. Ah, drunk bitches. 

We got an order of beef Pad See Eew and chicken Pad Thai. 2 stars for the Pad Thai (way too covered in sauce) and 4 stars for the Pad See Eew. It hit the spot in all of it's greasy glory.
author: Monica S.

description:
came here last night while drinking next door at rye .

this is the original osha and my bf being thai, was very interested in seeing how they became such a big hit.

we ordered 
bbq pork with sticky rice- an easy dish to make,cant go wrong. the sticky rice was blue! lol 
crab fried rice- it had lots of flavors but not sure if i was tasting real crab or imitation crab....
angel wings- sweet and saucy. pretty good. chicken looks cooked just before its a bit raw.

i thought everything was good but not like wow. my bf thought everything was too sweet which might be what majority likes. prices were a lil bit higher than most thai places. we ordered drinks too and total was around $50 plus tip.

i wouldnt mind coming again though if in the neighborhood.
author: Christine M.

description:
I have had much better Thai for much less money. I don't mind paying for quality, but this wasn't it. I am baffled by the rave reviews, but maybe it was just the location we wound up ordering from. 

We ordered a papaya salad, a beef dish and a chicken pad Thai. The flavors in all three were decent, but the beef was very overcooked and the pad Thai was greasy, heavy and not at all spicy. The highlight of the meal was actually the papaya salad, which had just the right amount of heat and fresh ingredients. With so many other choices for Thai food and other ethnic cuisine in San Francisco I don't really feel the need to go back on my next visit.
author: Heather D.

description:
Where else can you get stellar Tom Yum Noodle Soup at 2am while drunk?!? Uh...... nowhere but here. I think this is the only dish I've ever ordered at this location because it's just too good to pass up. 

The soup is sour/spicy/tangy and it comes with veggies and a ton of noodles-- the perfect drunken snack before you pass out for the night. I always look for tom yum noodle soup at other Thai restaurants and haven't been able to find it and if a place actually offers the dish, they don't make it half as good as Osha.

Although it gets pretty packed if you come late at night the service is quick and efficient enough so the wait time is usually 10 minutes max.
author: Stephanie P.

description: This was a pleasant surprise for us. We walked around for about 45 minutes looking for a place to eat that wasn't a forever wait, so we kind of gave up and entered Osha. I'm glad we gave up because we should have just came here in the first place. We got the spring rolls, which were great and for my entree I got the BBQ chicken! The chicken was gone in five minutes and the rice! Oh the rice is fried rice and it is so rich...My mom got the ribs and ate all of it. Osha is a solid option in the area!
author: Anna T.

description:
Whenever I go to Osha Thai it's usually a last resort - t's late, there's no other places open, or there's no food at home. Osha Thai is a dependable yet unimpressive chain of restaurants (6 in SF) to get your Thai grub.

This Osha Thai is a two room restaurant. One room feel like a casual lunch are while the other room is a dining hall that affords larger group seating. It has its trademark designy dish ware yet this location has its own eclectic interior design touches such as the big red flower painting.

The food, like I said, isn't the star player here. Despite the fashionable atmosphere it's mostly the convenience factor that will pull you in. Dishes range from $9-18. I had the chicken Tom Yum Noodle Soup (Hot & Sour soup, chili paste, lemon grass, lime juice, bean sprouts). You get to choose the level of spiciness and type of noodle. I went with a medium level of spice with rice noodles.

When it came out it was decently sized dish for one person. I have to remind myself that most Thai restaurants usually serve dry precooked chicken. My dish was good but man was it hot! After each bite I chugged three big gulps of water. I couldn't believe how hot it was. If this was medium then what was hot? I took whatever was leftover home. I was mostly full off of drinking so much water. I don't blame Osha Thai, but if you're afraid of spice I'd encourage you to stick away from it in this restaurant.

My friends' dishes looked good. They didn't complain of any blazing flames shooting from their tongues. I felt like a wimp! Haha. Next time I'll stick away from the volcanoes.

When I got home I tried eating my lukewarm leftovers since I was still hungry. Sometimes spicy food tastes a like hotter when its temperature is warm or hot. This was still magma on my tongue! Somehow I finished it with the help of orange juice. I can't really talk about how it tastes since it's so hot. Hot and sour? YES.

_____

Dependable, fair, and comfortable. Service is good too. Just don't expect much else.
author: Michael H.

description: I have tried to like you osha but I'm never impressed. You leave me feeling robbed. Your prices are high and the food is never as delicious as I hope for. The music is also so loud normally that my ears are bleeding and I can barely speak to whomever I'm with.  Three stars because your hours are incredible for a city that's restaurants go to sleep so early.
author: Eryn L.

description:
I found myself here several times this past week. Usually, post midnight and cocktails. The minute we stepped inside the service was always nice and prompt. When we walked in closer to closing time they even offered to pack up warm meals and send us on our merry, greasy Thai food loving way. 

If I lived in San Francisco I'd probably frequent this Osha since it has so many good bars within close proximity. I have to say that I wish they were opened until 2am during the week.
author: Maria A.

description: Hyped beyond belief! Hated it. Horrid service, mediocre food, fruit flies in and buzzing around food. Fried calimari was very good, so 2 stars.
author: Daniel F.

description:
I like this spot a lot! specially because its open till 3 AM! and its packed full of cute girls! and they were all soo nice and friendly there! If only I lived in SF I could of sealed the deal!!! But atleast when I come back up to SF I can meet up with them! lol sorry now back to the review!!!

My favorite dish had to be the papaya salad with salty crab! That was awesome! it was soo awesome the girl i was with order it with extra salty crab! Was'nt overly salty just right, and the taste wasnt to sweet or bland like COUGH "King of Thai Noodle". There yellow and red curry chicken was good as well, and there duck noodle soup was very tasty. 

Anytime I go back to SF and go out I will definitely come back here! Place reminds me of a Thai food place back at in LA..

Enjoy!
author: Freddy S.

description:
