The pad see ew is amazing but the papaya salad is awkward. Too ginger-y, vinegar-y and papaya-y. Ok, those words are even more awkward.

I thought the wait staff was just OK -- it was pretty crowded so I'm gonna throw them a bone.
author: Olivia L.

description:
This is the least appealing Osha Thai in the city. It was dirty and had a cheap diner feel to it. If you have a choice, go to the one on Union or in Embarcadero 4. They both have great ambiance and a fun scene. The Embarcadero location just opened a new lounge too which is always a plus. 

With that being said, the food is consistently good across locations. I ordered the pineapple fried rice and it was just as satisfying as I remembered it. They don't serve my favorite dish at this location, the brown rice clay pot, which is a bummer but you can't win em' all.
author: Julia N.

description: I have to say ....this Osha Thai is our "go to" spot for Thai food in SF.  It is quick, and open late night after a night of heavy drinking/clubbin! :)  Also, the chef at this location is much better (authentic) than the other Osha's. You gotta try the Padseeu duck - It is amazing!
author: Abra S.

description: Really great food, but the pad thai with crab was bad bad bad!! fishy yucky smell... no... bad.... but the rest was perfect. lol
author: Jason B.

description:
Thai food is hands down my favorite cuisine and while Osha is definitely not my favorite Thai spot in town, it does the job. It's cheap, convenient and the food is good enough. Tonight, I decided to branch out and try the Tom Yum Noodle Soup (basically Tom Yum soup with more Tofu and lots of noodles). It was a solid choice, but nothing to write home about; next time I will stick with something of the curry or  traditional noodle variety.

While the food is just good, the service is EXCELLENT. The host was friendly and efficient, the server was responsive and willing to offer suggestions and the cooks were speedy- the food  arrived at the table within 9 min of ordering. 

Overall, solid experience at a clean, efficient and affordable local Thai place.
author: Christina D.

description:
Hi Osha. 

I hope you noticed that I've made it routine to come visit you twice a week. 

When you ask me how I like it, I say "spicy"... and you do just that. You make it spicy for me, and you make it real good, every time. 

Anyway. The roasted duck curry (opted spicy) is a rich blend of spicy and sweet. The duck meat and bits of fat just bind it all together. Tom yum could use more spice and acidity, but the fish cakes are like potato chips that I uncontrollably pop into my mouth. Spicy eggplant, is indeed spicy, while the eggplant absorbs all the flavor of the dish has to offer. The squid salad is not shy- there are delightful pieces of squid in every chopstick or fork-full. Once again, it's spicy. 

In sum, I'll be seeing you, Osha, again, very soon.
author: Stef Y.

description:
As a visitor to the city we stumbled on Thai Noodle cafe.

Well it was a beautiful restaurant, with great customer service, and I like this American tradition of giving water, when you did not ask for it (not being sarky by the way). 

I ordered the Thai green curry which comes with the rice and I asked for the spice to be mild.  Well in saying that the Curry's vegetables were fresh with a nice crunch, but what I found odd was the sweetness. I  have had green Curry before and it has not been sweet.  Plus the spice was mild but could of been much more milder because I was still reaching for my glass of water, but maybe it because I'm a woose haha!

The price of the meal was reasonable under £10 dollars and it is on the buzzing street of Geary street, which seems to have a lot going on.

When I come back, ill probably step out of my comfort zone and try something else.
author: Omoraka O.

description:
Awesome tasting Thai food at a very reasonable price. OSHA never disappoints in my book....I ve been going to this spot for 2 years straight and I am still as excited as the first time I had my Tom Kha coconut soup there. This is standard my favorite dish at Osha...i had the green and red curry before and also the Pad Thai...all great, but there is really no comparison to the Tom Kha soup they serve you. It is rich, full of coconut juice/water, bean sprouts, mushrooms and noodles. Contrary to other thai restaurants, Osha 's Tom Kha really tastes and looks like coconut soup 

Place is hip and gets crowded in the evening so if you are very hungry please take into consideration that you might have to wait a wile before being seated...especially on the weekends. It is conveniently located in downtown SF and stays open till 2 AM so a great place for a late night snack or if you are a hungry owl ;-)

Prices: Very very reasonable!
author: Achraf S.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place cause I usually come out to SF with my best friend to visit her boyfriend. I came here once but the wait was so long so we decided to go somewhere else but then I came again with my boyfriend along with my best friend and her boyfriend. We came around 5pm & were able to be seated right away. 

I decided to order the pad see ew and my bf got the chicken curry. My best friend got the pad thai and her bf got the pineapple fried rice. We got it all at once at the same time. My best friend's boyfriend always comes here & always says its good. He was right! My pad see ew was perfect! It was sweet which is something a bit different from other pad see ew's i've tried. My bf's curry I thought wasn't bad either, i wouldn't say it was the best but it was ALRIGHT. 

I definitely wouldn't mind coming back whenever I'm in the city again!
author: Naomi W.

description:
Came here with a couple of friends for late dinner and drinks before heading out to the bar. The service is on-point and it took no time for us to get our food after ordering it. 

Feeling healthy-ish, I ordered fresh rolls with prawns, my friends ordered chicken pad thai and the fried calamari. The rolls were pretty good but the calamari was really the star of the table. Upon first glance, it looked like some sort of spicy mayo was drizzled on top the calamari but I was pleasantly surprised that it was a sweet mustard sauce instead. It wasn't too greasy, perfectly fried and I ended up eating half my friend's food, it was so good. The pad thai was huge- yet my friend practically inhaled his entire plate.

I ordered the "I love lychee" champagne cocktail. Holy head buzz, did that get the job done. By the end of dinner I didn't even need to continue on for more drinking at the bar and I sure as hell was relieved that we were walking home. Totally satisfied after leaving here with a full belly and a good buzz.
author: Nikki B.

description:
Hmmm....where do I begin? Well, I have been dying to dine at this restaurant after hearing so many fantastic reviews from my friends. My boyfriend and I chose to visit the Geary location instead of the Embarcadero location because we were going to shop at Union Square after lunch. The Geary location is closer to Union Square so we thought it would be best to dine here. BIG MISTAKE! Although we found parking on the street, we had to pay $2.00 just to park for an hour. Not only was it a bit expensive but it was an inconvenience for us because it meant that we only had an hour to enjoy our meal. 

We finally entered the restaurant and to my surprise it did not look like it did on the website. The restaurant was filthy and not aesthetically pleasing. We were not greeted with a friendly welcome by the waitress who was working. She seated us near the back, next to the smelly bathroom and I was not happy. I kindly asked if we may seat somewhere else and she rolled her eyes like it was such a big inconvenience for her.

So I ordered the spicy eggplant w/ duck dish and my boyfriend ordered the fried prawns dish. When I received my dish I was extremely disappointed to see that my meal was drenched in oil. However, I decided to be optimistic and give it a try. I can honestly say to never order the spicy eggplant w/ duck dish. It was disgusting. I felt like I ate three cups of oil. My boyfriend's dish was tasty but it only came w/ 6 pieces of shrimp. It cost $12.

To top it all off our table was dirty and there was a fly that kept flying around. 

My rating for Osha Thai:
-1 Star for the rude service
-1 Star for the oily food that clogged my arteries
-1 Star for the rude service
-1 Star for the persistent fly that kept flying around our food
author: Viennelyn C.

description: I used to come to this Osha a lot when my old office was nearby. I would compare their food to the other osha locations and this place always seemed so much better. I had not been to the location on leavenworth for over a year and decided to return last night. I have to say that I was very disappointed with the food. The lemon grass chicken which is usually slightly spicy and full of flavor was flavorless and watered down. The lime thai iced tea left a bad taste in my mouth and our waitress was very rude. I can now definitely say I wont be going back to their leavenworth location. I would much rather to their 2nd street location and pay a bit more.
author: T L.

description:
Late night Thai Restaurant within close proximity to bars and full of drunk people with the munchies lining up to use an unpleasant bathroom.  What seems like a possible combination meant for disaster, actually turned out to be a good thai food experience.

Tomyum soups: flavorful with fresh vegetables.  Half a soup for $5 is both economical yet filling.  The broth was amazing with the perfect balance of sweetness and spicy

Spicy Osha Noodles: Egg noodles sitr fried with duck.This actually cam out to top ramen noodles with vegetables all greased up in duck fat.  And the "spicy" title refers to a strip of Sriracha that is on the side of your plate.  Nonetheless it was decent, but not the restaurant specialty I expected 

Thai Style Fried RIce: Sweet and delicous.

What makes this place great was the speed and efficacy of getting your order out, despite the chaos resulting from the 2am rush for beer munchies.  The service was great and the food was good, but obviously my experience is a mere reflection on the time I went there. And thus my rating is on behalf of a "thai food at 2:00am experience"
author: Antonio C.

description:
I would pass on the crispy calamari appetizer next time. (I don't like mayonnaise based sauces and the batter was heavier than I prefer.) However, the roasted duck curry, tom yum noodle soup, and pad thai were delicious. 

Convenient location, friendly service, and won't break the bank.
author: Lisa C.

description: We were in a hurry and they were very speedy. Best yellow curry I've had in years! Chicken sate was ok.
author: Valeria H.

description:
Delicious Thai food!! 

I've been coming to Osha for some great Thai food in the city. This is their original location that I have been going to in particular, for some yummy late night eats. 

The last time I was here I ordered the tasty sweet Thai Iced Tea and started with an appetizer, the Taro Rolls: silver noodles, black mushrooms, taro, and cabbage with their sweet and sour sauce. It being fresh out of the fryer I almost burnt my tongue, that's what I get, just couldn't wait to dig in...haha 

For the main dish I ordered the Spicy Eggplant with beef, basil, garlic, bell pepper, and chili sauce, served with white rice. It was perfectly delicious and spicy just the way I like it. The eggplant cut on a biased was cooked just right not mushy and the beef very tender, the bite of the fresh bell peppers, fresh basil, and garlic in their Thai spices mmm MMM mmm... 

I've tried a variety of dishes at Osha from their appetizers like their mouth watering Angel wings, spicy beef, chicken, or seafood rice dishes, noodles like the Pad See Ew, to their green, yellow, and red curries.  Everything I've had here is always sooo goood!  Generous portions and the ingredients are always fresh.  

Good fast friendly service =) 

Good spot to enjoy some great Thai comfort food... Enjoy!!
author: Jayne M.

description:
Went here a while back during the Holidays. I was starving for some pad thai and was completely surprised at how large the portion was. This seemed to be the only upside as I can honestly say that I have eaten better pad thai. This dish was a bit too bland for my palate and there were entirely too many bean sprouts that took away from the other ingredients. 

And I have tried a many thai iced tea and was disappointed that the one I tried was a bit too watered-down.

It must have been a bad night as I have heard a lot of good things about this place. I'll have to give it another try!
author: Peit P.

description:
Dear Osha Thai, you need to come to the Sunset!

The food is great here, at least at this location.  Have been here many times and always leave satisfied.  I am always one for the Pad Thai; yes I am white.  But it's good...and the place is cool.  Open till 3am is bloody brilliant!
author: Sir Paul L.

description: I had the lemon grass sauce with chicken as take out. I went on the recommendation of a tour operator who liked to point out inexpensive neighborhood joints. The dish was very savory and I would definitely go again.
author: Lesley P.

description:
I used to come here a lot with my friends because one of them lived just two blocks away. Their stuff is good, but a bit more pricey than other Thai restaurants.

Tonight I stopped in and got pineapple fried rice vegetarian style. Normally I get this in my own neighborhood from King of Thai Noodle and it's a ton of very flavorful and delicious fried rice for around $8. Osha charges $10 for this dish, even if you get the meat excluded. With tax and a tip, this $8 dinner came out to $12, which was way more than I wanted to spend. I wish I would have just held out until I got home and got what I wanted and saved a couple bucks.

Pros: Good food, open late

Cons: Overpriced, it's usually a madhouse in here
author: P A U L.

description:
I like the location in SOMA better.I know that this is the original and that this is more of a cafe than the other one (which is a pretty amazing space) but I just thought that the food is better there.

This particular location was close to my hotel, so it was kind of a no-brainer after a trip or tow to Rye and Swig.

I had the beef pad see iew, chicken satay, chicken wings, and spicy beef (don't worry- I was not alone and there was food left over) and the Osha Tom Yum Soup on another.

Everything here was just okay, except for the chicken satay which, well... wasn't. The peanut sauce had a poor texture and it was way too sweet.

The redeeming qualities in this cafe come with the beef dishes and from what I'm told- the rice dishes. Oh, and the fact that they're open until 3AM is pretty spectacular too.

That's right. Thai food served until 3am. Dare to dream, Seattle... dare to dream.
author: Katie A.

description: For what you pay, I don't think it's worth it. Servings are small, pad thai (which I measure every thai restaurant by) wasn't too good. The sea bass was good, but not worth coming back for.
author: Raymond H.

description:
This is the best Osha and the cheapest too..The other places are overprice, overrated and not that great..The place is often crowded therefore, takeouts are recommended. The crab fried rice is delicious and the grounded chicken with string bean is yummy and spicy...

The location is perfect. Also, it opens till 3am on friday and saturday nights.....
author: Tiffany L.

description: I love OSHA and usually have a great time  but tonight was just not that night. The waiters were beyond rude, took more then 30 mins to take our simple order (sticky rice) and gave us attitude when we asked for a waiter. Having to get up multiple times to find someone to take our simple order was a headache since the place was packed. Regardless of it being busy or not everyone should be greeted and helped, first come first serve. We got here before two other parties who received their hot plates before we even got our order taken. Will be thinking twice about returning here... Womp.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Food is ok. Service is beyond terrible. I only ever end up here when my other Thai favorites are closed. Curries are good, pad thai is decent, but I can't reiterate how horribly atrocious the service is. Came here early halloween night when Lers Ros closed at 10 for some reason. It was relatively empty apart from the handful of drunken costumed patrons. Ordered pork with sticky rice (tasty), raw prawns (also tasty) and something else I don't remember. Maybe noodles. Clearly unremarkable. Asked for an order of rice and 2 rice bowls. Food comes, no rice/bowls (the bf is super Chinese and refuses to eat Asian food without rice. In a bowl). Flag down our waiter to ask for rice again. He's all like, whatever whatever ok. Waiting. Waiting. Flag him again. Ok, ok. (Again, there's maybe 3 other parties in the whole restaurant). Waiting. Try to flag him for the 3rd time and he's gone AWOL. Boyfriend goes up to the counter to inquire about the whereabouts of the rice and bowls (Fact: it has to be within a 20 foot radius). The woman at the register yells at him and demands he return to our table (W.T.F). A few minutes later, rice is unceremoniously tossed on our table. On a plate. Most likely to spite us.   

As I said, food is ok but is on the pricey side. Osha is simply, dirty Tenderloin Thai food with awful service. They'll put on bow ties and stick a totally unnecessary flower in the middle of your noodles and try to pretend they're not serving food to mostly drunk people. Probably not deserving of the $11-$15 price tag you'll pay for entrees.
author: Heather U.

description: Decent food. Seating environment is nothing to write home about. Food was solid, particularly their panang curry. The angel wings we ordered as an appetizer didn't taste fresh. May have been a reheated item dropped in sauce. Pad Thai was pretty good with chicken.
author: John M.

description:
while osha is far from authentic, it's certainly not terrible, and they definitely use high-quality ingredients.

the problem with most of them though is that they're all super-trendy and located in high-rent areas, and just way more than i'd ever want to spend on this kind of food.

except for this location, the original one :)

having the divey atmosphere that it does and being located in the TL, the prices are significantly lower than all the other locations, not to mention they're open until 3 on the weekends.

rack of lamb for $13? sounds great to me!
author: Mark A.

description: I used to love Osha Thai when it was more dirty and cheap.  Now I find that the portions are smaller, food isn't as good and way more expensive.
author: Suz L.

description:
Osha gets an extra star for being open til 3 in the morning and how fast they make your food! Granted, lots of their dishes do taste the same with that typical sweet and spicy sauce, but it's reasonably priced and generous portions. 

I always seem to go here when I am starving and luckily for me, I have never had to wait longer than 10 minutes for my food. My favorite thing to get is the prik pao..bell peppers, onions, and your choice of meat (or tofu.) Their tofu, by the way, is realllly good. It has a really good firm texture and it comes in good-sized chunks. 

Another thing I love is how spicy they make it. Lots of restaurants you ask them to make it spicy and you have to end up dousing it in hot sauce. With Osha, this is not the case. And even if you do like yours to be spicier, the hot chili oil is there on the table for your convenience.

Also, Tom Kha soup is amazzzing! Great light consistency and rich flavor. One of my favs from here-get it with chicken.

Atmosphere is ok..I don't personally dig the big white plastic chairs and be aware of the booth seating..you can't cross your legs under the table because the table is so close to the booth. The crowd is young. 

Other downside to Osha is it can be kind of greasy..
author: Andrea K.

description: Delicious Thai Food!! Fast service and quality food.  The seafood pot was yummy and the tud mun pla was plentiful and tasty.  Would definitely go back again and again if I lived in San Fran!!
author: Aura S.

description: They get 2 stars for just being open so late. One of the better options to eat at after you are out clubbing and ravenous. I have stumbled into this place a few times on the weekend and the food was decent. At 2am in the morning, usually everything tastes good. The restaurant itself is not much to look at and a little cramped.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Clean, good service and good food!
I really enjoyed my visit and I will go back for sure. I want to experience their late night hours tho. They open til 3am!
The waitress recommended any dish on the Chef's Specials but she told me the Volcanic Beef is a favorite... and it is a new favorite for me!
author: Christian P.

description: This is one of my favorite Thai restaurants. I would usually get takeouts here and bring it home when I am in the area or would always take my friends here if we are to do a day of shopping in SF. My favorites here includes: the crab papaya salad, crab fried rice, volcanic beef, chicken satay, and the pad thai. The thai tea here is also really good. It's also open late so definitely a good spot to drop by!
author: Ngoc L.

description:
I don't understand where all these 4 and 5 star ratings are coming from.  IMHO, this place is not even worth two, but I'll be nice.

We were a party of six and were seated right away.  This was around 8pm on a Saturday night.  I guess we got lucky.  They had a decent selection on their menu and each of us ordered something different, since it was served family style.  Out of our order we only liked 2 items, the volcano beef and some rice noodle in a claypot.

One of two reasons why they got less than a "C" grade in my book was because they messed up on our beer order and one even had a bug floating in there.  DISGUSTING!!  

The second is because of their unisex bathroom.  Don't even go in there.  Hold your pee if you have to.  That ish was just f'in gross!  Graffiti all over the walls, used toilet paper on the floor, strong stench of urine.  ehhhck!!!

Overall, if you can chose another restaurant to dine at on a Saturday night, I highly advise you do so.  I probably won't ever come back here, unless I'm in the neighborhood, drunk off my ass and I'm in need of some sober-up food.
author: Rizzel M.

description: This was my first time to Osha. There's lots of Thai places in the area so its fairly competitive and tough to stand out, but Osha does a decent job. I like the atmosphere with the open windows and seating. We received fast, pretty friendly service. They've done a nice job with the Halloween specials (Golden Mango Curry & Pumpkin brulette). I got the Spicy Basil tofu and it was mediocre. Great place for young people.
author: Gabriel T.

description:
Cheap eat and open during late hours. Great selection of traditional Thai cuisine with a twist. My hint for ordering: anything with the name Osha Thai in the name. The Osha Thai Tom Yum was probably my favorite, Spicy and sour, the tom yum will definitely stand out as a distinct Osha Thai dish. The garlic lamb chops were infused with a lemongrass dressing so it was a great Thai fusion dish. I also really liked the crab fried rice, chunks of crab claws were tossed in that dish, definitely worth the price!

One word of warning though, this location is on the seedier side when compared to other Osha's as it's really close to the TL. The seats are uncomfortable and the bathroom is rather scarily graffiti'ed. The service is great though, I think this is the only spot I've seen Thai people congregate at in SF...hmmm......
author: Annie B.

description:
I like this place for a number of reasons.
It's in the TL.
Not that I particularly like lurking in the Tenderloin... but the trek to and from this location of Osha is.... for lack of a better term....  interesting.
The vibe is lively and refreshing, and you will see good-looking people here.
They serve alcohol.  Always a big + in my book.
I know, I know...  'Presentation' is a term used much too colloquially.  However, I was impressed with how I was able to eat with my eyes before my olfactory, and before my tastebuds...  Good stuff. 
They use quality ingredients.
We had the beef rolls,
chicken wings,
the papaya salad,
the mango salad,
the crab fried rice,
the basil beef,
some awesome chicken and red bell pepper dish with rice,
and mango/sticky rice.
All were tasty, and worth ordering again.  
Tons of trouble to get into for "afters" in the immediate and general area.
Good times.
We'll be back.
author: Barry A.

description: I have been to a couple of thai restaurants.  This one is pretty good, but not amazing.  The food was good, but pretty greasy.  It was packed, and we were there at midnight.  I will go again, but maybe at an earlier hour.
author: Thao N.

description:
Me and my freinds come here after the club and its is extremely packed here at  2am .So, I completly hate the service here. This joint is opened untill 3am and so many people come here after the club. I tasted 3  dishes, the fried chicken with fried rice, the red curry salmon with green beans and basil and the shrimp pad thai.

I really enjoyed the red curry salmon. The salmon was not overcooked and tasted like it was saturated in the red curry sauce.  They used fresh basil leaves which was very fragrant  in the dish. The salmon was cut into bite size peices which  added  a different  appearance to  most salmon dishes that I have tasted. 
The fried chicken needed salt! I do not like salt in my dishes because of sodium issues, but the chicken tasted like it was batter, chicken and oil. There was no taste to it. The fried rice seemed like it was cooked hours ago and they just warmed it up before it was served to me at the table.
My girls ordered the shrimp pad thai, which had a generous portion of  shrimp.I was really impressed. The bean sprouts looked like it had  a little air exposure, they were not as fresh looking or crunchy for what I am familiar with. The pad thai tasted like it  was missing an ingredient or two . It was a little bland. Maybe a little more fish sauce or dried chili pepper would have made  it more tasty.
The Service SUCKS at OSHA!!  They forgot my girl's thai ice tea and  they made me wait 7 minutes after they brought out everyone's dish at my table beside mine. I was on the verge of cancelling my order!

If you  are looking for a last resort  for asian food after a night of partying and drunkeness at 2am, then go to the Osha Thai Noodle cafe, otherwise I would rather have  ate   a terriyaki bowl at Jack N the Box!
author: Nyla J.

description:
As I sat here having lunch today I thought to myself I've given Osha enough chances over the years. The plus about this place as opposed to others in the neighborhood is that it's open until 3am. 

Their green papaya salad is very salty, and it has a viscous quality to it which makes it seem less fresh. They give you a lot of big fat peanuts and toasted garlic, but there were no noticeable fresh herbs involved. 

The barbequed chicken actually made me mad. It's PLAIN GRILLED skinless sour-tasting dry chicken served with a sweet, insipid dipping sauce over two tons of  white rice. The barbequed chicken I've had at other Thai restaurants is always marinated and char-grilled with skin on. The sauce is not required to produce bbq flavor. I seriously thought about sending this back because based on my experience with Thai bbq chicken it was bad.

I'm not sure if I didn't just order wrong, but the pedestrian quality of the bbq chicken was a disappointment. I have enjoyed their curries here before and wished I hadn't changed my mind and ordered the bbq chicken. 

They're fairly nice here, but for $20 I'll head to Chai-Yo where the food is far fresher and better seasoned, in my opinion.
author: Roxmarie M.

description:
3.5 star
The good things come to this rest is they open pretty till late.
the service not really good... not friendly, but the good things is fast. and i don't like the way they change furniture cause you can't lay down your head anymore (which is can touch other customer head) the aisle near with glass window not comfortable anymore (maybe they try to save some money but in the same time try to decorate without concern how customer feel) :(
and what i don't like is one day i made order for pick up but the price is diff... what's going on ? are they try to took my money only for a tip ??? it's not prof but fortunatelly i ask why the price is diff ? 
just watch out if you order for to go (not all rest you can trust)
i love their seafood salad...
author: christine s.

description:
Now why'd ya' have to go and do that...

I've really enjoyed going to Osha's second street location and generally really enjoy their food, but this location just didn't tip the scales in Osha's favor.

I've always wanted to pop into this corner location when I come out for drinks at Rye, because it always seems packed and the portions from the window always looked huge.

So last night I came out here with a dear friend who is on her way out of the city, and I was sadly misguided by my stored memories.

Service was great. Never had a dry cup, but the food...

I knew it was bound to happen, as I've read about it before, but it was EERIE how fast the food came out. 

We ordered, the slip was sent back, and before I had even finished my first cup, the dish was fired out.

Now I'd love to believe that they just have unbelievable telepathic ability, and that once you step foot inside Osha they have already scanned your brain's bar code and identified what you WILL have, but this was just pushing it.

It makes me believe that the food has been sitting out for awhile or just microwaved and plated.

I had the BBQ Chicken rice plate and it does NOT take 1 minute to BBQ chicken ( yeah that's what we doin' )...( playa's holiday? ), and stir fried tofu over rice which is what she had does not take less than that as it came out first.

At least give off the impression that you 'play' cook in the back...

But me being me, the shoveler of food. Consumed. Every. Last. Bit.

Shows what I know about food...
author: Mike K.

description:
Osha is great (2nd St., Embarcadero), but not this one, not by a long shot.  I had a poor experience there a couple of years ago, but everyone should get a second chance, so I went again.  There will NOT be a third visit.

My friend and I arrived after the dinner rush, so we were seated promptly, but at a table crouched up close to those next to it despite there being large more open tables free (um, why?).  We promptly asked to be moved.  

We couldn't make up our minds between two entrees we were both eyeing, so I asked about getting half orders of each.  "Uh uh, not possible", said our server.  I balked, internally, knowing full well that the food was all already made back there and it was just a matter of plating it (which was verified later), but I acquiesced.  My friend likes his food spicy, really spicy.  But the waiter didn't ask our preferences and scuttled away before we could let him know.

I swear it was less than 5 minutes and our food arrived - ALL of the food, including our "spicy" mango starter salad which didn't have a shred of mango anywhere.  The noodles in both dishes had that sad wilty look like they'd been sitting around for a while, and they tasted as such as well.

I can't say that anything was good.  It was all edible, but not yummy in any way.  It lacked flavor, spice, wasn't fresh, and scrimped on the important stuff (beef, vegetables).  It was a sad, sad meal.
author: Jen J.

description:
They had me at "Crab fried rice" and "open til 3am"

Came in on a Saturday night around midnight. It was busy but not packed. There's music but its not so loud it drowns out conversation.  Its more simple and modern in decor (no random buddha items/mom and pop decor) 

Most important was the food which was very good. My group got the crab fried rice I heard so much about as well as the pad se ew, chicken satay, and duck curry.  To drink we got a thai tea, a singha and sapporo served in pilsner glasses which I appreciate more than a mug...makes it "classier", i suppose. 

The crab fried rice was make with real crab meat complete with claws. No imitation meat here. It was a bit greasier than I would've liked but had a right amount of spice and an abundance of meat. So Im sold. 

Duck curry was excellent. Nice curry: it was creamy with a hint of spice. The gaminess of the duck did well with the curry but I found myself more enamored with the curry on its own. However, the thing I didnt like was the pineapple. Maybe Im just not as big a pineapple fan as I thought, but I dont think it melded well with the curry. I ate around it. 

The chicken satay was a bit drier than I liked. The pad se ew was ok, but not a favorite and not really that memorable for that matter. 

So I do recommend this place as a cozy little nook to get a good bite to eat late. Nice atmosphere, nice servers, good prices and above average food--good stuff.
author: Lauren V.

description:
We came here late on a Friday night.  It was hard to find parking (we parked 6 blocks away).  Bathroom was FILTHY. Service was prompt and fast. 

Taro Rolls - fried. Pretty good but I did not taste the TARO? 
Spicy Spring Beans - Pretty good 
Spicy Cat Fish with Rice - Too coconut and creamy. I wasn't expecting it. It was fried too. 
Pad Kee Mao - Did not taste good at all.  Too tomato like and I've had better Pad Kee Mao at Marnee Thai and King of Thai.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
Ordered takeout, so can't speak to the service, but what I had was quite good. Here's the line up:
- spring rolls: wrapped in a spongier, thicker wrap than I'm used to, but still good. Not excellent.
- green papaya salad: very good
- green curry with chicken: thick and sumptuous curry liquid, plenty of vegetables and chicken, generous portion
- brown/red rice: a nice option besides white, well-prepared 
- takeout packaging: NOT STYRAFOAM, yes! Good job!

I will be back for more takeout and to dine in.
author: C G.

description:
I work in the Tender Nob and when i'm craving a little papaya salad and thai curry, Osha is my one stop shop. I love the basics: pad thai, spicy papaya salad and I absolutely love their pumpkin curry that is done with kabocha squash. I'm telling you, its all about the coconut milk! a glass of thai iced tea and I'm happy. 

This place is especially great for late night eating after hitting the bars in the neighborhood. I've been to their other locations which are way fancier in decor and for the most part the same in their food offerings, BUT, the prices leap a few dollars for the same things. I'll stick to my nitty and gritty tenderloin, in this economy, why would I pay 5 dollars more for the same thing?
author: Jennifer T.

description: I've been a huge fan of this original location for years. I cant count the number of times I've been here late at night for the green curry fried rice to soak up the alcohol from bars near by. Giving it 3 stars as the prices have been going up steadily and last time I was there, I was surprised to see most veg dishes were above $12. I understand the other locations have to charge high prices as they offer nice ambiance and are in high-rent locations. But to pay $20 for a late light night meal in the tenderloin seems a bit much.
author: Paawan K.

description:
Hipsters, hipsters everywhere! (Just not at our table).

We fit into the "tipsy and need fooooood late at night" category.

If you're expecting the fancy SOMA location, you'll be surprised by this smaller, much less modern version of Osha. 

I'll take the Geary location over the others any day for 2 reasons:
1. The food is just as tasty, if not better than the other snazzier locations.
2. Our three dishes came out at lightning speed. I mean order-drink-food on the table in less than 10 minutes during a very busy time. I was amazed.

I also liked that they didn't automatically water down or spice-down my curry to white person status. That shit was spicy and gooood, just how I wanted it. 

Reasonable prices, quick, pleasant enough service and great food. What's not to like?
author: Donna Z.

description:
The original OSHA! Even with their massive expansion, OSHA delivers consistently great Thai food at all of their locations.
Their prices have gone up quite a bit but they were so ridiculously cheap before, I guess it was inevitable. The menu changes slightly from location to location (just a heads up).
Love the panang curry, spicy eggplant, spicy string beans, and taro rolls.
I have lots of out of town friends who insist on a visit to OSHA during their time in the city.
author: Malarie J.

description: One of the few late places to get late night Asian food in San Francisco. I have tried this place a few times and it is ok.... It does not really taste like Thai to me. Thats not good, then with that said it just did not taste very good either. It is in the Tenderloin....the prices are still a bit expensive for a divey place. At least the food should be as good as the other Osha's in the area. it stays open till 1am I guess you don't have too many choices.......
author: Shane S.

description: I came here in the evening and found parking across the street in front of the Ambassador, lucky as parking is difficult in this area.  The decor inside is trendy and upscale.  The staff inside are very attentive.  Our seating was immediate and our bar drinks brought out instantaneous, deliciously mixed fresh mints and citrus fruits and not pricey at only $8.  Our dishes were so good and piping hot.  I ordered the pad Thai chicken, and my guest ordered combination fried rice w/ shrimp, squid, chicken, pork, and beef.  Both very good but I think I should of ordered something more adventurous after seeing and tasting the combo plate.  Waiter and waitresses are as I've mentioned very friendly and attentive.  The ambiance and atmosphere inside is very inviting.  Very cool place to eat and enjoy.
author: Asana T.

description:
I know that this place does not need another review but I thought I would share my experienced at this fantastic place! I had actually been here before many years ago with a friend who lived in the city. We only got drinks and some apps so I didn't get a full spectrum on the meal itself until now.

I had to pick up a friend from the airport who's husband couldn't manage to miss one baseball game to come and get her (lame) anyway, my husband offered to take me to dinner and go with me. Wonderful! He suggested a few places but I kept hearing him rave about a Thai place by his work so I suggested it, so glad I did!

We went and it wasn't too busy but busy enough so you could tell it was good. The decor was simple but I loved the tables for the large groups and the pillows. Many people came and ate alone which was comforting to know that people feel confident to do that! We didn't get an appetizer but ordered the basil beef, green curry with chicken, and spicy pad thai with pork. The food came with Jasmine rice which was cooked so perfect it melted in your mouth. The noodle dish was one the best I have ever had and the beef and curry dishes had such amazing flavor! 

The food did come quickly just like other reviews have said however this is the reason I did not give the place 5 stars. My husband and I literally sat and spoke maybe 10 words after order before the food came out. I tend to like to chat a bit before delving into a meal and if that's your preference as well then make sure you don't go here when you're wanting that. It was prompt, the service was good and everything tasted very good. The dishes could have been spicier. We did order the Spicy noodle dish and I couldn't even tell it was spicy at all. Next time I would tell them to make all the dishes spicier.

Would highly recommend this place.
author: Colleen M.

description:
YES!!!

Finally a place close to my house that I love. I walked in and immediately knew it was going to be good and I wasn't disappointed. Green Papaya Salad, Spicy Eggplant, and Pumpkin Curry Tofu.... AMAZING!

I'll be back regularly. See you soon.
author: Jennifer O.

description: Fantastic food, fast service, what more could you want.
author: James T.

description: I forgot the name of the dish I had but it's the other flat noodle one not Pad See Ew. It had tomatoes, bamboo shoots, mushrooms. It was good but I think I still like Pad See Ew better. My friends were not happy, our waiter was busy having drinks at another table and he wasn't attentive at all with us. Then he screwed up 2 orders, got one of my friend's dish completely wrong and the other asked for a small bowl of soup and got the large. We all finished eating and my poor starving friend was still sitting and waiting for her food. She gave up and cancelled the order, they ended up taking it off the bill and bringing it out.
author: Karen T.

description: After my second visit to Osha Thai, I realized that this place is my favorite Thai restaurant!!!  You can't go wrong.  On my most recent visit, we ordered Panang curry with prawns, a spaghetti noodle dish and a mango curry dish,  All 3 were so delicious!!!  We also had spring rolls with peanut sauce and that was really yummy as well.  Unfortunately I don't live in the Bay Area so I can't go here as often as I would like but I definitely will be coming back here the next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: S D.

description:
great food as always , 

just didn't know why they ad the tips when we only 3 people eating and i work in this business !!
author: Love F.

description:
I have been a fan of Osha since they were back in the lowly little Tenderloin.  Unfortunately, it seems the bigger they grew and franchised their level of quality has dropped. 

Back in the Tenderloin, you felt you stumbled on the tastiest piece of Thai heaven.  Authentic, delicious wonderfulness.  But when they expanded, so did their prices and what use to be great cheap eats, became overpriced and I resorted to only eating there when I felt like splurging on delivery. 

I have to say I was absolutely appalled with how difficult the staff at the 2nd Street location was when I tried to call the last time I had the urge for Osha. 

Apparently, they no longer deliver to Hayes Valley.  I was given the run around from four different people who all seemed confused as to where they did deliver to.  Finally, they talked to their manager who said unless I was willing to spend $100 - they wouldn't deliver  to Hayes Valley.   They even argued that I never had had delivery from Osha-- even though I had just months prior.  They suggested I call another location, guess what same run around.   Since when is Hayes Valley-- ghost town ?? 

I might have been willing to pick up- however it was the rude gentleman at the 2nd street location who felt the need to threaten and argue with me about ever having delivery.  Yet then still backed that if I spend enough, they would.  And in the end hung up on me.  

Quality Customer Service-- I think not.
author: chri l.

description:
My favorite Thai place in SF.

The GOOD:
--  reasonable prices.  although it looks like they've raised prices since I was last here (~ 2 years)
--  awesome food!  i've pretty much tried the whole menu and everything tastes good.  i used to eat here once a week when I lived one block away.
--  free hot tea.

The BAD:
--  bathroom is dirty so be careful if you need to go.
--  service can be slow when it gets really busy.

This last trip, we ordered, lat nah, fried chicken wings, papaya salad, and mango w/ sticky rice.  Total damage = $36 including tip.
author: Byoung Kyu S.

description:
This  is a bit better than the one in the mission but just because I don't have to sit in the lap of probably what would have been a pretentious person ( I am just too bitter) in a 100 dollar t-shirt.

Ok so the food, washed out thai food, maybe that is what people think that I want when I say EXTRA EXTRA spicy, nope, I mean EXTRA spicy and no place has so far given me that (except Sai Jai).
So the food is not making me long back to Thailand for sure.

I don't even remember how the service was but I am sure they were nice.

No, you are so close to Sai Jai, go there instead!
author: cecilia k.

description:
HATE REVIEWS here we go again~

walked into the door and being seated at this table that is right across from entrance, which means, the San Francisco chilly hawling wind will blow on me every time someone walks in/out.  

"can i.. umm.. can we sit at another table please? it is really cold~" kat in her forever sheepish voice when it comes to making request.

"that will be another 20 minutes wait!" 

okay, no then, it was 9 o'clock and my stomach was grumbling like a taiko performance and my feet hurt like a mofo.

while flipping through their mundane menu, i felt the cold air sneaked into my head-to-toe dawn jacket once again, door opened, two 6 feet tall caucasian business men in grey suits walked in, "Two please", in their forever confident voice.

guess what happened next?  they were seated at a nice little booth in the corner that's nice and warm with lovely candlelight that creates great pore-minimizing effect.

i ain't being hyper sensitive here but i confirmed with the hostess in a coy way that they do not take reservation that is under 5 people!  SO SCREW YOU OSHA I'M OUTTA HERE!  and you'll be forever on my black list known as the O'SHIT THai~
author: Kat S.

description:
The cheapest Osha in town. Interior is slightly used and the bathroom is not to recommend
However the food is excellent as in all Osha's in town and there is nothing more to add.
Oh wait they are open at night up to 3 or 4am! Wooohooo!
author: Sonja S.

description: I have been to a couple of thai restaurants.  This one is pretty good, but not amazing.  The food was good, but pretty greasy.  It was packed, and we were there at midnight.  I will go again, but maybe at an earlier hour.
author: Anna T.

description:
We've had 3 issues with ordering over the phone - we won't be ordering there again.

Strike 1: I called to order curry puffs and laht nah and the woman on the phone said "what kind of beef do you want?"  Unfortunately, she had to say it several times before I understood her (I apologized profusely, but I couldn't understand what she was asking), and when I finally did understand I said "chicken" and she said "OK" and hung up on me.  I didn't have confidence that the food would be there or that it would be untainted when I picked it up, so I didn't.

Strike 2: A couple of weeks later, I called again - prepared this time for the question.  I got a different person on the phone, ordered successfully, went and picked it up, but their prices went up again.  The food was good and it was the correct order, but I can't believe I paid over $30 for soup, noodles and an appetizer.

Strike 3: Ordered again tonight.  They didn't ask for my name.  Mr. C went to pick it up, but couldn't remember exactly what we ordered.  The woman at the counter said "I don't have any orders for xxxx."  He asked to look at the tags for her take out orders because he felt she didn't understand what he was asking.  She said he couldn't - but he also said she spoke very softly and with a pronounced accent and that it was really loud in there so he couldn't understand what she was saying.  There was a guy standing next to her (probably the one who took my order, but maybe not) and he wasn't helpful either.  I guess she thought he was going to snake someone else's food.  He told her he would go home and they would lose the money on the order, but she didn't seem to care.

So, we are done.  The food is good, but it's just as good at Bang San and Sai Jai Thai and they actually ALLOW us to pick up food that we ordered.  

Sorry Osha.
author: Suze C.

description:
Osha Thai is a great place to kickstart your night as it combines great ambience with great food. Trouble though is finding parking in the beginning and the waits tend to be on the longer side especially on Fri nights.

Portions are average and prices are indeed on the steeper sides but creativity and taste do justify it. They also really BUMP the music so don't expect any great conversations..LOL.

I swear when I went there were 6 birthdays which result in the lights beeing dimmed, a gong being rung, and drunken people singing the worst renditions of Happy Birthday...EVER.
author: Joe C.

description:
When I think of mouth watering thai food, a great big bowl of duck noodle soup never fails to instigate my drooling............until now. psh.

Actually..... it wasn't bad. It was actually pretty good BUT you could get 2 bowls for $13 at any other thai restaurant. For $13, I would think that we would be served extravagant, over the top duck noodle soup. I was hoping for it to be anything better than what was presented to our table, but my greatest fear was disturbingly not a dream. DUN DUN DUN....it was......soooo..... NORMAL. In fact, it was TOO normal, I could even say it was boring, so boring that I would probably not go back. 

I hope this review is legitimate since I was kinda drunk. Is it just me, but isn't food suppose to taste like heaven when your drunk?! 
And again folks, $13 for VERY AVERAGE duck noodle soup does not make a happy camper.
author: emily g.

description:
It's the best place to go after a night of partying if ur not interested in Jack in the box or el farlito. I almost never go here in the daylight, so I can never figure out if I like this place because it's good or it's good because it    Satisfies  my Aching hunger after a night of partying. Thai boat noodle, angel wings, and papaya salad. Mango and rice dessert is the best I've ever had(haven't had too many).  I guess the  3 stars are for the hours of operation. The foods pretty basic. Nothing more, nothing less.
 
I know I like  the OSHA on Valencia street. The atmosphere is nicer and they have a bigger and prettier selection. Tuna tataki, HIT!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Osha's has got to be one of my favorite places to hit up after a trip to the city; from a day of shopping to a night at the clubs. The dishes here will fill any cravings!

I came here after clubbing with my friend based on the following simple yet sometimes difficult parameters- it had to be delicious and open after 2am! Osha-our first thought. Usually there's a line around that time because everyone's trying to cooldown off their buzz, but we got there a bit earlier and beat the line and got seated right away. The staff seem to be really well trained in dealing with a crowd so they can turn tables faster, which explained how we got our waters from another waiter immediately as the first one seated us and we were given suggestions for that evening. 

We ordered the Angel Wings, pineapple fried rice and the Osha Tom Yum noodles (medium). The wings claim to be crispy, but after being served in the house sauce they soften up a bit; that's the only gripe I have, otherwise these wings are great- large portions and the house sauce that resembles a tamarind glaze makes this dish an amazing starter! Even the crispy basil garnish is delicious! The pineapple fried rice and tom yum noodles are both dishes you have to at least one of when you come here. The cooks seem to always have a really loose hand when it comes to adding in the chicken, shrimp and veggies and the subtle pineapple essence really pulls the whole dish together; always with a welcoming slight sweet taste. The osha  tom yum noodle dish is a combination of sour and spice, something you don't get often, but is an incredible combination. I would normally get simply the broth, but for just a few more dollars you can get the noodles complete with a large portion of meat, fish balls and veggies, which in the soup really absorb the all the tom yum flavor.

This place has yet to disappoint, if you're looking for really good Thai food, check this place out; if you're not sure what to eat go to Osha's on Geary!!!
Some of the most delicious and unforgettable Thai dishes I've ever had have been from this restaurant.
author: Jon K.

description: Glad that this location is open late. It's not as good as the one on Embarcadero. Although, the menu is the same. The food & portions were good. I had the volcano beef which was tender & flavorful. Also had the angel wings appetizer. Was also good & had a sweet sauce. Along with Pad Tai & crab fried rice. The crab fried rice was cooked to perfection.
author: Ed P.

description: Sorry Osha, I have to drop you down to 4 stars at your Geary St. location due to the trendy makeover and increase in prices.
author: Alex R.

description:
When looking for this place, I did not know what to expect. When we finally found it, it turned out to look more like a diner than a thai place. Once inside the decor was a bit odd to me as well. Strange white, plastic, art decor looking chairs filled the mainly black dining area. The environment was not too inviting. 

Anyways, this place is not bad as far as the food goes.  Out of all the dishes we got in our group, the Spicy Dice was definitely the best. The salmon was perfectly cooked and was well complemented by the curry type sauce. The dish I ordered for myself was the Duck Noodle Soup. I felt that both the duck and the broth were a bit plain. This of course was saved by the fact that the serving size was huge. 

This place seems like a great spot for some quick thai food if you're from the area. I definitely would not go out of my way to go here as there are far better and cheaper places for thai.
author: Jeff C.

description:
Spring Rolls and Pad Thai oh my!  I really am glad I brought my best friend who came into town to ring in my 32nd year on earth to Osha.  After a long day of wine tasting in Napa we went back to the hotel and sobered up and then she was like well what's for dinner and I knew I wanted to go try Osha.  I had a few friends tell me it was fun, good drinks and great Thai so we walked about 4 blocks and into Osha we went.

It was a Saturday night about 9pm and we were surprised to be seated right away - there were tons of large parties and we were seated right by the bar.  The restaurant is very nightclubby.  Young waiters with hip hair cuts carrying trendy looking drinks and all to techno music.  It was a fun vibe.

The food was very good.  We decided to get Spring Rolls, beef rolls and then for our main dishes Scallops and Pad Thai of course.  Because we both drank a bit too much in the afternoon we stuck with something with a kick - Thai Ice Teas.  The flavors of our food were authentic and spiced just right.  I prefer my Thai spicy and they of course have the peppers to spice it up too!  

Fun, great food and easy to get to on foot or even using BART.  I recommend you give this place a spot!
author: Heidi S.

description:
Let me just say I drove here from San Jose with by BF as I was recovering from the stomach flu just for some roasted duck curry, pad thai and rice. oh yea.. and water too. this is my favorite thai place! I think all the dishes are very tasty. 

This specific location is great after a night out clubbing in sf.
author: Priscilla S.

description:
I LOVE the decor in this place, very trendy and modern. When you enter the restaurant, there's a lounge side and a restaurant side. I can definitely see this being a great place just to relax with friends and get a drink. 

The service? It was okay. It wasn't bad but it wasn't great either. 

The food? It was a hit or miss.
We ordered the pad see ew, which was good but then again, you can never really go wrong with this dish. If you come here, definitely order coconut rice because that was DELICIOUS. Rice is rice but coconut rice makes it actually enjoyable all on its own. I love the slight sweetness to it. Now the garlic pepper pork was ehhh, or according to my bf "the worst I've ever had" It was dry, I felt like I was at those cheap places where you can get the same thing for $2 no good. We tried the Long Island Iced Thai Tea which was good and REALLY strong so if that's what you like, then you should try this.
author: Diana Y.

description:
I used to come to this place a few times a month. Granted, it was always after a night out, but my recent trip here left me disappointed. Maybe I haven't been here in a while and have since discovered other really good thai places but the usual orders (combo fried rice and pad thai) were not only very bland..but well, okay actually that was it. it was really bland! Throw in a appetizer of egg rolls (which looked like 3 miniature rolls) and the total was $30...it didn't really seem worth it, especially due to the bad taste experience of the food. 

I'm giving 3 stars because this place was once so excellent, i'm pretty sure i used to go out just so i could come here after.
author: Natalie J.

description:
Thai food is one of my favs so I was thrilled when one of my friends took me here when we stayed in the city. It was a Sat. night and it was pretty packed.. we had to wait about 15 min for a table for 6, not bad. I ordered the yellow panang curry and it came with a side of rice. It was cooked to perfection.. I just wish their chicken was cut into smaller pieces.

My friend ordered the pad thai but made a huge mistake by telling them to make it spicier because YOWZA did they make it spicy! He was sweating bullets... no joke. So be aware, don't ask them to spice it up because they damn sure will!! ( only if you can really handle it!)

BTW it's open till 3AM how freakin cool is that?!!
author: Mandee B.

description:
We went twice in the span of a couple days. Friday night at about 10:30 and Sunday night at about 1:00 AM.

Friday: Headed there after a recommendation from the front desk of our hotel. Waited for about 20 minutes for a table, and we were made to wait in the corner of the restaurant... real strange. We got two dishes, Yellow Curry and Yellow Sea (Yellow Curry with all the sea creatures you can imagine... including a crab claw and real tasty duck meat). Both were real tasty. If we had only gone this time, 4 stars for sure.

Sunday: Left the bar and needed food... bad. Found out the place was open and went immediately. No wait this time, just sat down and ordered. Yellow Curry and Spicy Eggplant (extra spicy). Yellow Curry was the same quality as the time before, but it came in a much smaller bowl. The price hadn't changed, but there was at least 30% less food. The spicy eggplant came and was certainly tasty, but hardly spicy. Sriracha was needed in a hurry. Anyways, 2 stars means "Meh, I've experienced better" and I had... at the same place a couple nights beforehand. 

(2+4)/2 = 3! 

I still wish anyplace in Olympia was open as late as this, a Thai place especially.
author: Nick W.

description: Love this place!! Cashew chicken and yellow curry all the way!! :) Park in the garage for easy access
author: Shannon J.

description: Decent papaya salad but not spicy enough even after I asked for very spicy.  I'm the papaya salad master so I would rate it a 6 out of 10. Looks old on outside, inside is nice enough. Had a good champagne lycee mango cocktail. Pad see eaw was so good. Flavorful slippery soft noodles. Good portion sizes.
author: Kasey H.

description: I remember when I went to this one on GEARY, it was a lot better before. Service was average. We got there before the crowd that night-about 1:30 a.m. Ordered the green beans, duck curry, and the pad siu. Green beans comes with rice now. I don't want more rice! :O( Anyways, the food was average tasting. I like the one on Valencia better. Quality of food is better tasting and offers more variety.
author: Jennifer G.H. W.

description: Best Duck Curry Ever! I came here on a date with my boyfriend and I loved it! The service and food was amazing!
author: Erin H.

description: A very satisfied tourist ate here 2 nights in a row when there were 100's of other places to choose. Osha delivers but my heart still lies at LA's Thai restaurants. For you Thai fever food lovers, get Tom Ka Kai with the meal. Finish off with mango sticky rice. WORD.
author: Champ M.

description:
This is my go to spot when I'm in the city. Osha has a pretty good variety of my favorite Thai Dishes. Panang Curry, Green Curry, and Roast Duck Curry are always good here. Other things that are good here are the Pad Kee Mao, Pad See Ew, and Pad Thai. Good general idea of just your average Thai dishes. 

Another great thing is the late night. I'm usually here till late, and the fact that this is open after a late night makes it all the much better. 

I'm a big fan of the roast duck curry. The balance of flavors is definitely something I look forward when I order this. Makes it all the better when you have it with just plain white rice. No need to mix it up with the fried rices. 

I definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a good late night meal in the city.
author: Richard L.

description: I have had the volcanic beef twice and both experience have been really good. When I go to SF I come here for lunch. Service and atmosphere is great.
author: Jan Michel P.

description:
This place is fantastic! I have gone to this Osha Thai on several different occasions and have never tried anything that I didn't like. My absolute favorite dish that everyone should try is the Crab Fried Rice. It's amazing! Other dishes that I have tried here are Panang Curry, Pad Khee Mao Noodles, and Spicy String Beans...all very delicious! I don't eat my food very spicy so my friends usually hate eating Thai food with me, but the food at Osha is really good even without the extra kick which is why we still go there together all the time, haha. And it's open till 3am on the weekends, perfect for after-hours pigging out! 

Can't wait to go back for some more Crab Fried Rice!
author: Jessica S.

description: Lots of yummy curry. Went with a group late at night, tried all the dishes and everyone was happy!
author: Chris M.

description: Key phrase "used to be good". New prices with shitter food. As a native and speaking for natives we don't go Herr no more. This place is for new people that are pretty much falling for a tourist trap and don't know any better. This place is banking on it's hay day. That's why all the new "longterm tourist" (what us locals call you people nit from here) pay the stupid prices for food not even close to as good ad it used to be. Obviously a lot of these people eating and leaving hi stars are one not from here or two Just a follower who doesn't know how to explore and try other places (basically narrow minded). So if you want to be average and laughed at by people who know REAL good Thai food then go here!
author: Jaimito R.

description:
I keep coming back to Osha Thai. To be honest, I'm not sure why. The food is good. The portion sizes are fair. The service is acceptable. The price is just ok, especially considering the neighborhood and other cheap and authentic options are available. The atmosphere is nice, though.

The atmosphere is nice and it's definitely a good option. A place to head to as a default, since it's just a few blocks away and open late.

I'll be back Osha Thai, although I'm not sure why.
author: Jenny T.

description:
I have a love/hate relationship with this place.  Whenever I need spicy string beans with beef, I come here.  But the service is spotty and your chances of getting charged incorrectly are high.

So, here's the breakdown:
Food: 4.5
Service: 3.5
Chance of a screwy bill: HIGH!
author: Claire C.

description:
The Verdict: "Best place for sit down dining after a night of drinks"

Small tight seating, fast service and great food! I've been to Osha Thai on 2nd street and was happy to find that this smaller version of Osha was also good. We ordered tofu pad see ew, Osha Sea (light curry, kamfir lime and lots of seafood), naked shrimp. Dishes were ready and hot at our table within 8 minutes! Even though they were pretty busy, the wait staff still came back to fill our water glasses. The dishes were tasty! However, naked shrimp was a little too spicy for me and later on gave me heartburn...but that is a personal problem. When we left with our bellies full, there was a line out the door with more anxiously waiting hungry customers. 

Would  I Recommend It? Yes, I'll be back!
author: Judy P.

description:
DISAPPOINTMENT.

Osha on Geary always had the soul of a Bangkok noodle house: bright, cheap, with a long menu and full complement of ingredients at the table.  Sugar, check; Vinegar with chopped chilies, check; everything you needed to spice things up or down!

But now the original Osha has caught the "peng" (expensive) disease from its sisters: it cleaned up its act, turned down the lights, reduced the menu, and raised prices. (Well, at least you can still buy a rice plate that actually includes rice.)  Sure, it still has the full complement of flavoring agents at the table, but how does the new Osha taste?

Boring.  The pad see you wasn't well bound together, and had no pan burn.  A basil chicken just tasted like strips of chicken .... with strips of pepper ... on a bed of rice ... and oh yeah, there some basil here.  It didn't even have the anisey taste of Thai basil, or maybe it was just weak and emasculated.  The brown sauce didn't "bring the room together" -- it just moistened the ingredients a bit.

Oh well.  Thankfully I live in Berkeley.
author: Daniel S.

description:
Headed over here, late Saturday night after celebrating my cousin's birthday at John Collins.

I had never been here, but late night thai food sounded especially enticing!

Instead of getting our own plates, the 4 of us decided to eat family style so we shared:

angel wings
combination fried rice
bbq chicken
woon sen pad thai

We ordered and our food came out hecka fast...the angel wings were not the ones I expected, I thought they'd be stuffed..at least that's how I thought it'd be prepared..but they were still good none the less w/ fried pieces of basil sprinkled on top.

The combo fried rice was filled w/ meat, shrimp and chicken and was tasty...the bbq chicken was aight...nothing to write home about and the silver noodles (pad thai) was delish..

All in all, this spot definitely hit the spot after a night of drinking!
author: Jade B.

description:
Late night drinking?  Need something to soak up all that alcohol that's swishing in  your stomach?  Head to OSHA!  

Osha has been my post-drinking friend for years now.  I was first introduced to Osha back in the college days, and I've been coming back ever since(too bad the prices have gone up and the portions have shrunk a bit)!  My usual drunken pick is the Thai Boat Noodle soup.  That warm broth just makes my tummy feel warm and fuzzy....or maybe that's just the alcohol.  

The best part is, this place is still good even when you're sober!  For a while, I would come here after my training runs....burn the calories and then comsume them right back.  My favorite picks are the duck fried rice, pineapple fried rice, crab fried rice, Osha spicy pan fried noodles,  and spicy eggplant rice plate.  

If you decide to make a post-party pit stop and grab a bite, don't show up at 2:45(they close at 3am) or you'll get the evil eye!!  And parking is a biatch at that time, too!
author: Patra I.

description:
solid 3 stars in my book

a bit overpriced, duck curry offered here many different selections spicy, sweet, all tasty bit oily on most dishes i tried, good for groups of folks who have never been to a tha i resturant that is in the city, ambiance speak trendy and expensive, full bar good drinks again pricey cuz of area.

food *** most main dishes i tried a bit oily
service **** very h elpful and informative about all dishes and drinks
price $$$ kinda pricey thai food, good for groups roughly big groups 10-15 folks
author: Clarence A.

description: Loud lunch, yeah!  Really a lot of food, hustled to fast turning tables.   Great decor, andthe staff protects it.  Everyone got a plastic cover for their drippy umbrellas before begin seated.  Fresh roses in a water bowl between the wash basins in the ladies room was a good touch.  Ill return for the lychee tea alone, complete with a whole, sweet lychee.
author: Jamie R.

description: the go to thai spot. they make me salmon with yellow curry (all salmon) not on the menu. like adult candy!
author: Chucky B.

description: I've been going here for almost 10 years...love it! The thai boat noodles are my absolute favorite, they take me back to Thailand everytime I start with my first bite. I'm addicted! I've tried to order other items but why stop and really good thing.  Word to the wise they get super busy, so arrive at a decent hour. Enjoy!
author: Kristy W.

description:
TWO THINGS...

1. DUCK glazed over bok choy

2. PINEAPPLE fried rice

YUM!
author: Chantie G.

description:
So far, I'm a fan.  Had my first thai iced tea in SF, and it was nice...not too sweet.  Nice portions...I got the red curry with tofu, and it was enough to have din-din last night AND leftovers for tonight.  Mmmmmmm.....

Glad this is in my 'hood!
author: Kat M.

description: I've been going here for so many years now.. before they renovated and got all trendy. Food is still delicious! Tom yum yum yum, green curry in my tummy, pad Thai me up.. can't get enough!
author: April L.

description:
Birthday Dinner?

This place will not be the place to have a birthday dinner or no special dinner I can say.  This place looks like an ordinary casual place to have a bite to each.  Looks more like a place to have a quick lunch or something.  This place was a good place to each after dancing or something.

Taste: 3.5 Stars
Price: 3 Stars
Customer Service: 2.5 Stars

I think this place is overpriced.  If you go to places in Berkeley, they have some pretty good places to eat and also it's about 10 bucks person.
author: Phung N.

description: The place looks overall very hip, with a dark interior, 270 degree bar on the ground level and an offset floor with dining tables. We had a pretty unpleasant experience - to be fair it was not a peak meal time (~4-5 PM), and possibly a singular experience. We walked in and got a table, and then started to hear this tremendously loud drilling. It turned out the bathroom was being worked on (so we couldn't use it), and there were construction workers ~20 feet from the table pounding / drilling away to install a sink. My green curry was fatty with a pretty mild flavor and a pretty small portion, and the service was a little distracted / impatient. Nina's brother did seem to really enjoy his dish, a chicken fried rice. Overall, I can see the potential of the place in its prime condition, but my one experience was not a great one.
author: Madalina B.

description:
I'd like to think that I've eaten enough Thai food in my life to know and appreciate when a restaurant has a winning combination of food, service and atmosphere. Osha failed pretty hard on the food front with their uninspired dishes. I had the tomyum soup, which was good, but no better than one I could make with some tomyum paste and hot water. The BBQ chicken was equally uninspired and bordered on bland.

After two mediocre experiences with Osha Thai, I'm going to do my best to stay away.
author: Badier V.

description:
After you've worn out your welcome with too many cocktails at Rye, the only sensible thing to do is go next door to Osha Thai. My friends had told me this was the best Osha of them all -- what, are there 5 now? -- and they were right. This is the original, after all.

I love that I can be rowdy here with a big group of friends, shovel in the drunk food, taxi it home and then curl up in bed with a full belly. The spicy diced salmon curry brought me out of my drunken haze right quick, and the pad see ew and pineapple rice were so comfortingly tasty they sent me right back into a stupor. 

Thank you, Osha. I would be hung over and waking up slowly in a Tenderloin back alley if not for you.
author: Nicole G.

description:
this place is easily one of my favorite places for thai food in the city. i've never had a single dish here that i didn't like, and everything is always steaming hot. the noodle dishes are absolutely stellar, my favorites being pad khee mao and pad see ew. also, roast duck fried rice gets an honorable mention.

but then again, I always mess up my pad khee mao by dumping half the container of dry chilies/ hot sauce on it....

it's not thai food unless my face is red, my lips are swollen, and beads of sweat show up on my forehead.
author: Ben T.

description:
I've been to this Osha three times now. The food is always good and the prices and portions can't be beat. I have tried the Thom Ka with shrimp (it is awesome) but beware of the pieces of lemongrass sprigs, these are in the broth to enhance the flavor not to be consumed, they are very tough. 

The Volcano Beef, amazing, love the onion rings and the meat is very tender. I've had several of the curries, the yellow curry with potatoes, could bring more potatoes, other than that it's good. The pumpkin curry was sweet and tasty. The pad thai was substantial and tasted great. I like their steamed rice, but wish it came with the main dishes so that you don't have to order rice as a side and pay extra. Still it is all very affordable. Best of all the food comes out rather quick. Perfect if you are really hungry and want a good meal fast. 

The servers are okay, sometimes you have a hard time flagging one down because they get busy at night and on weekends. The techno music is ever present but not obtrusive.
author: Fabiola M.

description:
So one time I was at work, and my boss told me to juggle bricks while walking down stairs. We were out of safety helmets, but when I brought this up he only added more bricks to my already overstressed juggling load. Now, this is already pretty unsafe, but just wait, it gets worse. You see, as I was walking down the stairs, it turns out my co-workers had forgotten to pick up his 70's style disco roller-skates! Oh man, you can imagine where this is going I'm sure! Yep, that's right, I put on the roller-skates and continued on my way down the flight of stairs. When I arrived at the bottom the ENTIRE FLOOR COLLAPSED FROM UNDERNEATH ME.

When I awoke from my coma, I decided that I'd had enough of this unsafe work environment and decided to call O.S.H.A (That's the Occupational Safety and Health Administration) and report them for an unsafe work environment. So, I called 411 and asked for OSHA and they gave me the number. I called said number, they gave me the address and I went right over.

IT WAS A THAI RESTAURANT!  

Oh man was I ticked, but I figured hey, if I'm already there and my legs are both broken from falling 2 stories, why not sit down and have some dinner? I ordered the Pad Thai. It was DELICIOUS; extremely well balanced with just the right amount of magical Thai herbs and spices.

The service was extremely good (and guys ((and some girls)) the waitresses here are really hot!) they kept my drink filled to the brim with ice cold water. Oh, and speaking of ice, the ice here is AWESOME! I don't know how they do it, but its really soft and edible and makes for awesome ice water. Seriously, I've never had a better glass of ice water before or since! 

Anyways, back to the service: it's impeccable. Very prompt, and extremely friendly. All other restaurants should take notice here, because this place sets the bar quite high!

I'm giving this place 5 stars: the price, food and service add up to an awesome experience, even if they couldn't help me with my carpentry catastrophe.
author: Adam M.

description:
I've eaten at the Osha's on 2nd & Valencia and have had great meals there. Hit this one on Geary thinking it'd be the same.

This was horrible. They served shrimp that was black & rotten in the middle. Not under cooked; spoiled. Showed it to the waitress and she didn't care; in fact, she never came back again. Rest of the dishes were meh, so we focused on the shredded iceburg lettuce. 

Needed to wave my arm like a windshield wiper to get somebody to finally come over and give us our check. 

Rotten food, horrible service. Should have hit Thai House Express or Lers.
author: Floyd L.

description:
The great, and rare, combination of inexpensive food, great service and techno.

This Osha was one of the first restaurants in SF I ever ate at back in '99  ( before there were other copies of it around the city and even before this exact site was the size it is today ) and I've never had a bad meal there whether it was 1PM or 1AM.

Try the Osha Spicy Dice  ( the salmon just melts in your mouth ), the Pad Khee Mao and the Pineapple Fried Rice.
author: Mike J.

description:
Went here for lunch after actually stumbling on it (even though I had gotten recommendations to go to Osha, it hadn't made the list of places to check out for dinner). It was on the direct path from our hotel to the waterfront, so we went. I can't say I would have sought it out otherwise because, quite honestly it was nondescript. 

In any case, the food was, well...Thai food. Good, satisfies the appetite, has a kick...nothing exceptional. In my experience with Thai food, that's pretty par for the course for any restaurants I've been to in the US (going to Thailand for actual Thai food is of course, a whole different story). 

So, a good fix, not sure (based on my assessment of the environment) I'd really ever make it a destination for dinner.
author: Purvi R.

description:
EDIT 11/17/07:  The peanut sauce tasted like it was out of a can...or housed in the bathroom.  Wherever it came from, I still ate it all, so I can't fault them too much.

----------------------

Everything here is pretty average.  It's close to so many better Thai places that I can't justify giving Osha more than three stars.  

The space is cramped.  It always seems busy, but the wait area is tiny--four chairs situated in the corner, which, unless you want to spread your legs out onto the laps of the people sitting adjacent to you, really only seats three.

I will say that the food came out quickly despite it being a full house.  But the dishes also didn't come out at the same time.  The exterior is janky looking, which fits into the TL scene.  Just as the SOMA Osha has a more trendy feel to it.  

The upside to this restaurant are its late hours, open till 3 a.m., Fri-Sun.  Otherwise, I'd say opt for Thai House Express a few blocks away.  Osha is a popular spot, but in the end, it ain't worth the wait.
author: Marsha Z.

description: If you are looking for some really good Thai food this is a solid choice. Their Pad Thai is really flavorful and the service is very prompt. I really enjoyed the crab fried rice as did my wife and she's the picky one! If I'm in the area again I will certainly be back.
author: Chris J.

description:
This is one of the absolute worst dining experiences I have ever had.

The food was decent and service was decent until it was time to pay.

THEN, service goes way down hill. no more water, no checking on us, nothing.

a group of 5 of us and we ask for separate checks. the waiter promptly says "no. no way possible." ok, fine, it happens. We get the ca$h out, figure who is paying the remainder on their card, who goes to ATM, who owes who, etc.

AH, here is where it gets good.  He gives us a check with 20% gratuity added to it. yea right pal.
