We call him over to tell him to remove that and charge the rest without the gratuity to my friend's card and that we will decide our own tip for his services. Sure thing, he says. but what does he do? includes it anyway.

We ask why we can't decide our own tip for him. He says it's their policy and it's stated on the menu for groups of 5 or more.  Well, we'll just have to take a look at that policy ourselves, we respond.  He goes to get a menu for us, looks at the back, then puts the menu back down.  So we take matters into our own hands.

We grab a menu from the front and right there on the back it says in plain English: "Gratuity of 20% added to parties of 6 or more."

6. not 5.

I complain to the guy showing him the text.  He says he can't cancel the transaction and he already swipe the card. We ask for a manager; he says he'll get him; instead, he walks off, keeps on serving tables and doesn't get anyone. 

So, I find him myself and have to force him to give us our money back.

IF YOU WANT TO MARGINALLY ENJOY YOUR FOOD WITH BAD SERVICE AND A PAINFUL PAYMENT PROCESS, EAT HERE. BE MY GUEST, BECAUSE I CERTAINLY WON'T.
author: Victor B.

description: This was the first Osha we ate at and based on that transcendent green curry experience, we tried out the other location near the Marina. THIS is the one to go to. That green curry is like an other-worldly magic sauce. Put it on anything and it's fantastic. It's also the only Osha that always has mango and stick rice regardless of seasonality. Stick to the Thai dishes; don't meander off and try the Wonton soup. For price, consistency and late hours of up to 4AM, this place is hard to beat and is still my favorite price for value Thai in the City.
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
I came here for lunch, and it was delicious!  The interior was nice and modern.  The only downside was that it didn't have that family-owned, authentic feeling I'm used to in Thai restaurants.  However, it's nice to have a great chain thai restaurant with so many locations in the city.

The menu had a ton of choices... lots of curries, noodles, and rice plates.  The portions were big but not expensive at all, and the waitress refilled my water glass about every 3 minutes.  Great service and very tasty chicken with cashews!  I will definitely be back.
author: Laura W.

description:
Now THIS location is my favorite!  Although the decor or location is not to par with the others - namely 2nd fav Embarcadero location, this one is the one my friends and I have been going to for about 10yrs.  My then friend (now husband), introduced my friends and I to this restaurant way back in the day.  We came here after the club, on Sunday afternoons, and just because we were starving for Thai food.

We always start off with the papaya salad (which in my culture is slightly different from the Thai version - ours have a shrimp paste).   Then we have the usual - and this NEVER changes - beef phad see yu, fried chicken over fried rice, osha sea curry, and green chicken curry (you can never have enough curry) - with sticky rice (gotta have sticky rice!).  And like clockwork, everything comes out within 10 minutes or less.  All dishes are hot, fresh off the stove, and delicious, full of flavor.  We always ask for "spicy" and when we do, it means Thai spicy, not taco bell spicy (hey, we're southeast asians - gotta represent).  Of course, the staff always looks at us like we're crazy.  Just because we're not Thai, doesn't mean we don't know spicy.

Parking is always crazy but if you circle around a few times within the two block radius, you're sure to find someone leaving or a vacant spot.  Pricing here is better than the other locations.  Food is served faster.  Last time we were there, there still wasn't any cocktails on the menu but at least there is beer now.  The staff has been the same forever - they are like robots sometimes.  They seat you, take your order, bring out the food, etc... that's about as friendly as they get.  I really don't recommend this place for a fancy nite on the town or a large group.  But, this place is the ONLY place in the SF Bay Area that serves authentic Thai food to the T - take it from a Southeast Asian born and bred.
author: Yee C.

description:
I LOVE Osha Thai.  I can't believe I haven't already reviewed it.  I love it because the food is great, because the Thai iced tea is great, and because it's fun to watch my husband and the waitstaff struggle with each other's accents.

We were there at 2am and people were still pouring in...yet they managed not to irritate us.  For a medium sized restaurant with essentially no waiting area they really manage the crowd well.  The people before us were seated and served before us and the people after us were seated and served after us...just as it should be!

My yellow curry was like ambrosia, as in the food of the Gods...not the fruit salad.  My husband's spicy eggplant was not spicy enough for him (which I'll admit is a little strange for a Thai place) but still good.  So...they lose one star for that and their nasty unisex bathroom.

Man...I wish I had a Thai iced tea right now...
author: PrincessPeac H.

description: Every time I've been to this Osha location I have been disappointed with the food but I've had some good food at the Valencia location. Maybe it's the ambiance or lack thereof at the Geary location. Or maybe it's that their main rush is in the middle of the night when drunken fools come in with little to no expectation so they feel they can slack off a bit in the food dept.
author: Regina C.

description: Love the Thai beef salad! It's the only reason I go to this location. It gets pretty busy for dinner time but the one thing that prevents it from getting 5 stars is the uncomfortable seating! Wood benches? Smh
author: Lex K.

description:
It's open till 3 in the morning and they have great duck fried rice.  Man, Asian food in the bay area seems to be a notch above the stuff here in L.A.  Why?

Must be a convergence thing, mo' Asians better food, I guess.

My first "find" in S.F. with many more to come, hopefully.

hi, Stephy.
author: Anton E.

description: Pad Sew Ew was amazingly good! Of course other dishes are good too... but I have to make a note on this one as my newest discover.
author: Flora F.

description: Wow. This place has gone waaaaay downhill. I used to eat here all the time a few years ago and would take friends here etc. I thought it was better than Thai Stick. Anyway, last night I went back for the first time in a while and it was creepy. I get the same thing every time and it just didn't taste good last night. Everything tasted like it was low quality. There were fruit flies buzzing around me while I ate, and the waitress wouldn't bring the check when we were done. I finally got sick of sitting in this swarm of flies that live off of rotting food and went to the counter, where the ignoring continued. I was finally able to convince someone to let me pay and I left. Probably for the last time.
author: Noah P.

description: Pretty standard stuff.  Nice because it's open late but gets a large after bar/club crowd so be prepared to fight for seats or wait.
author: Ken L.

description:
good, cheap, fast, tasty late night food. AND they serve alcohol, to keep the buzz buzzing. what else can you ask for.

try the basil chicken and anchor steam..they hit the spot. 

BAD
- only 1 bathroom
- may have to wait some time around 1am ish
- take out is not as good as eating there
- get some random drunk ppl here all the time
- staff is semi friendly

GOOD
- beer
- cheap
- fast
- good enough food
- thai iced tea
- basi chicken
- fried tofu
author: Bobby B.

description:
I come here all the time. The location can be sketchy and the menu is limited and not the same as the other locations.  For instance, the volcano beef is not offered here and the broth for their tom yum soups is kind of weird.  Don't get the noodle soups, blech.

With all of those detriments, why have I reviewed this location and not the others?   Allow me to list the Pros:

1.  Much less chance of a wait
2.  Open late
3.  Menu might be limited, but food quality and portions are excellent
4. Iced Coffee in big glass compared to the fancy shmancy skinny glass at the 2nd St. location
5.  No flash and no pretention.  You can come here in pajamas and no make-up and fit right in.

For me, those five things are worth four stars, easily.   They also are usually good about paying attention to my When-Harry-Met-Sally-style of nitpicky ordering and making sure my dishes come cilantro-free.   I love that I can walk in here at almost any time and immediately get seated.  Service and (most of) the food is really good.  Sure, I could make the effort to get volcano beef at one of the other Osha's, but the convenience of this one will always make it win as my first choice.
author: Courtney Y.

description: I liked this place. It had a laid back atmosphere that had a kind of cool red and black vibe. The I thought the food was wonderful, I had the pumpkin curry and the pad see ew. They were both totally divine. The service, however, was a bit spotty. It didn't seem like the server and the the expeditor had much communication. I went with a large group, which I admit generally causes complications for a server with so many orders and checks and such. Two people ordered and then asked for their orders to come out with everyone else's as no one else had arrived and they were trying to get things going. Their food came out at least three times before they told the poor food runner just to leave it. I would suggest coming with a smaller group because the food is absolutely worth a shot.
author: Adrienne N.

description:
There's no denying the quality of their dishes...primo for sure - my only beef with this location is that they bring out your dishes whenever they see fit.

We ordered one appetizer and two entrees.  One entree and the appetizer came out within ten minutes...delicious to say the least.  Just as we were finishing them and wondering where the other entree was - the waiter informed us that they were out of that particular entree.   What in tarnation?  Shouldn't he have informed us of this earlier.  He didn't offer me a comparable substitute, nor did he seem apologetic.

The result?  A one dollar tip.  This all could have been avoided with simple communication.

What started off as a fantastic lunch left a bittersweet taste in my mouth.

Osha - you've done this twice to me now.  Do I look like a sucker?  Please don't do it again.
author: Mc Matty b.

description:
Back when I used to stay up all hours, Osha was a Godsend.  Now it's just my favorite Thai in a city where the number of Thai restaurants has reached plague proportions.  

Minus one extra star for the dine-in experience.  It's so dark and claustrophobic.  And I'm ashamed to say it but I can't stand how there is always someone (often aggressively) panhandling right outside.  The last time I ate there by the window one guy stood there doing tricks with his cigarette for half the meal until another took his place and kept trying to sell me grubby jewelry.

Favs at Osha- angel wings, both egg rolls, fried chicken salad, cashew chicken, fried garlic and pepper, spicy string beans, and especially sweet sticky rice with mango.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Maybe it was just my compromised state last night, but I swear food has never tasted so good.

I'll fully admit the service here is borderline.  Our table ordered three dishes, received two right away, and almost forgot about the third entirely.  Then as we were wrapping things up to meet the rest of our party, our waiter finally brought out our Pad Thai.  I might normally be mad about that, but we just shrugged our shoulders, served it up, and scarfed it down.  I don't think the plate even hit the table.

The food was just too good to get upset over the little things, and for late-night dining you can't expect too much.  It was more like a charming quirk than a significant offense--the kind of story that you can laugh about later on when you try to piece together the fuzzy details of the night before.  Maybe it's not 5-star food, and it definitely isn't 5-star service, but places like Osha are a huge part of 5-star Saturday nights.
author: Adam W.

description:
Yelp came in handy! 

My friends from Fresno came down and visited me for the weekend, one of the places I took them was here. It was close to their hotel and relatively cheap. We wanted to have Thai food that night, so we got online and found this place. Searching for nearby Thai Restaurants, we came across Osha. Ranked on average of four stars, we knew this is where we should go. 

As we came in, they welcomed us and escorted us to our table, the scenery was pretty nice for a Thai restaurant, almost trendy in design, and no feeling of Thai food being served here. The service was attentive and the food was delicious. We tried the won ton rolls, TWO yellow sea, and some Thai coffee. It was more food than we expected. We could of easily split the entree. 

So, for all those who review this place, I thank you! I was amazed and impress by this place. 

The only thing bad about this place is the restroom, you can never find a descent clean restroom anywhere in downtown San Francisco. 

From the servers, they recommended the 49, 51, and 53 entrees. One of them is the Pad Thai.
author: Stanley K.

description:
Sooooo much cheaper than the one in soma.

the hours are good too, since they are open when you leave the party and want to eat so abd you almost consider going to jack inthe box.
author: Amy Y.

description:
It's a 3 star night at my house. I'm not backing down. 

I walked into this place the other night after another successful night of drinking for free thanks to some poor startup that probably wont ever make it. Hahahah. www.thrillist.com.  Actually a decent website.

I couldn't believe this was the same Osha Thai as the ones with the cool little white chairs and the trendy hipster crowd.  I mean, there aren't any white chairs. Just cuz your the original doesn't mean you DON'T have to conform.  Your little Osha brothers and sisters are hotter by the way. Sorry, its the truth.

Anyways, I have the same internal struggle of what to order at every Thai place I go to.  I love Green Curry, but I don't want to be boring, so I order something else, eternally destined to be disappointed  because it's never as good as I hoped.

The reason why this place is getting 3 stars. 

My friend ordered the cucumber salad, after we all received our  food we asked if the salad was going to come. The lady said "you still want it?" Umm Yah we still want it. And we'll just assume you were going to apologize...Dirty pirate hooker.
author: Adam L.

description:
This is my first Yelp review.  I felt compelled to tell people about Osha's shady buisness practices.

First off let me say this.  I eat at Osha at least once a week.  I used to be in there 4-5 times a week before they raised their prices.  I love their food.  Good, decently priced food that is quick and close to my house... all good things.  

This review isn't about the food most of us agree that it is one of the best Thai joints in the area.

If you come in a group be careful.  The menu says groups of 6 or more will have an 18% gratuity added in.  I'm fine with that but the last time I was in there with a group of 5 they added it into our bill.  I would have double tipped if I didn't catch it at the last minute.  

I approached the woman at the desk about it and here response was "the menu is wrong, its supposed to say 5".  I think that BS to be honest. If the menu says 6, its 6, I don't care if you say it should be 5.  As a very frequent customer it really aggravated me.  

I might be going a little overboard with this but it just got to me.

end rant
author: Jon G.

description: I crave the beef roll, spicy egg plan with beef, catfish, vocanic beef, all of it! So full of flavor. The girls and boys behind the counter are super friendly and helpful especially if you become a regular.
author: Shen L.

description:
A date (... I actually went on a date?) drunkenly directed us here for a late night bite after having been out at a loud, packed club... and the restaurant was equally as packed with beautiful people.  Wow, I went on a date... (+1 Star)


Service was quick and functional and surprisingly attentive considering the hustle and ruckus of late night post-club diners. (+1 Star).

The food was flavorful and fast, but also missing just a little bit of finish - which, at 2 AM, isn't really necessary anyhow. (+1 Star)

Prices aren't exorbitant and portions are decent; an a la carte order of Panang Chicken Curry, side of rice, and Pad Thai were more than enough (probably too much) for the two of us, with enough food left over to feed a third person.  And we shared the Fried Banana w/Ice Cream... (+1 Star)
author: Mikey U.

description: Osha has been one of my favorite places to eat for years however they've been getting a little full of themselves. They used to be a super divey thai place with great food and great prices. In the past few years they've done their best to increase the swank factor, minimalist sheik table, matching black uniforms, ambient techno in the background. The only divey part of osha that still exists is the bathroom which is just as filthy as it always was. My real problem with their metamorphosis is that the price of the food has gone up a little while the portion size has steadily decreased. It's like watching a geeky girl you thought was hot in high school get a make over and get all boojie and snub her old friends. Don't be that girl Osha. I'll always remember the real you.
author: Nate P.

description: OSHA is my favorite Thai restaurant in SF!  I don't get down to the city too often but ALWAYS visit OSHA when I'm there.  I am in love with the pad Thai see ew w/ tofu.  The food always comes out super fast.  Everything I have tried on the menu has been awesome too.  The fried rice and soups rock!  Check them out, I strongly recommend it!  I've brought every friend to this place.
author: Sophia F.

description: Best pad see ew I've ever had. The noodles were so soft and amazing they melted in your mouth. Also the tuna tartare appetizer was really good! Id def come again...
author: Aline M.

description:
Better than your average King of Thai, but it feels dirty in here. Pros: They open til really late and food comes five minutes after you order. Cons: Bad (and that means dangerous) neighborhood with nowhere to park, and it can get really noisy in here. However, the food is definitely worth trying. I'd go here more often for a late night meal if it wasn't so out of the way.

JONSAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
Ordinarily, I would prefer to wait before giving my impression of a place like Osha Thai because I have only been there once.  But, I was pleasantly surprised.

There was funky odor emanating from god-knows-where when I entered, which I feared was a bad omen.  I had intended to hit Bang San on O'Farrell, but it closed early, and Osha Thai is open until a comfortable 1a during the week and a whopping 3a on Friday and Saturday.  Because it labels itself as a "noodle house," I opted for the Pad Kee Mao.

Now, I take my Pad Kee Mao slightly different than the average Joe.  First, it has to be vegetarian, with no oyster sauces or shrimp pastes.  As always, I like my PKM spicy (which so few places are able to manage).  I also prefer the thin rice noodles over the fat ones typically used for PKM and Pad See Ew.  I'm amazed to say this, but this was among the best PKM's I've had anywhere.  It was perfectly spiced, with just enough bite to elicit some pain, but not so much that I couldn't taste the rainbow dancing on my tongue.  Despite its description, there were many vegetables gracing the dish, and it was not greasy at all.  As much as it pains me to say it, Osha did a better job on my PKM than Modern Thai has in the past.  I liked that PKM so much, I wanted to take her home and spend the night with her.

It's definitely affection at first bite.  I hope the second date will prove as promising.

The staff was pleasant, if not reserved.   I had to stake out the waitress to tell her what a magnificent job she did with all of my tweaks..  Sigh.  I miss the sweet Thai folk from the motherland.

I'll be back, and with its late-night operations, it won't be difficult.  I reserve a three-star judgment for now because my experience is simply too limited at this point to extrapolate to the broader menu.

Still have no idea where that smell came from . . . .
author: SalsaBoy S.

description:
For as much as I love Thai food, I had never been here before.  I know it's an institution.  I know it's always winning awards.  

Still, a half hour wait on a Tuesday night for Thai food in the ghetto?  It was pretty good but not that good.  If I'm going to get hassled for change and cigarettes on my journey, the last thing I want to do is pay $11 for something that my local place charges $7.  

And honestly, it seemed whitified.  I asked for my curry medium spicy.  What I got tasted like candy - it was totally sweet without even a hint of a tingle or kick.  There was no complexity of flavor, just sweetness.   It was good - I'm never one to turn down something sweet - but it wasn't exciting.
author: Frankie D.

description:
I am a lover of Thai food.  Though I'll be the first to admit that Osha isn't the best place in the city to get Thai food, it is definitely one of the best values.  Inexpensive, quick food service and decent wait service are trademarks of Osha.  A bonus is that they're open late on the weekends for the after bar/club folks.  A solid four stars based on value.

Don't bother with the other Oshas in the city.  The food isn't nearly as cheap, not great on the taste and they're trying to be too trendy.
author: Randy C.

description:
Osha Thai.  I ate in TWO of your fine establishments in one week.  It's possible I have a problem.  An addiction to dependable and accessible Thai food perhaps.  The 2nd street location is much swankier inside, but God bless the Geary location for it's hours.  Just like Ben G. said - it rounds out my stumbly evenings in the Trendyloin.
Osha - you hit the spot.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
5 stars for being really really delicious!!  Came here with my friends and asked to be seated for 7 people.  Very crowded on a Saturday night.  Semi-cute decor but I heard the one on Embarcadero is much more glamorous.  Hmmm, sounds like a place to try next if you ask me =)

PROS:  Service I thought was friendly, but my friend on the other hand wanted to complain to the manager.  OMG, luckily she's my friend or I would've slapped her in the face for a complaint so small.  HAHAHA.   Anyways, ordered.. (of course) Pad Thai since the Coconut Curry that I wanted to try was unavailable.  Boo.  Pad Thai was verrrrrrry scrumptious and had a wonderful creamy-flavor to it.. just the perfect amount of peanut sauce where it's not too dry or its not too wet..  PERFECT!  And I also tried the Pa Ram Chicken---yummmy.  All my friends' food looked very appetizing!  Definitely had a good time here =)

CONS:  Parking was such a bitch.  Took us about 30-40 mins tryna look for parking--minus being lost for another 30 mins.  Damn SF, always has that effect on me and my friends.  NEXT TIME... I'M DRIVING!!!!  HAHAH.  Thank Goodness for my friend and a random stranger we yelled at for directions.  Needless to say, you guys are LIFE SAVERS!

Thanks to YELP, all my friends said I made a really goood choice when it comes to food.  Well, DUH =P
author: MaryGrace V.

description:
I've only been here about 5 times in the last two weeks, so I thought I might need to update this.  Their veggie pad thai is my partner's and my new addiction.  It's exactly what I need when I want a quick, yummy meal.

When NASA said they'd do things better, faster, cheaper, they should have looked to Osha.  They're doing it right.
author: Shea G.

description:
Had the Pork Pad See Ew and it was definitely delicious.

I would have to say that it was not spectacularly better than other Thai places such as...Sai Jai Thai.

Taking the food togo might have had something to do with it considering the other food int he restaurant looked amazing, but if you're just in the mood for some quick and cheap Thai food, $10 for Pad See Ew might be much.

Should check out their other stuff soon though for a more thorough tasting.
author: Jason K.

description: hands down the best Thai food I've had in the Bay Area. Their curries are awesome as well!
author: Lorrie M.

description:
Last week I searched for a Thai place that would actually put some heat in the flavor but didn't try Osha because of the mixed reviews on Yelp.  
Last night I went to Osha and found out that it is in fact just what I was looking for last week.  Great flavors and the "medium spicy" food really had some kick to it.
author: lisa g.

description:
I should probably be updating this review like 30 other times since i've been coming here so much, especially at night after the bars and stuff.  Thank you Osha for staying opened so late.

-Angel wings are always good
-Tom Ka soup with seafood is sooooo much seafood.  scallops and calamari make this well worth it
-green curry fried rice - really good and the rice isn't all soggy!
-eggplant and beef - still very good but probably the bottom of the list in the stuff i ate
-papaya salad with salty crab - the salty crab either has a lot of sand in it or something but it was kidna gooey inside which makes me think whether its raw and cured meat or just cooked weird.  its tasty and kinda tangy sweet and the other parts of the salad is good, just the crab gave me a funny feeling.
-pad thai - never a dissapointment (pork was a little dry though, but understandable)
author: Vincent K.

description:
So for the two years I lived in S.F. I hadn't been here but stopped by yesterday while visiting and had a pretty good experience. We called in our order ahead of time and just picked it up for take out. I think it was a pretty good call seeing as how the place was already packed. 

It would be a cute place for a date. The big black wooden benches are super cute and I like the decor inside, a but noisy but that just means people are having a good time, right? I can imagine it would be pretty tough to get a table here during their rush hours, seeing as how we came  around at 8 p.m. and it looked like all the tables were full. 

Anyway..."Would do business with again. A++!"
author: Mitzi Y.

description:
I love the fact that this place is open late because it stirs you away from getting that unhealthy fast food after a late night out in the city. :) Plus it's cheap so that's always a plus.

food quality wise it was alright.  We had Tom Kha and it was pretty tasty, just not the best I've had.  It wasn't as rich and think as I'd like it to be.  I also had their fried tofu and it was cool. Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside (not over cooked).
author: Emmylou C.

description:
Ranked # 4

I never realized how small this place is in comparison to the Osha Thai iterations in SOMA and in the Embarcadero.  Although we were in SOMA when we decided to have dinner, my friend insisted on this location because the menus are different at each Osha Thai and he was craving a specific dish.  I did not know that.  

The food was okay but I think I mentally subtracted two stars more for the lack of ambiance that I associate with the SOMA and Embarcadero locations than I did for the quality of the food.  I've eaten here in the past and recall the food being very good.  So I'm mixed with this review.  I'll go again and give it another shot.
author: Richard R.

description:
I ate here last nite at 2:00 am, and I give this place a solid 4 stars, partially due to the fact that they prevented me from having a nasty hangover this morning.....
i walked in with two of my compatriots after many drinks at the ambassador across the way, and at 2 am on a Saturday night, this place was packed. Luckily, they seated us pretty quickly. I ordered the pad thai, and my friends ordered the papaya salad to keep to their fitness regimen. I was starving, and craving carbs, so I didnt. Anyways, service was quick, the pad thai was delicious, and my carb counting companions eventually dug into the pad thai and proclaimed it "awesome". The bathroom was nasty though....i kept a distance of about a foot between myself and the seat, but it was probably due to all the other drunk mofo's there.
author: Manali K.

description:
(from August of 2008)
Osha's Thai restaurant rests on top of a small hill between Geary and Leavensworth in San Francisco. The clientele are your typical hippie west coast connoisseurs. I get there at a quarter to seven and I sit down to order food with my friends; one of them is from Texas.

The food is good. I never tried papaya salad before, and I always thought that it was like the sweet papaya, but it was actually really refreshing. The texture is like turnip, but it soaks in a lot of taste from the salad dressing. I order a Barbecue chicken dish, which is nothing like the chicken that you drench in sweet and sour BBQ sauce. It turns out to be grilled chicken with BBQ sauce on the side. My friends like it though, as we cleaned up the plates.

One thing that I notice is that there are no pictures of the Thai King in the restaurant. That's actually a funny observation that my friend Ivan proclaimed, all Thai restaurants have a picture of the Thai leader put up. Another one is that Thai restaurants require actual Thai people to make their food. It's odd, but it's mostly true.

Oisha's is a good place, and just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of downtown San Francisco.
author: William H.

description:
An Osha Haiku

Ate here in the past

then I saw a fucking rat

I'll never go back.
author: James J.

description: Dinner was very quick. Pad see ew, chicken basil, chicken skewers and beers. Food was delicious! Beer was cold. The already small place was insanely crowded. Take out if it look busy
author: Jo V.

description:
Only one thing to know when eating at this place. "Volcano Beef". I dream about this dish. The curries and noodles are nothing special. They are good but no better than a lot of other Thai places. However, the Volcano Beef dish is unique to Osha Thai and possibly the best thing I have ever had the pleasure of eating 6 times. And each time tasted as good as the first time.

I give that dish 5 stars but the other dishes get 3.5 stars.

One of the few good places to eat late at night in SF.
author: Earl Y.

description:
My bf introduced me to this place last year and everytime we go to the city, we always have lunch here. The wait isn't too bad at all. The food usually comes out in less than 20 minutes. We always get the Pad See Ew and of course my fav, spicy Pad Thai. The outside looks like any other asian joint in the city but the inside is pretty modern. You won't find great customer service here but hey, the food comes out very fast anyways. 
Parking is very hard, expect to park at least 2 blocks away from Geary.
They also have 2 other locations in the city; Embarcadero and on 2nd street. A little bit more classier than the one on Geary. We still have yet to visit it.
author: Margret A.

description:
Things didn't start too well, but I guess I can't put too much blame on the Osha Lord. We showed up with a reservation for 20 at about 9pm on a Saturday night (emphasis on "reservation," but yes, that can be tough to pull off), and our table was not even close to ready. In fact, a table walked in of about 12 people just after we arrived--and they were seated right away. Oh M gee! My glass-half-full attitude led me straight to the bar where I asked for a Sapphire Martini. I am historically content to wait when I have some gin in hand.

We were there for a good forty-fiver and things finally started to take shape. Two tables were pulled together, and then another carried over by the hostess herself. Enough to seat 14 of us. Then the table next to us got up and the busser brought it over. Voila! Table for 20!

THE BEST PART: Entrees took about six minutes from order to arrival. They must have a virtual Thai village of prep cooks back there in the kitchen. The food was marvelous--hot and delicious. We were all so hungry that we devoured it all. More rice was brought upon request. We were happy Thai-campers. And the price was just right. We got out of there with tip for about $25 a piece. Not bad.
author: Michael W.

description:
Not must-have when you're in San Francisco but if you're in the the area, this is a solid choice. Very fast service when we went.

I had some dish that just a ton of seafood (mostly shellfish) in this very tasty soup. Rice on the side. It was great.

My wife had Pad Thai and that was good from what I tasted of it. Very peanutty.

She and I were both thrilled with our meals.
author: Tom M.

description:
Pad Thai is great. The location? Not so much. 
Osha stands for great tasting food, but Oshoot its dangerous.
author: Jon F.

description:
So THIS is where it all started..Osha Thai Geary/Leavenworth. Wow...it's amazing how far this place has come. But not suprisingly enough since the food is SO damn yummerz. I've always loved Osha Thai and what they do at their restaurant. Simple traditional Thai food at a reasonable price in a cool kinda hip, swanky atmosphere.

So my buddy Tim and I decided to hit up a little Osha Thai before I had to head to work. We were seated quickly even on a Saturday night! :) The staff is really friendly (which is impressive since it IS an authentic Asian restaurant). Most know that real authentic Asian restaurants aren't exactly known for their customer service nor hospitality. But Osha always seems to come thru.

We ordered the Chicken Satay appetizer, the Pineapple Fried Rice and the Pad See Ew Beef. I had hot tea and TIm the Thai Iced Coffee. I wlil say that the Chicken Satay was DEEELLLLIICCIOUS! Of course thanks to the dipping sauce it's served with. The Pineapple Fried Rice was good but a bit on the heavy on the oil side. The Pad See Ew Beef was the only complaint. Though the food came out quickly which was great.....the beef was undercooked, making it still slimy and chewy. Eew...won't be ordering THAT again.  However, the waiter took it off the bill and we had some dessert. I had to have the mango sticky rice and we got a side of Coconut Ice Cream. Yummerz!

All in all, Osha Thai always a good go to when craving Thai food!

4 Yummerz Stars from me!
author: Ann T.

description:
Osha's wonderful location makes it great for a late eat or just a casual lunch with friends. While I'm not always up for eating spicy Thai after a hard night of drinking (it's open till 3 on the weekends), I like having my options open. Located right on Geary street between two bar areas, (union square and Polk street) they serve practically priced Thai food that is worth every penny. 

At Osha, it really doesn't matter what you like, you will find something on the menu to make your pallet happy. While I'm not a big fan of vegetarian or seafood dishes, I find myself ordering them, trying to find a dish that I dislike. It might just be impossible. I think the best part about the food is that take out does not effect the quality. It is very hard to find any restaurant where the take out is as good as when you sit in, but Osha is definitely one of them. Since I work graveyard shift at a hostel 6 days a week, it's great to be able to get late night take out that isn't going to leave me feeling gross or on the toilet for 45 minutes after I get off my shift.

If you really only care about how good the food is at a restaurant, you should probably stop reading the review and pretend I gave Osha 4 stars. Get some Osha take out and love it. The food is amazing for the price and it is prepared at lightning speed, but almost everything else about this small restaurant is far from perfect. The inside is cramped, unappealing to the eye and uncomfortable. If there is a line, sitting near the door is beyond annoying. The wooden booths and the plastic cafeteria chairs need to go. The late night waiters are quick, but unfriendly. I guess it does make sense when you have a line out the door of 15 drunk people, 50 minutes before you close and at every table you goto keeps you answering the same question over and over again:

"Can I get a Sierra Nevada?"
"No, it's past 2 am so we can no longer sell alcohol."
"Common, please? Just one? I'll give you a nice tip. No make it two. my friend John probably wants one too... He's taking a piss right now. He'll be back and I know he'll want one if he sees me with one."
"no, I'm sorry we cannot sell alcohol this late."

To keep on topic, the drunk people. Yeah I get it. Who goes to a Thai place late after the bars have closed and expects there not to be drunk people, huge lines at the bathroom and to be able to have a calm conversation with your friend. I get it. But It's annoying when the girl in the booth next to you pukes. You kind of loose your apatite (you also kinda laugh. Bet that hot Thai puke feels great up your nose. Owned.) If you think you can handle the atmosphere, it is still the best late night bite. 

To clarify, Great food, small place. I'd advise going for lunch. Same great food, a lot more relaxed, and an unrushed waitstaff. Take out is always perfect. Can't go wrong with their curry.
author: Zane C.

description:
Alright, I have to say, I'm a sucker for a good Thai restaurant.  However, Osha has to get 5 stars for many reasons.  First, it's open REALLY late.  Every weekend, when my friends and I go out drinking in the City, we consider all the late-night places.  One place we never get tired of is Osha.  Sure, it's in the middle of the Tenderloin, and sure, my cousin got mugged right in front of restaurant while we were waiting for a table, but it's a really great place to eat.

For an appetizer, I recommend the Dressed Prawns or the Duck Rolls.  They are full of flavor and a great starter.  For an entree, there are so many to choose from.  The Volcano Beef is great if you like meat, the Pad See Ewe (chicken) is delicious, the Pad Thai is comforting, and the various curries are all pretty damn good.  However, I must say, my favorite dish on the menu is the Fried Rice with Fried Chicken.  Before you judge me, try it.  Something about the grease makes me feel good inside!
author: Mark P.

description: Yummmy!!! Always a personal favorite when I do visit SF!  Love the eggplant dish...It's not in the best part of town but I have yet to order something that I didn't like...you have to definitely hit this!
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
I've eaten at all the Osha's in the city, but Osha Thai on Geary will always have a soft spot in my heart and is my favourite of the three (watch out -- there's one more opening on the Embarcadero!):

1) They make my favourite dish - #55: Osha Spicy Pan Fried (with duck, tomato, straw mushrooms, Chinese broccoli, red bell peppers, onion, basil and fresh chili) - to perfection.  Not too spicy, with the most fragrant, thin and al dente egg noodles, which for some reason the other oshas cannot replicate.

2) This original location is not as wannabe hip as the other two. I like the hole-in-the-wall feel.

3) My boyfriend and I ate here just before we started dating.  Fond memories indeed... :-)
author: Claudine C.

description:
It's a risky concept to create one brand, but have many varieties of that brand.
 
One person will experience Osha at one location and think:  "Hip place."  Another will have it and think: "Decent food but kind of dingy."  Another will try yet another Osha location and think:  "High class, all the way."  Yet, we all Osha'd.
 
But somehow - Osha works it, and works it well.
My favorite location is the one on 2nd Street - - but I finally got to try the dinkier one down the hill from me -  Osha Thai Noodle Cafe.
 
First off - this one is open LATE.  This is good in that when you're out and about, drunk, and hungry - - you can count on them.  This is not good in that so can everyone else, when they're out and about, and drunk.
Second - the food comes out fast.  When you're out and hungry (and drunk) - - speed is key.  Osha has some psychic cooks or something in the kitchen - - you place your order with the server, she goes to the kitchen and seems to bring it out immediately.
Third - the food actually tastes pretty good!
 
It's not as classy as Osha on Second - and the food is not quite AS good.
But on this night, we had a beef noodle soup, and a seafood claypot.  Neither was what we expected, unfortunately.  I expected a more pho-like noodle bowl but got a bowl with good noodles, but a really dark beef stock.  DARK.  We were expecting some soup-type claypot, but there was no soup, it was like a stir-fry in a claypot, actually, with glass noodles.  Though both strayed FAR from what we were thinking we were ordering - -  both actually tasted pretty good.  The beef noodle soup is almost identical to a Chinese Beef Noodle Soup.
 
Service in here was adequately friendly - and all in all, it's a place I would go back to for a late night meal.  They also have a big menu with all kinds of rice plates offered, a l carte or otherwise - and there's something for everyone.
 
Good find, one worth keeping in your bookmarks for a late night meal.
 
3.5 stars for the food itself - - an extra 1/2 star thrown in for the late hours.
author: Grace K.

description:
Osha is conveniently located across from the ferry building and a few blocks from BART.  Had lunch with a friend and didn't have to wait, which was nice.  They have a nice outdoor patio but we opted for a window seat.  We shared curry and shrimp pad thai, which were both good. 

We've also had food from here for meetings, but I don't think they deliver.
author: Nicole D.

description:
Osha is OK for a late night supper  (they are open till 1 am except Friday and Saturday till 3am).  But it is definitely not the best Thai restaurant in TL.  
 
I had:
1. Taro Rolls / Vegetarian Egg Roll - It's good but VERY greasy. - 3 star
2. Thai Sausages - very tasty - 4 stars
3. Yum Woon Sen (silver noodle salad) - overall good flavor but the "medium rare shrimp" tastes not fresh enough to eat rare...- 4 star
4. Thai Spicy Beef Salad - good but not special - 3 star
5. Papaya Salad - taste like something is missing - 2 stars
6. Tom Yum - It's missing some kick - 2 stars
7. Beef Ball Noodle soup - beef balls are tasty but the broth lack some flavor. - 2 stars
8. Tom Yum noodle - for some reason, Tom Yum noodle taste better than Tom Yum... I thought they just add noodles... - 3 stars
9. Pad Thai - no flavor other than sweetness - 1 star
10. Thai Spicy Pan Fried ( Pad Kee Mao?) - It is one of my favorite dish at Thai restaurant usually but something wrong with Osha's version... -2 stars
11. Crab Fried Rice -  nice, not too greasy - 4 stars
12. Spicy String Beans - nice and crunchy green beans. I think it is the best dish at Osha.  Order as a rice plate - it is $2 cheaper than the a la carte and it's big enough for me  - 5 stars 

The bottom line, I'll go again if I'm hungry after 12am.
author: Chie J.

description: This Osha is awesome!! There is nothing like getting done with a night on the town in the Ternderloin and then grabbing great Thai food at 1:45am. In fact, it's very likely that if you come too close to bar close you may have to wait 15-30 minutes for a table! The prices aren't the cheapest but the food is amazing. In true Osha style, the ambiance reflects the surroundings. Meaning this is a bit more casual than the Embarcadero or Marina locations. As a matter of fact, this location is the first Osha!! And you know there's always something special about the original.
author: Nii M.

description:
Osha's the kind of thai food that's good enough to satisfy cravings for cheap. It's open late which is always a plus. 

Oh, and the food is adequately spicy so if you can't handle the heat, this may not be the place for you.

I didn't give it 5 stars because it's the kind of place I'd go to if I happen to find myself in the area, but I don't actively seek out Osha to go to if I'm craving thai.

Two years ago on April 20th, a bunch of friends and I found ourselves here in the middle of the night. Obviously, we weren't in the proper state of mind and ended up ordering way too much food. But it was good. Burp.
author: Viv C.

description:
At 2:30 AM, after a whirlwind bar crawl through the Tenderloin that consisted of oh, somewhere around eight different bars and twice as many vodka sodas, ANY kind of grub would hit the spot, right? Actually, make that closer to 3:30 by the time it was actually consumed, since catching a cab out of the TL at closing hour is akin to catching smallpox these days. But, the answer is NO. 

Osha Thai SMELLED great, when I swayed through the door and drunkenly ordered some kind of noodle dish and a papaya salad (or maybe it was a mango salad --- I don't know). The aroma of the carry-out bag TORTURED me while I tried in vain again and again to secure that elusive cab and get the hell back to Inner Richmond so I could inhale it. Why did I do carry-out, you ask? Because it was PACKED: 20-minute wait for a table at 3:30 AM. Hence, another reason why I was expecting late-night greatness. 

But when Matt M. and Scott S. and I finally sat down (or rather stood around the kitchen counter) and did the deed, we were mightily disappointed. It just didn't taste like anything. 

Yep --- it was just substance, texture. Damnit. Making its way to my tummy to soak up the vodka. Which is probably all Osha Thai really needs to serve, at 3:30 AM in the Tenderloin.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Pretty darn good Thai food but a bit more expensive then I'm used to back here in LA. It's almost double the price and the portions are smaller. The decor of the restaurant is really nice too.

A few things I didn't like though:

- The hostess lied to me and said they were cleaning up a table for us, then she told my friend we had to wait till one of the tables left.

- The waitress was kind of bitchy. She rolled her eyes when I changed an order.

 -They kept taking our plates and silverware away as if trying to get rid of us.

Things I did like:

- The food came out really fast.

- They were really on top about refilling our waters. I would take 2 sips and a guy would be back refilling my glass.

I would recommend this place just on the food alone.
author: Alan C.

description: Don't really care for Thai food.  Don't really care for dodging smokers and spit on the floor from nearby.  But have frequented this OG late night location of Osha numerous times, even before it became the Starbucks of Thai food.  Crab fried rice is our favorite.
author: Tony And Candace T.

description:
AMAZING. Simply awesome. This place will rock your socks and your taste buds. Oh jeez, they are good. Once you walk in you're immediately seated. The benches you sit on aren't comfortable at all, but your body is too busy focusing on your mouth than your spine to even notice. They serve big portions for what seems like a decent price. The Osha in the mission is fancier looking and the food is served more "artistically" but its more expensive. Just go here, and you'll get the best thai around, easily. I love the crispy veggie rolls and the pad see ew. The noodles there are great, and every time my friends and I go we are never disappointed. The service is pretty good, and they always have some one walking around refilling your glass. 

The only thing I would complain about is that they serve your food once its ready, not waiting for the other persons dish at your table. But besides that...it can't get any better.
author: Shaina P.

description:
If I reviewed Osha's about three months ago, I would have given them five stars...

Being that it is currently *NOT* three months ago but today, they get two.

Osha's, what happened to you??

You can't put up some wood paneling and call yourself high class...  ESPECIALLY when you're in the Tenderloin....

The recent price hike for a menu of sub-par Thai food isn't really my thing, and I'd really hate to say this, but Osha's, you're off my list.

See ya.
author: Jess R.

description:
the waitress sat us down, gave us the menu, walked away & never came back! she walked around singing the whole time. she looked over at our table a few times & i made eye contact but she kept looking away & continued singing. we sat there with our menu down & talking the entire time! USELESS.
Pad Thai = everything was very good but the noodles were undercooked & super chewy!
Yellow Curry = good. i like how they cute everything in bite size. potatos were undercooked, HARD.
author: Tran T.

description:
Where the hell have I been?  See this is what I am talking about.  Just another one of those gems in San Francisco that I always stumble into when my eyes are open! Well that's not true, I was secretly on the hunt for a good Thai spot.  Noodles are amazing, the staff is really nice - especially to a wandering Blondie in the middle of the night requesting assistance with her selection.  

I ordered the cashew chicken trying not to be too adventurous and now I am thoroughly screwed because I will be thinking about that dish every day for the next month. It was nothing like what I expected at all.

Just another reason to be careful what you wish for, sometimes those stupid things actually come true.
author: Yelper A.

description:
My experience at Osha was a classic example of altering first impressions. With some friends, wanted a fairly fast, inexpensive dinner so we had food in our stomachs in preparation for a night of boozing. Walked in, saw plenty of empty tables, yet we had to wait for 20 minutes. Hmmm. Plus, and this may sound weird, but the floors were super slippery as if they had been recently waxed, and I swear to God we thought we were gonna break our necks when as we navigated towards the table.

But, all turned rosy from this point on. The menu's great, with so much good stuff to choose from. Service is attentive and fast, and the chicken and shrimp with silver noodle dish I got was top-notch. My friends thoroughly enjoyed their meals too, and it really is high quality Thai for not much moola. Osha did us right that night; it was exactly what we were looking for, and I would definitely go back in a heartbeat. Wearing rock climbing shoes.
author: Drew S.

description:
I had a great time here last night - mostly because i was sitting across from a really hot guy and engaging in stimulating dinner conversation about midget prostitutes, sex with amputees and hypercolor t-shirts.  

It took me at least 20 minutes to get my first beer.    I felt like i was invisible to the waitstaff for most of the dining experience.  At one point i had to hold myself back from actually throwing a scrap of food at one of the waitresses just to get her to look at me.  I know, i know, i totally shouldnt be allowed out of the house. 

So we order our food and it literally comes out 3 minutes later almost like it had been sitting there all day and they were all back there going "I sure hope someone orders the curry puffs today - should we just hold onto these and wait and see?  Hey!  Bob - those 2 drunks out there just ordered them!  Hell yeah, send them out!"

But i cant complain about the food, it was pretty fucking bomb and it tasted better and better the more beer that i drank.  I also started feeling sexier.  If the food had been sitting there all day i couldnt tell, but as you all know by now, mine surely isnt the most sophisticated palate.

My lovely date almost knocked the entire table over on me right before we left which really capped the night off well, in my opinion.

I would totally come back here again - its a great spot to come late at night with the love of your life , some person you're just hoping to stick it to once or twice and everyone in between.
author: Kirsten S.

description:
Sometimes all I want is noodles and Osha is one of my favorite places to satisfy the noodle craving. My favorites are the various seafood noodle soups. I also love any of the pan-fried wide rice noodle dishes. But know that when you say "medium spicy," it's still pretty spicy! 

The remodel is sort of funny - new dishes and light fixtures to match the other newer locations, but the old tile floor and dingy bathroom betray its dive roots (which I sort of miss). But luckily they've kept their prices low, which is key.
author: Caitlin L.

description:
Good thai, good price, nice space. 

Minus 1 star: N'Sync's "God must have spent a little more time on you" on repeat the WHOLE time. NO exaggeration. We gave them the benefit of the doubt thinking that it must have been some mistake, but when we brought it to the attention of the hostess, she said, oh, ya, it's on repeat...as if they do that all of the time! WTF?
author: Nicole S.

description:
Okay...I'm Thai and I can tell that Thai foods in SanFran are much better than what they have in Chicago.  More authentic and tastier!  

I ordered Pad Thai - Thai Iced Tea - Fried Coconut Ice Cream.

They were GREAT!  I strongly recommend you all to try Fried Ice Cream either Vanilla or Coconut.  I stopped by for lunch so it wasn't bad for waiting time.  I will definitely go to Osha again next time I'm in town.

PS OSHA means delicious .... and it's really true : )
author: Jay A.

description:
Being the one (half) Thai person in my main circles of friends, I seem to be looked on as the "expert opinion" on Thai food. I'm not too concerned with "authenticity" since no matter where you are in the world, there are always good restaurants and bad ones.

WIth that caveat, Osha would fall into the "good" category for me. As far as ingredients and taste, it reminds me of the foods I grew up with in Bangkok. Of course, portions in the US always seem double or triple of what you'd get in Bangkok. Osha serves a good range of what I'd call an "everyday menu': pad thai, pad see ew, fried rice, noodle soup, fish cakes - all things readily found from street vendors and sidewalk eateries in Bangkok. For me, the marks of a good pad see ew are moist noodles and the use of chinese brocolli (pak kana) instead of American brocolli florets. And I appreciate that their Thai ice teas and ice coffees are rich and flavorful. 

Note: the menus at each of the Oshas around town are not quite the same. All the other branches seem to me to be more non-traditional (and more pricey) "gourmet California Thai," which is fine if you're open to that and looking for those flavors.

Can't beat the quick service; seems like they get the dishes to you in under 10 minutes after giving the order. Atmosphere is basic for the Tender-Nob. They seem to be redecorating once again when I was there this last Monday.
author: Alberto V.

description: I used to work around the corner from this Osha and had many pleasant experiences - never outstanding, but always decent food and fast service.... but last night was my last visit to this restaurant.  The staff was rude, and wouldn't seat us because we were a party of 3, despite the fact that they had 2 tables open. It was very clear they were hoping a party of 4 would come in, therefore they blatantly lied and said someone had a reservation. Yeah - right, nobody makes a reservation for 8:15 at Osha in the TL, total BS. I won't go back.
author: Derick D.

description: I've been to all the Osha Thai locations in the city at one point or another over the years.  I've never written a review because I always feel like things are just "meh" for the price.  Now mind you, I'm a repeat customer, but it's usually because everyone I know likes going to them.  They do give you the chain store benefit of having pretty much the same menu at every location and you know it will be decent.  A friend of mine said it best, "you can get the same stuff cheaper at plenty of other Thai places."
author: Corey V.

description:
I love how this place is open late (till 3am on some days).

Dishes I recommend:
Shrimp paste fried rice
Green Curry Fried Rice
Pad see ew
Fried Banana with Coconut ice cream
Papaya salad with salty crab (order it "pet-maak" --Thai spicy!)

The papaya salad with salty crab is the ONLY reason why I give this place 3 stars.  It's soooo good!

Dishes I DON'T recommend
Green Thai Curry (Geng Khiaw Wan)... the bamboo is not well rinsed so it still smells/tastes like that pee-essence.  GROSS.
Their noodle soups are not that good.
author: Grace M.

description:
Come here for the food. Not the service. 

So what? The entree came first, then the appetizer, and then the soup. It was all good. Mix it up, live a little, enjoy some of the best Thai in the city.

If you are spending less than $10 a dish, you really can't expect someone  to wait on you hand and foot. The kitchen here is quick so if you're hungry it's not like you are ever waiting a long time and that's really the thing to get cranky about. 

Maybe some people have increased expectations since the remodel. I had not been here in over a year and was warning my friend that we were going to a total dive. It was basically a burger joint that got turned into a Thai restaurant. Apparently they've classed it up a bit since then and gotten some better dishware too. I'm sure she thinks I'm an utter snob. This place is super cute now. Guess they had to keep pace with the new one in the Mission. 

Come here and make sure you order the Tom Ka Ga and the Thai Phat See You (that's how they spell it) you will not be disappointed.
author: Michelle B.

description:
A pretty good place for a snappy Thai lunch, although the state of the dining room doesn't betray its good reputation. 

Prices are quite low, and I was happy to see a papaya salad with salty crab on the menu for 6.95, which is one of my favorite foods in the whole entire universe. The food came out extremely quickly, and I was suprised to find that when they said the papaya salad was spicy, they actually meant it - most places kinda nod and roll their eyes and bring out the mild dish anyway. This, on the other hand, had my eyes running with tears of painful joy. The crab portion seemed to be an entire small crab (these suckers aren't big) and I had a fun interactive moment sucking, biting, and ripping out every single part of seafood flavored protein from its tiny body. I apologize to everyone else in the dining room. My only complaint: the portion size was pretty small, though I suspect this was meant to be an appetizer instead of a main dish. Thankfully, I'm not exactly a huge eater. 

The day I went there, the place contained an alternating crowd of Thai diners and vaguely out of place cops, all ordering noodles and talking loudly. The wall are mirrored, which is somewhat awkward for me - how repulsive is it to watch yourself feed like some sort of giant carnivore anyway? The place is decently designed but it seems like little care is being taken to maintaining it. I was really suprised to find on Yelp that Osha has some sort of "hip" reputation, because that sure as hell wasn't my first reaction. I thought, "Oh, look, a cheap dive with dodgy hygiene!" (My standards for ambience are very low.) 

Oh, and do visit the bathroom here: it's dirty and under-maintained but has a truly exciting degree of graffiti. I was under the impression I had mistakenly stepped into the cement bathroom of a squatters warehouse and spent more time then I really needed to reading the walls. People looked at me funny when I finally stepped out. Well, eh, reading material is what it is.
author: faine g.

description: When I first started eating here years back, I loved it. Unfortunately they changed owners and slowly the menu, quality, taste and service changed. They have a nice atmosphere, and great food presentation. But everything I've has been too salty or overwhelming with flavor. And not in a good way. I haven't been here since. Quite sad since I used to frequent quite a bit. I know a few of my friends have said to feel the same way.
author: Natasha S.

description:
It's open late. Food is fairly priced. Service is good and quick, no BS. Dinner and a movie? Nothing beats real life. God knows I've seen some interesting stuff happen in the theater of Geary Street, but Thai food just makes it more interesting.

This is, btw, the ghetto big sister of Osha 2nd street (the Corporate Sister) and Osha Valencia (the Hipster Sister). Geary street will shank you in a minute, but will leave you smiling that glazed Pad Say Ew smile. Heartless wench.
author: Charlene L.

description:
When i used to live here I would go here everyday! The food is bomb! Its on Geary and leavenworth right on the corner across from a liquor store. Parking is hard to find, but there is a parking garage if you do want to pay. Day and night is always crackin'. Hella people be going here. 

Pros:
-Deliver
-fast sitting (at times its a wait when there's a lot of people)
-great customer service
-decent pricing you get a lot for what you pay for
-food's just so good
-some plates are spicy so if you can't hang make sure to tell them how hot you want it. They don't play when they say hot!
-OPEN LATE! til 3am i believe on the weekends and on weekdays til 1am

food recommended:
-pad thai
-fried chicken/grilled chicken over fried rice
-fat rice noodles with chicken and broccoli
-thai iced coffee
-thai iced tea
-papaya salad 
-really everything there is good but that's what i usually get
author: april j.

description:
Gimme some of that pad thai! I only get one thing here: their SUPERBLY yummy pad thai! It's fresh, with the perfect combination of lime, tamarind and fish sauce, and the right amount of kick from the chili peppa -- not spicy, but not bland either. I haven't tried other dishes since it's sooo hard not to get the pad thai again (and again!)

The Geary place is a lot less dressy and "hip" than the one at Second Street, but hey, it serves great food without the wait and the crowd at 2nd. So works for me! Oh and the staff is wonderful. I'm not sure if it's because they already recognize me, but a couple of  times I had to get it to go, they allowed me to pay it with debit (it's below their required amount for card purchases) since I didn't have cash with me!
author: Erika I.

description:
"Can I get the Spicy Pan Fried Noodles?" I asked. 
"How Spicy" the waitress inquired. 
me: "Spiiiiicy!"
Wow, not one's to back down from a challenge, Osha Thai melted my face off with the sheer Spicy-ness of these noodles. They were delicious, hot and wonderful, with plenty to share. The steak was tender and flavorful as well. 

I would most likely give 3.5 if 1/2 stars were an option because when they forgot Erika C's cucumber salad, instead of apologizing and promptly comping it, they ask if she still wanted it. 
What??? Yeaah, she just ordered it to order it. wtf? the eating of the salad was just optional, you know icing on the frosting covered cake that was placing her order. 
anyhoo, good food. 
order and hope for the best.
ps. spicy!!!
author: Gabe b.

description: Osha is a great thai restaurant. However, this particular location is kind of booboo. The wait staff was mediocre. The atomosphere is bleh. Food was wayyy better at one of it's other locations. And the slap in the face that earned this location their 2 stars was when I went to enjoy my so-so leftovers and was ready to enjoy it straight from the chinese-style to go box, the main dish was on the bottom and 4 inches of white rice was on top. What's that about?! I had to dig for the good stuff. Sorry Osha on Geary, I don't believe that I will be seeing you or that dish washer with the rat tail who I caught staring at me creepily through out my meal again.
author: Momo C.

description:
I can't help but compare them...I had eaten here a couple of times before I realised that it was the same chain of restaurants as the one on 2nd Street. The menus don't' seem the same and certainly the atmospheres are completely different, this menu I thought was truncated.

I enjoyed my food, but found this location to be a little dirty, especially the bathroom, and the restaurant itself lacks the pleasant atmosphere of the 2nd St.. locale and its just plain cold in there, and not terribly comfortable.
author: Marz W.

description:
My sister wanted to try this place so we drove over on a Saturday afternoon (parking was easy to find but we had to feed the meter). Walked in and there were not a ton of people... it was warm outside, but DANG was it hot inside the restaurant. We sat by the open door, so at least there was a bit of a breeze. I was really unimpressed by the painted metal chairs and wooden benches.

We ordered 3 dishes for the two of us. The Tom Yom soup with tofu was tasty, we got it Medium hot and it wasn't too spicy except for the occasional bit of chili which made us each cough on different occasions. The Pineapple Fried Rice also with tofu was delicious but a bit greasy; I wish the bits of pineapple had been smaller, or at least more of it! I got the Chicken Satay for myself cuz my sis is a veggie, it was a good marinade but the chicken was a bit tough for my liking. (Great peanut sauce and cucumber salad served with it though!)

The waitress wasn't exactly friendly, but was very good about keeping our water glasses full and brought the bill as soon as we were ready. Overall not bad, not wonderful. At least you get a LOT of food for the $30 it cost us (including tip).
author: Shannon B.

description: Horrible service, but, awesome Thai food! Best OSHA  in the city. Stop by the bar next door for a drink after!
author: Jen E.

description:
I remember when this Osha Thai first opened in San Francisco, before it started branching out with all its other divisions.  The corner location that it opened on had been host to numerous other restaurants that had failed over the years. (I knew because I lived, and still live, only a couple blocks away and I used to work across the street as well as take the bus from that corner, at least, when the bus stop used to be there.)  My friends and I didn't know how long it would last (I think this was during high school, 10 or so years ago), but it eventually became one of my favorite restaurants. 

The spicy laht nah w.ith beef became my dish, although at times I would vary it up with the spicy eggplant and beef or the red or green curries. I also marveled at how cheap it was and how huge the portions were. But sadly, that was years and years ago.

Now, Osha has become overpriced and the lines have gotten long, and it's become host to too many of the after-clubbing crowd (yes, I go there after clubbing too, but I was there when it opened!).  And, another thing, having been to three of its other locations, I feel like the other locations try too hard to be cool. The Marina one turns into a lounge at night, the one the financial district absolutely sucks, while, actually, nevermind, the Embarcadero location is okay.

I want my Osha back.
author: ML N.

description: Delicious Thai food, a great variety and a few fun items on the menu. I'm Thai and would say this is about as good as it gets.
author: Terry M.

description:
5 stars based on food and value.

I was told this Osha is better than the other locations.

Since I always order the same thing every time I come here I can only recommend the following:

SPICY LAHT NAH:
Fat rice noodles with bamboo, basil, Chinese broccoli, tomato, bell pepper, garlic and mushrooms, onion.

If you're extremely hungry and want some stuffing you may try:

B.B.Q. CHICKEN or (fried version):
B.B.Q. chicken fillet marinated with garlic and pepper served with fried rice and sweet & sour sauce.

Try the fried banana with ice cream for dessert if you have room in your appetite.
author: Stephen S.

description:
Food was good considering that me and the people i went with didnt know what we were ordering. We ordered too much food. but the flavors were delicious. 

The Servers Were Rude or maybe that is the way they are. We felt like that they we were going to run away or something.  

Price was ok. our average was $40.00 a person and thats becuase we order 4 plates to much.   But over all this place is not bad
author: steve a.

description:
Easily the best Thai food I've ever had.

Fast service, excellent prices, and delicious food.  I was amazed at how fast the service was, and very pleased by their prices relative to the amount of food you get (I always leave with leftovers).  If you're into Thai food and in the area, this place is a must!
author: Sue P.

description:
It's Saturday night/Sunday morning. You've just had a great night out in the city, and all your friends want to grab a bite before heading home. There are probably hundreds of choices of places to go at 2am, but nothing I've had thus far hits the spot like some good asian food. And Osha is just what I've been searching for.

It was a really wet weekend out, and we didn't want to go all the way back near home to yet another American diner. Denny's/Carrow's/IHOP after clubbing is fine, but when someone mentioned thai food that was nearby, we were all up for it. 

Osha is a relatively large place for a late night spot. Don't let that fool you into think you can get instant gratification at 2:15am when you roll through. The experienced clubbers that double as fans of Osha seem to have it planned out pretty well. Leave the club by 1:30 and beat the after-clubbing crowd that bum-rushes in between 2-2:30. Believe me, it's a huge rush of people.

The food? Amazing. Penang red curry, pad thai, green curry fried rice, and a bunch of appetizers made my night. The Penang curry was definitely the best of the dishes I had. I have to admit that I'm a huggeeee fan of southeast asian curries, especially Malaysian, Singaporean, and Vietnamese varietals. Why? They ALL will have coconut milk! 

The decor of this place is great for a late night eatery. I'm giving Osha a 3 because of service. They're catering to a slightly intoxicated and impatient crowd, so I can understand that it's difficult. I didn't expect much at this hour in the morning and neither should you as far as service goes. Just expect good food.

I'll need to try it again when I'm 100% to ensure the food wasn't just yummy because of the condition I was in! (That means yes I would come back again!)
author: Richard D.

description: frown. I came here recently and the prices went way up. they've since converted their menu to match those of their other locations. I never minded paying more at their other locations since their other locations were actually nice and the service has been good. BUT this geary location has since turned into a crap hole. excuse me. the service here has never been good, and the only reason I liked this place before was because i was able to order noodle soup for less than $7 and they were open super late. But now I dont see the point in paying almost double for the same food as the other locations when this entire restaurant smells like shit and piss from the bathroom =X I'm so disapointed. epic fail.
author: Serena L.

description:
Open until 1:00 am!  And the service is pretty fast, even though the restaurant was full.

Sticky Rice with Mango was sooo good...definitely a great place if you want to avoid the late-night breakfast thing.
author: Randy F.

description: I give it a B- for service but an A+ for tasty food! Their panang curry is to die for!
author: natasha m.

description:
Pretty nummy. Sunday night- good time to go. Post "last call" nightmares trying to get past hipster-nos while walking home some Fri/Sat nights. Good attempt on the urban-chique interior. The chicken soup is delicious coconut flavour. All medium-spicy - spank-tastic.

They let us walk in with our home-made martinis -  Extra star for 4 STARS!!!
author: Braden B.

description:
Absolutely fantastic Thai Food.  Small dining area doesn't look like it can seat large groups - a fair few small (4-5 people) parties though.   They listen to you when you say you want it hot, food comes out quickly, and everything is fresh and tasty - Nothing tastes bad here!  

Warning, and this is a big one: Do Not, by any means, use the restroom.  It's absolutely disgusting and doesn't reflect the lovely restaurant that is Osha Thai.
author: Maulie D.

description:
I've been going to Osha since 2000. It's always been a little hole in the wall and every time I come back to visit, there's something new. An extra area...new tables...more tables...new menus....

It saddens me to read that the prices have gone up because that's what made it so worthwhile...as well as the fact that they were open late. 

But I must admit, last time I was there the food was just so, so. And the bathroom has always been wretched...I don't ever use it unless I absolutely need to.
author: Marlyn A.

description: Great spicy noodles that arrive at your table with lightning-like speed. They make a perfect meal after a few cocktails.
author: Miriam W.

description: I have been eating at Osha (ok I get it to go LOL so no 1-3am bathroom issues) since 98, 99, I don't know, but it has always been great for me. The curry chicken (green) is amazing. Fried Bananna...yum...thai iced coffee...omg!  You get the picture ;0)
author: Bella B.

description:
Osha is great! They are conveniently open late, till 3AM, attracting the late night crowds.  In general their food is not bad and I highly recommend any of the curries. Every time I go here, the curries never fail me. Be warned though that if you ask for it spicy, be prepared to sweat. I am no stranger to spicy food but this spice was intense. 

Overall when you put together the location, price point, quality of food and operating hours, I would recommend Osha to anyone looking for a good deal.
author: Miguel Y.

description:
OMG...I recently got turned out to Thai food and when a friend of mine heard that she was totally stoked and was like she had the perfect place for me. 

We went on a Saturday afternoon.  We instantly found parking on the side street which was PERFECT.

There was hardly anyone in there.
The service was GREAT!!!! We got our food super quick.
We ordered a noodle w/chicken dish called something like Pad See something, asparagus w/tofu, and a rice dish.  It was to die for.  
The prices were very reasonable as well.
I think from my one visit, I'M ADDICTED!!!!!!!!
I've been thinking about that place since I left!
A must try!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Sandra S.

description: hands down, easily my favorite Thai place in the Bay area.  If you are into curries, this place has the best anywhere (especially Penang).  all the dishes are quite flavorful.  prices are pretty inexpensive.  place is very popular so be prepared for a wait during peak hours.  only one bathroom but fairly clean.  parking is a bit tough in the area.
author: JL G.

description: Just make sure your whole group is here when you arrive or they might make you wait to be seated. We had to be quite insistent that the other 3 peep in our party were finding parking before we got the big booth. Anyhow, the food is good, well priced and its open late, a good spot to go right before going out at night on your way downtown. I recommend the basil/fried chicken wings, and pineapple fried rice (it's spicy too, which I like).....I'm giving 4 stars because of the consistent food, availability of wine/beer, central location, and convenient late nite hours...on the downside, the bathrooms are bad and you should be careful where you park your car in this area.
author: Lily G.

description:
Usually I don't really like crowded, cheap places as that usually means shoddy service... and I must say their service is not at all great... however, just for their food, I love it here.

I swear by duck noodle soup with egg noodles, especially when I am feeling a bit sick or after a night out or on a very cold day.

Their papaya salad is great... medium spicy is already plenty spicy... sometimes I go for mild when I don't feel like the spice, but mild in my opinion is almost too mild... so usually I just suck it up and go for medium and enjoy the heat.

Their pineapple fried rice is awesome too!!! must try once!
author: Sascha O.

description:
Osha review #90.   

The thai food loving spouse is happy.  That makes me happy. 

she- noodles of some sort that wasn't pad thai
me- yellow curry w/ chicken

extra star to the server who burned her hands getting our hot tea to us.  Thanks for not spilling it on us and letting us laugh at you - I mean with you.
author: greg e.

description:
Edible Pad Thai, cute surroundings, late night hours, somewhat hipster yet not too hipster environment. I like this place. If I lived in SF, I'd probably end up here a lot. My friend who does live in SF (in the area) brought me here for dinner. I liked my food. I wasn't massively blown away by any of it, but it did its job of feeding my Thai-food hungry stomach without offending me. I can see why it would be fun to eat here after getting trashed at one of the local bars.

One star for decent pad thai.
One star for being open late night.
One star for being cute without being overly pretentious.
One star for a great logo.
author: Adena D.

description:
Meh, it was bland.

I ordered this Fire Eggplant with shrimp (had the "flames" logo next to it).  The waitress asked me how spicy I wanted it and I told her Thai Hot Hot Hot!

Maybe she misunderstood me because it tasted EXTREMELY mild (it wouldn't offend my grandmother).  I'm not exaggerating to make me seem like I'm all manly, it really was as mild as can be.

The place was a little bit dirty inside, but it's was 11:00 on a Friday, and they have tons of foot traffic, I'm sure.  There were lots of people there.

I will try them again for sure.  Pretty much everything I saw people eating looked scrumptious.

Plus they're open later and have a much more varied menu than my other favorite up the street, Arroi.
author: Rocco B.

description:
After one crazy night of drinking and God knows what else, my friend and I finally wake around 2pm and attempted a trek down Geary to fill our empty stomachs.  Per his suggestion we decided on Thai.

I've had better foods to sort out a hangover that's for sure.  Not that it wasn't delicious, because it was.  I just wish I had been more mentally alert and not hurting everywhere else when I tried it.  I will definitely go back, and it's top of my list for Thai in my neighborhood.
author: Mary R.

description:
Without fail, they always serve quickly and wonderful tasting Thai food!!

Food: super delicious, very tasty, awesome Thai food.  The cooks are super consistent: the food has always been good every time I've gone.  A good variety of the usual Thai dishes, plus a few more to keep things a little more interesting.  Not greasy, fresh ingredients, tasty, and fast!  My friends and I would crave going there to eat!!

Atmosphere: decorated a little nicer than before, nicer plates and settings, booth & tables are nicer than before, and slightly trendier.  They also have a tv going on in the main room that's kind of entertaining.  Their background music is very 92.7FM, which makes the place seem a little triendier.  This is still the original spot of Osha that led to all the others, and I believe it is still cheapest out of all the Osha's, and still the best of all the others.  One other best thing about here: they're open late!  Definitely a great place to go when you feel hungry, even late!
