Service: service is lukewarm (don't expect a conversation), but the staff are very quick with their work and efficiently get all of the orders fast.  They get you in and out of the restaurant pretty quickly, so not usually much waiting or lines.

Location: on a busy spot of Geary with lots of traffic.  It's also walkable from Union Square, which is convenient when shopping and getting hungry.  Parking varies.  Remember, you are in Tenderloin, park carefully, keep nothing out in sight to prevent getting broken into.
author: Jason K.

description:
We came here around 8:30pm on New Year's Day with no reservation and a group of 13! We were seated in less than ten minutes, and even though we offered to divide our party in half, the staff was able to move together a series of tables so we could all sit together. 

Extra stars for being able to take our orders despite the tipsy/loud/confused/indecisive nature of our group. 

The food arrived promptly and everything I managed to try was tasty. The fried rice, the cashew chicken, the pad thai. Our favorite was the pumpkin curry with tofu, although the tom yum soup was pretty darn tasty too. 

Our only complaint was that we ended up with several more dishes than we ordered and way too much food. And we suspected that the waittress may have snuck in a few more orders to boost our bill a bit amongst the confusion, but she was gracious enough to take a few of the extra curries off of our bill when we returned them to the kitchen. 

And the staff was even able to put our drink tab on a separate bill so paying and divvying up the bill was super easy. 

Extra props for being open on New Year's night, when most of Polk Street was completely shut down! 

I'll be back for sure, and will definitely give their other locations a try.
author: Mindy S.

description:
Best Thai in the city, hands down. Cheap, quick, and now they serve beer! AND they're open til 3.

I HIGHLY recommend their Tom Kha Seafood soup as a hangover food. When they ask how spicy, tell em to make ya cry. And then wash it down with the Thai ice coffee and thai phat see you. The noodles at this place ROCK. 

I ate at this place at least once a week for 6 years and then I moved out of the Ls. I miss Osha desperately. 

THEY DO NOT deliver--I don't know what sort of crack anyone who says so is smoking. Belieeeeeve me, if they delivered, I'd know.
author: SheRat R.

description:
My favorite Osha by far.  Its divey, its spicy, its open til 1am.  On Friday and Saturday it is open until 3am.  I've been going to this place since just after college, mostly at 1 or 2am.  It is always packed at that time.  Last night we had the duck curry and the pad see ew with chicken.  We asked for extra spicy.  Every meal I've had there is delicious, whereas at the more uppity Osha's it has been sometimes questionable.  Where whatever you want.  The service is quick and the food is delicious.  A quick fix in Tendernob.  

The bathrooms do suck at 1-3am.
author: Diana L.

description:
Stumbled into Osha starving for lunch -- I hadn't been there before but their lunch combo sounded excellent, and it was.

First off, the waiter really listened when I told him about  my gluten allergy and checked to make sure my food and sauces would be safe to eat. (For what it's worth, their peanut sauce has no soy in it). I had their spring rolls in peanut sauce (YUM), salad with peanut dressing and a heaping bowl of red curry beef. The beef was only slightly tough, but the curry was tasty, medium spicy and not too salty -- all things I like in a red curry. And one of the other staffers kept filling my water glass so I never got thirsty. 

I left completely stuffed and only $12 (plus tip) poorer. Yay!
author: Beth W.

description:
Absolutely the fastest, and greatest Thai food ever.  It's so fast sometimes I am nervous! I've eaten a lot of the dishes and everything lives up to what I expect.  I love bringing out of towners here, it's fun and a great show of San Francisco cheap eats.
Total success
author: andrea g.

description:
Does anyone else want to smack the last two reviewers? Not to be too uptight, but if you've ever waited tables, it really sucks to burn yourself while working, and laughing is just MEAN. and the gay thing, well, i dont know what to say to that. 

i've only been to the mission one, but it's good, stays open late and i believe has a full bar, somewhat of a rarity at thai places.
author: Erica W.

description:
i don't normally review places that already have a hundred reviews, but I had dinner here last night and feel compelled.

I've eaten here more times than I can count, and the food is great. Everything else blows. Service is shitty. Last night we were brought spring rolls and my boyfriend's fried rice, then water, my Thai iced tea, and about 10 minutes later they brought out my curry. It just doesn't make sense. In previous visits I've waited up to a half hour after I was seated to have my order taken, I've had to track down wait staff to get my order filled properly or get my bill, and it seems that the waiters go through insensitivity training before they begin--I don't think I've ever gotten as much as a smile.

The decor is terrible. Awhile ago they swapped out comfy booths for hard wooden benches, and the tables are way too low. It's uncomfortable all around. 

I know, I know, it's kinda in the Tenderloin so we're supposed to feel like we're slumming it. I get it. But I really can't believe that the same people who run the nicely-decorated Osha on 2nd Street and the classy location at the Embarcadero run this place. The only reason I go here is it's the closest one to my house.
author: Lara L.

description:
This is a great place to go after a night out dancing. The food is just soo good and flavorful, and all very well priced! I came here after going to Slide, and was just plain tired. Not so much hungry, but tired, and really wanting a place to sit. The place was incredibly crowded, full of asians. hahah. I randomly saw 3 people I knew..

Ordered the Pad See Ew, which came all steamy and full of flavor. yummy....they kept the water full, which was exactly what I needed. Water and a place to rest my poor feet...
author: Carol L.

description:
This is the best Thai food if not in the city, in my area, P-E-R-I-O-D (do I need to punctuate the period if I spelled it out?).

1st star for the fast seating and service. Unless you go to Osha Geary at 2am on a weekend crowd of after-clubbers, this place will seat you in a blink of an eye and serve you as fast as a celebrity lawsuit. If you do go after clubs and bars, this is the place to go if you want value for your wait time.

2nd star for the decor and presentation. The menus are tech-licious cuz the font designs make my tongue wanna dance to trance. Gotta love the 'Fryce Ryce" idea and the hip and modern serveware.

3rd star for the quality and value of meal. Everytime I come here, my dish is always presented with a quick dose of "ooh-ahh" fashion. The glossy look may be the MSG but hell it only makes it taste that much better. Although the prices are very reasonable, I find the rice plates with the best value. Try the Green Curry. Mmmmm, mmmmm!

4th star for the convenience. This place is about 4 blocks up from me. Great place for my dinner dates for the food and easy access back to my pad ;) 

1 missing star for Osha Thai deciding to try their hand in serving wannabe yuppies and culture-depressed tourists in other parts of the city.
author: Flynn D.

description:
This place is simply amazing.  Either for a solid complete dinner, or at 2:30 am after a night at the bars.  Great mint chicken, panang curry, and pad thai.
Fast service and moderate prices help as well.  Great TenderNob option.
author: A. S.

description:
Im not sure if there are more locations of Osha but I went to the one on Geary and Leavensworth. The food is really good here. It was kinda thai fusion looking but whatever, it was still bomb. The style is really nice for thai "fast food" restaurant
I went at night on a Friday and it was hard to get a table. We had to wait outside for one to open because there are so many tables and people you cant wait or really walk around easily inside. They have this table in the back too right by the bathrooms which is kinda gross. 
The service was fine but we had to ask for water. The prices are cheap too and the portion sizes are normal.
author: andree t.

description:
It's a good food and affordable price for this neighborhood, but please people who are drunk don't come here. I sometimes see people doing some crazy things at late night, and it's too sad to see it. Thank you.
For the food, you shouldn't miss:
1. Osha sea
2. Osha noodle tom yum
3. Fish cake
4. Pad kee moa
author: Sasitorn O.

description: I forgot to mention: we ordered the duck pad thai and instead of duck meat, we got duck skin ... chunks of skin on the noodles and tofu. The dish description mentioned choice of meat or tofu, but never mentioned that it was giving you tofu even if you ordered just meat ... oh excuse me SKIN.
author: Isabel P.

description:
Three reasons I loved this place:

1. Great tasting food and large portion!  We had a papaya salad and the shrimp and chicken glass noodles w/rice.  It was enough for 2, and both dishes were very delicious!

2. Good prices.  For the two dishes mentioned above plus tea, taxes, and 20% tip, we paid $20!

3. Quick, no frills service.  There was a 5 minute wait to get a table, but we didn't feel rushed to order once we sat down. We did have a 1 hour time limit to eat since we had to go to a party afterwards.  So we were glad to see that the food came out quick (despite a fully packed restaurant) and the service was good.
author: Mon L.

description:
Let me start out by saying, I live in the neighborhood and have been to this location several times and enjoyed it well enough for a mediocre thai restaurant. My recent experience there was so bad that I will never return. Three things happened that can never be excused:

1. I was with one other person on a relatively busy night, and my companion got his appetizer and main course over 15 minutes before I got my entree. 

2. While I was waiting for my entree I saw a MOUSE scurrying around the floor of the restaurant. When I finally got the waitresses attention to complain about my entree never coming, the mouse poked its head out again and I pointed it out to the waitress who saw it and kind of laughed it off and pretended it was no big deal while she muttered incoherent english/foreign language. This is absolutely disgusting and the place should be shut down for health code violations.

3. When I finally received my entree, which was a noodle dish, it only came with a spoon! Really? A spoon to eat noodles with?... great. When I finally got the waitresses attention again and asked for a fork, it took her another 5 minutes just to bring my fork while my greasy noodles got cold. Gross. By the time I started eating my companion already finished his entire meal. I will find somewhere else for late night thai.
author: Isaac T.

description:
Great food for reasonable price. Osha is the way to go.
I was once impressed by the newer osha's pad thai so I wanted to try this original one since usually the original is better. 

No disappointments. The seafood clay pot was great. It was mostly sukiyaki with chunky seafood in a claypot. Tasty. My gf got tom-yan soup noodle, which was also quite flavorful. The services are casual which matches the atmosphere of this place so I have no problem with it.

And I heard it opens until 3am? I know where to go if I'm in this area after drinks then, but I would assume there is a long line.
author: Lance C.

description: Good lord, WTF happened to you, OSHA?  ya used to have tenderloin-licious character and spicy spectacularly cheap grub.  WHAT happened??!!   how many face lifts later, your food sux big time.  if you cant even get your tomyum noodles right, what can you do??  truely tragic.  i guess youre too busy franchisin' all over da city to realy put any effort into your food.
author: Kris H.

description: Presentation was nice.  Food was alright, nothing spectacular.  Spring rolls were cut into bite sized pieces, which made it easy to insert in mouth.  Sauce for spring roll was good though--tangy, sweet and sour, different from other places I've tried, but actually I liked that the most.  Pad see ew was not good.  Dry and the texture of noodles were off.
author: Anon B.

description:
In a nutshell: The way to find mid-priced culinary salvation after a night full of debauchery!

Osha has always been a choice of mine when it comes to late night eats. Contemporary black boxy furniture (what you'll see from Ikea) is what will seat you and your party.The ambiance isn't the typical, after-clubbing grease joint. You'll find yourself surrounded by semi-well-dressed groups and couples. Occasionally, you'll be seated next to the obnoxious younger drunks. But, for the most part, the crowd is behaved. 

The food is decent, but a little on the extra-greasy side (or so I've heard from the Osha in the Financial District). Expect to pay about $15/person for a decent sized dish and beverage. My favorite dish is the Fried Chicken served with sweet and sour sauce, on top of fried rice. My choice of beverage is the Thai Iced Tea (imagine Cold Tea mixed with condensed milk) (eh-hem: can you say diabetes?). Pad Thai is rather tasty, though, a little on the sweet side.

Overall I give Osha a 4/5 because 5 is reserved for top-notch restaurants.  Well, it would have gotten a 4.5/5, but the one unisex bathroom was absolutely disgusting! It echoes the horrific aftermath of The Guns and Roses stay at a hotel room. Though, I must say that the graffiti that litters the walls do add some character.
author: Carloalexi M.

description: The best thai food in san francisco. their service is great. the food is delicious. I would recommend this place for anyone who would like to go there and try it
author: seng s.

description:
We went to Osha Thai for a friend's birthday. This place is not really suited for a party of more than 8. I think that would be the maximum. We were in a party of probably 15. We were split into two tables. One had 4 people and the other had...you guessed it, roughly 11. So how did this work? Not very well. Anyway, the worst part was that they knew we were coming and could have planned the seating out a bit better. On the lighter side, the food was not very expensive and tasted pretty good. The portions are large and the food comes out fast. I would recommend dropping in on this place for a quick bite to eat in a whole in the wall type setting. 

Also, looks like the door handle to the washroom is broken. Just remember, instead of pushing the handle down, pull it up.
author: Andrew Y.

description:
Its been two years i still dream about the crab fried rice, hehe
Service = ok
Ambience = ok but late hours helps
Food = Everything is so good, i seriously dream about food from here
Price = cheap
Crowd = Younger, yuppies to tourist
Personal Favorite = Crab fried rice, osha seafood
Worst = to popular, everyone knows about it, parking is tough
Meal for 2 = $35
Final say = just might be worth it to fly in to eat here!
author: M C.

description:
This is my go-to spot for take-out -  Decent prices, good sized portions and thus far everything I've gotten here has been yummy. 

So why the 3 stars? I would love to give Osha 4 stars BUT having dined in a few times I have to knock it down one star due to the bathroom situation. I'm usually not a prissy "omg, that is so disgusting I refuse to use it" type of girl when it comes to bathrooms (hey, when you gotta go, you gotta go!)...but this bathroom smelled so bad from 15 feet away that I literally could not go any further. The ground surrounding the bathroom was wet and super dirty too. I can't even imagine what the inside of the bathroom looks like. 

I love you Osha, but your bathroom is just gross!
author: Amanda R.

description: Definitely the place to go to after my night outs and late night munchies since they're open late! I have been here the most out of all the Osha locations since its more laid back and closer of course. Can't wait to come back soon!
author: Nikka L.

description:
I've been there about 3 or 4 times. The first time was after a show at the Fillmore around 1am. I guess my gang and I were happy to find a decent place to eat that night and boy it was yum! We had some Thai curry and I think some sweet and sour soup. HOWEVER--the second time around, I was a tad disenchanted: The green papaya salad was delicious and perfectly spicy but then it started to get a little sweet as I continued to eat it. The #81 Praram and #47 Pad thai were ok but then as we kept on eating again we were overwhelmed in sweetness. Sickeningly sweet. Tired of Thai resties that make me sick after the 5-6th spoonful with overdone sweet food intended for the american palate.

Oh--service was just OK but music was way gooovy.
author: Ms. P S.

description:
My roommates and I have ordered delivery from here the past couple weekends to give us a break from CLG (yes, we heart CLG). On the plus side, the woman at the other end of the phone is always very friendly, speaks clearly, and ensures that she gets our correct order, phone number and address. On the minus side, though, the delivery guy ASKED for a certain amount for tip! I gave him a few dollars (i never know how much to tip for delivery - do you base it on how much food you bought? i could argue not because they'd be making the same trip regardless of if you ordered one entree or five). Anyways, apparently the few dollars wasn't enough because he knocked on the door again and asked for more money! How tacky! I must have really insulted him. I'm sorry, delivery man, it won't happen again. 

Now to the food: Pad thai wasn't spectacular, yellow curry was quite tasty, veggie spring rolls were good, spicy eggplant with beef was average, pad see yu was okay. Overall, I guess this is a 3 star review. Maybe 2.5.
author: Susan L.

description:
After going to a live comedy central taping at The Fillmore, my friends and I were all starving as none of us had dinner prior.  But we weren't sure what was still open at this late hour.  So this is how we finally ended up at Osha:

My Friends (MF): Where can we go eat at this hour?

ME: Mel's Diner, of course?

MF (in unison of course): No!

ME: Grubstake?

MF: Where is that? No!!

ME: Naan and Curry?

MF: Naaaaah and Craaaaappppyyy!!!! No!!!

ME: God damn it!  How about ole' reliable,  Denny's?

MF: NO! NO!! NO!!! NOOOOOOOOOO!!!!!

ME: (Thinking to myself, there is no where else, except...) OSHA THAI on Geary!

MF: Yes!! Let's go!!

I'm glad this place is open late.  I was ready to jump out of the car and  just walk to the Mission for a burrito.  Although the decor is not as nice as the other Oshas, I think the original one, as I was told, makes up for it with better food, larger portions, and cheaper prices.

We ordered the Chicken Pad Thai, Shrimp Panang Curry, Osha Fried Rice, and Beef Prik Paow.  All dishes were well done!

Here is my STAR rating:

+1 STAR for speedy service.  Less than 5 minutes for all 4 dishes.

+1 STAR for the extra MSG they used in the food to make it taste so DELICIOUS!!

+1 STAR for having the choice of VERY SPICY.  Thai just tastes better when your mouth is on fire.

+1 STAR for preventing me from disowning my picky a** friends.

-1 STAR for the bathroom.  It was NASTY!!!
author: James C.

description:
Called them up and asked for directions from #th and Market to get an idea how far we were and they didn't know. We sat down and weren't checked on for a long time. The table next to us was seated later and ordered earlier.

But anyway, the food:

The fried taro rolls (3 in one order) went great with the sweet sauce, but you have to look for the taro. One person got the Spicy Eggplant, ordered hot, and said the spiciness was just right. The Osha Spicy Pan Fried noodles use egg noodles, which go well with the tasty fatty duck. I got my Pad See Ew with beef, which was a mistake. Everything in it was good and had enough flavor except the tough, overcooked beef. The kind you use your fork to pull away from your teeth just to tear it.

Food came out fast and hot, including the tea. It's nice to see Chinese instead of the usual broccoli on the menu. Portions were decent, and next time I'll save room for the fried bananas. This is the restaurant you go to for quick Thai food where the service doesn't matter, but don't order the beef.
author: Amy N.

description: This place was recommended by our concierge at King George Hotel.  So glad we went. Got in easily-only about 2p.m. We had Osha's Sea and their Roasted Duck Curry. my friend didn't want all the veggies in the duck dish so they left them out and gave her double duck.  It was so good and full of perfectly cooked duck.  Osha's Sea was full of fresh and tasty seafood-cod, shrimp, octopus. perfect curry sauce with that delicious kaffir lime leaves. I'd go back in a heartbeat-food and service rocked it
author: Crzgma M.

description:
Two words: DUCKY CURRY

Big ups to osha's for keepin' their doors open past 2am for us drunk folk
author: Kev C.

description:
I had lunch here with a friend yesterday.  We ordered their shredded deep fried pumpkin thing as an appetizer to share.  It was part of their Halloween menu.  My friend had ordered duck curry and i got the Tom Yum soup with rice noodles and tofu.  This is the first time that i have ever had tom yum soup with noodles.  I think i prefer it without.  

Service was adequate, nothing to go into detail about.

The food was okay.  I have had better thai food, but would definitely be back to try other things from their menu.
author: R R.

description:
3.5 on the Shrimp Paste Fried Rice (yum yum yum); 3 on the green papaya salad, 2.5 on the Pan Fried Noodles with veges + chicken- it just wasn't that tasty at all. 
4 on quick service. Super efficient at 1.15am on a Sat nite; we got our dishes in app 5 mins.
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
This place is a classic.  It's the best thai I've ever had in my life.  

Food:

Pad see ew and Pad thai - they're both mouth watering delicious.  I could literally eat it all day if it wasn't so unhealthy...lol.  The Tom Kha and Tom Yum soup is great too.  The combination fried rice is unlike any other I've had...consider how bold that statement is since I am Chinese.

Decor:

Casual, come into the restaurant for a quick fix craving.  

Bottom Line:

Osha Thai may be more addicting to cigarettes.  

Enjoy! : )
author: Nelson W.

description:
I've eaten at both this Osha and the one on second.  This review is an average of the two experiences.  We'll start with the Geary location.  I order the Taro Rolls and the Tom Yum Soup.  The rolls were pretty good, a little greasy but that is to be expected for a fried item.  For their Tom Yum Noodle Soup I give them 1 star.  It was probably the worst I've had.  The broth was ok (though not very spicy), but the only thing they added to it was a couple of pieces of steamed chicken and some noodles and sprouts.  Blah.  I guess I just ordered the wrong thing.

At the SOMA location I had the Spicy Dice.  It was delicious almost 5 star worthy.  I had requested it spicy and still had to ask for extra chili because their idea of spicy and my idea of spicy weren't quite the same so it looses a star for that.  

I will go back to Osha for the Spicy Dice (and order it super spicy) but it definitely won't be my thai restaurant of choice. There are much better thai restaurants in the city.
author: Julie P.

description:
A friend recommended a group of us go there for dinner one evening. I wasn't so sure about the place because of the name. So I was a bit skeptical at first. Also, the place was not as clean as I wanted it to be and the host just shoved 8 of us in this small booth. So I'm thinking this place is just a regular restaurant that doesn't care too much about their food and service. After I got the food, I was AMAZED!!! Wow, it was delicious!!! I was so shocked at how wrong I was just from my first opinion about the place. Really tells you not to judge a bood by it's cover. 

I loved every dish we got. I really don't think you can go wrong with anything your order there. Every dish was ooh so Delicious! I was so FULL after my meal there. 

I would have given them 5 stars if the place was a bit cleaner,  have nicer bathrooms, and better service. 

It is cheaper here than the other Osha Thai restaurants. But if you want the great food they serve in a nicer ambiance, you should try the Osha on 2033 Union St or the one on 149 2nd street. I know they have two more that seem pretty nice by the pictures online, but those are the 3 that I have been to. Each place has most of the same dishes, but there are some differences too.
author: Kimberly L.

description:
What a difference a neighborhood makes.  I've been to the OSHA in SOMA, right across the street from 111 Minna, and had an amazing experience.  So when I left SWIG last night and headed over to the one on Geary, I was disappointed in the sub-par service and quality of food.

I was with a group of four others and we got seated immediately which is a plus but from there on out we had to flag down a waiter to order drinks, get more water, order our food, pay our bill and get our cards back.  This is surprising because this place is roughly a third of the size of the other location.  I got the same pad thai I had at SOMA and, forget the lack of presentation, it was just blah.  The only word that comes to mind is "blah."  The other dishes chosen by the meat eaters didn't seem that appetizing as they looked greasy/soupy.  

The Osha in SOMA is so much cleaner, more spacious and has top-of-the-line service.  I'm not sure what went wrong with this one but I would suggest the management take the staff over there for observation.  Just a suggestion.
author: Kara M.

description: I love Osha. Open until 3am, what more could you ask for? I love their shrimp fried rice, pad thai and LOVE their panang curry with tofu and brown rice. Other reviewers claim this isn't "real thai" but the food here is delicious and I really don't think you'd be disappointed, especially after a night of drinking and dancing. My sister and I make it a point to stop here after a night of drinks, despite whatever neighborhood we're in. It's worth it!
author: Jennifer Z.

description:
For me, this location of Osha Thai is great for late night eats after LAST CALL at the local clubs.

Last night, after my friends and I had called it a night (from Dragon at Club Eight) we ended our night with some snacks at Osha Thai.  

Some things we ate:  

Pork&Shrimp Won-Ton
Spicy Beef Salad
Pad Thai
Tom Yum 
Green Curry Fried Rice

$53/all together (4 people, including beverage). 

One thing to keep in mind...SPICY=HOT, THAI SPICY = HOLY SHi% that is HELLA HOT...

or, in my case last night's conversation:

Hiromi: "What?, I don't taste any spice this is quite disturbing....are my taste buds dead?"  

My friend: "Uhm...you're just drunk".

OH...RIGHT :)  

PS - lines can get LONG after 2AM...leave a little early before last call and you might not have to wait outside...in the rain :)  Parking is always iffy...and the service is fast...and can border on the not so personable side b/c they are rushing orders out.  Yet, the food, is good.
author: Hiromi N.

description:
The combination rice is so delicious I can't order anything else, ever!

when I am wanting some great food and my friend suggests Osha, I cant help reply "Fo sho-sha''

HAHA
author: Vega G.

description:
This place used to be my favorite Thai restaurant, but I noticed that after all these "fancy" versions of Osha chain stores opened, their food quality has gone downhill.  The sad part is, the price, on the other hand, keeps going up.
  
Having said that, I will still go to the original one (the one on Geary) and order the pineapple fried rice, Tom Yum Noodle, Thai Laht Nah and Thai Laht Nah Talay.
author: Jaquelina L.

description: Came on Sat. Night.. around 2am. It was really busy, 20 min wait for our party of 5. Food tasted great, but my girl & I were sick for the next 3 days. I think it was maybe the chicken Pad See Yee. Hopefully just an isolated case, I ate there a few times before with no problems. The other bad thing is they automatically added a 15% gratuity charge to our bill.
author: Daniel S.

description: This place is OK. Portions are big, prices are right and flavours of dishes are good. However, something tells me that their dishes are not very authentic. I don't cook Thai and I've never been to Thailand so I can't tell. May be someone here can?
author: Alfred L.

description: Simply delicious.....all I can say is order the seafood silver noodle claypot! My heart desires moreeeeee!!!! Go for the food and.nothing else no bars no fancy clothing and no five star service but the food is.just overwhelming!
author: Thaleda C.

description:
I have had dine in at this place 2 times but mostly take stuff to go. This place is a real find in the Tenderloin/Nob Hill area. The place is super clean, well lit, large windows for good people watching plus its always busy but you  never seem to wait longer than 5 mins to be seated. 

If I had to choose the best thing: The portions can't be beat, as a poor city kid, you gotta know how to stretch a meal...well a $8.00 entree here can be portioned out to 5 meals (yes 5) and trust me I'm no dainty eater. But to be conservative, you can AT LEAST get 3 meals out of your entree unless your looking to stuff yourself.
author: Angelo F.

description:
I have been coming here since the late 90's when they had this super buff waiter that I would drool over. Best Thai food I have ever had. Even when compared to home cooked authentic Thai food. Fast service, good portions, and great prices.

12/20/06 UPDATE: WHAT THE HECK ARE THEY DOING WITH THEIR NEW LOOK? Seats are so uncomfortable now. Wooden benches, gimme a break. The whole intimate lighting, puh-lease. I remember when thy only had the one side you walked in, then they expanded adding the right side in. Now they changed their appearance?! What happened to my old OSHA? Still good food, but now smaller portions. I would take a star away if it weren't the best Thai food ever. . . .grrrrrr..
author: Christina B.

description:
This is the original OSHA that San Francisco has come to know and love.  Yes, the newer and fancier location @ Embarcadero may be a little more high-end, but this is the location that started it all!

Although Osha is open 'til 3am, you best get there a little bit earlier, or at least before the bars close, or you will definitely be waiting a while for a much coveted table. 

I used to stay in the area a couple years ago, and this place never disappointed when I had some late night munchies for some pad thai or green curry.
author: Clarissa P.

description:
"Oh. Oh. Oh. Osha. Oh. Oh. Oh. Osha."

Go to Osha and if you see me, you get to see my "'Oh' Face" (a la Drew from Office Space.)

So I can go on and on to the break-a-break-a-dawn about my love, but I'll make it a quickie (no pun intended.) This OG Osha location is my favorite Osha and Thai restaurant. And it's for sho the best food on the late night. I have had many back-to-back meals--post-club grub to next 'noon session--yet I still don't tire of this dimer.

Reasons? 
Pad Thai: Tasty, sweet, good-textured noodles. This dish has been the joy of my life for 12+ strong years. It has yet to be outdone.

Pineapple Fried Rice: Wonderful experience of flavors and textures with every bite: Rice, chicken, raisin; Rice, cashew, pineapple; Rice, green onion, shrimp. Now you try. 

Green Curry: Yummers.

I've tried just about every dish here and they're solid across the board. Noodle, fried rice and curry dishes are what they do best. You can skip the appetizers, though. If you like it hot, you won't be let down. Medium to me is spicy. No matter how hardcore you are, there's a side arsenal of chili/hot sauce for you to add to the fire.

The servers are friendly and prompt. They recognize the face and know me by name. The decor has been upgraded (along with the price.) But the bathroom ain't nothin' nice for the sitters, yadadamean?

So spare yourself all these reviews and come and get your "Oh Face" on!

-NCM
author: Chiu Man N.

description:
This was the first place I ate when I landed in SF over six years ago and today it's still my favorite place to eat. The food is always amazing and fast and it's nice to feel like you aren't really eating out because it's so cheap and so fast. And even better, the atmosphere is great and they even get bands like Radiohead waiting 20 minutes for a table!

Wait - maybe I shouldn't be so kind - I still want to be able to get a table...
author: Rachel G.

description:
Osha is the best thai food in the city, in my opinion. Located on the corner of Geary and Leavenworth, its easily accessible by the 38 (right in the heart of the Tender Nob). This place is fast, cheap and delicious. Open for lunch, dinner and late night dining (3am on the weekends).

I have friends who used to live here who have since moved away and one of the first things they want to do when they come back to San Francisco is go to Osha. I even have my little sister hooked.

Not to be confused with other Osha's like the one downtown or on Union. They may have the same name, but the menu, prices and atmosphere are very different. The one on Geary is always playing dance music. I dig the fun atmosphere.
author: Kathleen N.

description: If they let me put ZERO STARS I would. I tried to order from this location who told me they dont deliver in my area (they are 7 blocks away) and asked me to call another chain location that was nearly 3 times the distance away. When I called back she then admitted THEY DO deliver to my address but the driver did not show up and that if I wanted to order I had to wait nearly 2 hours. I then asked if any other of their locations could deliver, to which she replied she had a different customer to help and hung up. It was completely unprofessional and she lied. I was more than happy to walk down and pick it up if they had no other delivery options, but she hung up before I could even ask. They will never get a referral from me, no matter what the food tastes like.
author: Carlos K.

description:
ok ok...I know...there are 500+ reviews already so why write another.  Well aside from my compulsive need to document every food place I go to now (damn you yelp...jk love you lots!), I need to make sure my loyal fans out there know my thoughts regarding this restaurant=p

So....the birthday girl, Charmane E. requested that we all dine here for her birthday dinner in SF before hitting up some clubs/lounges to check out this 'hyphy' scene I've heard so much about (yeah, yeah I 'm from the OC. what do i know?!)  Anyway, we had a party of 11 so I was surprised to find out that we would get seated in 30-45 minutes.  WAIT...I take that back.  Thai places down here seat you pretty quickly since their food is literally fast food!  

The place looked a little decent for a 'hole in the wall' & they dishes were very contemporary for (again) a 'hole in the wall'.  I shared a BBQ chicken fried rice dish & a won ton soup with the BF & I have to say....it's pretty tasty!  Very similar to Banana Bay/Coconut bay down in the SGV (why am i abbreviating?  who knows) .  The portions were perfect for sharing (if you're sharing more than 1 dish) and the prices were very reasonable.  The Thai Iced Tea was superb & the staff was forgettable.  

The one thing that was very 'hole in the wall'-esque was the bathroom.  There's only 1, it smells like urine (but better urine than feces, right?!), there's barely any soap, and there's this closet door that's partially open but it's too dark to see what's inside.  I was soo scared of what might pop out, reach out & grab me, or just watch as I alleviated my bowels that I seriously did some quick peeing!  

Overall, check out it but beware of the restroom....muhahaha!!
author: Shelly C.

description:
i used to be a huge fan of Osha... and dont get me wrong, they still serve great thai food... but for some reason, i liked them better before they expanded so aggressively... maybe it's because they also raised their prices on their stuff... or maybe they are trying to up the decor of the geary location... i actually liked it when it was that "hole in the wall" feel... 

i always view their geary (TL) location to always be the to-go place for late night thai cravings.... and it is still... you can count on them after a late night bar/club night since they close at 3am! 

on this late friday night, i had their spicy string beans with pork and pad kee mao.  the pork... was not so good... it was dry and hard... gonna think twice to order pork there... maybe stick to chicken... the rice was also hard... i'm missing that fluffy thai jasmine rice here!  the pad kee mao was decent, tho their portions seems smaller now.  both dishes were seasoned well and had the nice spicy kick that we all look for in thai food.
author: Kelly H.

description:
Late night thai food is precisely why I love the city. However, when you want late night thai be prepared for GTFO service and sharing a single bathroom with 60 other patrons, male and female. 

Overall, the food is pretty tasty. Be forewarned that when you ask for medium to spicy that you will be sweating by your second bite. On that note get some water. You're going to need it. 

Unfortunately, my memory of the place is marred by a white-supremacist picking a fight with an asian patron at the restaurant which nearly resulted in a full out brawl. Finally one of the tiny waitresses had to step in and break the fight up, but be forewarned this area can be a bit rough on the edges.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
I think its overated. Food Is decent, but I've had better thai food. Service was horrible. worst service Ive ever got for a very long time. I went there for dinner with my friend. the waitress came over to take our order, and started to take my friends order. he was done ordering and she just kept looking at him even though he was done ordering. I was waiting for ever to order but she didnt look at me so i just laughed.. she turned to me and stared at me . I then ordered my food and she didnt put it thru because i laughed? It was really horrible. waste of time and money. 


Good to go fried icecream though!
author: d n.

description: Its dangerous how this place is across the street from me. Bottom line, the food is good, no great and the prices are okay. One thing I've noticed is when I order to go they give me different portions every time. Sometimes a lot, sometimes not at all. Weird.
author: Dalilah A.

description:
Maybe a 3.5, but I'll be generous and round up.  It's an average looking place - big neon in the windows, tables, the usual.  Definately not as swanky as the Valencia location.  The food is just as good, though!  Damn delicious.  And cheaper!  Compare: green curry @ Geary Osha: ~$8.  Green curry @ Valencia Osha: ~$11.  But, the Valencia location has swanked up the food a bit along with the location.  Here, the curry sauce is wonderful (especially at medium - the perfect level of kick), but isn't filled with as many fun ingredients.
So while it may not be "fancy" Thai, it's fucking good Thai, at a great price, and I'll eat that any night of the week.
author: Don H.

description:
Good fast Thai food.  The yellow curry was fabulous.  We asked for everything medium spicy but for medium, it hardly had any heat to it.  There were a few whole hot dried peppers on the side of one of the dishes so I supplemented the heat with pieces of dried hot pepper that I crushed with my fork.  That did the trick.

The whole meal for 4 people was $50.  What a deal!
author: Tracy A.

description:
Just read Gabe B.'s review.  Same experience, still mystified as to why my  cucumber salad became optional at some point.  But when I got it, it was goooood.  And yes, the food was perfectly spicy.

Much better than the one on Union.  I can actually hear people in this one.
author: Erika C.

description:
I am a big fan of Osha and consider it best Thai in San Fran. I eat here often and I always leave with a big smile. Portions are hearty and food is reasonably priced. It is a clean nice restaurant though not as chic as the one on 2nd st and in embarcadero. 
had all the curries, yellow, red, green and also the pumpkin curry. you just can't go wrong here. definitely a bang for your buck
author: Hasham Y.

description:
Im giving this place 4 stars 3 for the food and one for the fact that I could order it at 2:30 in the morning.

We got in right b4 it got really crowded service was fast and when they say spicy it really is..

Next time Im late night drinking in the area Im so there
author: Kim R.

description:
Ate here randomly, it's a great place with a cool, fresh, almost japanese vibe. 

Had the Pad See Ew and the Angel Wings, both were excellent.

Will definitely visit here again!
author: Alan T.

description:
The difference between this location and the others is that I know for sure this one is open at 2am.  Don't ask me how I know, but I do.  

I feel like each location has it's own vibe and energy.  This one in comparison to the one on Drumm Street (Embarcadero) or the one on 2nd Street is not as nice.  This one is sorta divey compared to the others.  But at 2am, I'm not really gonna notice, to be honest.
author: Denise B.

description:
2 stars for eating in and 1 star for take out.

I dont know how this is the only Osha that sucks but it does.

Oh and if they seat you in the back room on a cold day, have fun, you might as well get take away and eat on the street.
author: Marina P.

description:
Another good Thai place. 3 persons have actually recommended this place to me. 

The prices are just a little bit higher than other Thai restaurants, but they still fall within the average range.

Very nice presentation. 

Ample seating space at the back area, although the whole restaurant itself is not that big. 

Convenient location.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Wait which Osha am I reviewing again??? That picture there doesn't look like the one that I went to on Geary... Did they open another on Geary?? ahhh I cant keep track of all that Osha. At least they didn't get all generic and start numbering them.... 

Anyway I like this place alot. It opens super late in a city that pretty much limits it's late night dining to Denny's and Mel's Drive in. Osha in that sense is a god send. Pad Thai is a bit too sweet. But I love the shrimp paste fried rice. It's worth a trip to the Get-Oh just to get some of that goodness. Also recommend the "Osha Sea." -- It's like a sea of Red Curry with eggplant coral at the bottm with all your favorite seafood compadres invited! Mussel Check. Shrimp Check. Salmon Check. 

Osha late night definately check!
author: clint t.

description:
"I'm hungry"

"Yeah, but its late...nobody's open"

"Oooossshha iiisss!!"

So, I don't think I've eaten here during daylight hours. And I have never ever been here when its not packed. The food is good, but by no means is it wait-in-line good.

After nearly being trampled on Chinese New Year, my friend and I decided that eating sounded better than being squished between giant sweaty tourist ladies and strollers, so we popped in here for some grub.  We got here right on time to be sat at a table with another pair of diners at the same table, right before the line formed. I didn't like eating cafeteria style in high school, and its kind of weirder as an adult in a restaurant.

The food was good, satisfactory, as usual. But again, I wouldn't wait in line for it.
author: Vanessa R.

description:
Tom yum soup at 2:30am. Totally hits the spot and sobers you up, after a night of bar hopping and drinking.

They make a gooood chicken & eggplant too. And crab fried rice. And green papaya salad with salted crab!

Just kinda sucks when you drive around trying to find parking; or when you get there RIGHT as the bars have closed; or when there's a long line for the unisex restroom.

Other than that, this is my fave post-drinking food spot.
author: Jill T.

description:
Am I dating myself if I call it the "OG" Osha? 

The newer Osha's are sleek, modern and sexy. The original Osha is a hole-in-the-wall staple loved by night owls for post-clubbing grub. 

Honestly, I was so wasted and tired that I can't recall entering or leaving this place (or paying the bill), but I do remember the pad see ew - it was exactly what my patron and champagne filled stomach needed to counteract a hangover. I say Thai food gives burritos a run for its money for best late-night post-debauchery grub.
author: Deb I.

description:
You HAVE to get the Thai sausage. It comes to your table all blistered and deep fried to perfection. From the first bite you can taste the lemongrass and ginger and galanga and of the course the pork. I like to drizzle lime juice all over mine for that extra sour kick.
The only thing that disappointed me one time was when I had the Green Curry Paste Fried Rice, every thing was going well until I had that one bite where the paste wasn't broken up and mixed around, well as you can imagine I lost a few brain cells that evening.
If you're lucky enough you might also catch the aggressive panhandler show outside.
author: Brian J.

description:
Osha Thai continues to unfortunately unwhelm me. I just don't really like the price to satisfaction ratio at Osha and this place is unfortunately a bit more of the same. Good taste, but you end up paying much more than you should for the inevitably small portions that you receive. This is a problem that affects all Osha locations though so unless there's a change in their price structure I probably won't change my opinion on that.

Unfortunately, this location has worse atmosphere than the more downtown locations. You can't compete with Embarcadero, for sure, but even 2nd street looks a bit better here. It can't be helped with the surrounding area, but the black decor of the insides just isn't all that great. And I wasn't such a big fan of the wooden benches I had to sit in either. That gives it minus points compared to the other Osha locations.

It's good that there is reasonable high class restaurant option in this area, but if I need to go to Osha, I'd rather go to the other locations before this one.
author: Roland C.

description:
The food is great, good fried rice and silver noodle.
They can really make it spicy, yumm.
But the service is poor, no smile.
author: fenny g.

description:
Osha osha osha....

you are there for me when i'm tired, when i'm drunk, when i'm hungover, when i'm happy and sad....you're always there to feed me your delicious pad thai and #23.

This is the place to go if you're too lazy to cook dinner, if you just want to veg out in front of the tv and eat takeout, and if it's 2am friday and sat night, and you need some carbs to absorb that alcohol so none of it comes back out.

Delicious, oily, wholesome thai food at its best!
author: Tadd L.

description:
I've been to every single Thai restaurant in Los Angeles and none of them compare to Osha Thai in Frisco. DO NOT GET THE BEEF SALAD. It smells like sour feet and it tastes like sour feet(not that I would know). 

Get the Pad Thai, Yellow Curry, Cashew Chicken. I haven't been to the fancier Osha Thai but from what I hear, this one on Geary is a little bit less pricey and they give you more food.

Awesome.
author: Daniel H.

description:
My brother raves about this place.   So we went last night.   Its a very club like environment with the loud music and the dark wooden booths.   

The food was very good.  We had the angel wings that was topped with fried basil.   The wings were tasty, but I found them a little sweet...  it didn't stop me from having 2 pieces, though.   

The papaya salad was very tasty.  I liked a lot, though I had to forgo the spicy crab it came with as I can't eat raw stuff right now.  Though it would have been hard to get at the meat I'd imagine.  The Tom Kha soup was very good with the combination seafood.  Broth was not at all oily like some places.  The seafood was abundant and the calamari was tender.  Very good.

I really liked the green curry fried rice.   It had a good kick and oh so tasty with the bamboo shoots, green beans, and the prawns.   

The eggplant with beef had good flavor, though I thought the beef was overcooked.    The pad thai was okay.   I thought it was a little too sweet.  

The thai iced tea was excellent.    All in all, I would come back again, if nothing else for the green curry fried rice.   some yummy meshing of flavors in that dish.
author: Regi K.

description:
Three words: "Crab Fried Rice" - oh my gosh it was great to find this place after arriving to SF late at night.  I got my Thai food fix for damn sure!!

The fried chicken wings were fabulous, they weren't too greasy and were flavored just right - i was thinking it was going to be another teriyaki chicken wing, but i was proven wrong. Hubby got Pad Thai which I thought was pretty good, but not as good as my rice.

You have to definitely get a side of cucumber salad with any dish. I will have to dine here next time I go to the bay area!!!
author: chelo a.

description:
Excellent Thai Food!

Back in College, my buddy and I would eat here at least 4 times a week.  Service is Fast and the Food is delicious.  Every time I pass by the city I make it a goal to always revisit Osha Thai Noodle Cafe.

Happy Eating!
author: Frank G.

description: Great late night dining....closes at 3 am.  My BF works late and this place is perfect for him.  The food is yummy and the wait is not long.  I love their thai lime ice tea. Now I know where to eat late in SF.
author: JAN I.

description: I came to Osha ready to pay $15 a plate to experience fine Asian food. Instead, I got poor service and mediocrity.  The staff was rude and ignored us. Then, they brought out all five of our dishes at different times in a span of ten minutes. The curry for my crispy catfish was obviously burnt, and the eggplant was mushy. The catfish itself was good, but the dish was worse than something you could get for $6-$8 in Chinatown.  The mediocrity and price make me less than eager to go back.
author: Joaquin E.

description: I'm only going to review the Osha at this particular location because there are many others in the city. I went to this one at 1am on Friday night. Horrible food, horrible service and one unisex bathroom for a completely packed house. I didn't realize a restaurant could make such a horrific pad thai...and I'm also still confused as to why there was lots of spinach involved in it. Not basil, not cilantro, but spinach. Cooked spinach. The sauce was terrible, the noodles were undercooked and there weren't any other vegetables, aside from some red bell peppers and some sprouts that made me question whether they got washed between the ground and my plate. Also, my date got the papaya salad and got a ridiculous stomachache from it. Never going back to this location.
author: Veronica J.

description:
Let me make things clear here.....I give this restaurant 3-3.5 stars if you were to eat here for lunch/dinner....but I give this restaurant 4 stars if you eat her after a night of clubbing...maybe it's the drunken debauchery they tolerate or the food making the nauseating effects of alcohol dwindle away....but one things for sure....yes....you guessed it.....FRIED CHICKEN OVER FRIED RICE!

End your meal with mango & sticky rice. I rank their mango and sticky rice dish as top 7 in the mango and sticky rice category. Don't fret...It's TASTY....i've just had way too many mango and sticky rice desserts from way too many Thai restaurants....
author: Michael C.

description:
This is the place to go after a late night of drinking.  The food is okay, though not as good as it used to be.  The employees are all Thai, which speaks volumes for a Thai restaurant.  Don't go there if you are a germaphobe though, because it's not as clean as you'd probably wish it to be.  But then, if you're drunk, maybe you won't care. 

PS... the bathroom here is especially nasty.... you'll notice that, no matter how drunk you are.
author: Mikolo R.

description:
just having the steak salad and wok broccoli for lunch

or beef with chili and vegetable combination for dinner

and i'm content.
author: Li L.

description:
This location is much better than the one at the Embarradro (they got crazy, rude hostess there).  A lot quieter and the food is just as good.  Spicy is really spicy.  Mild is spicy.

I usually get the lamb or the beef, but their curries are awesome too!
author: H L.

description:
It was ok....... I tried this place w/my friend who was raving about th place, hence the disappointment......
I like Grand Pu-Bah better, or I rather eat cheap King of Thai. I mean, it was ok, nothing but that. 
For the price I rather go somewhere else, like coconut bay in burlingame........I prolly won't come back here, unless someone else wanted to eat there, but no one I know does, so I'll be ok. The crab fried rice was a bit greasy. 
Nothing was memorable about the place, and it looks like king of thai almost, except it costs more.
author: Jenny W.

description:
Great place to go if your looking for some late night eats. 

Mood is very chill and cool. 

Food is priced affordable. 

Food comes out quickkkk.
author: Brian L.

description:
omg best authentic spicy water in a bowl i've had since i got back from bangkok!!!1!

I am so sorry but the downtown location is way better (meaning 2.25 stars). spice don't = http://content.answers.com/main/content/wp/en/8/89/FlavaFlav.jpg , SON.
author: Nicholas E.

description:
Why is it that everyone who comes to visit me wants to eat here by default?  I think they drive past it in their cars and take mental notes to drag me here.  This is my official Denny's.  What's pathetic is I eat here about once a week since it's 2 blocks away from my place.  I'm officially sick of this place.

However, you can't beat the consistency, taste, and fast service.  It seems like there's psychics in the kitchen because as soon as I order, within 2 minutes my order comes to my table hot and fresh.  

Everytime I come here there's a line out the door like a nightclub.  And there's always a bum outside trying to get a cigarette or some change.  Leave me alone you aggressive panhandler!

Added star for the spicy catfish they added to their menu like their big brother Osha's.  I was always wondering when they'd add that.
author: Nezza F.

description: Let it be known that Osha Thai uses a curry mix that contains MSG. Shame on them, as they portray themselves as a high-end Thai restaurant. I hope the word gets out, and that they change suppliers (or make their own without it, for heaven's sake).
author: G F.

description:
I went there twice with guesses from out of town and both time was very disappointed. 
The food tasted  like it was prepared by the dis washer. The serviced was so bad that I forgot to tip them.
I wonder if I should give the  other so call " High end Osha" in Embacadaro a try   ;(
author: anthony b.

description: i love this place......they make the best pad thai ever. since im so hard to pleased but only this place who can satiesfied my super duper spicy pad thai chicken craving. i just wish they can cook a lil bit consist when it comes to the flavor. but other than that im a big fan of this place. the service is good.
author: nita d.

description: The food is still great, but the black "chic" decor since the new ownership  defintely leaves something to be desired. This used to be a cozy place for cheap eats.
author: Karen T.

description: Best thai food I've ever had! Thai food is one of my top ten favorite foods, use to be #1 until I discovered Japanese food. I personally ALWAYS get the Pad Kee Mao because this is the only place that doesn't skim you on the chicken and vegetables. I also like how it doesn't taste too oily like King of Thai. I've tried the Fried chicken wings with the sweet and sour sauce and they are okay. I wouldn't get them again. I also like to come here because they have the BEST tom yum soup I have ever tasted. It doesn't taste generic, just authentic, sweet, sour and OH SO GOOD! Prices have gone up a bit, but I'd pay the extra buck to go to this place! Oh, the only con is that parking may be a bit hard to find.
author: Nancy Y.

description: Scary neighborhood---worth the adventure to sample their Green Curry and Spicy String Beans.
author: Sallie D.

description: I was there for lunch with my friend and I had orange salmon, it was so good. we got our food fast and the service was also nice. the only thing that I do not like my friend got his food olmost 10 minutes before than me. he had to wait mine it was kinda unpleasent however this restaurant is one of my favorite restaurant in downtown not because this place is a short walk from my restaurant because they have a wonderful food
author: Hilal P.

description:
I have always been a fan of Osha Thai, the food is one of the best in the city when it comes to Thai food. I usually frequent the one on second or embarcadero however if you want late night Thai food your only option is to go to the one in the TL so that is what we did. As usual the line was long to be seated and the place was filed with a few intoxicated people.  I can understand why the staff wouldn't be on top of things and as happy to see you as you are to see the food coming out however they really need to try and hire better staff for the night shift.

My friends and I found out that they have a policy that if you put your name on the wait list and order your food for take out and decide to eat it at the table when they seat you that they will not allow you to eat the food, even if you order additional food and drinks, they still will not allow you to eat your take out food. When we asked why they said that is their policy and that was it. We were a bit confused and said then we will not order the other food and drinks and will leave since we don't want our food to go cold and they were rude and said OK. My friends and I were all sober so we were not rude in anyway, the only one being rude was our waitress. 

The only reason I gave the place 2 stars is because the food is good, the service has never been good at this location when I have been there.
author: Bobby B.

description: Love the hours and the late night crowd. I really like the Osha spicy dice and the tom ka ga soup, though I did not think the shrimp appetizer was great. Their Thai Iced tea with crushed ice is divine. I actually don't find this place to be THAT affordable.
author: Andrew K.

description: This is the late night cheap eat place to drop by for a quick bite when just about everything else is closed and you can't think any other options.  I prefer the other locations for the ambiance, decor, and selection of dishes on their menu.  This might have been the first location before the expansion of the franchise.
author: Jenny L.

description:
This place is ridiculously delicious. The prices have gone up in the past few years since the other locations have been springing but the food has consistently been amazing! I swear this is the best pad thai I've had ever! and i go to so many thai restaurants and even in thai town in la, there is no better pad thai than here. the waiters are also really sweet and pretty quick. 
Today when i went for dinner, i looked around and staple dishes that i saw at every table, including my own, were fried rice, pad thai, fried squid balls, and papaya salad. They were alll so fresh tasting and just the right amount of spicy. I also had the spicy chili beef and panang curry which was so saucy and tasty. The wait is a little long but it's worth it. I also enjoy how the place offers with rice or a la carte in case you're with a big group and your group wants to either eat family style or order separately.
author: Veronica L.

description: I used to be a friend of a waitress who worked there named Julie.  She says that the food is made by real Thai cooks so they tasted authentic.  I don't know if she was right or not.  Their spicy noodles has a real kick.
author: Jim J.

description: One of my favorite thai noodle joints when I lived in SF, I got to stop in for dinner last night on a business trip.  Osha Thai is always busy but the service is fast, the food is delish and it's open until 3am on most nights!  A great spot for a spicy, late night bite after doing some drinking.  My group of co-workers were impressed with the place, had some chicken larb, shrimp wontons, and shared a sticky rice with coconut ice cream.  Hard to get this kind of food in NC and at these prices, I miss ya Osha Thai!  Oh and I really miss the Tenderloin, sigh...
author: Ron W.

description:
I use to be a regular here before I knew how to cook and still make an attempt to grab a meal here whenever I am in SF.  It is definitely a plus that they're open as late/early as 3 AM.  Try to remember this place the next time when you find yourself drunk and hungry after partying in the city.

My favorites:
Fried chicken wings
Satay
Osha sausages
Tom ka
Yum woon sen salad
Spicy beef salad
Pad thai
Roasted duck curry
Thai fried rice
Pineapple fried rice
Crab fried rice
Fried banana with ice cream
Sweet sticky rice with ice cream
Fried ice cream
Thai ice tea
author: Stephanie C.

description: If you like affordable Thai Food that's open pretty late, this is a great place to go to.  The food was pretty good and the environment was typical SF.
author: Neville B.

description:
We always go here! Usually after a long day of shopping at Union Square...and since it's within walking distance from union square, you don't need to worry about trying to find parking, which can be a real pain. I went again last night around 11:30pm after watching a movie at the Metreon. (no long line this time...YAY!) I love how Osha open so late! (I think until 2am)

Try their Pad thai, Osha Tom Yum Noodle Soup (extra spicy), Penang Curry, Papaya Salad, Crab fried rice, and the angel wings. YUM! Trust me, they are superb. Nothing else like it. The best Thai restaurant in SF, hands down. Plus, the portion is pretty big, not like small itty bitty portions you find at other thai restaurants.

I took 1 star off for the stinky bathroom (but you're not there to eat in the bathroom, right?) and the price. I love Osha and everything, but they are getting more and more expensive! =( what's up with that? =( $11 for the Osha Tom Yum Noodle Soup, before it was around $8, which was a more reasonable price. I might not be able to afford Osha if it keeps on getting more expensive!
author: Natalia H.

description:
I love their food, have used them for my work lunches with pleasure.  Not a single bad thing to say about the food.  They even know how to make blisteringly hot food for non- thai folks.

but seriously,

I just paid $9.71 for pad see eiw.  You gotta be kidding!  for a cheap lunch?  Yeah, it was delicious.  but man oh man, this is only going to be a very seldom treat from now on.
author: Rebecca R.

description:
I had one of my B Day dinner here a few years back hoping that it would exceed to all the hype I've been hearing about, but I was more disappointed than ever. 
The price were ok for the ambiance but not for the flavor.
I ordered pad Thai, and they made it super spicy when I ask mild.
This place is always busy , so remember to come early with reservation. I've had better thai food, considering I've been to Thailand.
author: MC C.

description: Gross bathroom. Food is decent at best. Papaya salad, beef curry, and spring rolls were edible.  I prefer the other locations.
author: Janelle F.

description:
Ever since Cousin Sheila introduced me to Osha's I just haven't visited or yearned to eat at King of Thai for about 2 years now... WOW HUH?

Osha's is consistent delicious food, customer service is friendly, serve time is very quick, and the prices are very affordable, even for the broke college student!

I think I have ordered almost everything on the menu and I still take 10 minutes to order because whatever it was that I thought I was going to eat ends up changing once I see all of the other options...

Parking can be difficult since it is in a busy area and the wait during after hours on Friday and Saturday can be long... otherwise, I can't complain about this establishment!  

I HEART OSHA!
author: Chrysantha C.

description: Kind of expensive for Thai. Their Pad Thai is too wet... curry isn't too spicy. Tom Yum soup is not great. Only plus is portion. They're not cheap with their servings. I definitely had much better, especially when there are like 20 Thai restaurants in the area.
author: Captain G.

description:
Good food, served up cheap & quickly.

Minus a star for it being too dark in here to see my noodles.
author: Holly F.

description:
How could I not write about Osha?  I lived around the corner back in 99 before it was expanded and pretty much a dump.

Now, it's unrecognizable in both clientele and interior.  I'm not happy with having to wait every time I go but when the shit's good...it happens.

Try their Shrimp Tom Yum soup...medium.  Also, the spicy green bean rice plate and the eggplant tofu rice place.

Don't expect sunshine service...you will get ignored here until they see you are done with your food...then it's check time!

I, personally, hate cheery waitstaff and am content with just being provided my food and being left alone unless asked for.  So, I'm OK with this.
author: Diego S.

description:
I tend to favor this Osha location over the others because of its late night hours, mostly stemming from my late night Thai cravings. This location offers you the most casual experience compared to its Union, 2nd or Embarcadero locations. As far as the city goes, I'd have to say Osha and King of Noodles are the best Thai restaurants in terms of authenticity. Osha Geary usually does a good job, but I had one bad experience where I ordered a classic Thai favorite that wasn't on the menu: Pad Ga Pow (Stir-fried basil with meat). They gave me a quarter serving of rice noodles, perhaps to offset the cost of the basil going in? Who knows, but that did not please me. I typically stick to the favorites like KaoPad Boo (Crab Fried Rice) or Pad See Ew. 

Oh and when Winter comes along, make sure you don't get seated near the entrance. When lines form outside and the host constantly checks on them, you'll receive quite the breeze that instantly chills your food. It's worth another 10-15 minute wait, unless you're one of those freaks who eats cold pizza.

--------------
11/03/2007
Demoted to 3 stars after learning they jacked the prices.
author: Tom B.

description:
a Wannabe Thai food..


I only eat here a couple times even though I am Thai. Honestly, I cannot stand fake Thai food.
 
- Tom Yum Noodle Soup

I could tell from a first bite that they added shrimp paste in the soup coz It had such a sharp and harsh smell...errh. It was nothing close to a real Tom Yum Soup. 


- Pad Thai and stir-fried Dishes
You are going to have high cholesterol if you order these dishes frequently. They are way too greasy.


They have increased their price on the menu, but never improved their food.


One star is for a nice decoration only.
author: Ari C.

description:
When you don't need my review, but I still should review it as I have been there and have an opinion and don't see why i wouldn't actually keep doing this yelp thing at this point....

I write a haiku.




The Thai is quite good.
But its seems so hip at times
Less enjoyable
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description: This restaurant was a delicious find! We just came across it when we were hungry and found out it's unique, cozy, and delicious!  The mocktail arnold palmer is great! I recommend it.  I'm not a fan of mint, but in this drink it was so subtle I loved it!  The mango mocktail isn't bad, but I think the palmer was better.  The mango salad has an amazing dressing and isn't at all what I expected! It was delicious.  It was fresh, light, and flavorful.  We also got the fried chicken, which is not American fried chicken, and it came on top of fried rice.  The fried rice was well cooked.  It was not greasy or too dry.  The fried chicken was also delicious.  It was sliced thinly and was moist and flavorful.  The service was also really good and fast.  I'm glad we stumbled on this place!
author: Denise A.

description:
Halfway decent, moderate prices, large portions (but if you look at the ingredients they are making plenty of money on this), semi-lounge music.  Can get a little hectic / crazy / dirty and the staff zombifies in its prime hours (midnight to 2, 3 on weekends).  Never had the urge to come here for regular dinner but it's great after clubbing.

Update for late 2007: They've now renovated this informal original location to match the upscale vibe of all the newer ones.  That means dramatic pin spotlights, dark interior with heavy wooden furniture, and going more to lounge chic than noodle slurping club kid dance music.  The food has improved some too.   So +1 star, even though prices are up.
author: Gil S.

description:
I wanted to start this review with a witty anecdote comparing Osha Thai Noodles to its federal counterpart OSHA, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration, but there's just no comparison between a federal bureacracy put in place to protect workers while on the job and an affordable place to get a mid-drinking dinner.

Osha noodles is smack dab in the middle of the TenderNob at Geary and Leavenworth, right next to Rye and near the Indian and Pakistani restaurant corridor on Jones. Getting there around 8:15, prime dinner time, there was a line - but the turnover was so fast that we were sitting by 8:30 and eating by 8:45.

The food ranged from average to better-than-average. The Thai Iced Tea was very nice, and considering it was the size of two normal Thai Iced Teas from most other restaurants, it was a real bargain. Sate pork ($5.95 for 4) was fine if not extremely memorable but the fried wontons were outstanding ($5.95 for 12) - evoking memories of fried wontons on the East Coast. The main courses were in the $6.95 range, and my Spicy Laht Nah - spicy chicken and flat noodles with broccoli, peppers and straw mushrooms was very good ans satisfying. The best part? For two iced teas, two appetizers and two main courses, we only spent $31! 

Osha isn't a destination restaurant by any means - but it's a fantastic place to go when you're in the neighborhood looking for an affordable, fast meal.
author: Avery G.

description:
This location is certainly not for the Gary Danko typical diner because of the gheto-ness.

I certainly love the fried wonton - which can only be found in this Osha location. The shrimp inside the wonton is very fresh and is perfectly paired with the sweet sour sauce. The duck fried rice is another favorite dish of mine. 

In a nutshell, this is my favorite Thai restaurant in the city (unless I could find somewhere else that could serve Thai food as tasty as Boston's thai restaurant)
author: Fred F.

description:
MY SUPER FAVORITE!

I didn't even LIKE Thai food until a friend dragged me in here kicking and screaming.  I can't get enough of the Garlic Pepper Chicken!  I have since converted quite a few Thai haters into Thai LOVERSmmmm and I won't stop until everyone's gotten a taste!

And the service is so damn fast that they would have already served me if I had placed my order when I started typing this.  And I ain't no slowpoke on the keys.

PS--there are 4 other Oshas in the city, but this one trumps them all.
author: Eric E.

description:
This Osha is unlike any other! Seriously, the food here is fantastic and maybe because of its "prime" location, it's always cheaper than its off shoots (e.g. Embardero, Marina, Mission). As everyone else attests, great for after clubbing eating.

- Beef Pad See Ew: they ran out of the fat rice noodles this time and subbed w/ the thinner linguine looking ones. Just as good.
- Spicy Eggplant w/ Seafood: always a favorite dish, though this time I think we had way more seafood and not enough eggplant. The sauce from this dish is simply mouth watering on top of rice.
- Fried Garlic & Pepper Pork: new dish, and maybe cuz I'm not a huge pork fan, this one didn't do it for me. But objectively, the pork was very tender and the fried garlic delivered a lot of flavor.

I'm eager to go back for any of the fried rice dishes (e.g. Green Curry Fried Rice), Basil Leaf Chicken, and the Sticky Rice w/ Mango. Definitely will be back.
author: Cindy W.

description:
I tell people that I could eat Thai food 4 times a week, but I if I lived in San Francisco, I would eat at this location of Osha all the friggin' time!  I wanted to go to the original Osha, since I had been hearing about it all time. 

It did not disappoint me in the slightest.  I'm glad that my friend and I ordered 2 appetizers and 2 entrees because that means leftovers!

The chicken satay was tender and came with their incredible peanut satay sauce.  The shrimp rolls were crunchy, tasty, and fried to perfection.  And I'm not typically a fan of fried foods.  

The pad kee mow is one of my all time favorites with flat rice noodles and its spicy zing.  And to top it all off, we had the duck curry, which was absolutely outstanding!   The leftovers were divine a couple days later.
author: Evelyn K.

description:
I'm a big fan of the chain, but if I want Osha.... I would rather go to the Embarcadero or 2nd street location. 

This location is G-H-E-T-T-O! The only reason I came here was because we wanted to eat after out night out. Since we just hit up Rye and The Ambassador, it was a close enough spot. 

The decor is not anything like the nicer locations. And a trip to the bathroom scared the crap outta me! Dirty and filled with graffiti! 

I'm definitely avoiding another sit down at this place. If I find myself craving Thai late night, I'm grabbing take out.
author: Maggie L.

description:
I have to say, this place has pretty good pad thai! Moist noodles with just the right amount of that thai peanut sauce.

I was skeptical because it's a late night thai joint- however I was quite impressed. 

A friend of mine ordered the chicken salad, but that was okay thought. It's just a bag of mixed icebergs, some carrots, fried chicken strips, and honey mustard dressing. I'd stick to the authentic thai dishes if you're here =)
author: Cindy L.

description:
Okay, so I lived in Hawaii for a few years, where the Thai community is pretty big, and went to Thailand a couple of times too, so I think I am okay when it comes to judge of Thai cuisine. 

And Osha is pretty good. Good flavors, rich meals. I particularly like the green curry fried rich. A thick and silky texture. 

It's a fast service too, that is always good if you are just on a lunch meal in a busy week day. 

My only thing is that the staff is not always the friendliest, but, at least they are efficient.

Just don't go there if you are on a diet, since they are not too careful about calories!
author: Catherine L.

description:
I've been to this place a lot over the years, but only once while sober and i have to say - drunk or sober, the bathroom always gives me the willies.  if you make it there before the crowd your chances of not having to wade through an inch or so of piss covering the bathroom floor is greatly improved.  otherwise, think twice about taking those expensive shoes in there.

Now that the bathroom review is out of the way....

This is one of those old standby's you hit up after a night of heavy drinking when you need some crab fried rice, satay and tom kha gai to keep you from upchucking that last long island you slammed cuz the bar was closing down.  You can't really go wrong, everything on the menu is pretty tasty, the service is fast and the crowd is usually pretty lively, 20 and 30 somethings wrapping up a night out.  This is always a safe bet.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
Although the food is good and not that expensive the service is awful and sorry to say, service makes the food.  Granted we went pretty late like at 2am and it was busy and full of drunken idiots but still....took us 30 minutes to even be asked what we wanted and we still had to wave somebody down and when we actually got someone to take our order he was short with us and wasn't friendly at all.  

We ordered the Osha fried rice and the crab fried rice....I asked for mine to be spicy but it wasn't spicy but it was still good.  Plus there was hardly any meat in any of our dishes.

Would I come back here?  Depends....I'd have to be drunk to go to tolerate that service.
author: David C.

description:
The food is good for eating thai food at 2am while ur still buzzed/drunk (haha).  But the service sucks.  They gave us a small table for 4 for the 6 of us.  They forgot one of our entrees that we had ordered.  They didn't even supply us with eating utensils until we had to ask them for it over and over.The bathroom might give you diseases.

update:: although the service is not so great and it is dirty and in the TL, where a homeless man is always standing infront of the door begging for money or food...  this is still one of my favorite places to go to for thai food! their noodles, fried rice, curries, spicy salads and the rest of their menu trumps most thai restaurants that i have been to
author: Kymberli C.

description:
I decided to give this place a try for a late lunch on a Saturday.  There weren't a ton of people in there, which was nice.  The service was very attentive and prompt.  The music though, good lord.  I do not want to listen to dance music remixes of Mariah Carey and Kelly Clarkson at 2:30 on a Saturday afternoon.  Actually, I don't ever want to hear such music, but definitely not at this time of day in a half-full restaurant.

My staple Thai dish is Phat See You (or Pad See You or Pad See Eew depending on where you are).   It was okay here, but a little on the sweet side.  I also prefer places that don't use Chinese broccoli, which doesn't even resemble broccoli as I know it.  I prefer the typical broccoli.  I ended up leaving all of the broccoli on the plate here because it was so tough.  Sure, it's Americanizing it even further to use typical broccoli, but that's still my personal preference.
author: Squirrel L.

description:
Back in my old college town we used to hit up the trusty ol' Taco Bell or Taco Roco for post-drinking dining. Long gone are my cheap, Mexican food-filled days... Here in SF, I'm lucky to have this Thai joint as my new replacement that's open till 3 am and serves amazingly good food. I've been to their Mission & Marina locations where they have a much cleaner, trendier feel to them vs. this Tenderloiny location, BUT this place doesn't have much of a wait & always sends me home w/ a happy, satisfied tummy.

Try their Pad See Ew and Spicy Fried Rice. You really can't go wrong w/ those 2.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
This is one of my favorite Thai places to eat in the city. 
Favorite things to order.
Tofu Tom Yum soup with the "Skinny Noodle."
The panang curry with chicken.
The potato appetizer thingys
and
the pork fried rice. Top it of with a diet coke and a glass of cold water and I am a super happy girl.
Service does suck.
Bathrooms are funky.
Great prices though.
author: Amanda M.

description:
