I'm indonesian so i'm really picky for south-east asia. I went to thai last year and I didn't remember if the food better than osha. Anyway I'm a faithful costumer to this place. I will recommend this place to all my friends because every times I take people here, they always love their food, not to mention that the portion is big and also not that pricey. 

What I will recommend is Osha sea $10 I think, Tom Yang Gong (I don't know if i spell it right), Fried Rice Duck. I don't know about dessert or appetizer.

Don't  expect the service will be good tho..
author: Fenny G.

description:
Food's pretty good! It's a good late night place: Open till 3:00 am... 

But the bathroom is gross.
author: Ashley M.

description:
Whenever I'm in Frisco, I come here (partly because I haven't really looked into other places in the area and because I don't know anyone locally so I go to where I know its good !!)

We always get the angel wings. The sweet n sour wings we had last time were good too, crab fried rice is divine, papaya salad, pad thai, pad see ew, beef and brocolli (altho this is very inconsistent in the tenderness of the meat, sometimes its great, other times its real chewy n dry) and a few other dishes I can't remember, but its all been good. Again, I'm not a soup person so I can't comment on that. And we always end it with fried bananas and ice cream, just love that hot and cold feeling.

Service is okay tho not too helpful with recommendations, I'd assume its all good stuff but still. Food always comes out SUPER fast. Parking is crap and usually very hard to find. We've always just used the small-ish garage a couple stores down and if you're out in a hour its only $3 I think (but if you have a big SUV I don't know if they'll take you). Never had any issues with them either.

Bathroom is really weird and unkempt looking and yes, thats singular, theres only one. I know theres supposed to be a lot of other Osha's in Frisco but haven't tried 'em yet.
author: Nesto J.

description: My friend was visiting from Guam and her cousin took us to this place because it was one of her favorite thai restaurants in the city.  Wow. The food was delicious.  We just ordered pad thai, panang curry, white rice and some thai teas. When they first brought out the food, the portion looked small (compared to Thai Chili in Elk Grove) but then after mixing the pad thai with the bean sprouts, it looked like the serving size became larger.  Our meal was enough for three people, and we were all full and very satisfied. So far, I'd have to say that their pad thai is my favorite now. That and their crab fried rice... Omgahhh.  So good! Presentation is nice, service is good. We came around 7pm on a Thursday night and the wait was about 10 minutes. And they're open late! You city people got it good.
author: Kayla A.

description:
Wow, how this place has changed over the years. What an evolution. It was basically a hole in the wall in the middle of the Tenderloin, but it WAS the place for good late night food. Now, after it's third or fourth remodel, it's sorta lost it's charm. It's cleaner, the seats torn and you're no longer sharing tables with strangers. 

The food is still great thought. It's harder to eat to eat for under $10/person now, but the prices are still reasonable. Service is fast, but it seems like they lost all of the hot waitresses that use to work there. 

Maybe I'm being nostalgic, but I was longing for the good old late nights at that place, and now it's gone. It's just a regular restaurant now, actually a chain of restaurants as they've open 4 other locations around the city, but I guess it also means that they've been successful. Which, I'm not at all surprise since we use to wait outside, 15-20 minutes at a time, in the middle of Tenderloin, where drug deals were happening at every other corner and prostitutes were on the others, all the while hoping not to get shot and not freeze to death from the cold.
author: John L.

description:
Came here looking to try out their Tom Yum Noodle soup.  It was pretty decent I would rank it a 3rd or 4th out of all the tom yum noodle soups I've had.  As a FYI when you say mild it pretty much means no spice in the soup whatsoever.  

Overall a decent place to eat at.  I definitely like this place way better than their fancy one on 2nd street.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: I've never eaten in, but have enjoyed delivery many times.  I usually order from other places closer to where I live, but these guys cook some mean dishes.
author: Dmytro A.

description:
Went here after being at Ambassador.  Delicious & hits the spot.

Food-  Pad Thai was really good.  It was flavorful and the texture of the noodles was perfect.  The portion size was decent- average for a Thai Restaurant.  My friend ordered the Duck Curry and everyone loved it- if you're a fan of Duck, I recommend this dish.  The eggplant with chicken is also very good according to my friend.  

We arrived here at 11PM and got a table for 8 on the spot.  

Bathroom- Only ONE bathroom for both Male & Female.  Uh.. if you can hold it, I recommend you to hold it.
author: Angela G.

description:
my fiancee would have given osha 4 stars.. i'm not as generous.. the noodles were decent.. and it definitely hits the spot after a night of clubbing.. 

tom yum soup was ok.. tangy and semi-spicy.. 

the pad see ew was ok.. but it's always good with a touch of hot sauce.. in fact.. all their noodles tasted better with hot sauce.. 

duck curry was heavy.. just heavy.. good over rice.. but nothing special

the osha thai special pan fried noodles was pretty good.. a decent amount of duck

the crab fried rice was meh.. but apparently my fiancee loved it.. i like pineapple as much as anyone.. but i'm not sure i want pineapple and crab in the same dish..
author: Stan L.

description: Came here once, man it was goooodddddd  i would definately come here again to eat and eat.  I never wolfed down a dish so far in my life, best chicken fried rice ever
author: Grant L.

description: Don't know why anyone comes to this place anymore. Back in the day it was the shit, now it's just kinda shitty. It's always so busy that they just keep on pumping it out, no attention to detail or taste for that matter. Food is hot but not very good, servers look like they're ready to slit their wrists. Was with some friends that haven't been around in sometime and they really wanted to try it again. They were ready to run out on the check!
author: I D.

description: GREAT late night grub in between bar hopping! good food and service at 12am!
author: Jenn S.

description:
Late hours and in my 'hood are key - the food is OK, not great but not terrible or offensive either.  It's very hip-festive - always good for a group.

The thing I've never cared for is that, without fail, they always bring the appetizers after the entrees.  And every time we've gone there, they've forgotten at least one dish. 

The praram pak (vegetables with peanut sauce - i'm guess remembering the name) is just some blanched vegetables with padang sauce poured over the top.  The papaya salad is too harsh.  The pad thai is not my favorite.

But it's open LATE.

BTW, as pretty as the new Osha is in the Southern FiDi, it is sooooooo loud and the server was MEAN, and the wait with reservations was so unbelievable (we've gone twice and it's been the same both times) that I won't go back.

UPDATE:  Ok so I keep going back to the SoFiDi because it's a good place with a group thanks to those tables.  I have upped it a star because the fried bananas with ice cream was DE-LICIOUS!
author: Robyn C.

description:
One of my fave Thai restaurants in SF and I always come back when I'm in town.  They keep it real.  Where else can I find a place that will put shrimp paste fried rice on the menu?!  Brings me back to my vacays in S.E. Asia.  Yummy!!!  I'd give 5 stars but the bathroom still scares me.  

The 2nd Street version is not so bad, they have the decor going on but they don't have shrimp paste fried rice.  Boo!!!  Guess I'll just have to settle for crab then.  Oh the horror!
author: Melissa B.

description:
92 reviews but here's why I need to review this place.

6:30- best friend from life picks me up to go see dave chappelle at the punch line. i think he's just a fanatic and wants to get inline by 7 b/c it will be crazy.

7:00- punchline, two people outside. he realizes the show is not at 8 like he thought. what a stoner moment, and he doesn't even smoke. i told him it was 10.

7:30- in potrero hill, at his home so he can check the time in his email. two friends from our hs days happen to be visiting his roommate. weird. awkward. we need to eat and go find parking on the street near the punchline.

8:00- successfully find parking near osha. order our food.

8:20- full bellies and on our way to grab a parking spot near embarcadero 2. 

tight. a 20 minute dinner that didnt include french fries and the golden arches and a  great parking spot not too far away. 

that my friends is why osha is good. fast, cheap, decent food.
author: Niki M.

description:
"I know a great place to eat thats open at 1am!"

Food: Ooh, its late at night, you're starving, or just need something to settle your stomach before you go home, from wherever you were - OSHA is the place.  The food is that stick to your stomach Asian food, that'll make sure you don't wake up starving or with a horrible hang over.  

Vibe: URBAN.  Hhaha.  This part of town, of course you're very aware.  But nonetheless, once you sit down, the staff is very kind.  

Parking:  Street!  Get ready to walk. 

Scoring : Late night convince, stick to your stomach eats, at a great price!  Love it!

Lasting thought:  $1.50 Thai iced coffee!  It doesn't get any better than this at 2am.
author: Mai A.

description:
I ate a whole chicken here. i was hella hungry. 

i go here a lot, but i'm not sure why. i guess the food is pretty predictably good and sometimes a little above average. the service is pretty average. coconut soup was good here. the pineapple fried rice is good. this place is pretty small, but they have killer booths to sit in and we usually wait 5 minutes to sit. A good place to eat, especially when drunk.
author: Jessica W.

description:
The food is great, no complaints there, but the service kind of sucks, well a hell of a lot. Take-out is nice, but not when they don't tell you when your order is ready. They wait for you to come up and ask them, and if they are busy, this could mean waiting around for a while, while your food gets cold. 

Yes it's amazing hangover/late night food, but there's plenty more options where the service is a bit better.
author: Brett B.

description:
This review recognizes that Osha Thai is not Thep Phenom. With that in mind:

Yeah, pretty good! The panang curry was all the things that a panang curry should be, and the papaya salad was citrucy and spicy. Asking for "medium spicy" produces real Thai chilies; it is a very respectable medium, and not for the faint-tongued. I ate long after I was full.

One weird thing is that my friend's seafood soup was actually rouge-tinged. Also, the veggie spring rolls were pretty greasy.

I only wish I had saved more room for the sticky rice with coconut ice cream. You definitely want to save room for this one! It is so, so so so good. I worked in a Thai restaurant once upon a time a long time ago, and I thought I knew what stellar sticky rice was... But maybe, just maybe I was wrong.

P.S. This is 3.49 stars, rounded down.
author: Sahra H.

description:
Deceptive exterior. This place has beautiful, modern dark wood tables and great ambient music. The food was solid, however, we ordered a couple appetizers and a couple main dishes. The appetizers were the last to arrive, although everything arrived within 5-10 minutes of ordering. Not exactly what we'd expected. Pad Thai is excellent. Fried salmon appetizer is delish and comes with green beans. Not too pricey and super convenient to bar hop post-dinner. 

We asked for our food medium to spicy...we all like spicy but didn't want to be on fire. The food came out pretty mild. There is a big round tray full of seasonings I couldn't even being to identify. Extensive menu. Fast service. Got really crowded.
author: Angela N.

description:
Now how many nights have I been here post the Qool party at 111 Minna for a late dinner?

A few things on the menu are great  I love, LOVE their pineapple fried rice.  So good.  Fried mixed veggies are standard, and I need to get back to give the true Thai food review now that I've been to Thailand and I've converted.
author: Jenny S.

description:
You want cheap, fast, fresh, decent Thai food?
You want it now, or at 2 am?
Come to Osha.
It aims to give you what you want, service is fast and unfriendly, but who cares? You're here to eat, right?
author: Julia T.

description:
Used to like this place a lot more.  But lately, I just feel like they give little for what they charge.  But they do have business though, so I do understand that they have to charge what they are able to charge to maximize profits.  

I just feel like the portions are too small and I always end up still hungry after I'm done with my meal.  At least with the noodle soups.  But with the other stuff, they are a little better.  So maybe I just have to order the non-noodle soup dishes more often to be satisfied.  

What I do like is that they open late so I can say that it's definitely great to have this option rather than the standard Diner food that is generally what most late night eats will serve.  

So from this point forward, maybe I'll just stick to coming here late night cause there are not many options.  During regular meal times, there ARE alot of other options so most likely I stay away at those times.
author: Mark W.

description:
After more than 5+ shots of Knob Creek without any food in my stomach, just when I was about to barf, my friend dragged me into Osha. Wednesday night at around 11, it's about 95% full! 

The roasted duck curry is AMAZING!! It was creamy (coconut milk) sweet (pineapples) spicy (of course) and savory. OMG, best dish after 5+ shots of Knob Creek!!!! The duck is nicely flavored (marinated then roasted), and so incredibly tender. They use FRESH pineapple chunks, not canned pineapples!

We also got the shrimp egg rolls, and spicy eggplant over rice. The egg rolls are fine, well prepared. The spicy eggplant is pretty tasty with HUGE chunks of eggplants.
author: Yuchi C.

description:
There's not that many place that served good food at 2 o'clock in the morning so this place is truly a gem.
The only complains are the nasty whore that stumble in drunk and puke on their attempt to make it to the restroom.
author: Andres K.

description:
My friend (who lived in SF for a couple of years) had been raving about Osha...so when we finally went, here's what we got:

Highlights:

Pan Fried Noodle: favorite dish of the meal! There was enough sauce to soften the noodles but still retain the "pan fried" feel
Crab Fried Rice:  loved that there was a little meat in the claw
Fresh Mango w/ Sticky Rice looked deceptively unripened, but it was sweet and ripe

It's open late night, conveniently next door to the bar (Rye) we hit up.

Just ok:

Lad Nah w/ Duck: tasted kind of plain, wasn't terrible, but not spectacular either
Fried Fish Cake: I'm not a big fan of fishcake, it was just OK for me
Squid OR Beef Ball (wasn't sure...think we ordered squid but it tasted like beef...): same answer as "fried fish cake"
Fried Chicken Breast over Fried Rice: chicken was tender and lightly breaded and fried served w/ fried rice.  Could imagine myself eating this for takeout in front of the tv...

I don't think I'd crave it, but it was tasty and I didn't leave mad or hungry :)
author: Jackie Y.

description:
My friends took me here and said if I was ever in the City late at night and needed really good Thai food to eat, come here! Well, we went for lunch and were sober but it was really good and clean. For 3, we had 4 dishes, mostly noodles, and the bill with tip came out to about $50, not bad. The service was good, too. 

Their crab fried rice with the fried egg on top really was yummy! We also had some flat noodle dishes and one that was in a soupier broth. Free hot tea, too, if you eat in.

And after a few hours, my head didn't hurt, I didn't feel sick, it was GREAT! I don't think they use MSG like most other Asian places do which doesn't do well with me so I was very happy I had no after effects eating here.

I would def come back to this place. My friends also said this place had some other locations in SF, too, but that this one had the best quality of food.
author: Vivian L.

description:
Crab fried rice!!!
Yummo!!!
I went on a crave for this like almost every day at one point...worst part
my hubby had to cross the bay bridge to get this for me all the time.
I must say it is the best thing ever!!
author: Grasie l.

description: It has been awhile since the first time I came to this restaurant and when I returned I remember why. The service, they don't even seem to try to be friendly or engaging or give you any information about an item other than "yea its good or spicy." So why did I come back and why the 3 stars? Although most the time bad service will detour me from ever going back again, the food has me hooked! the Volcano Beef and Garlic Lamb Shanks are two of the best dishes Ive ever ate. My fiance got the Spicy Dice which was really good. So in all for some good late night Thai this is the place to be. Just don't expect a smile from your Waiter!
author: Sean C.

description: This place has great ambience!  It can get rather crowded and gets a line out the door but that's because it's sooo good.  Great for going with friends after drinking and is open late.
author: Paige W.

description: Is this part of the same chain as the other Osha Thais? I was crying all over my meal, so I didn't really get to enjoy it. But through all of the salt and tears, I think I enjoyed my pad see ew.
author: Jamie C.

description:
The food is mediocre if you are seeking authentic Thai, go some where else.

The service is poor and the place is a little run-down. For the money, I would say they are over-priced and over rated.
author: C L.

description:
Visited this place for the first time last week. My gal-pal and I were weary from the traffic to get into the city and hungry from a meeting that we were an hour late for. Woops! 

So we agreed - shoot let's go grab some grub and a beer somewhere quick. And quick it was! We luckily ninja'd our way in and got a table in less than 3 minutes. I ordered the Penang Chicken with (hella) rice. I eat rice everyday, but that was like ratio fist full of rice to each piece of chicken hiding beneath the murky curry sauce. 

Curry was a little too watery, but I can forgive a lot when I'm starving. Service was fast, beer was chilled = happy little me. 

Awesome place!
author: Noemi T.

description:
4 words

SUPER GOOD
SUPER CHEAP

oh i love this place so much. great place to eat if you are in downtown sf after a long day of shopping. just a couple of blocks up on geary. sometimes there is a line, but you know what that means...IT'S CRACKIN lol
and i love how it's open late. munchies time JK hahaha

the food is soo good, has a lot of flavor, good portions for the price.

very cute place =)
author: Teresa W.

description:
I found myself here several times this past week. Usually, post midnight and cocktails. The minute we stepped inside the service was always nice and prompt. When we walked in closer to closing time they even offered to pack up warm meals and send us on our merry, greasy Thai food loving way. 

If I lived in San Francisco I'd probably frequent this Osha since it has so many good bars within close proximity. I have to say that I wish they were opened until 2am during the week.
author: Jason L.

description: Funny enough I like the OSHA down in SOMA, but this one is really not so hot! It doesn't help that it has the same prices as their other stores with an ambiance that is not up to speed. Food is good, but not worth the prices.
author: Megan R.

description: I went here last night for the first time with a group of 15 and needless to say that they are VERY fast! The food is great and the prices are reasonable. I had the Garlic and Pepper Chicken over rice and I was able to eat half and feel stuffed! I also had some of the Beef Pad Thai which was very good! My boyfriend ordered the Spicy Dice with Salmon. It was diced Salmon and Green Beans in a spicy chili coconut sauce. It was very good but I would probably order it mild next time. Be FOREWARNED!!! IF you're not a spicy food fan, this is not the place for you! Medium is REALLY spicy! At least it was for me! I will definitely come back to this place if I want a fast Thai meal in the City!
author: Mees R.

description:
My favorite Osha location hands down! 

This little shop near the tender nob is delicious and unpretentious.  Unlike certain other locations (Embarcadero and the Marina) this place serves the full Osha menu for lunch and dinner.  

To top it off, it also serves Thai Noodle Soup - YUM. Definitely one of the best Thai Noodle Soup places in the city: it's not too sweet, with just right amount of sourness and oodles of spicy sauces if it's not hot enough for ya. 

The food comes out with good speed - very important if you are impatient like me.  Good service, decor, and portions for the price. 

One star off for having a nasty bathroom though...
author: Amy L.

description: Good food, nice and spicy when needed and pricing is not all that bad. While the neighborhood may seem a little scary, it is just fine with friends.
author: H L.

description: Get the Tom Yum Soup with Rice Noodle. Spicy Level - Medium!  Perfect for a cold day!
author: Sophie S.

description: Osha has been some of the best food I've had at 2 am. I got the pad thai and really enjoyed it. It was just a really good pad thai, it IS a typical dish but it really is quite tasty here. Everyone else in my group was very happy with their dishes as well. I'm frequently in the area to go out and will end up here when I'm feeling the pre or post party munchies. Definitely recommend this place.
author: Shayan R.

description: Great Thai Food and Location. The service was very good and the crowd was not too busy for a lunch time. Can't say there was anything special about the place but a location I am sure to return.
author: Rix G.

description: Saw chef blowing his nose and sneezing over the cold food station in the kitchen and demanded my money back on my to go order.  Dirty, dirty, dirty.  Shame on you Osha.
author: moodyfoodie m.

description:
The original Osha Thai Noodle Cafe... 

I swoon at the thought of Pad See Ew at this theater district neighborhood haunt.  I used to live, just two blocks from this eatery and boy did I have them dialed in.  

From late night munchies to quick bites, vast assortment of dishes ( rice plates, noodle dishes and salads ), quick service (if you're hungry, they're waiting for you) then take my word, this place is top notch that won't make a dent in your pocketbook.

I Love Osha Thai!
author: Aimee C.

description:
Given the "ambience" and anti-Marina (read: Tenderloin) surroundings, this is not the place to take a romantic date.  Unless she is easy-going, enjoys tasty food, appreciates fast and efficient service, and isn't indignant you spent only $15 on her.  

Heck, I've even taken friends visiting from Germany and my sister (albeit not simultaneously) to this joint, and they ALL rave about it.

In particular, I recommend the "Osha Spicy Dice" -- one of the few over-$10 dishes -- that consists of delicious salmon, perfectly cooked green beans, and a frickin' addictin' smooth and slightly sweet curry sauce.  Enough for one super-hungry person or two mildly hungry peeps.

Also, do get the mango and sticky rice for dessert.  It's a wonderful close to the meal here :)

My only quibbles?  Sometimes you have to wait for a seat.  The ice coffees and teas are too sweet for my taste and they can't be adjusted (they just add a mix apparently).  Oh, and skip the non-Geary location; I was really peeved to find that the selections were sparser (is that a word?) and the prices were higher at the Valencia location I went to, and the food wasn't any better tasting.  Oh, and the seats were uncomfortable.

Anyway, given that this is my first Yelp review, I should probably just quit blatherin' and say: Go to Osha Thai on Geary and Leavenworth (and bring me some of the leftovers) :-)
author: Adam L.

description:
Osha Thai on Geary is the original Osha. It's the uglier one and the Osha that is open late.

The food and prices are pretty much all the same at all Osha locations so I would much rather eat at the prettier ones on Valencia or 2nd Street. But the Geary location is one of the few choices for an after-hours meal, which proves why it is often packed in the early morning hours.

If you're ever there, check out the graffiti in the bathroom. It's pretty awesome.
author: Tommy T.

description:
Some of the best service I've had in the Bay Area.  Three times they tried to come take our order, but we had already ordered.

Both us had food restrictions and they were totally accommodating without batting an eye.  Made the sweet and sour noodle soup into a vegetarian version that was tasty and not a bad deal for $7.50.  Made up my friend's celiac-friendly meal that was cheap, too.  

I love it when a restaurant doesnt make a big deal about getting your order the way you want/need it --- go figure.  

I hear they're open late so anothe bonus when you're out having drinks.
author: Surf R.

description:
I'm so glad this place is open as late as it is.  Every time I'm in Rye it seems like hours have managed to slip by and all of the wonderful bartenders in there keep my belly full of Mint Gimlet and Mojito galore and Oronoco, I seem to forget that I haven't eaten!  The crowd around me is beautiful and the brick wall with its subtle and track lit ambiance with candles all over the place is so overwhelmingly pleasing that I have just forgotten to pay attention that knock at the door by my hungry belly, "hey bastard, if you want to keep on going like this you had better feed me something good!!"

So I go over to Osha and they seat me.  There is always a pleasant crowd (whether you go late like me or not) and the guys in the kitchen are considerate enough to wear gloves and even masks over their face and the menu just goes on forever...  I'd recommend the Chinese Broccoli with roast side pork, but I'm a meat guy.  If you're not, that is OK because they have tofu and vegetable dishes to die for and the service is fast here. 

Order a Thai iced tea and relax while your belly bangs a fork and knife on the table of your belly in anticipation a Thai food explosion!!!
author: Benjamin G.

description:
Sawasdee

Great food, priced well, located next door to a bar (Rye), open late night and walking distance to my place gets it a 5 stars in my book.

Some people complain about the service, but let's be fair, most people that go there are people who had few drinks before hand and some are obnoxious and they wonder why they don't get great service.  For me, I always get decent service, not white table cloth establishment service, but good.  I just break out a few thai phrases (i am hungry = chan hiu, Thanks =Korp khun krap) I know to pass up the que.

fyi- there spicy is actually spicy, so just warning you ahead of time.
author: Alan N.

description:
This is the only Osha location I've been to.

The service is hit or miss, depending on when you go and who is on shift. I've taken dates here and we've gone for quite a while without water while having a spicy meal, to the point where I try to sneak behind the counter to get water.

"Can I help you sir?"

"Oh, finally..."

The food is consistently good, and usually comes out fast and hot. My favorite dish is the Pahram with chicken. Just thinking about it makes me hungry. They do some sort of magic with their tofu that makes it better than meat!

Be warned, phone ordering in a meal for pickup can be really aggravating. I tried to do a phone order once, and my cell dropped the connection half way through ordering. They wouldn't pick up the phone when I tried calling back a couple of times!

The 38 and 27 bus goes right by here, so it's super easy to get to. I usually walk to this location. There is metered street parking if you are feeling lucky.
author: Mark B.

description:
Pretty good Thai.  King of Thai is probably one step below.
Osha has a modern furnished interior.  Deep black finished wood benches with hip industrial lighting.  Usually pretty busy.   Yellow curry is a bit sweet,  Spicy Laht Nah (thick noodles w/ gravy) was mediocre.  Everyone is right about the service. It really is random to get good service.
Angel wings are good but also too sweet for me.  They get an extra star for being able to choose level of spiciness of your dish.  
Good eats at a great location for decent prices!
author: JASON L.

description:
I swear I'm addicted to this place. I LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE IT! I go the Valencia location more often - but if you're bar hopping and you're craving some peanut curry - OSHA is the place. Its open so late at night and packed with drunken people!

reheat - wasn't so great. still edible though!
author: Anita C.

description:
I love the original Osha, before they expanded and went upscale.  I am all for ambiance and don't mind paying slightly more for it, but Osha going upscale means taking away my favorite dish at the new locations, Tom Yum noodle soup.  

At the other locations, they either don't taste the same or "only available during lunchtime."  What the?  I can see how a bowl of noodles can't justify hiking up the price and therefore not a profitable dish to have when you invested mucho dollars decorating the walls.  But I just don't know if I even would want to go to Osha if they didn't have it.  Everything else I can get at other Thai restaurants.  Tom Yum Noodle Soup was the only difference.  And you really can't get the same taste anywhere else, not even at Marnee Thai where they have something similar.  

I also love the original Osha for its hours.  Nothing beats an greasy pad thai, or fried rice or sticky rice with mango at 2am when you are drunk and hungry and happy.
author: Candice B.

description:
I used to live around the corner to this place. And around the neighborhood, there are plenty of Thai places, but this is still my all time favorite. If you'd like to try a little something different from your everyday pad thai, their Osha special, the one with the seafood and the lobster is REALLY good. But everything else on the menu is pretty tasty as well. I love their noodle soup, not only cause I'm a noodle soup fan, but their soup really has their unique Thai flavor stewed right into it.
If I'm ever shopping in downtown, i wouldn't mind walking a few more blocks to this place just to rest my feet and fill my hunger!
author: Fanny C.

description:
I love going to this place after a good night out.  Definitely better than the typical late night pizza or burrito (or at least a change of pace).

Duck Pad See Ew as drunk eats is just fantastic and it's always fun just talking to random other drunk people.

I actually think the food here tastes better than the food at other locations (particularly the marina) but perhaps that's just the effect of tipsy taste buds. :)
author: Sam H.

description:
Good late night dining that makes me feel a little healthier than Jack in the Box or McDs.  I usually come with friends after a long night of drinking and dancing. Fun times=)

Get the duck curry! It's awesome =) The crab fried rice was better at the Osha in Embarcadero Center but its not bad here either.
author: Becka T.

description:
Sure there are 549 other Thai places to go to that have better ambiance and aren't in the ghetto of Tender-nob (no offense)...

BUT, Osha (more specifically, Osha on Geary) makes a decent Pad Thai, a delicious Pad see ew, and they are open until 3am!  Enough said.

Word to the wise...if it is close to 3am and you want take out...call ahead and place your order (even while you are in the cab or beginning your walk there - although why would you be walking at 3am in this area is beyond me)...they are quick and it will be ready when you get there. :)

Don't eat the weird Thai candies on the counter (unless your name is Paul), because they trick you!  You think it is chocolate, but I always find a way to pull the coffee-flavored candy out of the assortment.  Yuck!
author: Carlyna R.

description:
Whoa, the prices have gone up since the last time I was here!  One of the few good Thai restaurants in the bay area, the crab fried rice and Pad Thai are two of my favs here.

I should try out the one on Union street next time.
author: J D.

description:
Hey weird. I was just about to review this place but my sister (who I dined with), already has. See below -- Shannon B. 

Way to steal my thunder, Shan. 


In summary: the Tom Yom was good, the fried rice was decent, and that place is in dire need of some windows. And maybe cushions on the benches? Osha wasn't bad, but it wasn't as good as the hype. 

Good location + open late = I would go back... after a night of drinking.
author: Megan B.

description:
I am a convicted lover of this place.  I still love it after all these years.  I wish they delivered.

Currently, my favorite dishes are the roast duck curry and the chicken pad see ew, and my favorite appetizer is the fried curry balls.
author: Susan C.

description:
This is the best Osha by far.  I've been getting their crab fried rice since college (has it been 10 years already?!?!), and strangely I think this is the only location that serves it.  Unfortunately, the price of the crab fried rice has risen from $5.95 to $11.95 (it had grown slowly over the years, but I still experienced some sticker shock last night).  Still, it's probably the closest thing I have to a food addiction and they've got to go a bit higher to price me out.

Other dishes are also great.  I'm a big fan of the Osha spicy pan fried, and the duck curry is delicious too.

Maybe I don't go there often enough (I visit from out of town every few months), but the look seems to change every time.  Fortunately, the food is always awesome!
author: Mike W.

description:
I'm going to warn readers of two things that have affected my review:
1. Driving to downtown SF and then looking for parking was a pain.  I circled the area for 20 minutes before I found a spot.  I'm picky about where I eat and what I have to do to get there.
2.  I have had thai food plenty of times before, so nothing was really new to me.

 The service was fine.  I was surprised to see that one of the waiters could remember what each person ordered, especially since there were 20 of us (birthday party).  

Osha Thai has decent food, I'm not going to lie.  But for what they give you, it's pretty expensive.  Almost 10 dollars for BBQ chicken over fried rice is almost ridiculous.  It was good, but nothing fantastic.  I've had better BBQ chicken, and the fried rice was bland.  

I dont know if it's mandatory for cafes, but the huge windows allowed some strange characters to stare at me and my friends while we were eating.  Very uncomfortable.  All in all, it was an interesting experience, but I don't think I'll be going back there again.
author: Andrew T.

description:
Hella GOOD! everything is just tasty and delicious...i would love to dine in here during the day...i tend to eat here for most of my late night outs and yes they are packed around 2am, but gets you seated quickly. love the pineapple fried rice and the pad seeu. 
FYI--this place is way better than the one on embarcadero or the marina.
author: Maria S.

description:
Fastest take-away service in the world!
Call and 10 mins MAX later you have your order.

I have eaten in there a few times and love it but this place earns it's dosh from me at 2am on fridays or saturdays (open till 3am) or in take away

the food is great, the price is good and it is a nice looking resturant
gold
author: Nathan H.

description:
Osha Thai is the perfect late night dining spot after the clubs.  It's located in the Loin, right on the corner of Leavenworth and Geary.  They're so busy at times that they may forget to put your name down for a table.  Their space is tight, but they make use of it and service is pretty quick.  I don't like their sticky brown tables though - pretty damn gross.

The food is your standard Thai food.  Gotta love the carbs after a night of drinking.  Pad Thai is a big plate - half with bean sprouts and grounded peanuts and half with the actual noodles... so this gives you the illusion you have a bigger portion.  Pad See Ew was delicious but kinda small.  My friend and I grabbed some and it seemed like half the plate was gone already, which is surprising to us because we ordered 5 dishes to share with 6 people.  Angel Wings were meh - nothing too spectacular and not worth $7.  Pumpkin Curry was flavorful, but I like it when pumpkin is actually mushed and incorporated into the curry sauce.  Pineapple Fried Rice was good - def hit the spot.

All in all, I would come back here if I was out at the bars or lounges, but I wouldn't come here during normal dinner or lunch hours.  It's more convenient for its late hours.
author: Michelle W.

description: This place used to be very accomodating to vegetarians and would make vegetarian versions of most of their dishes, i.e. without fish sauce and replacing the meat with veggies and tofu.  However, they no longer do so.  For an establishment that is moving in the wrong direction in being accomodating to their customers, I cannot give more than one star.
author: Dinesh M.

description: if you can avoid getting screamed at by people in the area and manage not to step on something gross, this place is nice.  they're always quick and the food is consistently good.
author: M C.

description: Their food is okay-great; some good, some soso. I used to go here all the time since they're open late and right across my apartment, but they've given both me and my boyfriend food-poisoning, not just once, but THREE times. I do crave Osha sometimes but, I'm scared to go there again. But, if you insist on going, I recommend Pad Thai, Angel Wings, Tom Yum noodles, Roti, and Thai Iced tea.
author: Hana K.

description:
I like vegetarian options here and their fresh juice. 

But love ambiance if i ignore offending elephant sculpture.
author: chess t.

description: It's 5 stars because Osha opens late right after I get out of the club.  Good eats after way too much alcohol consumption! I love their pad thai, omggggg.  It's so good.
author: Jenny W.

description:
Looking for some late night grub?  This is your answer.  This is one of those places where you definitely want to follow the crowd.  I've been going to this place for more than 9 years and I have to say it hasn't changed a whole lot.  

Keep it simple:
COMBINATION FRIED RICE! 
PAD SEE EW 
PAD THAI - A little sweet but still tasty
THAI ICE TEA 
FRIED BANANA WITH ICE CREAM
  
FYI - Parking can be a B..
author: Brent S.

description:
I've been wanting to review this restaurant for a while now..keep forgetting and finally I bump into the restaurant while visiting a friend in that neighborhood. My experience of this place was aweful. Food was ok, but too pricey for quality and quantity as well as presentation. I could get better thai food anywhere. This place is nothing special. in fact worst I've had. We ordered a dish of soup, an appetizer, curry, a noodle dish, a tofu dish, chicken dish,  an eggplant dish for 4 of us ...ALL Small small portions and quality was mediocre. 

Service was baaaaad. Talk about bad -- I would say horrific is more like it.  The outing was to celebrate a close friends'  birthday, and we wanted to surprise her w/ a small  birthday cake. We brought the cake from her favorite bakery and decided to present it to her at the restaurant. To our shock, when asked if we want to order desserts, we told the waiter we won't be ordering desserts-- we actually have a birthday girl on our table here turning 30 today! From her favorite bakery we brought with us her cake--would she mind providing us 4 dessert plates and forks to help us enjoy the cute birthday cake we have?  Her response was "No, sorry but I can't do that".  We all  said, "what ?!!"  She said they have a strict policy and she must follow -- they do not allow food brought from outside the restaurant, and they do not offer plates to serve it, or to provide any type of service related to the food brought in.  I thought I had a hearing problem -- I could NOT believe my ears!!  WTF!!!  Excuse us for dinning at your restaurant and spending upwards of $80 for LUNCH!!!   It was a simple small birthday cake to serve 4 people. Our cake surprise was ruined -- and it  that  ruined our spirits and the purpose of our celebration quickly went to the dumps. We were all disappointed - shocked - and angry.  All of us swear we will never patronize this restaurant ever  again.  They DID not deserve our business. There are plenty of restaurants willing to provide us 4 little dessert plates !! DO NOT go there!
author: Jessica H.

description: I love coming here after a night of partying in the city. The service is fast and friendly. Sometimes you just need some greasy food to sober you up. The food here is just average, but I love that they are open late. It's always crowded late night. I would just rather come here than the millions of pizza places (but if a pizza place is located right next to a bar/club...then you can find me there).
author: Patricia L.

description: The BBQ chicken was make with boneless chicken breast which was amazingly moist.  The wasabi sauce on the fried calamari had just the right amount of fire while the bed of pear made for a refreshing contrast.  Service was a bit slow on a Sunday afternoon, but it was a lazy afternoon to enjoy so I didn't mind.  I would come back.
author: Joe N.

description: This used to be one of my favorite places, especially since it is open until 3:00 AM, hence the three stars. Their duck noodle soup was awesome and so were most of the other soups. However, seems like there may have been a change in Chefs and now the food is not as good as it used to be.... Disappointing, since I have been going there since  '99.
author: Mariya L.

description:
thai food....mega spicy. 

I had the 5star (extra spicy) pad kee mao w/ tofu. My lord was i not ready for the spice.. there's just something about the discomforting feeling of burning lips. Any who putting aside the heat the dish was well prepared, the ingredients seemed fresh and the tofu... pleasing. Plus the food just had that good look... a squiggle of  red sriracha sauce on the the side.. ohhh

To cool off this spicy far east cuisine i ordered the thai tea, which was deelicious, and drank several cups of water, which were refilled quickly..yess good service points.

An interesting affordable experience.
author: Mike E.

description: Food is good, service is terrible. A little bit more expensive than it should be.
author: Nisa Q.

description: Came here with co-workers for a birthday event. Food took long to come. Overall quality of food was pretty decent and presentation was good.
author: Steven C.

description:
This place is awesome.
It's open after the club so that's a plus.
My friend lives literally across the street so I have 2 reasons to make my way over here to eat.
Their fried chicken wings are excellent.
And, it's not over priced here.
I haven't been to their other locations but I'm good with just sticking to this one.
author: Grace P.

description:
The Osha on Geary is kickin. so consistently good. it is better than the top Thai restaurants i've been to, and its more fun. The Ducky Curry rocks, as does the Osha Spicy Pan Fry, The Beef and Eggplant, amongst others.
As of tonight i must add two of my new favorites: Garlic pepper lamb Ribs  and Pork with Chinese Broccoli. super delish.
author: sarah C.

description:
Food: 3.5 stars (authentic, good variety, quality, & flavor)
Atmosphere: 3.2 stars (fast pace modern eatery)
Service: 3.3 (fast and efficient)
Price: 4 (very reasonable for what you get)

Recommended Dishes: 
Sukiyaki Soup (must ask for the special sauce) Thai style soup w/veggies and seafood, it's spicy and perfect for a cold day!  The special sauce hits the spot!
Fried rice w/fried chicken
Papaya Salad
Thai ice tea

NOTES: parking is only available on the street, almost always a wait going on at all hours but the wait isn't so bad. Parking in the area can be a challenged if you're not lucky!
author: Mel S.

description:
Best Thai food I have had in the city so far.  Went with my pal, who is originally from Bangkok, and a resident of the East Coast US.  According to him, the noodles were the most authentic he has tasted in the US.  The chix wing app was not necessarily "authentic", but the sauce was recognizable as one that is widely used on a popular whole fish dish.  

Thanks to the prices I will be going back a lot.
author: Joel K.

description:
Osha Thai You Make Me Sigh . . . 

So I've been going to Osha since '98, before they expanded this location and it's as good today as it was back then. . . 

Now that they are all over town the prices are a bit higher in some locations, so I say stick to the original.

By the way, what spice do they put in that thai fried rice with chicken? It's like crack! I can eat an entire plate on my own----my stomach says I'm full, but that spice just brings me back for more. . . the thick rice noodles with chinese broccoli and beef is also wonderful and the yellow curry with chicken has just the right amount of coconut.

I like that they still open late and after a few too many cocktails at Rye next door, it's easy to crawl on over to Osha for some amazing Thai food.

What can I say: Terrific Thai!
author: David R.

description:
2.12.07 (...and about 15 other times)
8:30PM

This is the OG Osha: the flagship motha that started it all.  I have eaten at 3 of their 5 locations and this one is by far the grimiest of them all.  (I love the Mission...I LIVE in the Mission....but the Osha in the Mission isn't Osha.  The one in Embarcadero Center is pretty legit.)

Osha is Thai goodness at its very best.  (Also been to both Ozone & Citizen Thai; they don't hold a candle to the FOOD at Osha.) 

FOOD:  5 Stars  (awesome....awesome....awesome....)
VALUE:  5 Stars (dirt cheap)
SERVICE:  2 Stars  (bring your own water; GL flagging down a server to put out that fire in your mouth!)
DECOR:  2 Stars  (The Mission and Embarcadero locales are much nicer...)

For the price, you can't help but love this fast and delicious eatery (plus my girlfreind only lives 2 blocks away!)  If you come during peak hours, (after 7PM EVERYNIGHT) expect a wait.
author: William R.

description:
What can I say about OSHA.

It's fast, affordable and they are open late.

My fav...crab fried rice. I rather come here to eat compare to Denny's.
author: jubi l.

description:
Don't get me wrong, the place has delicious thai food. One of the best in San Francisco.

Here's the low down. I'm all for hole-in-the-wall, cheap eats to have lower quality of service. Shoot I expect that.  If I want service I'll go the the Osha on 2nd St. But when you don't know your server and she's looks like she's gonna kill you for asking for extra napkins and water.. there's a problem.
author: Jack H.

description:
My favorite dish is the Duck curry, but you can't go wrong with any of the curry dishes here. Get the Taro rolls as an appetizer. Green Papaya salad has too much vinegar and is pretty spicy. Phat See You is one of my favorite noodle dishes here. Most dishes are spicy, especially for a wimp like me, so you need to request mild.
Great for a late night fix, as they're open until 3am on the weekends.
author: Arlene C.

description:
Cheap, solid, generic, modern Thai.  Tasty, fast, nothing special, but it does hit the spot.

I originally gave this place three stars, but on my return trip, I would have to say that my waitress's handling of my dining companion's demanding attitude plus the tasty tasty tasty taro rolls and panang curry with tofu have garnered it the four stars it truly deserves.

I think there's almost always a wait, though.  And don't count on the service being helpful, I think our girl was more the exception.  Although I don't blame them, it's loud and busy and always crowded, and I wouuld give all those hipsters attitude too if I had to wait on them every day.
author: Kyle T.

description:
I love this place! It's the best fried rice and veggies I've had at any thai place. The seating is very limited but it's worth it! The dishes are really cool shaped and the design is very trendy. I would say this Osha location is the best of all of the Oshas around the city.  I've eaten at all of them and i like this one the best.  
It's always a guessing game with thai food at my house...I plan on going back to osha if I can get my boyfriend to stop obsessing with thai stick.
author: Sloane G.

description:
I HEART OSHA THAI!  You will find an array of patrons any time of the day.  When I make it out to the City, I try to hit this spot up.  I enjoy the fact that I could get delicious Thai food at midnight to feed my cravings!  

The chicken larb is my absolute favorite!  The combination of the thinly sliced red onions and dressing.  The warmth of the meat and the coolness of the lettuce is a good combo.  The tom yum chicken (soup) is good on a cold day.  They add the right amount of spices (of course they cater to your taste buds-mild, medium to spicy).  Pineapple fried rice is full of flavor.  The Thai laht nah talay is good too...it must be the delectable gravy they serve with it!   Their Pad Thai and duck curry is on my list of good eats as well!  

The Geary location is smaller compared to their newer locations.  Don't expect to get seated quickly, but do expect to have your food served in a good amount of time.  It's in and out so the service is mediocre.  Every dish I've had has been delicious.  I haven't complained once about any of their dishes!
author: Margarita M.

description:
Ahh... Osha. An oasis in the middle of the TL. Osha has been a great fallback - I've been there for birthdays, I've been there late at night to cure the midnight munchies, I've even been there for Valentine's Day! (Only because it's right near all the theaters - not because it's romantic!)

Osha is solid Thai food served in an unpretentious and bare bones atmosphere. It's cheap, the service is quick and efficient, and it's the perfect place to stop before or after a night out on the town. 

I've seen the new fancypants Osha in the Marina, but the Osha in the TL will always have my heart.
author: Ava S.

description:
Let me say the food is good, and served quickly.

So why the 2 stars?

Because the goddamn waiters are just plain dumb.  Don't clear out the plates, and hand me the bill when you give us the dessert menu...

DUMB DUMB DUMB.
We got dessert at another place.
Thank you. 

Next time i'll get take out.
author: garbanzo b.

description:
Went to this place with a total group of eight people. It was OK. The food was maybe a 4/5 but the service was not so good. The wait staff was rather rude and curt. They forgot who ordered which drink and pressured us to order. 

The restroom was nasty and wet because of the rain. No one took the time to mop the floor and we witnessed at least three people slip and slide as they exited and come close to falling. 

Food = 4/5
Service = 2/5
Restroom  =  0/5
author: A J.

description:
I've walked by this restaurant on many occasions since it's on the way to the office from my parking lot in SF. It's got a more modern flair than most Thai places, although for the food I wouldn't say that it's limited to Thai. The food's more "general Asian" but with a bit of a modern twist to it. 

When I went my party ordered 3 appetizers : the seared Ahi tuna, chicken/beef satay, and the crispy duck. All these appetizers were fantastic and I had high expectations for the entrees. I must have chosen something that was less than spectacular, because the BBQ/Crispy pork was less than remarkable. I will say that I will go again in hopes of a better entrees.

The wait staff was very attentive and both the female/male waiters were very good looking. Even around the entire restaurant, there were great looking people. There must be something about the joint, that attracted all of the attractive patrons to Osha! One thing worth noting was that it is a fairly loud restaurant with the amount of people eating, the wait staff, and background music. So if you're looking for a quiet dining experience or looking for a place where you don't have to talk a little louder than usual, then this may not be the right place.

Good eats in my book!
author: Chris D.

description:
Osha Founder 1: Let's open a restaurant  in Mission... I don't know Thai maybe... those people over there love that kinda thing.

Osha Founder 2: But we don't know a thing about Thai food.

OF 1: Who cares? Just make the place fancy with lots of shiny bright objects and art and get some good looking waitresses.

OF 2: Sure but what about the food?

OF 1: You worry too much. Just pick up some thai paste or whatever from Whole Foods and some cans of mixed chinese vegetable or some shit.

OF 2: That's it?? It doesn't sound very authentic.

OF 1: These people don't know jack. Just make the place fancy looking and don't forget to cut the cucumbers fancy too.
author: Jay N.

description:
I gotta give this place 5 stars. We found this place one night (2003)after the usual "out to eat after a club" and were sick of the crap you get down at Mels or Dennys! This place was open till 2am on a Sat. night.

We now frequent this place whenever we are in the area and want a Thai fix =) The grafitti bathroom I thought was pretty cool (just dont touch anything). As far as I know this was the first Osha in SF. We also started going to the one in the financial district at Embarcadero 4. Totally different atmosphere but the same great food.

Everyone we have pointed to this place has had nothing but good things to say.
author: Marlon O.

description:
Had the Chicken Thai Basil.  Portion was fair, bell peppers were NOT soggy, perfectly done!  Very Tasty!  Shared the Thai boat soup... Great as well! 

My homie I was with ordered the beef salad.  Very delectable as well!  Thai food is my new favorite food at the moment!  Go THAI!!!!
author: Ryan A.

description:
Yo what happened? I remember just about a year ago, this place was awesome. Something about this place fell off. 

First of all, someone mentioned that the food was "pretty standard". Yes, that sums it up exactly. It's hard to describe that, but it's just "standard". And that wouldn't be too bad except.... did they raise the prices? I could have sworn just a year ago, this place was slightly cheaper. 

Nowadays, it's hard to justify going here when there are other great Thai options that not only taste better but are cheaper.

Another thing, last time I went, they had completely forgotten my order! So I sat there waiting for my food, while everyone else at my table was about halfway done with their meal. That sorta sucked......  

Osha Thai man.... you done fell off......
author: Jay W.

description:
Had friends in from out of town and needed a great place for six people on a Saturday night.  Luckily we arrived fairly early for the Sat night dinner crowd (around 7:30pm) so we were able to snag a six top before the larger crowds arrived.  Great vibe for our group (love the lit-up wall and darker overall atmosphere). Louder place but that was good for us as we were all laughing and talking loudly ourselves.

Most important though - the food was stellar.  We are all from Seattle originally where there is no shortage of great Asian food and Seafood but this place delivered.  The duck, green curry, phad thai and steamed calamari were particularly memorable.  Service was pretty solid - regularly checking in with us if not overly engaged (which is fine when you have six people who are fully in conversation) - although we had to ask for more water toward the end of the meal as we were hitting the spicier stuff.  But by that time, it was full on Saturday night dinner crowd so that can be forgiven.

Overall - great vibe, wonderful food, good service and the prices weren't bad either.  I'd highly recommend Osha and I'd absolutely return myself.
author: Anna M.

description: Good food, great casual atmosphere. The duck and chicken curry is tasty.  Went there a few times, never had any bad service.
author: Jonquinette M.

description: This is my favorite Osha in the city.  Amazing Thai food for cheap...that's what I am talking about.  Granted it is in the TL but the food and service has always been great (been coming here for over 5 years).  The other Osha's might be in nicer areas and the decor may be fancier but this is the spot.  They are also open into the early morning so it is perfect to stop in after the bars on the way home.  The pad thai and cashew chicken are off the hook and the tom kha soup is yummy too.
author: Austin P.

description:
When I used to think of Osha, I would drool and have a semi-orgasms. The Bloody Sally had the right combo of crispy exterior while the interior of the salmon was tender and the sweet chili sauce was always hot. The Pad See Ew was always mouthwatering (I prefer it with beef) and the chinese broccoli was always cooked to provide a crisp in every bite. My faves also included the Spicy Eggplant (I love the flavors of eggplant and thai basil marrying each other in a dish), Pineapple Fried Rice, and Fried Banana with Ice Cream to take your stomach to its limit. Not only was the food good, the service was quick as fuck. 

I have been coming to this place for over 5 years and it has always made me excited to eat here until they changed the decor to match the one downtown. The portions were not as large as they used to be and the flavors do not seem to make my mouth convulse anymore. 

I went here for lunch a couple of years ago (right after the decor was replaced with espresso wooden seats with no back support), and when the pineapple fried rice arrived at our table, we found the rice to be undercooked and it was still hard. This rice dish is not supposed to be cooked like paella people. I have never thought a dish would be sent back at Osha, and I was disappointed when that day came. 

Despite my disappointing comment, I come back to this place bc the dishes are good, but it is not the same as it used to be.
author: Nancy B.

description:
I still love this place.
The prices have doubled since I started going there when they first opened, but SF in general blew up in cost of living since then.
I give the place five stars since the other Osha restaurants that have opened around the city are far more rediculously overpriced, this TL location is still the best bang for your buck.
Some other reviews are negative, but every restaurant has off times, and a few sub par dishes, but this Osha still generally has high quality, fresh ingredients, fast service, with a nice-while-not-too-fancy dining room
author: Chuck D.

description:
This is probably the least fancy of the Oshas in the city, but it's THE BEST! Ok, so there are multiple jean jacket outfitted creepy crackheads asking you for money outside...that's hardly a downside to Osha. That's one negative compared to many many delicious positives. Like...

(1) Their $1.50 (or something close to that) Cucumber salad
(2) Spicy Eggplant-deeeeelicious
(3) Grilled Chicken salad-tangy, healthy and amazing

The servers are always nice...except on the weekends when they are busy as hell and trying to serve drunken ruby sky attendees at like 2:30am right before closing.
author: Karina A.

description:
I was first introduced to this place a couple of years ago and this is my  favorite place for Thai food. My favorite dish that I ALWAYS get is the Shrimp Paste Fried Rice! Hands down the BEST! Smother it in red hot chili sauce,mmm yummy. 

Parking is a B$%#$! So bring your patience.

Prices have gone up recently, but that won't stop me from enjoying my favorite Thai place.
author: Rhonda A.

description: Usually when I show up at Osha Thai Noodle Cafe I have been on the town a bit and am in need of some carbs to counteract my celebration drink intake. I usually get the fried rice, chicken crab or shrimp and it does the trick. I get filled up with little fuss, and my tummy calms down quite a bit. I especially like the pineapple chunks buried  in the rice, little sweet bits among the savory food. A nice contrast for my dull palate. Hey, I said I have been usually out before showing up here.
author: Virginia V.

description:
I always get the best food and service here and it's very inexpensive.  I go to the other OSHA as well but still love this location the best. 

My favorites here are Papaya Salad, Osha Tom Yum Noodles (egg noodles) and Chinese brocolli with chicken or beef.
author: John N.

description:
I used to really love this place for lunch, after work or late night eats. Over the last couple of years they've tried to change the charm of the original Osha, and now it's just another place to go. 

The food is good, but often inconsistent and probably not worth the new inflated prices. Medium spicy today will be mild tomorrow and super spice next week. I want the old Osha back. 

The level of service is probably my biggest disappointment. What happened to the friendly people that used to work there? The last two or three times that I've eaten here I've noticed that almost no one makes eye contact with you. Of course they've always had the problem that the dishes come out one at a time, so the first person might get their dish five or more minutes ahead of the last person. 

I'm not so keen on the new decor and colors either. It looked new for about a month, and now it looks dirty and worn. And those benches are NOT comfortable in the least. 

Oh, and should we talk about the disgusting restroom? If you sit two or three tables from the restroom door ... you don't even need to go in to know it is filthy.
author: Timothy M.

description: Decent food, but the service is wretched.  Just wretched.  Servers are rude and pushy, spill things and let you clean it up.  Is it the crappy dance music that draws a crowd?  I don't know how they're still in business.
author: Ian S.

description:
The original San Francisco treat. Perfect hangover remedy, late night on-the-way-home spot, fast take out, and the best Pho I've had in the city.
YEA YEEAAA!
author: E.Mo. ..

description:
Love this place and I'd give them 4 stars if not for a few pet peeves that never seem to change.

The good.

Food is pertty consistent and made to order...A lot of Thai in the city and plenty to choose from so this falls into the category of actually being flavorful and consistent....Tom Kha is great as are the curries...We try something different nearly every time and come away impressed.

The Bad.

Spice factor is entirely random, in my honest opinion...Medium ranges from sometimes bland and nonexistent in terms of spice to scorching...Those times where medium actually tastes like medium, it's a perfect combo for the food...Yet, it is rarely the same level of spice regardless of how we order it...Their soups are terrific but they always leave out tomatoes, always....I ask for it and perhaps there'll be 1 in there...Strange...Hustle and bustle of this busy restaurant (For good reason) translates into a staff that is in a hurry to seat you, serve you and get you the hell out...You will feel rushed in here if you're dining in.

The ugly.

Continued pet peeve of mine when checks come with tip calculators printed on receipts as 'suggestions'...When did tipping become mandatory or to the extent that they have to spell out percentages for you?...Seems insultingly pompous...Lose it already.
author: Barca F.

description:
Yes, it's in the loin'...
Yes, the service is spotty...
Yes, it's a little bit dirty...

But does any of that matter when you're rolling in drunk and hungry at 12:30am??  No.

All that really matters is how AMAZINGLY good their Crab Fried Rice is.  This Crab Fried Rice is different than any other iteration you'll find in the city.  Try it for yourself and you'll forget about everything else around you.  It'll be just you and your yummy plate of CFR, floating on a puffy white cloud...
author: Brandon C.

description:
Sorry King of Thai, I found a new love.  
Her name is Osha.

Quick seating.
Quick service.
$6.95 entrees beautifully presented on sleek, modern dinnerware.
Portions just enough to fill your appetite.     
Flavors, flavors galore.

If you can't hang with the occassional visit from TL locals, don't bother coming here.  Instead enjoy the same food (and pay more) at Osha on Valencia street.  That one's hella bougie...
author: melissa n.

description:
All I can say is Pad Thai..mmm..I love the sweetness of the noodles and how chewy it is...It's just not the same anywhere else. It's cheap, good and u get quick service. Sometimes a little too quick.. I wonder just how well cooked my food is.  But so far, no complaints. You can't go wrong with noodles.

They have some other great items as well. They have some good spicy noodle soups, angel wings, fried rice, curries...mmm..a ton of choices.

A great late night spot, but beware of long lines!
author: j t.

description:
Some restaurants have excellent enough food that they can rest of their laurels and have poor service.  The food at Osha Thai did not suffice to that caliber of quality.

While a plethora of wait staff joked around, my friend and I waited patiently to be seated.  It wasn't even that busy so I was already perplexed as to why it was taking so long.  My dish was an orange curry with duck but it was missing the bamboo that were supposed to be in it!  While duck is a fatty poultry, the curry needed to be lighter to balance the heaviness of the curry.  

I left with a stomach ache.
author: Melissa L.

description:
I would give it a 3 and a half stars but i don't know how to make a half star.  

I love this place because it's open till 3 am and they serve their food quickly and the cooks in the back are very clean, they even wear surgeon's masks and gloves.

The food is kind of strong tasting and salty but very yumm yumm good.  I enjoy the pineapple fried rice (with cashews and raisins), shrimp curry fried rice, and chicken pad thai (ask for extra limes).  I thought the thom yum hot sour soup was good, but not amazing.  The papaya salad was decent, but I wish they would slice things a bit thinner.  Savory egg rolls and lettuce wrap appetizers are great to you in the midnight hunger crave.  

My favorite has got to be the fried chicken (not the wings or angel wings).  It's basically chicken katsu (battered boneless chicken) with a different crispy batter that tastes like it's been fried in the won ton oil and is OH MY GOD good at 1 am.    I get it with steamed rice instead of the fried rice, too much fried stuff.  Another winner is the refreshing coconut ice cream with fried banana dumplings.  Don't forget the thai iced tea.

My only complaint is that the food is heavy and fried and salty with a lot of fish/garlic/chili based sauces which are great on their own with a squeeze of lime, but the heavy taste starts to add up when you combine appetizers, and heavy seasoned salads.

the prices are great and it's also fun because it's always filled with people having fun no matter what time of night.
author: Mark K.

description:
Open until 3am.  Great place to stumble into after a night out and have some steaming hot Pad Thai.  Apologies to the staff if we've ever been a bit... well, you know.

This place is more than that though... great food at any time of the day.  I haven't been disappointed with anything yet.
author: Danny C.

description:
The food is good, the ambience is laid-back, the atmosphere is hip.

I love me some osha!  this is a place I bring mostly everyone (i like) to.

ask for the spicy basil with duck, spicy.  addicting!!!

i love the shrimp pad thai - though it's a bit on the sweet side - just ask for it a little spicy.  looooove the crab fried rice.  the wontons are not to be passed up.  and i'm not usually a big fan of curry, but yellow, green or red - can't go wrong!
author: monica s.

description:
I L-O-V-E the Osha Tom Yum Noodle Soup with the thick rice noodles! The broth has a great combination of sweet, sour and spicy flavors. Osha is the only place that I have tasted a soup so flavorful. I've tried the dish during lunch and after the club and it has never disappointed me! Note: some of the other Osha locations do not serve the noodle soups.

The angel wings and pad thai are good, but both on the sweet side.

It would be oh so great, if they added a bar or more alcoholic drinks.

One complaint is the restroom, only one stall and it reaks like piss. But I'll still go there....you know the saying - the dirtier the place the better! haha
author: Yvonne N.

description: There are already 800+ reviews of this place, but I just have to say that I had the best red curry here! The papaya salad and pad see ew were also delicious. Fast service, inexpensive prices.
author: Susan P.

description: I personally prefer this Osha than the fancier looking one in downtown 2nd street. The food is practically the same but the price is lower due to location. The seating is usually always available. No long waits most of the time i've been here. We usually come here after drinking at Rye or Ambassador. Their curry are very authentic like the ones i'd tasted in Thailand. No disappointment here for sure. Enjoy
author: Ernie P.

description: love love love it and opened till 3:00 on Fri and Sat
author: Mona L.

description: This is one of my favorite places to go after a fun shopping day at Union Square. The prices were definitely cheaper, but the food is still just as I expected. The tom yum noodle soup is A+. The pad thai is recommended. And the curries are alright. Best part is this location opens until 3AM! I remember the bathrooms were kind of gross. But anywho, I'm there to eat, not pee. Their other locations are more on the fancier side  - great for dinner nights out - not as casual at this location though. If you have no idea where to eat, you can't go wrong with Osha.
author: Margareth H.

description: I was going to give it a 4 star, the food is pretty good, papaya salad is on the spicy side, but It's a good portion. The drawback here is this place some how, is really really echo-y, I was there with a friend and we have to shout across the tiny table with food in our mouth, not very pleasant.
author: Bo D.

description: I hate this place!!!! I went here on a Saturday Morning when everybody is eating here I guess. So me and my friends finally sat down and got a table after waiting for 15 minutes. So me and my GF had to use the bathroom and the waiter apparently told our guy friends that they have to order ASAP and fuck waiting for us since we are probably fucking each other in the bathroom or "We're women who cares what we want to eat.. Just order anything for them" So I guess this guy that I just met has no idea what a vegetarian or vegan is and decides to order every possible kind of meat on the menu.. LOL That's fine I get back and I told him he is still getting the tab. So I asked the waiter if there are anything vegetarian on the menu and he rolls his eyes and says"NO." Okay you idiot that's fine. My friend then goes to another waitress and asks If there are anything vegetarian on the menu and she says yes everything can be made vegetarian. That is when everything went dark and black. I almost lost it. If it wasn't for the guys I was with I would have seriously grabbed all the plates on the table and slammed it to the ground. I asked to speak with the manager and they said he wasn't there when It's obvious that it's the little short old dude with the glasses just standing by the register watching everyone work. I used to have compassion for my Asian friends but now I FUCKING hate eating anywhere that is run by asians.. AHHHHHH!!! Asian restaurants just screams "BAD FUcking service"
author: Kayla G.

description:
I love Thai food but, this place didn't make a great impression on me. I came over for a friend's birthday. If I knew what would have happened, I would have skipped it.

1. The place was too loud and crowded on a Saturday night. To get to my seat, I had to step on other peoples' seats because we can't even move.
2. Parking is difficult. Enough said.
3. I guess  I should give them props for plating my dish very nicely. I was a bit guilty "destroying it." The dish, however, destroyed my stomach. Worst feeling ever.
author: Josephine D.

description:
There's one thing that keeps bringing us back, the Volcanic Beef! The Pad See Ew noodles are a great combination to this oh-so-marinated dish. And, at great prices too! 

One of my favorite places to go after a late night in the city, even for lunch! 

Only downfall, the service is not that great but food and prices more than make up for it!
author: Mel T.

description:
Great late night food! I love coming here after a night of heavy drinking!

All of the food is fantastic. Usually have to wait a little bit because this place is popular.
author: Christopher B.

description: Ok I give this place 5 stars simply because it opens until 3 am for friday and saturday nite. I love the fact that I can get my duck fried rice, hot spicy tom yum soup and fried wontons after going clubbing =) I just have to say that the location is perfect cuz its in downtown and it really does beat out going to dennys. sometimes I do crave my bacon n sausage but most of the time I just love THAI FOOD! now if only Japanese restaurants would open this late...I could def go for sushi at 3 am!!
author: Rika K.

description: Great food, awesome service, only thing that sucks is all the homeless people hanging out outside making the place look trashy. Definitely check it out if you're in the area and looking for good Thai food.
author: Edgar B.

description: I have a real knack for showing up here whenever I'm piss drunk.  Must be the awesome food.  Everything I put in my inebriated mouth just explodes with flavored greasy goodness.
author: Yeeman N.

description:
I love this place. I always order the BBQ Chicken and its always tender, juicy and has no fat on it just how i like it.
The fried rice that comes with the chicken is also very good. Its very light and not greasy. This is a must stop everytime i come to the city.
author: SonD B.

description:
This place serves delicious Thai fast food.  Noodles, fried rice, and a variety of curries all taste the way they're supposed to.  Based on my visit, this is thankfully not Americanized Thai food -- it's flavorful and devilishly spicy if you ask for it (as I did).

Green curry fried rice with beef was a big winner.  I've had this dish before made in Thailand with condensed milk, and this used coconut milk instead to much better results.  The beef may have been a little tougher than I prefer, but it didn't detract my completely enjoying the dish.  Green curry taste, lots of basil, and since I asked for it Thai hot, lots of shredded Thai chillis.  Make sure you have a cold drink and a towel to wipe the sweat from your brow, but you'll enjoy every bite.

For dessert, we cooled down with fried banana and coconut ice cream which was perfect.  The fried banana was crunchy (as it should be), not soggy and the coconut ice cream was the perfect meal-ending fire extinguisher.

They're open 'til 1AM weeknights and 3AM on weekends, take credit cards, and dish up delicious food with friendly service.  I'll definitely come back again!
author: Bruce R.

description:
Why do people like this place so much?  Is it because they're drunk when they go here?

The food isn't bad, but the service leaves a lot to be desired.  

FOR EXAMPLE:

One time a customer on her way out took a couple candies from the jar and in this really friendly voice said: "Hey!  Thanks a lot!  Have a good night!"  But what did the girl behind the counter do as soon as the customer's back was turned?  She started bitching about how much candy she took!  She was actually mimicking her by scooping up two giant handfulls of candy and going on and on about it (which was a huge exaggeration by the way.  The woman took like 3 candies.)  

Anyway, it was such a turn off that I would have gone somewhere else if I hadn't ordered already.  (FYI:  Bitching about your customers in front of your other customers is something you should pretty much never do.  All it does is leave us thinking, "Hmm...  I wonder what they'll say about me when I leave?")

If this was an isolated incident, then that would be one thing, but attitude seems to be a trend here...

Another time I asked if they could leave the chicken off my Pad Thai and give me some extra prawns or something instead, and the guy got all snotty with me and said, "Well, we have to charge you an extra dollar for that."  

I was immediately sorry I'd gone there again, but hey!  How did I expect them to act, right?  Plus, prawns do cost a little more so the price difference seemed normal at first.......

Here's the thing though:  Guess how many extra prawns I got?  

LIKE ONE!!!!  

I've ordered that dish there many times before, so I knew what to expect, and I pretty much quit going there after that.  I only really go there if they're the only thing open.  Sorry but I'd rather walk out of my way to the Na'an n Curry on O'Farrell Street then deal with service that like this....

(I give them 3 stars for their late night hours only)
author: Rachel W.

description:
Okay, I'm going to try not to let the fact that I have eaten here way too often get in the way.
Basically it's quick, cheap and generally very good Thai food - plus they are open late! Unfortunately, I have never had a good experience with this place when I get take-out! The food just does not taste as good. It's too bad since I live right next to it .  But hey, that's just my experience. My friend gets it to go all the time and notes no difference. 
The music there is very loud, not a good place in you want to have a serious conversation with someone. But it hits the spot...
author: Adelle W.

description:
I can only echo what others have said--this is a great bargain, quick, and decent. 

The food here is pretty much the exact same as the sister store on 2nd where you pay extra for atmosphere and presentation (by accident, I went to both in one day).
author: Andrew A.

description:
MONEY.  

That is the only way to describe Osha Thai at a little past 2:00am on a friday or saturday night.  

Shrimp paste fried rice is my nicely kept little secret (till now i guess).  Good shrimpy flavor with all the salty carby goodness of the combo fried rice.  

Vinatieri at the end of the game in the playoffs...yea THAT money.
author: Hansen S.

description:
I love Osha. I love Osha so much that I go a couple times a month and the staff knows me by name and frequent order. I love that I can order take out and in the five minutes it takes to walk over there from my house it's piping hot and ready for me to take home.
