I don't eat meat, so I can't comment on that, but I love the veg pad thai and the yellow curry. I also have enjoyed the curry potato puffs and the pumpkin curry. It looks a little pricey at first glance, but I am rarely without left overs when I'm done.

Generous portions, excellent hours and fast service- YES!
author: Kirsten G.

description:
Best Green Curry I've had in....ever! A tiny bit pricey, but it's super tasty! 

The service is terrible, they always take too long to bring you the check. And most times won't ever check back on you after you've gotten the food. But if you can overlook that, you'll be happy.  Better yet, take it home and eating while watching a movie.
author: Victoria V.

description:
THE BEST! You must be crazy if you think any difftrent! my typical meal goes like this
1.Corona
2.naked prawns (HOT)
3.thai ice T
4.cucumber salad
5.Osha sea curry with squash no egg plant
I have eaten alot of thai food  and this is where you can find me after hours in the City open late and money well spent
author: William G.

description:
still my favorite place :D

always perfect after a long night of clubbing. gets crowded & you will most likely have to be on the wait list when you come here around 1-3am...but the wait doesn't take long. it is WORTH IT!

crab fried rice, green curry fried rice with beef, osha tom yum soup, pumpkin curry, pad thai, anything with DUCK, all the noodles, seafood claypot.... i've had it alll!!!!!
author: Rosalynn D.

description: I think I have been there about a half a dozen times.  Each time I've gone there the food has been tasty.  I LOVE the crab fried rice.  The service is great and they are very accommodating.  It's been a year since I've gone there.  I think perhaps its time for me to go back.
author: Jennifer C.

description: If you cut out a hunk of  San Francisco sidewalk with a concrete saw and used it for bathroom flooring, it would be cleaner than Osha bathroom. It is like homeless streetcorner with added feces and urine, vomit and grafitti. Now why is this a big deal? People wear shoes off sidewalk into restaurant. They go into filthpig restroom. They go into kitchen and cook. Obviously health inspectors are incompetent. Waiter never offered tea or brought chopsticks-- and we are Asian !! Food OK if you like woodchip ginger. I'd rather go to dentist office. One star for being open late.
author: Musashi M.

description: Love the spicy string beans with chicken or tofu, love the tofu tod but NO WAY does it make sense to pay $30 for the 2 items above, plus rice and semi-flat coke. that is too ridiculous a price to pay for something that i can whip up at home if i knew the sauce was something i could make or buy. truly breaks my heart that it costs so much to eat here, when in the past better thai places were 1/4 the cost!!! If you are the owners, please for the love of all that is good food, lower your prices!! They are unreasonably too high for string beans, and for chrissakes, include the rice! $2 for a 5 oz serving of rice is just stupid.
author: Liliana A.

description: Fried catfish was amazing. Spicy but not overpowering. Crisp veggies. Mango curry more mild but calamari and shrimp and loads of fresh veggies and mango made it feel very healthy. $13-15 is a bit more than some Thai places around here but I will return.
author: Scott J.

description: I think my tastebuds have changed and because I've been eating a lot more Thai food than in the last few months , I don't really like this place as much as I used to . My friend and I was playing MJ the other night and we were hungry . Since Osha is right across the street , we decided to order take-out . We got the yellow sea which tasted pretty decent . I had the fishcakes again which was okay but not all that great ..
author: Eileen L.

description:
This is my favorite spot to grab a bite when I am in a rush to run off to work or just simply having a lazy "I'm not cooking" night. There are several Osha's located around the city, but this location is extremely convenient due to the fact that it is a mere block from my apartment. The Osha in the Embarcadero is my absolute favorite, the vibe is a tad bit classier, having an extensive specialty cocktail menu and a posh lounge in which patrons can relax at the end of an exhausting work day. However, the convenience of the Osha neighboring my home is familiar and has catered to my hunger needs more than any of their other locations.  The Beer is always cold, glasses are always chilled, food is consistently great, and service is always quick and friendly. 

I have had many of various dishes on Osha's menu but I have a few favorites that I consistently seem to run back to. For appetizers I love the fried pork and vegetable wontons with a sweet and sour dipping sauce or the vegetarian Crispy rolls stuffed with silver noodles, black mushrooms, cabbage and carrots with a plum dipping sauce. For my main course my favorite dish would have to be the Osha spicy pan fry, a simple yet delicious egg noodle dish adorned with mushrooms, tomatoes, basil, garlic, bamboo, Chinese broccoli, bell pepper, onion, and string beans. I order this dish medium spicy along side a nice frosty Asahi; guaranteed to please your taste buds and clear out your sinuses fabulousness! My second go-to dish is the spicy basil leaf which comes with any meat assortment of your choice (prawns, seafood, duck, stir fried chicken, pork or beef) mixed with fresh chili's, garlic and basil leafs all atop a bed of white rice. I order this dish with beef, medium spicy with a sprinkle of soy sauce, so scrumptious! If I have room for desert I absolutely have to have the fried bananas with coconut ice cream, the ice cream actually has chunks of coconut throughout, mmmmm!!!

If you order from the dishes I listed above you can't go wrong, in my opinion these are some of the best on the menu. The only thing I should warn patrons of is the variations of spicy that the chef dishes out; medium spicy can either be mild or tongue numbing hot! I suggest ordering less spice than you think you can handle and then adding more if needed from the condiment trays located on each table to insure the proper heat. I usually order food from this location for pick-up; no matter how busy the venue, my food is always ready within fifteen minutes. This is a fabulous venue for a casual dinner out or a cozy meal on the couch!
author: Bri C.

description: Ive tried most of the stuff on the menu but i only have one favorite. Fried wontons! They are very delicious, kinda pricey but well worth it. The noodles and rice are very so-so. Kinda disappointed with the fish cakes, so stick with the wontons and the thai ice tea! I stop by every once in awhile, i just hope one day everything will be as good as the wontons ...
author: Frankie L.

description:
Late Night Food

Closing time at Element means get the F out.  So I ventured home dodging the drunkards and bums I smelled this aroma.  No, it wasn't the smell of urine from the bum pan handling, it was Osha Thai.

Atmosphere - All the tables were filled.  Surround by drunks trying to fill their bellies only to see it come up later... what a waste of good food.
Service - Nothing memorable, but the most important nothing bad
Price - Average
Food - Penang Curry w/ rice, Yum!
Recommend - Yes, They are open really late.
author: Po L.

description:
I freaken love this place.  Every single time I go to San Francisco, this place is a must!!!  Especially when I'm real real hungry.

Their food is delicious (if you like Thai food)!!!  And their service is real quick.  Their portions actually got a little smaller, but they're still good portions!!!  

I simply love this quick service, w/ great tasting food!  :)

and their environment is pretty awesome, the colors and the chill style in the right idea for a big city, although they could use some new seats!  Other than that, it's awesome.

Late night meals.. a definate YES!
author: sal v.

description:
Before I evacuated from the Tenderloin Heights, I brought my brother - from out of town - to this location, which happened to be right by my apartment.  We came here on early on a Friday night, and the place was moving at a moderate clip (read: it wasn't crowded).  It was a drafty and cold night mind you, and when we were waiting to be seated, the "hostess" placed me and my brother right by the door...and direct access to cold drafts and rain, whenever the front door opened.  

When a booth opened up, right as we were being seated, we politely asked to sit in a booth - away from the door - instead.  We rudely told "no", and the next two people who walked in were given the booth me and my brother requested.  After this nonsense, we got up and left.

This location has changed, perhaps for the better, maybe for the worse.  Great late night place to go if you're drunk and had a mojito too many at Rye (cool place) or Ambassador (gasp!).  Ah, what happened to my nice and friendly Osha Thai (Tenderloin version) that I used to frequent for 7+ years?  (sigh!)
author: A.D. A.

description:
Many of these reviews for Osha are mediocre to poor but I had a very positive experience.  The tom yam kung (hot and sour soup) was great for a cold night and the green curry was amazing.  The service was fast and diligent.  Good sticky rice for dessert.

I'd definitely recommend it.
author: michael p.

description: My mom told me never to judge a book by its cover.  So when someone suggests a place for late night dining, the place looks like a nightclub and the cast of characters or patrons in the restaurant is eclectic - I shouldn't judge a book by it's cover.  The food was good and there is a little jar of peanuts so you can add peanuts like hot sauce if there isn't enough.  We ordered the Pad Thai, Thai fish cakes and the pineapple fried rice.  The portions are ample and every bite was good.  We had so much that we had leftovers for dinner the next day.  In the Tenderloin district where you don't expect a restaurant that would bother to put little touches like orchids as a decorative touch, this place is refreshing.  The fish cakes were a little overdone for my liking but the pad thai and pineapple fried rice were good.
author: Irene W.

description: The crab rangoons on the specials menu were heaven and our waiter was so nice and had the best haircut...BUT we ordered wrong for our mains. The Tom Kha soup was too thick and strong-sweet, like a sauce, and catfish curry overly sweet also and eggplants undercooked. Wish we had Yelped it first for the good recs!
author: Laura A.

description: My boyfriend and I get pad thai and volcano beef here all the time. Get those two items, and your eating experience will be divine. MMMM!
author: April Y.

description: I love Osha. I love that they are open very late and they always have fresh food and their service is really fast. The BBQ chicken and pad thai is delicious. Won-tons and fresh spring rolls appetizers are amazing.
author: Melissa H.

description: A good place to eat after a long night of drinking at the clubs.  The place is usually packed on the weekends and rarely you will find parking close by.  The service is okay but the food is delicious.  The Kao Pad Gai Tod and the Pad Ke Mao are to die for.  Add a Thai ice coffee and you are set.
author: Eddy M.

description: Stayed at a nearby hotel and thought we'd try out this place before we left town. We had to wait maybe 15-20 minutes before we got a table (there were 2 of us). But once we got inside the service was insanely fast! Ordered our drinks and literally within 2 minutes there drinks were on the table. Ordered a plate of noodles (don't remember what it was called) but it was amazing. Pretty large portions, split one plate of noodles with my boyfriend and we still had leftovers for the next day. I just couldn't get over how fast the service was. The only negative thing I have to say is that it felt like we were rushed out of there. I understand there are people waiting for tables and we can't just linger forever but damn, the second we stopped eating and were talking the waitress was there asking if we wanted a box. Very rush rush atmosphere. That's the only thing preventing me from giving this 5 stars. Food was amazing though!! Love the late night hours.
author: Katherine B.

description: This is one of my new favorite spots. I've been to most of the other Osha's but I def like this one the best. Its casual and laid back and the food is so yummy and the service is good too. My faves are the calamari & volcanic beef - so good! A little pricey, yes, but super good and worth it :)
author: Kimberly R.

description: There are two certainties in life: death, and my ordering the roasted duck curry at Osha if I'm anywhere nearby. (As for avoiding taxes, just become a CEO.) This is my No. 1 after-hours eating spot. It puts a place like Mel's to shame.
author: Greg K.

description: The angel wings were not that great only ok. My rice plate was ok but did nothing great. My friends had some sort of beef roll appetizer which he said was good. The service was slow and there were a lot of employees but the place was not that crowded when we were there. They are open til 3AM on the weekends so if your craving thai it might work for you.
author: Jack B.

description:
Found this place by accident walking around in the neighborhood.  We had the satay and a noodle dish.  Both were very nice.  There is a good selection of condiments on the table to spice up your food as you wish.

The staff was very nice and the food came quickly.  The only thing that I keeps me from 5 stars is the restroom.  Very dirty and messy.
author: John R.

description:
I have never been dissapointed.
Huge portions (kinda too much), great prices and while being no expert on the intracacies of thai food, always damn tasty.
My roommate has gotten me and several friends hooked on this stuff.
Great veg-vegan choices as well as the usual.
I have never made the after-the-bar trek, so I can't tell you what that is like, but during regular hours it has always been good, no-wait service and the take out is only like ten mins.
author: Sam R.

description:
Would you like to eat SPAM in the middle of a beautiful park, or eat deliche cuisine in the hood?   Think about it.  Seriously - think about it before you come here.  

The food at this place is fab.  I had some kind of spicy noodle dish that had far better flavor than almost anything spicy I have ever had.  We completed our meal with Mango sticky rice too.  My first experience with it, but I will now be a regular.  

Now, the downside is that your likelihood of getting caught in the crossfire of a driveby shooting seems a bit higher here than many other parts of the city.  I forgot my wire back at my crib, so me and my homeys had to keep it real while we were waiting in line, just staing down at our kicks and mindin our own bidness.  Once we got inside though, it was total yummers.
author: Dan H.

description:
3.5 stars...
The pumpkin curry was great!  Everything else was just OK.  Wasn't a fan of the coconut milk chicken soup (tom ka gai)-- too bad since it's my favorite Thai dish.  Service is pretty damn fast, came here starving and was eating within 15 minutes.
They were bumping Justin Timberlake- bringing sexy back while eating Thai food makes for good times:)
author: Sayeh A.

description:
The first time that I had Osha Thai was at dinner time. I had a great dinner: spring rolls, yellow curry and some broccoli dish. The service was great even though the restaurant was packed; my water glass was never empty. 
The second time was a bit of a disappointment. Again, it was dinner time however it was early and it was pretty empty. My curry was good but my friend's pad thai noodles sucked and so did the service.
author: Miguel S.

description:
Food excellent
Menu extensive
Service very good
Prices very very good



Osha is a fun place to go, unpretentious people tend to gather here which is A ok in my book. Huge menu selection to satisfy everyones craving being meat or veggie. From noodle plates to Pho, Osha will amaze you! The service is very fast paced, sometimes too fast. Open till late makes this restaurant stand out from the rest.
I highly recommend checking this place out. 
It can be a bit dirty at times (-1 star) but this is because they do tons of business, plus the location adds a little dirty feeling to it. But nothing terrible that would prevent you from eating there. Just don't eat off the floor and you will be ok!
When you order, the server will ask you if you want your dish mild or spicy...beware of spicy! I had people not be able to eat their meals because they did not listen to the server hint  "are you sure you want it spicy"
Oh yeah parking sucks.
author: David Y.

description:
So sad. This place used to be one of my favourites, but over the past couple years the service has gone way down.

One time I walked in to order take out, the waiter came up to me and said "what?" I said I wanted take-out and he just pointed to the cashier and walked away. The cashier never made eye contact with me and never took my order.

The last two times I have gone in there, they have screwed up my order. I specifically asked for things to be take-out, only to realise they never complied.

The food is good, but I am over this place.
author: UT V.

description:
This is my all time favorite Thai restaurant in the city.  I  love the yellow curry with chicken and they have the best pineapple fried rice!  The place has been through some renovations making the restaurant more modern and sleek, however I do not understand why they haven't remodeled their restroom.  It looks totally gross and filthy!  The toilet's old.  The sink's old.  And there's graffiti all over the walls.  I've only been in there a couple times out of all the times I've been to Osha.  They really should upgrade the restroom.

Something that's really irritating and deceitful about this establishment.... Ok they charge you (15 or 18%) tip if you have 6 or more people in your party.  Totally understandable.  However, if you pay with your credit card...when you get the credit card bill there's a line for adding tip and since they dont give you the original bill with the credit card slip you could end up paying for tip twice if you don't pay attention.  It's robbery!  I feel bad for all the people who've been duped and the many more who will be!  So pay attention people!

Food's good here, but they need to do something about that billing issue.  It's so dishonest!
author: Amy T.

description: Great food, rude service. I understand though it's super busy.
author: Jeddy H.

description: I love love LOVE thai food any day of the week.  I especially love it as my form of nourishment at 2 a.m. on a Friday or Saturday after the party has died down and my drunk ass needs something to eat.  I've never gone wrong with anything I've eaten here (although occasionally I don't remember my meals here so I mite not actually remember if I've eaten anything unsettling...) My only complaints are the yucky one room bathroom and the occasional long wait outside in the cold.  But then again I cant hate on other people for loving 2 a.m. thai just as much as me!
author: laura q.

description: Osha on 2nd is one of my favorite places in the city! I prefer this location for take out rather than dining. The decor simply is not as nice as the others. I think this was the original location. Anyhow, the food is just as great as the others, but be aware the menu is slightly different.
author: Kandace K.

description: Little bit overpriced for a tenderloin location but i was ok with that getting my favorite soup from here until one rainy night the cashier ruined it for me . I can tolerate any thing but hygiene , the cashier after counting money for few customers he grabbed my soups and with his filthy bear hand dipped into a jar of cilantro and throw into my 2 soups and that's disgusting . I don't think i'll ever come back here giving the fact that Thai places in the area are by the dozen .
author: Adam O.

description: My favorite dish here has to be the shrimp paste fried rice and the Volcanic beef. They're both full of flavor and I know to some shrimp paste? what's that? But I have to tell you, you have to try this dish to see how good it is. The good thing about this place is that it's right next to a bar and across from a lounge Ambassador. Osha opens really late for the party people. So, if you have the munchies after drinking. This is the place to go. There's is really never a line and the food service is fast.
author: tam t.

description: Their food is usually pretty good.  I've had a few misses, but, then again, I also come here pretty damn often, so I'm bound to have a few misfortunes.  I usually come here after going out, and it's good that they're open until 2 or 3 am.  The price is so-so... not cheap, not expensive, but when you're hungry at 1am with a bunch of drunk friends, you don't care too much about paying a couple extra dollars for a bowl of nice, hot,tom yum skinny noodle seafood combination soup. (this is what I usually order btw).
author: Samson F.

description: Osha has the best tad mun pla, pineapple fried rice, crab fried rice and papaya salad. 5 stars for open late in the AM for hungry night owls like me!
author: Gracee G.

description: This place never disappointed me. I love everything (volcanic beef is my favorite and their curries) so far I've ever tried from Osha.   Always delicious food, quick service and awesome hours.
author: victoria c.

description: One of only two thai places in the bay I would even consider giving a 5 star. Awesome food, open till 3am, decent-to-good service, never bad. No matter what I have ordered or what time of day I have gone, always consistent. Prices arent too bad. DO NOT FORGET TO ORDER SOME FRIED WONTONS!  Few places have stuffed wontons, and even fewer do them well, Osha Thai has nailed it! Even in Thailand and Cambodia at "5 star" resturants, theirs failed to meet the great perfection that we have the blessing to enjoy here in the bay. I always look forward to bringing people there, a quaint hole in the wall any time, & awesome on the way to the bridge if leaving the city around 1 or 2am!
author: Ben M.

description:
My husband and I stayed in SF for two weeks in early November 2008.  This restaurant was near our hotel and was our fallback plan.  We ate there three times during our stay.  

The food was tasty and fresh, the hours were extended and the wait was short.  The waitstaff was neither a plus or a minus, they really made no impression on me, which isn't necessarily a bad thing.

My favorite out of the dishes we tried was the tom yum soup with egg noodles.  The green beans were also pretty good.  There was not really a bad thing that we tried. 

The only reason I give it three stars instead of four is that it was not the cleanest place I've ever eaten.  We got there right as it opened one day and the floor hadn't been swept from the previous day.  It had recently rained and the staff was furiously lining up buckets to catch the water nearly pouring out of the ceiling, the splashing rendering a whole section of the place unseatable.  That probably isn't the fault of the restaurant, but it wasn't very appealing.
author: Jennifer B.

description: We just went here for a small quick snack.  I've been here before and the staff is really nice.  We had mangoes and sticky rice (Delicious) and Crab Fried Rice (again, really good).  I always think the food here is really good and for late night, it doesn't get much better.  They could do a better job cleaning the bathrooms though, people really trash it at night.
author: Jeffrey T.

description: Osha is my go to place for good Thai food. This is the original spot without all the fancy flare of the nicer locations. You can get a delicious meal here without breaking your pockets and leave very satisfied. Their Tom Kha soup is one of the best things I've ever eaten.
author: Noel E.

description: The best way to compare restaurants are by trying the same thing from each place, just like how u use the same song to try different loudspeakers. For me, it's the Tom Yum Noodle, absolutely favorite, and I am glad that I found another place to get good Tom Yum. It was their Osha Tom Yum Noodle which I fell in love with, I wished I could have had the courage to ask for spicy, must have tasted much better. My friends are fans of their Fried Chicken over Fried Rice, huge portion, worth it! Not a big fan of their curry tho, they are too sweet for me. Service is mediocre , not fantastic but just enough. Ambiance is very nice, very spacious, no elbow-touching. Overall, will come back for more. :D
author: Marlis T.

description: My bf lives just a couple of blocks away...we are always admiring how busy Osha is... On the way home from A Christmas Carol this evening we popped in. There was a wait of 4 ahead of us. How quickly they turn their tables over. The staff works as a team, which is friendly and extremely efficient. We ordered Thai iced teas, Spicy Chicken basil leaves and the yellow chicken curry. Each and every selection was delicious and LARGE in portion! Refills were instantaneously. We were in and out within 30 minutes including the wait time. Looking forward to returning and trying other dishes soon!
author: Tiffany L.

description: I went to the city to celebrate my daughters birthday..... after a long day of shopping we were driving around looking for a dinner spot.  We stubbled upon Osha It was delicious!!  The food was good, the service was fast, and the restaurant was very clean.  The people watches was very entertaining too!!
author: coco g.

description:
only go to this osha thai. the other ones are whack and over priced!
its like $5-$10 cheaper and not ritzy like the other 2. the food is ok thai food. ive experienced better. their pad thai and panang beef are good. spicy, but good. like i said, only go to this osha thai. tenderloin isnt as bad as you think it is. dont be scurred.
author: A. V.

description: This location is the best one price and quality wise, me and my girlfriend love the spicy string beans with chicken - meduim spicy..... nd her regular favorite drink is thai iced tea...
author: O J.

description: Maybe more like 3.5 stars but the only thing I have to complain about really is the total LACK OF PERSONALITY in this place. Holy cow, you'll be lucky if you get a smile out of this staff. The food is always super fast, some times too fast for my liking..its a little pricey, you can definitely find better Thai for much cheaper in the city....The yellow curry is amazing though!!  3 and a half stars for me.
author: Chris T.

description:
this is my favorite osha in town! what's so different about this osha, you say?

it's the location. it's the people. it's the food. i swear, the food at this osha tastes better than other osha's. how can that be?

...cuz this osha feels a lot more real and "sweaty" and less pretentious than its siblings. you won't find any hipsters or soma web 2.0 geeks here. this osha is for the people of tenderloin and lower nob hill who appreciate late night thai food at an affordable price. and that's money in the bangkok! woo hoo!

.
...and finally, so you know, when radiohead came to town a year ago, they ate here. yup, they really did. isn't that like the most amazing endorsement evar? so if it's good enough for radiohead, it's certainly good enough for me and you and everyone we know.
author: frisco j.

description: Good place to get food late at night.  Food is affordable and they're pretty fast.
author: Matthew P.

description:
Late night dining and a show. . .what more could you want?

If you go to Osha on a weekend evening at around 1:30am make sure to ask to sit downstairs. . .near the window.  Then you get to watch the drunken fools file out of Rye.  It was one drunken cliche after another.  There was sloppy hook-up girl who first came outside to smoke with one guy.  They made out against a wall.  We had front row seats.  Um.  Yuck.  Later, she comes outside with another dude.  Just talking.  Then making out.  Blech.  Third dude. . .smooth as silk as he got to second base right in front of us!  Can anyone say petrie dish?  Then there was the couple who came out of Rye.  The dude lays on the ground (someone should have told him that the particular part of Geary Street he was laying on is sometimes known as "A River Runs Through It" . .. as in a river of urine) and his girl or hook up or whatever starts cracking up and then she straddles him and they go all Kevin and Britney on the beach back in the day.   And what's up with all the smokers hanging in second doorway at Osha?  They've got a cage in Rye for y'all nicotine addicts . . stay in the cage, dammit, your cigarette smoke is coming into the restaurant and it's nasty.  P.S. - what's up with all you drunk smokers?  "Social" smoking is what you call it?  Well cut that shit out . . you look like a dork.  

Now away from the floor show to the food.  Osha used to be kick ass good back in the day when there was only one but now that there are multiple Osha's (what the frickin' plural. . should it be Osha?) this one is only eh.  But those fools at Thai House Express now close at midnight (why, god, why???) so Osha will have to be my late night thai fix. . .the one and only thing that rocks my world there is the green curry fried rice with pork.  Goddamn, that's some good stuff!!  I could eat a whole plate to myself.  Delicious!  The Tom Ka is only passable and the Sate is a kinda weak.   Altho the cucumber salad that comes with it makes me happy.  Also the little dishes of chiles is a favorite. . .the sliced green ones. . .oh man, so good!  Thai iced coffee is good and CHEAP.  Their mango sticky rice is a little too firm for me. . .I like it a little creamier.   You certainly don't come here for the service.  There is no love. . .altho our waitress had on a shirt that said "proud to be awesome" . . .but I say you should have a certain sense of humor to pull that shirt off and her humor level sat squarely at "0".  

No night at Osha would be complete without one of two things. . .seeing some poor schmo run out of Rye to hurl one too many basil gimlets or getting approached by a hooker on your way to your car. .. this night, we scored both!  Ring-a-ding-ding!
author: Lainie L.

description: Yikes, what happened to this place?  Used to be a great, inexpensive place that was always busy and open late.  Went back recently to find the prices raised considerably, the food just so so and (not surprisingly) pretty dead. On the plus side, the service is still very friendly. Bring back the old Osha please.
author: Jeff Z.

description: The food is pretty good:  Papaya salad, Pad See Ew?, fried rice.  But man...place is pretty dirty.  Feel icky sitting there...and hey, I'm usually not this prissy.  Bathroom is bad news also.
author: Jenny K.

description:
worst service

rude waiters.

they kicked my friend out because he didn't tip well.

obnoxious
author: Hassan S.

description: Meh - not impressed.  We went there tonight, party of three; each of us ordered an entree.  The waitstaff brought our food out as each entree was ready, each several minutes apart, rather than bringing all three entrees together; I really didn't like that.  Also, we didn't seem to have one server; instead, several different people stopped by our table repeatedly to ask if everything was okay or if we needed anything else, so basically we had to interact with the staff many more times than you would usually expect over the course of a simple meal.  I'm vegan, and ordered the Pad See Ew with no egg and no fish sauce or oyster sauce.  My dish was almost completely devoid of flavor - they didn't bother to add any other seasonings to make up for what was left out - and was also very oily.  I've been to other Osha Thai locations and had a much better experience, both with service and with the quality of the food.
author: Lisa B.

description: A okay for now, that is because I got the papaya salad. I got it mild and it was super spicy! I regretted it, I didn't know that it was going to be that spicy. But I just sucked it up and ate it. My friend got their pad thai. Why did I have to be adventurous and order their papaya salad. I wished I got their pad thai. Let me come here again and order their pad thai. But his pad thai did look soo yummy, it was pretty big too. I want it now. Why does not thai place deliver to bay view?? That sucks. I wished someone would open a thai place on San Bruno Ave. May be that will be my future business, but too bad I am not thai. I can't wait to get their pad thai here, I am drooling now.
author: Janet Z.

description: It is definitely not nearly as pretty as the one on second.  The decor is pretty lame, non-existent even and the menus are just menus!  no fancy books or awe factor at the table.  But...the food is still as good.  Its open late, its in the Tenderloin so it makes for a great stop after an evening of bar hopping, and if you can make it past the panhandlers outside you are in for a delicious, quickly served meal of scrumptious Thai food.  They also deliver to Rye next door if you are drinking there and get hungry.
author: Lauren F.

description: Quick, Reasonably priced but DEF not the best Thai in the city. The Pad Thai had too much sauce on it to the point where I didn't want to eat anymore. I imagine it is great when you are drunk though.
author: Alexis B.

description: The first few years when it opened, it was great and marvelous. After they remodeled and brought in a bunch of new waitstaffs, the service has been declining and food portions are smaller. The food is still good but it was better before.
author: Michael K.

description: The servers here are bitches to me but so nice to my bf!  WTF? O well. The food is good at 3pm or 3am.  But especially 3am.  Service is quick and brusk. Don't use the bathroom. Nasteeeeee.
author: Joyhan S.

description:
ahhh, osha.  you were there for me in the midst of hell - i mean, finals.  you've been there for me when it's late, and i'm drunk.  you're there for me when i'm too lazy to cook.  you're there when i want to watch tenderloin denizens scare tourists and bar-goers on geary while i shovel praram into my hungry mouth.  and you're there when i don't want to walk more than two blocks for a reliably edible, reasonably priced dinner.

basically, osha gets 3 stars for its food - it's pretty good, nothing amazing, but never bad or sketchy.  it gets an additional star for being open LATE, and an additional star for its reasonable prices.  

it loses a star because the service pretty much sucks.  the most annoying thing about the service there is that they'll bring out one of the two dishes you and your companion ordered and plan to share, but they'll bring ONLY ONE set of cutlery.  WTF?  is it so hard to bring two forks at the same time?  there are two of us, after all.  eventually we will need two forks at the table.  so why not bring two forks with the first dish, and then that way, your diners aren't stuck there waiting 5-7 minutes for the additional fork that will come with the next dish, sharing the one that you brought out, alternating its use from bite to bite.  or, better yet, why not bring out the forks as soon as your diners sit down??  i waited tables for four years, and that seemed to work just fine.

regardless, though, i still give osha four stars.  decent food, decent price, killer hours.  i'll keep going back.  but i'll be bringing an extra fork in my purse next time...
author: genevieve g.

description:
rewind to a few years ago.  i was living in the mission, and new to the sf area.  my roommate always had good recommendations of where to go for whatever i was looking for, and then some.  about a month into my stay, she brought home some pumpkin curry.

i moved away.  
stupid, i know.  blah blah blah shut up i know it was dumb.

anyway, i couldn't remember where i had the great pumpkin curry.  since then, i've lived in three different cities.  and in each one, i search the local thai joints for that friggin delicious pumpkin curry.

fast forward to later.  er, now.

first night back in the city.  exhausted.  long flight.  long week.  a friend says "hungry?  there's a great place up the street open till three."

it's osha.  and what do i see when i open the menu?

FREAKIN' PUMPKIN CURRY.

now *THAT'S* what i'm talking about.

atmosphere late on  a friday?  if you're not drunk, come watch people fall over and either laugh or worry for their safety.  come to see the chaches chachin' it up for the ladies.  

or come for that flippin' pumpkin curry, which will haunt your every move for years to come.

in a good way.  not in that "oh crap, i shouldn't have had that last burrito" way.
author: Kimberly K.

description:
im a huge fan of eating off of other ppl's plates.  me? i seem to always hate my own dishes and luster after my friends' selections... sort of the thrill of the chase...  but this time their food was actually better than mine!

i was starving.... after waiting a good 45 mins for one friend to take the bart from walnut creek... i ordered a safe dish, pad se ew.. and i found it greasy and kinda too sweet... but my friend's pad se mao (or whatever) was a lot better... so this place is 4 stars despite my flop pick of a dish...
author: Tina L.

description:
Looks like the hot spot after marinating your liver with alcohol. 

We went directly to Osha after clubbing one night and it took a while to get some seating, but we made it. They split our tables up since we were in a large group and the service was quick although they didn't give us many refills on the water, I told two different waiters to get refills, but they completely forgot. Finally I asked the female server and she was prompt.

I recommend the angel wings, those things were really tasty, but they were so hot out the oven when they got to the table, I almost burned my thumb. But once they cooled off, they definitely had a kick to them.

Great food, decent service, but hey.. I feel bad for the servers who are always stuck with the drunk mo fos every single night. It gets a little crazy and I won't knock em for forgetting a couple times.  I definitely think we should cut some of these guys some slack.
author: Prince B.

description: Average Thai food, great service, easy location to find for visitors.
author: KZ B.

description: Food is exceptional.. Noodle soup used to be better but fried rice is the BEST!! The service can lack sometimes which is why 1 star was lowered. A must visit in SF.
author: Brian S.

description: Out of three of the Osha Thai restaurants that I've tried, this one is the worst. I don't understand how someone can make bad pad thai but they managed to accomplish that feat. This location is not worth the trip.
author: Jen A.

description: Good restaurant, lower prices (and less pretense among the customers) than the other Oshas. Just please don't go here if you're drunk and belligerent. Thanks.
author: Wes F.

description: Love this place!!!! Love the crab fried rice!!! I think everything that I've tried here is good! Pad See Eew goes great with their pre made mince jalapeno sauce... Yum
author: Rose E.

description:
I love the location at the corner and the fun seating. 

The Osha Sea dish is my favorite. Everything else just as good.

It is a fun place to go to in that area with a younger crowd clientele.
Definitely on my short list of fav Thai restaurants in SF.

Go4it!
author: Rod A.

description: The best Thai food in the city!  One of my favorite spots after a night of drinking (open til 3am on Fridays and Saturdays).  Go for the noodles and rice dishes -- you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  My favorites include Thai Spicy Pan Fried Noodles, Beef with Mint Leaves over Rice (add cashews), Fried Chicken over Fried Rice, and the Tom Kha (Chicken) Soup.  WORD UP.
author: Tommy O.

description: Not a lot of places are open after 2am on weekends which makes this place a great late-night Thai grub joint if you don't mind the loud afterclubbing drunks. I would add another star if the service was a little better. Food is ok, overrated. Price is ok. I enjoyed the Financial District location a little better.
author: ren b.

description: Same as the others. Reasonably priced yet good food. The yellow curry was sweet yet spicy. The fried octopus balls had some good sauce, but were just ok...
author: Nicolas H.

description: I love Thai food and this place had one of the best Tom Kha's I've had.  The salmon with asparagus in a red curry coconut sauce was also amazing. The service and decor/theme isn't good or bad, but I also loved the fact we ordered tea and weren't charged for it.
author: Cara J.

description: This place was great! Service was prompt and attentive. The food was decent Thai, but for the prices, it was a great value (dishes are only about $8-11!!), I enjoyed my meal and I'll definitely go back. They have a new location in Glen Park that I'm going to have to check out...
author: Paul B.

description: The food is pretty good here for a reasonable price.  It's open pretty late also.  Just DO NOT GO IN THE RESTROOM HERE!!!   You will lose your appetite!!!  Trust me...
author: H. A.

description: So I have to say I was let down by my most recent experience at Osha Thai. Usually I stick to the simple stuff, but I wanted to think and eat outside of the box (or plate) so I decided to try the Volcano Beef, I was expecting nice slices of beef with veggies (especially since I had to pay nearly $14) but I got giant chunks of tough beef instead, I was not thrilled to say the least, I didn't eat most of it, the knife they gave me was totally necessary as I could not even cut the meat with a fork. I hope next time is better (may not be a next time, I was very disappointed)....
author: Aaron L.

description: Maybe my favorite Thai noodle option in SF. I was sold the first time I went there, years ago, when i noticed the large percentage of Thai teenagers slurping noodles and grabbing take out. This place must be good. It's low key, high quality and has fast service at very reasonable prices. Why can't they have one like this in the Mission?
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Nice logo and nice eats. I had a blast here stuffing my face full of all the rice, noodles and whatever it was that was served with it!
Great Soups!
author: Daisy S.

description: A table for 6 please..no wait...a table for 8...i guess the two flies will be joining us. I'm from santa ana so I can look pass the tagged up bathroom and the barely breathable hot air blowing in our face. MUST TRY: Catfish curry w. egg plant.
author: Anhers M.

description:
after being at rye for a while on a friday night, i took a break so my friend could get some food.  i had a singha, he had barbecue chicken.  he got a lot of tasty looking food for very little money at osha.   i know it was a lot because i had never seen this guy not clear his plate from being too full until that night.  

we beat the 2am rush so we got seated and served very quickly.  next time, i will try the food.
author: Seong P.

description: Spicy Crab Fried Rice is the BEST, i don't think they have it in the menu anymore but please order it. You won't be disappointed and it only takes less than 5 mins for them to bring out your food, not too bad for microwave food at alllll. : P The best thing in SF that opens until 3am!
author: Sandy L.

description: AWESOME FOOD. i wanna drive the 400+ miles just for the seafood curry. BOMB!!
author: Chris C.

description: I like this location.  Whether it's after the bar, for lunch or dinner, osha thai has always delivered a good meal.  I tried the one in the marina district and it's more expensive but the same food.  it also has yuppie decorations to try to give it an upscale feel for all the snobs in that area.  I suppose that's why its more expensive.
author: Michael N.

description: The last time I came here, I did not order the raw shrimp appetizer.  Nonetheless, I was served raw shrimp in my green curry.  Nothing like biting into mushy, translucent meat when you least expect it.
author: Janut B.

description:
I really like this place, great seelction of food.  

The only down side is that sometimes they are inconsistant with the food.  Once I ordered pineapple fried rice and loved it, the next time is was too greasy and didnt have enough flavor and was very disappointed in the dish.  

Also, my boyfriend and I like to order-out instead of dine-in and the woman that is usually there in the early evenings can be quite rude.
author: Bernie B.

description: The food is great but the portions are gettign smaller and more pricey.. I think I am going to hire one of there cooks to show me how to make the food for my own home.. TOOOO much mula now days to eat there
author: Alejandra M.

description: good pad thai..and noodle dishes...the rice dishes and curry dishes are just as good....it's 3 star worthy...but extra bonus star for the late night hours....the mild spices will definitely soak away the alcohol out of your system....and wake you from your drunken stupor...always piping hot and fresh....
author: Hen A.

description:
This is my favorite Osha's... it may well be the least decorated and the food may not be prettied up the way they are in other Osha's locations.  It is also probably the smallest of them all.  Nonetheless, I love the unpretentiousness and the fast service.  There is always a wait no matter what time of the day you come in, yet I don't mind the wait because I never have to wait for more than 15 minutes.  

This is one of very few places that open late at night (especially if you're looking beyond the usual IHOP / Denny's / Mel's Diners) so it is super-popular among club-goers looking for post-drinking snacks.  

Boring as it seems, my favorite dish is Osha Fried Rice and Pad Thai.  Extra spicy, please.
author: Ange L.

description:
This place keeps my friends and I fed and happy after a night out. A good local cafe that is well known to SF party-goers due to their kick-ass hours. I believe this is the original location. They now have several other locations in SF. 

I usually order the eggplant with pork or chicken, mild of course. Served over rice. To a Thai person, if you order medium or hot, make sure you have some Thai ice tea or coffee handy. Water won't help. =) 

Their green curry fried rice is also one of my favorites. Panang curry with beef is also a hit. 

Service is good given all the customers they have to tend to. Expect to drive at 20-30 minutes to find parking. There is also a good wait during the weekends, so go with friends and at least you have people to entertain you while waiting. Or better yet, let the drunks entertain you during rush hours (me being one of them)...haha...hilarious!
author: Seb. M.

description: I used to LOVE this place when my then-boyfriend lived around the corner in the venerable TenderNob.  One of my fondest earliest SF memories involved us taking his dad here and giggling madly when the tom yum made his dad sweat.  But I've been back a few times lately and it's just not as consistently tasty as I remember.  It's still better than the newer outposts and they keep the third star for the late night availability that is so rare in this city.
author: Nat K.

description: A friend took me here for dinner last week. The food is really good, the seating is different. They have these big black wooden benches, not really very comfortable but they are stylish and look cool. I ordered the Spicy String Beans with Chicken. It was very good, much spicier than I've received at most other Thai restaurants (which I like!). I got fire-ass the rest of the night though. There was literally fire shooting out of my ass!!
author: Mike S.

description: Good place to get food after a long day's work.  My favorites are the pad see-ew and fried rice.  Would have given it more stars if the meat in these dishes are better.  No matter chicken, beef, or pork, it will be dry in your mouth with no taste.
author: Winsor L.

description: I've lived in SF for about a year now and have had some amazing Asian food around town and for some time, Osha was counted among my highly positive experiences. But over last couple months, Ive been to Osha-Tenderloin with a good friend and our service has been TERRIBLE, food quality not consistent, but yesterday afternoon just took the cake. We walked in and were seated by a seemingly pleasant waitress. We were immediately asked to place our orders with only seconds to review the menu. My friend and I like variety and are grazers so we started with 3 appetizers. One of the appetizers were the Angel Wings. The wings came out terribly overcooked with big gashes in the side of them as if the cook stabbed them while frying to make sure they were well cooked. Well they were more than well-cooked....they tasted freezer burned, dry, and barely edible. While waiting for our apps, the waitress took our dinner orders. My friends asked for a minor alteration to the fried rice that was coming as a part of his entree and the waitress abruptly said, "No! You can't do that. We dont make changes like that." We immediately were taken aback by her aggressive tone, and he decided to just order the entree as it was listed on the menu. After we cleared the table of our inedible angel wings and other plates, we were sitting waiting for our dinner, and all of a sudden another waitress brought our check as if we were done! At no time did anyone ask any question about how our experience was going. She just flung the check carrier down on the table and nonchalantly walked away. Just about that time, our dinner showed up. The rice dish that my friend order was not right. He asked me to taste it, and it was horrible. It was suppose to be thai fried rice, but looked and tasted like old overcooked plain rice with no taste. He hesistated to send it back since we had already had run in with our waitress, and when she finally approached the table, she asked in a rather condescending tone, "whats the matter?" He explained that the rice was bad, and she wasnt even paying attention. She just asked, " What do you want now?" He ordered another dish, and her response was that the dish was 4 dollars more than the previous. The reordered dish came out quickly, and it seemed that we were being rushed with various wait staff now hovering around. Just horrible.  As many times as we've been to this restaurant we'd never expereince this type of  attitude and lack of customer service or lack of attention to detail. Unfortunately this was our LAST time going to Osha, and we will resume going to other Thai restaurants in the area. I hope the staff and management at Osha see these reviews about their declining food quality and service and decide to do something about it before they lose more customers.
author: Bryan H.

description: My favorite Thai restaurant! Its good for late night snack because they close late. My favorite is padsee ew with beef and basil beef. I like the casual setting and the staff is friendly. Sometimes it gets pretty crowded but its always worth the wait.
author: Grace K.

description: FOOD POISONING!! My friend and I have been going to this place for quite a long time..however, after the last time we both got sick. It is VERY DISAPPOINTING and frustrating, since it is not a bad place and the food usually tastes good there. That last time we had Tom Kha Soup, Pad See Ew dish and chicken wings. I am not completely certain what caused the poisoning.. It is unacceptable for a reputable restaurant to serve expired or bad-quality food. Hopefully, you won't get poisoned.
author: Mary E.

description: Use to be a nice late night spot to eat, but ever since they remolded, thumbs down.  BOOO BOOO... for the ugly tables and benches.  I have thick thighs so its very uncomfortable to sit and have the table land right on top of my thighs.  WTF.  and the portion has gone down and the price has gone up.  Time to look for a new late night dinner spot......
author: Mimi S.

description: It was after the clubs and we came here to get our grub on. The service was okay. It was pretty busy with a lot of drunk people so they did the best they could. The food was all right. I mean it wasn't like the greatest or anything, but when your tipsy and hungry anything tastes good.
author: Joanne D.

description: Best place to eat after a night of drinking.  The cheapest Osha in the city.  The other ones raise their prices probably because the decor is more fancy. Fancy or not, I like to eat at Osha.
author: Nicole C.

description:
this place doesn't even worth 1 star. it's the worst thai place EVER.
the quality of the food is bad and it doesn't come close to be AUTHENTIC, why do i know that? my mother is thai. this place serves shitty food.

don't go to osha if you don't want to be ripped off.
author: Danielle E.

description: Great food, fast (CRAZY fast!) service, and cheap cheap prices.
author: Kevin R.

description: Crab fried rice chicken satay was amazing. A nice surprise when exploring the loin.
author: Mark H.

description: Went for a late night meal just before the mad rush and enjoyed a very nice plate of Pad Thai (boring, I know).  Service was 'ok' not bad, but not amazing either.  Was just right for a 10pm dinner.
author: Marcolm A.

description: My favorite... if not just for the booby shaped light sconces, then for the lightning fast service that makes you wonder if they have a giant phad thai dispenser in a seemingly broomcloset sized kitchen.  Well-priced and open so late it's almost early, the staff is dressed much like the alternatively appareled patrons, often with obscure engrish phrases on their tshirts that will put you into deep thought and zenful introspection.  While the dining area has improved its layout and lighting, the bathroom has kept its creepy deep dark heavily graf'd subway bathroom feel that presents a vague awareness of someone watching you from behind the bi-fold closet doors.  It's ok, I've already checked for monsters... just cleaning materials... obviously never used on the bathroom itself.
author: Marjorie B.

description:
Best late-night meal. Forget the pizza, come here. 

Hard to miss with the menu, except I would recommend ordering a fried egg on top of whatever dish you order. Weird, you say? Try it first.

Here's a great night out: have drinks next door @ Rye and finish off the night with phat-see-you. Go home happy.

[Their location in the Mission has an upscale menu and is worth trying.]
author: Asdf A.

description: Not sure what all the hype is about this place... I mean it was decent thai food, but not really worth the high price they charge for it
author: Josh U.

description:
the classic post drinking hangout, so best to come right before 1:30 am to not have to wait.
food is fast and reliable enough (nothing spectacular).  typically go for the curries
i.e. pumpkin, yellow, etc. little pricey for what you get
still the same spot for the post Swig, Ambassador, Jones, etc.
author: Rob C.

description:
i don't know what it is about this place, but everytime i'm in SF, especially after a night out, or when it rains, i yearn for this place.  i think its because the spices just fire me up.  man, i'm drooling just thinking about it again...and i just ate a half chicken.  

word of the wise...don't overdo it, spicy in is spicy out.  and at Osha Thai, it aint no joke.
author: John P.

description: My late night cravings are ALWAYS Osha's Lemon Grass Tofu.. it is divine and the price is just as divine. Not to mention that it is fast & Tasty. Oh not too mention i got it last night too! :) Get the Lemon Grass Tofu and Tom Ka Soup mmmhm.....
author: Chloe C.

description: This place is so delicious every time! So why not five stars? Because over the last year they have doubled their prices for the same food eaten at the same tables and uncomfortable benches. It's still a decent deal, but not like it once was.
author: Elina R.

description: Boo this place... Its open till late but damn, its hard to find parking at the wee hours. Food is nothing great... they put a lot of MSG but like i said, I'll eat anything when I'm drunk. Oh this is the cheapest Oshas compared to the one in Financial Dis. and Embarcadero.
author: Jose S.

description:
my faves -chkn larb, tom yum (seafood or chkn), yellow curry, chkn fried rice, and pad kra pao w/ minced chkn...and this boi is happy!

btw, for those who dont know, expect to wait atleast 25 mins on wknd nites at 2 o'clock in the morning! drunk + hungry = Osha.
author: Sha A.

description: Big fan of the green curry paste fried rice with chicken.  I've never seen this dish on the menu at other Thai restaurants in the City. I also like the Tom Ka Chicken soup here. Other dishes I've had are just okay.  The beef in the Beef with Chili is the complete opposite of tender.
author: Eating Sleeping T.

description: Out of all the Osha's in the city, this is not the one you go to for the atmosphere or the ambience, cuz it's not that spectacular in comparison to the others. This is the one you go to when you've got the 2 or 3am (drunken) munchies, or just a late-night craving for Thai food. I couldn't have asked for a better Pad Thai at 2:30 in the morning!
author: Felicia C.

description: Great late night thai food, don't be suprised if there is a line at 11pm at night.
author: Jared A.

description: Great panang pork curry and Thai Iced coffee, thanks for stayin open late!!
author: Andy M.

description:
i liked this place cuz the food was grubbin and the space is fun.  tasty thai in a 50's diner type setting..it works!  i ordered the angel wings which were full of flavor and hit the spot.  i think i tried the pad thai which was also good.  

i've been to only one other osha thai location (2nd street) which is a complete 180 to this one in terms of decor.  food was just as good tho.
author: Niki M.

description: It's good but it's not great.  But when it's 2:00am in the morning and you're stumblin' out of the Ambassador right across the street or from Rye next door,  dammit this place does the job!  So when you want to deviate from the monotony of pizza, head over.  I love seeing how everybody eatin here at that time is completley loaded!  Good stuff...
author: Holden A.

description: The original and always delicious.  This one definitely has a different flavor than the rest.  It must be the authenticity.  The tom kha is mmm mmm good (way better than campbell's).  My only qualms are how crowded it gets and the hard wooden benches.  I must admit, it is a bit more pricey for the old school decor and smaller portions.  They shouldn't have updated the prices like they didn't update the decor.
author: Jen T.

description: The tom ka soup was tasty but not overwhelmingly impressive (just staightforward, with no extra vegetables to offset the bean sprouts, chicken and noodles). However, the tasty, thick rice paper spring rolls,  and design of the cool mod ambiance and wavey textured walls merited a fourth star.
author: Shannon R.

description: I'm not sure why people get so pumped about this place cause its really just not that special.  The food is meh, service is mediocre if not really bad (especially bad during lunch time).  This place is/can be a scene with a lot of "bridge and tunnel" types that think this is the best Thai food the city has to offer which is prob a good thing as it keeps them from ruining the really good spots (wow I sound like a snob, but seriously don't bother with this place).
author: Nathan J.

description: Love it. Its a bit out of the way for me and the parking eats balls but its pretty worth it, especially if you're with someone. The service is good, if you're not satisfied with the food you can have them change it with no extra charge. The Food is tasty and affordable. They close late so its a prime destination after a late movie.
author: Jordan A.

description: This place WOULD'VE GOTTEN FIVE STARS if it was still under the previous management because they cooked better and served more. The food is still tasty and the prices are reasonable as it's a great place for lunch or late night dinner. Other than providing a fun atmosphere, especially being in the Tenderloin, it looks different than before they remodeled. They have these hard black wooden lounge seats instead of the old plush leather seating before. You also have to get used to the seemingly constant loud music so don't expect to eat in silence. The fried banana with ice cream is a MUST to top off the meal.
author: Brandon H.

description: The food is mediocre and a tad overpriced for such a small portion.  3 stars---only because the place is open late.  Osha is a good late night alternative than a drunken Denny's/Jack in the Box night.  At least you won't feel as guilty/crappy when you wake up hungover.
author: Jacquelynne S.

description:
it's perfect for that...

late-night-don't-wanna-go-home-yet fix

late-night-gotta-sober-up fix

damn! i'm-feeling-like-some-spicy-thai-food fix

seafood-noodles-and-rice fix

get your fix!
author: Jac T.

description: Combination Fried Rice - One of the most classic dishes at Osha Thai.  Get it for lunch, dinner, or late night booze food, it's ALL GOOD.  Moved right into the heart of the TenderNob my first year in SF.  This place kept me sane and stuffed that year.  Five Stars for that!!
author: JY J.

description:
god i love this place.  
and specifically this location.  
especially between the hours of 12am and 2am.

best pad see ew ever.
author: Cindy N.

description: Good Thai food at reasonable prices. Been coming here for 6+ years. I think this location is the cheapest out of all their other locations in the city. I like to order the chicken tom yum noodle soup with thin rice noodles....fried wonton appetizers, and this stir fried flat rice noodle with eggs, chicken and lettuce....my my my! I eat alot!!!!
author: C. T.

description: This is THE late night Thai spot in the TL, open till 3 on the weekend.  Good atmosphere for the late night partygoer meet up.  I wont' sign off on everything but the Thai fried chicken with fried rice special is the best.  Extra crispy chicken fried thai style and served with sweet and sour orange sauce! Yum!!  Whenever I'm in the bay I have to have to hit this spot at least once.
author: Oliver S.

description: This is a great place for affordable, quality Thai.  Very casual and speedy for the most part... Green & Red Curries are both superb.  Fairly greasy at times, but, it still tastes excellent.  There's a lot of Thai in the TL, but, I'll usually choose this one over most of them.  The Scrolls of Lore smile brightly upon this establishment.
author: critical Francis ..

description: I think this is the OG spot. The tendernob is always full of surprises and this OG Osha is a little gem for people who want some good Thai food. I ate my brains out the last time I was there and I think I fell straight into food coma because I am having a hard time recalling what I ate. But I know it was damn' good and I know I'll go back. Sorry this is such a lame review.  And no... I wasn't drinking. If you are in the hood it's a safe bet for Thai. I've been to their other restaurants on Mission and Second. This is my favorite.
author: Stephanie I.

description: THE perfect place to go after a night of drunken debauchery. It's open late, has good (cheap) food and a parade of trannies walking in and out. I went for the first time the other night and it completely cured me of my impending hangover.
author: Grace L.

description: Great cheap late night eats. At midnight you can dine here and enjoy some Pad See You, Yellow Curry, Crab Fried Rice, and Papaya salad while watching the suckers stuck in line outside the Ambassador. Seriously, who wants to wait outside in the Loin? The food here is pretty tasty. My friends and I received our food soon after we ordered and the bill was really reasonable. Will definitely be returning...
author: Lauren Y.

description:
I heart Thai food.  Actually, I heart all food but for the purposes of this review let's just pretend I only heart Thai food.  OSHA serves it up PROPER!  Very few Thai restaurants can make me forego my usual hot and sour coconut milk seafood soup with a side of rice but OSHA did it!  My partner in crime, Nez, and I started off with the fried wontons which were excellent and a real bargain at 12 for $5.50.  She had the beef with pepper and garlic over rice and I had the OSHA Sea curry over rice.  (A few moments of silence for Jill and Nez as they stuff their faces) SOOOOOO goood!  I took home half of my meal because it was so filling and let me tell ya' it was STILL excellent this morning when I finally made it home.  After a quick conference we decided that we had sufficient room in our "dessert compartments" to go for the fried banana with coconut ice cream.  A wise choice.  Washed everything down with the ubiqitous Thai iced teas and we were done and out of there minus $40 and less than 45 minutes.  Plenty of time to run out the door and conveniently catch the 38 Geary.  
Most importantly OSHA leaves you with a solid drinking base for the rest of the night's requisite debauchery!
author: Jill D.

description: I'll give this place a nice 5 star. It's the second Osha I've been to and they always deliver. Great food and good service. Not much to say about that!
author: Gerard L.

description: This is the second Osha Thai I've been to in the city, and I've been told this is the most "casual" of all of them.  Regardless, we were seated quickly and had a short wait to have our orders taken.  I must say, the food was brought out so fast, I had to wonder if it had been pre-prepared.  Pad thai was alright - nothing special.  Chicken friend rice was also okay.  I had more success at the Osha thai on 2nd St, but that could've just been my ordering wrong dishes.  I'm not sure I'd go back to this one, it was only convenient as we were going to Rye after!
author: Melanie N.

description: When people suggest we go to OSHA i always think of this one regardless on how closer the other locations are. This is the OG of the bunch and my favorite no matter how hip or pretty the other ones are. The food is great and cheap. It does get busy later in the evening but regardless if you dine in or out you wont be disappointed with the food. I would especially recommend the Pa-ram Chicken... Yummy!
author: Alfredo N.

description: Osha is great for all you partygoers living the life in SF. Their pad kee mao is the best I've had in the Bay Area, and their green curry is quite tasty.  Fried chicken over fried rice is also a crowd pleaser.  Prompt service and late hours are definitely a plus. If you're looking for good Thai food at starving-student prices, come here.
author: Peter C.

description: I guess i like this place. we always go super late night after a bad night of clubbing and getting rejected by a bunch of drunken hott girls. i usally get the crab fried rice which is really good. and the duck yum. the service kinda sucked the last time we went....actually the last few times we went. oh well nothing open late late nite. im gonna have to change from 4 to 3 stars cause of service.
author: Mark F.

description: I've been coming here for years and they have consistently provided a quick, cheap and super satisfying answer to my Thai cravings whether it is dinner time or late nite. I love that any of the dishes can be customized with different noodles or veggies and the service is always lightning quick. My favorite's here include the pad thai, the chicken silver noodles, and the eggplant stirfry with pork.
author: Christina N.

description: Naked prawns? First of all, the menu didn't say they'd be naked slash raw. Second, who likes raw prawns cooked with some peppers and onions? If you're gonna go raw, migt as well go all out with completely raw and fresh ingredients. The green curry friend rice was very good though.
author: Peter S.

description:
they're open late, and the food is adequate.

i had the veggie pad thai and the noodles were a bit too firm. the sauce was watery and lacked flavor.

the spring rolls were just okay. i wish they had the salmon rolls from their sister restaurant in the mission. the other osha thai is much better in every way.

but for late night sustenance, i suppose i had no choice but to eat here.
author: Lizzie O.

description: Foods OK, the service sucks, staff is rude, I didn't leave a tip but, was still charged one on a total bill of $35.59 I was charged a $5.68 tip without authorization, for a total of $41.27 called back was told they didn't charge my card - but, it went through for a total different then I authorized - I went to my bank to dispute the charge and got back my TIP........this is the US not "THAI LAND" where you think tips are just added on to what you feel you should get - TIPS are based on service and up to the customers discretion - don't SCAM someone like that - BITCHES.......YOU suck and ur service lacks the need to tip.......
author: Jonathan B.

description:
Love this place!  Open very late - 3 am!   You can go out to a show or just hang out really late and come here if you're craving some Thai food past midnite!

Service is good and fast!  We've tried pretty much everything on the menu... you can't go wrong.

Whenever we are in the area, we try to come eat here! =)
author: D D.

description: Great food, fast, cheap and open late for all the after drinking muchies!!  Favs are fried wontons, papaya salad, and the Osha noodle soup (number 32 from the old menu I think)!  Parking in the garage just up the block on geary is only $3-4 for an hour.  I ate here twice a week for 6 months when I first moved to the city!!
author: David C.

description:
Let me start by saying the food was excellent. If you're in no hurry and don't care about service I doubt you'll find any issue with this restaurant. We were seated right away....and then we waited. After waiting for about 15 minutes server #1 brought us glasses of water. He did this without introducing himself or otherwise making us feel welcome. 

Another 15 minutes of waiting and server #2 finally came around to take our orders. She seemed angry, but we didn't mind because we were relieved to finally be ordering after so long.

Some time after this we started to receive our plates. The food was excellent. They mixed up who wanted HOT and who wanted MILD. By this time we have dealt with three or four different servers. In fact I'm still not sure who our real server was.

After this, things only got worse. So bad, in fact, that it was almost like a nightmare. At one point, one of the waiters needed some place to put her tray, and she saw an empty spot on our table, so she just put it there, and left, without saying anything to us as if the table was completely empty. 

These are just a few examples of the horrible service at Osha, and I wouldn't recommend the place to anyone. But perhaps things would have been better if we went at a less busy time.
author: oskar v.

description: The garlic chicken/pork/beef will leave you dateless for the next month but worth it (death breath).  Don't order dishes spicy unless you really mean SPICY.  I made the mistake of ordering a dish spicy and had to wait the next morning to eat the meal cold.   after 12am, 95% of the patrons are drunk.  me included.
author: J M.

description: Not bad for late night. Soju was ridiculously expensive but whatever. The food was good although they messed up my order. I had low expectations considering where I was and the time I visited. I'd go back if I was in the neighborhood and everything else was closed again.
author: Art W.

description: I love Osha Thai, I've been to two different locations and they are very different from each other but equally as good!  I wouldn't say that this is authentic Thai food, but whatever it is, its flavored very well and always keeps you wanting more.  Every time I come here I end up stuffing my face as I can't resist having another bite.
author: Brian F.

description: Three star thai food that gets an extra star for being next door to Rye and open at midnight when I needed some food after a long evening of drinking.
author: phil h.

description: First of all, I went there late at night, so maybe that could of been the issue, but I don't think that should be an excuse for bad service and bad food. The Waiter or "hostess" as she called herself took out order on the back of old receipts. we waited an hour for our food, while we saw everyone that got seated after us get there food. and finally we asked where it was. She forgot to put in the order. and blamed that she was a hostess so she forgot to put it in. NO APOLOGY at all. HORRIBLE. then when we got out good, the fresh spring rolls were horrible. The wrap was too thick and soggy and I could make better rolls. the Chicken fried rice was too salty for me and the beef pho noodle didn't have enough flavor. I wish we went somewhere else. I didn't think this place would be such a dissapointment. if you're looking for a good thai place, I would say, go to Thai House 530 on Valencia. It's great there! family owned restaurant.
author: Pearl Y.

description: YUM YUM YUM! I have been saving my five stars for places like this.  Tasty, Quick and Cheap.  Enough said.
author: Sarah S.

description:
YOU MUST GET THE FRIED BANANA WITH COCONUT ICE CREAM HERE. 

My friends were so happy that I introduced them to this place after a girls' night out. I havent been here in awhile, but I remember my favorite was the mint leaves with beef. So spicy and good after a long night. 

One big downside- finding parking in this area. It takes about 20-30 minutes circling around the block to find a space. And there are also some transvestites hanging out in the area.
author: Retired B.

description: Food good, open late, service is quick but what always amazes me about this place is how fast the food comes. I've never waited as much as ten minutes even when the joint is packed. And its much better than its sister on Valencia, by the by.
author: patrick g.

description: I literally go here every other Thursday (it's Tablespoon on alternate days) after teaching my last yoga class.  The spicy food and bustling atmosphere make this an invigorating stop.  Try the Thai Spicy Pan Fry with Tofu.
author: Amme P.

description: Left over pad thai and catfish curry/oyster sauce was better the next day! whoopee!
author: Maynard M.

description: This place is a little expensive but it's really good, I will definitely be back. The design is really gorgeous too, they have wonderful landscaping before you enter the restaurant and they have a patio area too that we didn't get to eat on, but I'd like to next time. So the design of the place gets 5 stars. Now, on to the food. 5 stars as well. Everything was really delicious and no complaints. Thai iced tea was good, and they will use coconut milk if you'd like, the pad thai was very good as well, the pad kee mao was definitely a success and the pumpkin curry was so good, perfect spiciness. The sticky rice with mango was so good and a really beautiful presentation. We also had a green papaya salad which I think was good but not a must if you go. Also, the server was really nice and very accommodating with substitutions. I will definitely be back, I think for happy hour next time, $2.50 bottled beers!
author: Kristen L.

description: Delicious take out.  Curry is great! Reasonable prices make it a great place to grab lunch, there or to go. The waiters always seem to be busy though, but overall it is a good place to eat at with a group of friends.
author: Gideon S.

description: I sure was missing out on something great until I stumbled upon this place. Makes for much better late night dining than the usual fare. I'm pretty picky about Thai food and thought this place was wonderful. Will definitely be hitting it up again late night. Be prepared to wait a bit if you come at peak night owl hours (2am) but definitely worth it. Quick, cheap, and delish.
author: Jon N.

description: We went to this restaurant before going to the Post Theater to check out the Spelling Bee musical. There were 10 people in our party and we got multiple dishes for everyone to share. Overall, the food was quite tasty and the service was quick and efficient. This is not the best thai food I had but for a big group this restaurant is a good find. Plus - the food was fairly cheap and the place is open very late!
author: Maria V.

description: Used to be better before they opened the prettier stepsister spots on Valencia & 2nd. I still like this one because you can get in & out quick and it's near some fabulous dive bars. It's got character...like Cinderella when she was still covered in soot and playing with rodents. Whatever happened to her after that lunatic "Prince Charming' came along anyway?
author: Colleen B.

description: I don't get the hype? Nothing is ever outstanding. Last time I ate here there was something terrifyingly crunchy in my tofu and the server explained there was "just a little bit of fish sauce" in the curry. shit.
author: Emily S.

description:
If I lived closer to this restaurant and money was no object, I'd order their Volcanic Beef from their menu and probably eat it twice a week. Albeit I'd probably have a heart attack after a few months of such indulgence. 

A few things that I don't like, but often overlook because of the above:
-the long wait time
-over-priced uninspiring cocktails
author: O C.

description:
i didn't find anything extraordinary about this place. it actually reminded me of renu nakorn in norwalk (LA area) except i liked that place better. 

everything tasted clean but i like dirty thai food.... DUURTY. i don't know how to describe it really... more greasy, flavorful, spicier, served on those traditional asian community plates (you know what i'm talking about?) dirty.
author: John L.

description: this was my favorite thai spot for the longest time... i used to LOVE eating at this place esp. on late nights after hours... their crab fried rice was my favorite meal... however, i've eaten there recently and the fried rice no longer tastes the same.  their chicken eggplant, pad see ew, pad thai, garlic beef, chicken string beans and basil dish are still quite tasty.  oh and their fried coconut ice cream is awesome =)  i just wish they never raised the prices on their meals.
author: Kae B.

description: The only good location of this entire chain.  The others are overpriced, overrated, overblown.  I used to be quite a fan of them, too, but it's clear that the other locations are just taking the piss.  This one remains excellent: Great food, prepared quickly, with none of the pretense of the others.  This is my Thai Of Choice.
author: Eric H.

description:
My favorite dinner dining place in the city for late night eats.

THE FOOD
The food is totally catered to the Panda Express crowd and everything will taste sweet/sourey.   It gives a false sense of being cultured to those who frequent  SUSHI GROOVE or PF CHANGs (do you guys not notice the walnut prawn sauce at PF and the sweet salmon roll sauce at SG are the same??..so funny) to think they're really going "ethnic" w/their food tastes.    Yea right.  It's like getting taco bell and thinking you're getting mexican food. 

Anyhow..if you steer past the sweet/sourey stuff....there's some really good dishes at Osha.
