They have a seafood dish called "Osha sea".  It's packed full of really good fish, shrimp etc.  It tastes very full flavored w/spices and not so sweet/sourey.  It's pretty authentic.

Next and OUR MOST FAVORITE dish on the menu at Osha is a noodle dish called "PHAT SEE YOU"  (pronounced Fat see you!)
It's flat noodles w/egg/chinese broccoli and chicken or shrimp.  
That's the DISH to go for at Osha.  Add a hint of hot sauce, and you have sweet/salty/spicey and hearty meat..in one dish.  You GOTTA try it.  THIS DISH ALONE gives the place 5 stars.

AMBIENCE/CULTURE/PATRONS
It seems to be the hangout spot for all the NIck and Adams who are looking to oogle at exotic thai waitresses and get their drunk fetish on(see posts below..and I've seen firsthand).

Sound like a funny observation?  Sometimes it can be to the extreme.
You know the story that guys/girls can't always just be platonic friends?  Well here is the REAL LIFE cautionary tale of WHAT CAN HAPPEN..and at OSHA!

After catching a cab after our stint at Mr. Smiths...my crew went in to get our 1a.m.  Osha fix.

Across from us was a table of 3 guys (who looked like they were in the band fatboy slim, or a bad gap commercial.) and one asian girl w/her head buried in her arms on the table.  

One of the guys APPROACHES us..and comes over and says "Hey..Bro..we got this chick...she's all wasted Bro...we're going to take her back to my place man......You guys want in?"

THIS REALLY HAPPENED...

I politely declined...and my entire group looked over at that table in horror.    The scarey part is..one guy from my crew..actually went up and to that table!   I went over and got him and dragged him away from there.  Crazy, boy...

Sorry for the novel..I'll sum it up.

Good Food..Try the dishes above..prices are cheap(table for 5 w/food to spare came out to 45 bucks..unreal)

Crowd tries to act azn cultured and can be overly fetished out..so be prepared.

The fetish crowd tends to run off after 1:30am.  Because the chinatown gangsters tend to filter in about 2-3am.  Try not to be there around then.

See you there at 3!
author: Michael L.

description:
i am BOYCOTTING OSHA thai. i literally live right next door, and i refuse to step foot into this restaurant ever again (unless im desparate). 

the pad thai used to be 6.50, now it is 8.95?! wth?!?! i dont really have that much of a problem with them raising their prices, but if youre going to raise the prices by that much, at least increase the servings! its the exact same size for $2+... i did not look at the rest of the menu, but im sure the other items went up as well. riiidiiicccuuullouuss. 

and the food isnt even THAT good.
author: Diana T.

description: It's pretty good. It's a chain, so it feels a little bit like one. That being said, the decor is pretty funky, I mean not the nicest looking place but not bad. I must say they definitely can make an awesome Pad See You. It's probably the best I've had in the city. The Pad Kee Mao was not great... But... nah, just generally good food, and open late which is good for post-bar food.
author: Aaron F.

description: Great food!  Good ambience for small to mid-size groups!
author: AJ B.

description: Best fried rice around, and Geary one is open till 3 AM!  The service usually seems pretty good to me, and more than once they've accomodated me when I've rolled in with a large after bar crowd.
author: Buzz A.

description: There are certainly other Osha's but this is the best of them and it happens to be the original. Service is great, the food comes fast and hot and is always delicious. I must have eaten 80% of their menu over the years and it's always always excellent. Check out the pineapple fried rice, string beans (with your choice of meat), fried chicken over friend rice or bbq chicken over fried rice. They're all mouth wateringly good.
author: Nathaniel R.

description:
i love this osha thai! my bf and i always always come here for late night eats.. it's opened late.. the food is delicious and it's still has retained the cheap prices that it opened with! 

some of our favorites are:

yellow curry w/ chicken
crab fried rice
and 
duck fried rice!

*YUM*
author: Lisa C.

description: This spot gets pretty crowded after 2 AM since everyone is here grubbing after the bars/clubs.  The wait for a table of 2 took forever.  We got the green curry fried rice along with the beef salad - which both tasted delicious.  FYI - ordering "spicy" really isn't very spicy.  Also, this osha has a different menu from the others.  It is a plus that the prices are relatively cheaper though!  :)  I'd definitely come back again but I'll remember to order EXTRA spicy next time.
author: Vicky C.

description: Can't beat the taste, speed of service or price of this Osha.  Some tasty dishes and you can turn up the spice if you want the authentic thing.  Also the most generous serving of fish cakes I've ever come across. If you are going to drink alcohol here go with the Thai beer.  YUM
author: JBO ..

description: Ummmm.... the food is very delicious! Very fresh and flavorful! You get well more than what you pay for. I love the spicy papaya salad and the curry puffs; I suggest that everyone try that. Sometimes the service is not that great but the food makes up for it, so just as long as I get my food I am just fine with Osha. One of the best Thai restaurants in San Francisco.
author: Marie-Claire R.

description: This is my favorite thai place in the city and I'm grateful that it's so close to my house.  The other Osha locations aren't as tasty for whatever reason.  The service is usually cold and unfriendly but whatevs...the food is outstanding.  The curry is always the perfect consistency, never too thick or too thin.  The papaya salad is rarely bitter here, something you have to take a chance on when ordering papaya.  I crave their crab fried rice weekly, which, I'd like to add, comes with two real crab claws.  Sweet.
author: Victoria G.

description:
My first review, I'm not one to whine and complain about petty stuff. I've eaten here a few times, food is always delicious, service is speedy enough, ambiance is nice... but this last time I got TERRIBLE food poisoning. Volcanic beef made my stomach explode!! 

Food tasted delicious but the aftermath was most definitely not worth it, very disappointed, and scared to return :(
author: ariana m.

description: This place was pretty good. Their price was decent. However, this place is so full, it's hard to find seating. But that just about proves how good they are. Their food is decent and not too bad. I got the pan fried noodles. Something about the vegetables were a little off and the portions weren't as large as I wanted. But for the price, it was okay. I probably wouldn't return to this place, but it's decent.
author: Alex D.

description: The red curry and spring rolls are my fav. I always enjoy my meals here and the price is right. Cool vibe and great location.
author: A D.

description:
I used to go there with friends after watching a late night concert, or after a night at a club because they had good food and were open late (we had the choice of also going to the Vietnamese restaurants near Chinatown that close late as well but Thai Noodle was way better). They pretty much led the revolution of the 'modern' Thai restaurants in the city. My husband and I have been going there for many years (from my memory for 13 years) when we were still dating (and we've been married for 9 years now). Osha wasn't named Osha yet and we used to refer to it as Thai Noodle. We still do if we refer to the Geary location. This place was the original location of the Osha franchise. And we loved this place because it had a hole in the wall feel to it (meaning it wasn't pretentious), packed with a good young crowd, cheap and delicious food with good portions, and fast service. We used to joke that they were a fast food Thai place (compared to other Thai restaurants at the time that had a traditional upscale ambiance). We still love their food until now, although we don't go there as often as we used to since we moved further south.

Funny how they changed. They renovated this place to have a cleaner, bistro-like ambiance (yes, it is more pretentious, such is the case in Embarcadero and 2nd St) and they expanded the Geary location (which was good since it was always packed. They added more dishes (I appreciated the addition of the fried ice cream which I could only find at a Thai restaurant on Noriega before) and they also jacked up the prices (boo). Because of this, I am only giving them 4 stars. But hey, the food is still good and we still try go there everytime we're in the city.
author: Cindy S.

description:
BEWARE...don't go to this place
they are discriminating! if you are not White, you will have to wait for your orders longer, even though you ordered first. I've been here many times and observed this. Therefore, I will not go here again.

No offense if you are White. I just don't like how they treat people here.
author: sleepy b.

description:
One star is for this place keeping late hours, in a city that really needs more decent late-night eating options.

Otherwise, the food here is generally decent and moderately priced. Probably the best thing I've had here was a "Phat See You" variant of Pad Thai, with wider rice noodles and Chinese broccoli.

Service ranges from indifferent to surly. The last time I was here, on the third refill of hot tea the server pointedly filled both our cups halfway. It was neither especially busy (plenty of free tables at the time), nor were we lingering in the place...this seemed like an overtly rude gesture.
author: Mark A.

description: This place is sort of a guilty pleasure - they're open late (the biggest selling point to me), they serve a little bit of everything Thai, prices are cheap and food comes QUICKLY.  Only thing is: I never feel all that great after my meal has had a few minutes to work on me...I'm not saying its not especially healthy, I'm saying you get what you pay for at 2AM.
author: Ryan W.

description: I have been to a few locations and for some reason the one on Geary has never failed me.  My personal favorite is the chicken with spicy string beans.  The place can get pretty crowded during the late hours of the evening.  Parking in the area is a complete crap shoot so take a cab out from your evening festivities.  This is definitely a place to end the evening rather than start it.  Check it out next time you are in the area.
author: Lonnie A.

description: My friend told me he'd take me to a place with great Thai food and said it was called Yellow Sea. Of course, we arrived and I was surprised to find myself at another Osha restaurant. We ordered the green curry, the yellow sea curry, and the crab fried rice. I loved the spice of the green curry and the flavor of the seafood yellow sea. The fried rice was a hit and basically we walked out feeling like we're headed for a food coma, but now have the calories to burn on a long bike ride. I definitely like the food more at this location than the one Downtown.
author: Faye P.

description: There are just too damn many Thai places in SF. This one can stay, they don't offend through pretension and the food is better than expected given the cheap prices.
author: Kevin S.

description:
yum!

thanks for being delicious thai food open until 3:00 AM on the weekends.
no thanks for a spiraling bathroom line that goes out to the main dining area to in front of our table.  luckily i am not one of those standing in line.

top picks for late night eats at osha:

1. fried chicken with fried rice (equivalent to a #31 at king of thai) haha
2. tom yum noodle soup
3. pad see yew w/chicken

**be prepared to wait for awhile if you are going to osha right after everything gets out.
author: Carli F.

description: I'm sorry but this place was pretty gross. My boyfriend and I came here last night based on reviews and everytime I pass by its packed. Based on the condition of the bathroom I knew what to expect, it was filthy, had a stench, slight mold growing around the corners of the sink, tagging etched everywhere, and paper towels scattered all over the floor. If you're not taking care of your bathrrom which many of  your customers see you're probably not taking care of your kitchen. We ate the crab fried rice because because sooo many people had reviewed on and said it was good! Geezus! It was disgusting! It tasted fishy, there was only like 2 little baby crab legs in there, the texture of the rice was off. The Pad see ew we got was eeeh and the Calamari was aight; too chewy for my taste. We couldn't wait to leave and I offered my take out to a homeless man outside and even he didn't want it. lol. I most definitely won't be coming back.
author: Patricia H.

description: Good dessert.
author: Wesley W.

description:
the place is open late.  the food is cheap [although the prices have gone up through the years].   the food isn't that spectacular, but good, and on drunken nights it tastes real good.  they pump out food fast!  it does get crowded, but the waits are never really long.. 10 min. max, at least when i've been there. 

my only complaint is that the spicy eggplant dish is too oily sometimes.

they did a little face lift here.  it looks nicer w/the paint job.
author: Sheri N.

description: Absolutely hands down, one of the best places to get crab fried rice.  This place is open late, but parking is a bitch!  Really good food, and since it's open late at night and close to most of the clubs and downtown shopping, it's a must to stop by at.  I take all my friends from out of town to go here, because you won't find a place like this any where else!  DELICIOUS!!
author: Jin B.

description: I have no idea why this is so well rated.  The service was minimal at best & the food was a whole lot less than average.  Tom Kha soup & the green curry were both extremely watered down & had little spice to them, even though ordered medium hot. The spring roll wrappers were not rice wrappers, perhaps mung bean. They had a spongy-slimy consistency & were stuffed with barely anything but lettuce leaves. With so much good Thai food in SF, I can't see why anyone would choose this place!
author: stacey e.

description: Junk noodles and such cooked with way too much sugar. Served in piles in a loud warehouse decorated in Early Hipster Loft. Perfect for drunks and tourists.
author: Cameron C.

description: We were trying to escape Union Square last Wednesday night and came across this place. It was crowded so we took that as a good sign. Food was very nice. Yellow curry was very tasty and really sweet, and the Thai sausage was amazing. The menu looked like it was designed by a 10-year-old and it hurt my head, but we managed to get through it. There were some assholes at the surrounding tables, but I guess that's not the restaurant's fault...
author: Juan C.

description: You. Your good buddies. Late night feast to end all feasts. This place hits the spot. I recommend the Pad thai, and the coconut chicken soup. Steer clear of the meat ball skewers. If not for the gamey / dull taste, then for the sinewy texture.
author: Alexa B.

description:
the first time i ate at OSHA was in the summer of 2001. only 1 location existed then- geary @ leavenworth. it is the best thai food in the city if you want thai at 2:30 am on the weekend (open till 3am) that is easy on the wallet, served up fast and is SERVED & MADE by thai people (my thai speaking friend has always been able to order in thai & yell out to the cooks exactly how she'd like the dishes prepared). she argues that there is MUCH better thai food in the city. my response - you can't get it after the bars have closed.

fyi - valencia, 2nd street and embarcadero locations don't come close to the original. all dishes are marked up $3+ at the other locations. probably to pay for the fancy decor and rent in those trendy neighborhoods. designer furniture, bamboo potted plants and brick walls don't make the food taste better.
author: Audrey E.

description: Nice decor, snazzy bowls, good food, 2 a.m.  Thai food?  Wait, sticky tables...  nasty bathroom...  oh yeah, thai food in the tenderloin.
author: Scott Y.

description:
this place is brilliant!

1) its cheap

2) its dirty!!  yeeaahh.  just deal with it

3) its open until god knows when

4) its fast...get a steaming plate of goodness like 5 minutes after you sit down

5) get fried rice or noodle plates...just a perfect stand alone meal.  dont mess with anything else

6) where else can you have a homeless guy valet your car, see a dozen tranny hookers, and then watch old white businessmen go home with one right from your window inside?!?

this is true san francisco dining
author: Robert S.

description: the food was fine, but the staff for some reason three nights ago, dropped the ball in that we were waiting while they sat three subsequent parties (as in we were there first) ahead of us and then claimed we hadn't been there the twenty minutes that we knew we had been.....hmmmm I wonder
author: Jacob G.

description: Wa wa wee wa!  I'm writing this review on behalf of my friend who grew up in Thailand.  He's been in San Francisco for four weeks scoping out every Thai spot in sight.  He's tried one Thai restaurant a day.  His number one spot for pretty darn authentic Thai food in San Francisco is Osha Thai.  He said that the Tom Yum Noodle Soups and the Yum Woon Sen (spicy silver noodle dish) are just like in Thailand.  I had both dishes and they were DELICIOUS.  Plus, the prices are definitely reasonable -- especially compared to the east coast.
author: Karen K.

description: If you served breakfast, I could almost stop grocery shopping altogether.
author: Patrice S.

description: moved to the city less than a week ago and have been here twice.  great food, fast service and open late.  I love this city!
author: Shawn S.

description: I love this place! The first time I ate there was 11 years ago when I visited San Pancho,  for the first time. I had the restaurant on the back of my mind and after 4 years of living in SF I finally went back.  I didn't know the exact street it was or cross streets so I kept postponing my visit. Finally, this weekend after some wine I decided to venture out in the streets and try and find the place. My friend lives a couple of blocks away and I had started  to feel a hunger urge. I thought people along the way would probably know the direction in which to point me towards. After asking several people, and a few unfortunate adventures along the way, I got there. The food was awesome as I remembered it.
author: Sandra M.

description: Hell yes. Great food, great prices, great portions, great hours, incredibly fast service. Definite one of my favorite spots in the city.
author: OJ C.

description: Blahh, I used to love this place. Having lived in Loin for a few years, I used to come here almost daily. What happened to it? A new facelift but what happened to the food? Its still decent, don't get me wrong but the prices have risen and the quality is just not there anymore. I cannot stand to eat at their other location so I don't have a weekly Thai fix anymore.
author: C L.

description: the best thai place in all the bay area. the food is delicious. i only go here for thai food. highly recommended, but expect to wait since it is always packed!!!
author: Ethyl M.

description: fast, delicious, cheap and clean! what more do you need?
author: Carol Y.

description: I love their crab fried rice.  Still going strong since I first tasted them 14 years ago.  Although price has been doubled since then, from about $7 a plate to $14 a plate for the crab fried rice
author: Rus T.

description: Pretty good Thai food, more towards noodles rather than curry as the name says.  Open late.
author: Russel S.

description: Solid Thai food.  If you fancy really Thai spicy, this is the place to go!  Only if you can take a serious fiery 10 do you want to ask for VERY spicy -  you were warned here first!  If not, add your own spicy condiments at the table.  The sampler platter was good though nothing out of the ordinary.  The green curry fried rice and pad see ew we had were excellent.  Just like how mom used to make lol.  Good place to go late too.  Everyone here is friendly and service is prompt.  Can't go wrong here for a good and quick simple meal.
author: Karen R.

description: A good place to go late at night.  I have been here at odd hours and they aren't closed.  The food is fast and good.  I like the sticky rice and mango.  Parking around this area can be difficult.
author: apple r.

description: Went here with a group of people.  The noodle portion sizes are large, but if you don't mind leftovers, it's still worth it.  The pad see ew is amazing!
author: Lizzy G.

description: Why oh why are you the only Osha Thai that doesn't serve the fresh spring rolls!?! They are too delicious to not serve! Please add them to the menu.
author: Sara S.

description: I've had some good noodles here over the years, and the late night hours mean a bonus star, though, I think I've finally outgrown the plastic house music that usually blares.
author: Stellah D.

description: My favorite pad thai in the city (so far)! There are many dishes I'd like to try but I can never resist the pad thai. I've actually had my food come at the same time as my water here, and not because they were slow with the water. Decently priced and open late, my kind of place!
author: katharine s.

description: This place is good for late night eating if you're in the area. You can pick your level of spiciness and they really do make it spicy!
author: kristin e.

description: Osha is the first step to hangover prevention.  Where else can you go at 2:30 am with 6 other people after a night of boozing?  It's very good sober, too.  But I may rather be inebriated when setting foot into their bathroom, though I'm willing to overlook that for their fast, inexpensive, and very tasty food.  And this is the only place I know that has a fully stocked Thai condiment tray on every table.  There's gotta to be at least half a dozen add-ons, including crushed peanuts, fish sauce, and sriracha.
author: M A N I K.

description: I was here with my parents on New Year's Day.  Sweet decor, good vegan cuisine, but nothing about the food really stood out to me.  Sure, it's been a couple months, but I can't remember what we ordered and I tend to remember dishes/restaurants that I really like.  I'd come here again, but meh.
author: Emily F.

description: This place has gone way downhill in recent years. The food used to be tasty (and a good value). Having not been to this particular location in a while, we stopped in for lunch a couple of weeks ago.  I ordered the Prahram (sp?), which is steamed veggies with peanut sauce. When it came out it consisted of 2 button mushrooms, a small handful of sprouts, and a couple of pieces of friend tofu. Pathetic, really. When I asked the waitress if this is how it is supposed to be, she shrugged her shoulders and responded "yeah".  Given that the dish cost $9 that made it about $1 per bite. My friends were equally disappointed with theirs. I will not be back.
author: SL N.

description: This is the original Osha Thai Noodle Cafe. The prices are affordable and the food rocks. I highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Jordan H.

description:
decent thai food at decent prices.  it's a good late night place to go too.  

i had the chicken noodle soup with medium sized noodles...sliced chicken, bean sprouts, rice noodles, and some fragrant chicken broth.  the dish didn't wow me, but then again it was 1030pm on a monday night and i was craving noodle soup.  ill have to try some of the other dishes next time like pad kee mao or the chicken with basil.
author: Wendy S.

description: When it comes to Thai food, I'm no expert, but I know good food when I taste it. Short of hoping on a plane heading to Bangkok, I don't think I can get Thai food that taste any better than Osha. Its a bit pricey (when is Thai food not?), but I highly recommend it. Oh and the Crab Fried Rice is bomb.
author: Don N.

description: good place to go when ur drunk (bcuz theyre open late) but the wait sucks. the food is pretty good but the portions have gotten smaller over the years and the prices have gone up...............
author: Lisa N.

description: Awesome Panang chicken. Liked the Chicken Pad Thai, the Tom Kha and the appetizer sampler plate too. Shitty, shitty wine - comes out of a jug and is simply "white" or "red," and absolutely no atmosphere, but good spot to hit up before going out in the Tenderloin - super fast, yummy, filling and far from pricey. :)
author: Sarah R.

description: I think the 2nd st location is much better in food and service and waaaaaay better in atmosphere but this one is still good.  It was another after midnight craving and so it got points for being open til one on a Tuesday night.
author: Debbie Y.

description: only thai place i know that is open late! gotta love the duck over long beans (off menu item - request for it!) *wink -- but i can't stand their unisex restroom. FILTHY!
author: Mika D.

description: This is our favorite cheap Thai place in the city.  Great late night Thai food that is yummy.
author: Rose C R.

description: After waiting for 10 minutes which actually gave me time to go over the menu, we - party of 2, were seated.  Then given water and asked if we were ready to order... which we were.  Waited another 5 minutes before our fried tofu appetizer came out which was pretty good.  The sauce definitely added more flavor to the crispy tofu.  The main entree was Garlic & Pepper Pork over rice topped with a fried egg.  Excellent!  It was quite tasty with all of the condiments for your taking at the table.  I wish they had more jalapenos at my table though.  I still favor Sanam Luang in Hollywood, CA but this will do for my first try at thai food in San Francisco.  I washed the food down with some tasty Thai Iced Tea.  Overall worth checking out and it's pretty good food!  We were satisfied!
author: Limzer L.

description: The young staff seems kind of amateur, but overall not bad.  Plus it's affordable and fast.  More of a younger crowd than some other Thai restaurants right around the corner.  Great late night spot --open until 3am-- as long as you don't mind the Tendernob.
author: Ryan L.

description: The food here is different than the other locations, including the decor and the BATHROOM!  Where is the consistency?  It was cool considering you are in the TenderNob area.  For a better experience of what Ohsa is all about go to the the 2nd street location, which is off the hook or the one on Valencia.
author: Jason A.

description:
this place is great for a bite to eat when you're in the area, early or late.
i had a yummie creamy coconutty chicken curry... oooh it just melts in your mouth with the warm steamed rice.  so rich in flavor and what a great value it was when it was time to pay!
author: charlotte s.

description:
Warning::: this place is addictive and unusually loud and bright.  There's no better Thai food in the Bay Area and certainly not one that's open til the wee hours.  

It's 2 AM in San Jose, the clubs are closing and you're hungry.  You don't want to settle for Original Joes or Denny's so what can you do?  Drive up to SF to OSHA!!!   Just think about the crab fried rice, take some friends who like to eat and you'll be there in no time.   That's how addictive the food at this place is.  

So you wanna know what to order? Bangkok style street food  is the way to go here, avoid dishes that show up on chinese menus.  In case you're wondering, I grew up in Bangkok, my cousin owns 2 Thai resturants, one which has catered to the royal family and diplomats when they visit DC so I know a bit about  Thai food.    Here's how to get your Thai fix: start off with something creamy, move onto spicy and finish it off with something sweet and sticky.   Mmmmm.... For appetizers go with  shrimpt toasts and tom ka gai (enough cholesterol from the coconut milk to clog your arteries for years), crab fried rice (not spicy, buttery rich), pad see ew (mild), any curry (get it thai spicy if you dare), and of course the Dessert Diva can leave a meal without coconut icecream on sticky rice (special order not on the menu).  Avoid anything that you can find on a typical chinese menu, that's not Thai food and it's not what they do best.  Thai resturants put that stuff on the menu to please the timid.    Good place to take out of town guests who want to experience something different.  Best Thai food in the Bay Area, right up there with Thai Town in LA for authencity.
author: Surai J.

description: The food is good and eventhough they may seem really packed at times they get through everyone fairly quickly. The servers are pretty attentive and are quick wuth the refills on your water and your tea. The free water and tea is also great. I usually order the Thai basil with grounded chicken. thats really good. I've also heard that they stay open pretty late to accomodate the club and bar goers.
author: Justin G.

description:
Stuck in the area and needing some honest Thai food? 

This is probably a great stop for you. The food is authentic and the area is decent for the neighborhood. 

Of course I'm not asking why you're in this area late.
author: David Y.

description: I really like the papaya salad and taro rolls. I should have also ordered the padthai, because it looks so good. Osha Thai is pretty clean too; it's pretty nice considering its location, BUT please be warned about the bathrooms. Take the 38 downtown and pee there.
author: Judy L.

description: This place always hits the spot for me.  It's no wonder why these keep popping up around the City.  Pad See Ew is always good!
author: Rod C.

description: Great Thai at any time of day.  This place is quite a scene at 2 a.m. after the bars close.  The food is great and this is the original location.  The other locations are more on style and have higher prices.  This place is solid.  Very good prompt service.
author: Moe J.

description: I know a lot of people who really love this place, but I don't get it.  I think the decor is great - wide open space, modern, super nice.  However, the wide open space makes the restaurant super loud & hard to have a decent conversation without yelling.  Also, I thought the service was sub-par and the food was only ok.  I definitely was not impressed. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't worth 4 stars.
author: l. a.

description: Fast serving and good place for Thai cheap eats. Love the green curry fried rice there! The other location on Valencia has a more trendy ambience.
author: Yan M.

description: Authentic affordable Thai cooking at this downtown restaurant opens into late night. Hip/funky crowd, fast service, great selection of food. Try their "naked prawns" (it's raw and super spicy!) if you dare! Go for Papaya salad with "salty crab". Too many yummy dishes i can't name them all, you just have to try yourself!!! From soup noodles, fried noodles, to fried rice; From appetizers, soups to entrees, everyone can find something he/she likes there.
author: Angela H.

description: This place is great for late night dinning. I usually get the chicken Pad Thai.  The service is great, prices very cheap and it is always packed. I went with a friend recently and  they were getting ready to close but accommodated us last minute.
author: Teddy d.

description:
Cheap, fast, and good thai food.  You can't complain.  Their pad thai is actually one of the better ones in the city.  Minus half a star for the difficult parking.  One tip is that you can go around 6pm b/c that's when you can park around the yellow zone..hehe..  Other than that, just know that it will take you at least 15 mins to find parking.  I also recommend their fried chicken.  If you feel like something greasy and crispy, their chicken is good.  It's not dry at all and it comes with a sweet/chilly dip that makes the chicken tastes great.  Their curry puffs are really yummy too.  Just the right amount of potato in the puff and the curry tastes wonderful.
*****11/3/2006 Update*****
Had their mint leaf with beef and it's so great.  A must try dish.  You have to like the mint taste though b/c I know some ppl are really particular about that taste.  Also, you will not go wrong with the Pad See You.  Also an excellent dish.  Tried their Spicy Spaghetti and that was not bad.  Nothing special, but the sauce is not bad.
author: AhLin C.

description: Osha fried rice medium spicy w/ chicken FTW!
author: Al W.

description: One of my faves in the city. Now I normally come here after the clubs late at night, but I did come here sober a few times, and it's still good! Some favorites are the Pad See Ew, crab fried rice, shrimp pad thai, and the penang curry.  Open till 3am, but try to be here before 2am to avoid the after-club rush.
author: Seila K.

description: This is a cool spot for some good eats after a club night. Everything on the menu is really good like the crab fried rice and the fried chicken and fried rice oh and the curry. This is some really good stuff.
author: Karim R.

description: My favorite place to go after the clubs! Great food and great price - I have yet to find something on the menu that is not tasty tasty!
author: Tony L.

description: This place is fast and the prices are cheap.  It's the least fancy of the Osha restaurants, but the food is comparable.  If you're coming for fourth meal on the weekends, it may be a bit of a wait, since everyone else will be doing the same thing.
author: Erika C.

description:
8pm on a thursday night and this place is packed BUT waited maybe 5 minutes outside for the next open table.  osha has changed alot.  their decor used to be on the lighter side with the birch wood finish of the tables and the ikea plates and cups.  now it has that lounge vibe with the black wooden tables and chairs, techno/ r&b music, and muted tvs.  this place is still open until after the clubs/bars close, i think that's why they've changed their look.  when it comes to the food and service, i'd definitely recommend this Osha on Geary than the one located on Embarcardero.  they suck... 

anyway...
food?  EXCELLENT!
well i ordered the papaya salad with the salty crab.  NO.  dont get that ever.  at least dont get the one with the salty crab..more like old and moldy crab.  it was nasty.  big no no.  the boytoy ordered his usual..shrimp fried rice.  always delicious.  ask them to level-up the spiciness...they'll look at you and smirk.  they know you wont be able to handle it.  and you probably wont..

let me break it down for you:
LEVELS of SPICINESS (USA VERSION)==
mild
medium
spicy
now, since we're in california, we think different.  we're not used to those tiny chili peppers they use, so you'd think that mild would be no spice, medium would be tolerable, and spicy would just be spicy..but noooo.

LEVELS OF SPICE (THAI VERSION):
mild=spicy
medium=give me 2 glasses of ice water
spicy=call 911, my head just exploded.

me?  im still a novice.  i go for medium.
so now you know, and knowing if half the battle... 
peace.
author: Summer R.

description:
looooooove me some Osha!

okay, so it is right up the street from my house, so it is a regular restaraunt haunt for me, especially good for late night eats

couple suggestions:
-spring rolls: yes
-bloody sally: yes yes
-anything with tofu: yes yes YES (their tofu always rocks)

WARNING!!
      do NOT order EXTRA SPICY no matter how tough you think you are.  i have witnessed firsthand very large men in tears over their extra spicy.
okay, be tough, but don't say I didn't warn you....
author: brenna h.

description: I've been here several times for lunch and have had a great experience every time.  Liked the curry dishes, beef fried rice, and pad thai (and I don't usually like pad thai.)
author: L C.

description: I used to love going to this hole in the wall.  I used to be able to get a quick bowl of noodles (not the best quality) but good enough for six bucks.  Now the bowls have gotten fancy (smaller) and the cheapest bowl is $9.95.  I won't go back.  There are cheaper places just as good.
author: C t.

description:
I was looking for a place close to where my daughter works so that I could meet up with her for dinner.  Osha was recommended by a colleague.  I arrived an hour early and sat in the lounge and ordered a Bangkok by Night drink - rum and strawberry liquer - wonderful!  The lounge was comfortable enough for me to read while I enjoyed my drink.  The best news was I got to enjoy during happy hour - the happy hour is from 3:00 p.m. until 8:00 p.m.  Monday through Friday.
When my daughter and her friend arrived they ordered the Lychee martini - omg!  I am getting that next time.  We then went to the restaurant - a little strange because you exit the bar area and enter another door for the restaurant.  The restaurant has a nice atmosphere - as does the lounge.  We ordered appetizers -Thai somosas and the hit was the crab with cilantro deep fried (anything fried is good!).   We ordered the country chicken, Osha spicy pan fried noodles and prawns pineapple.  The place was very busy and I felt slightly rushed by the servers but  I would return.  The restaurant is a little pricey but the atmosphere is nice and the food overall is very good.   I would catch BART and meet up with my daughter any weekday night for another taste of the lycee martini!
author: Dorothy M.

description: This place is amazing...I went here for dinner and had the Panang Curry, it was pretty good but I liked my boyfriend's Duck Curry. Probably one of the best Thai places I've been to. I liked the atmosphere, the customer service was good. The only bad thing about this place is their bathroom..it was pretty disgusting...but I'd definitely come back
author: Diana L.

description:
this place is a short walk from my apartment. unfortunately that short walk is up leavenworth and through a rather seedy area.  when i first came to san francisco the prospects of having an unpleasant experience walking through the loin was nary a problem. if i wanted my thai fix i would walk to osha.  it was good. not great. it was reasonably priced. and it was consistent. 

then i found out about other places around the loin that provided better thai food at just as competitive prices.  i stopped going to osha.  

one of my friends suggesting grabbing food here and i begrudgingly accepted. (why, oh why not lers ros?). after being back i have come to the conclusion that this place is average.  the service is lackluster but your food will come out fast. the food is tasty but not mind blowing. the feel of the restaurant is cheap. the seats are uncomfortable and it feels like a run down diner. and the wait (to get in the restaurant) can be kind of ridiculous. 

there are so many good thai options around. including other osha thai establishments... i say check those places out-unless your friend drags you here ; )
author: Jason B.

description:
Food - great (vege versions of Tom Yam soup and pumpkin curry).
Location - excellent. Get to lunch by 11:50 to grab an outdoor table and check out the Justin Herman scene.
Service - terrible.  Soup was delivered to table with dirty bowls.  When we pointed it out, the bowls were removed without a single word of apology.  No attempt to ladle the first bowl as is typical at Thai restaurants regardless of how busy they are.  No smiles from any wait staff.  Kept on trying to remove our food when it was clear we were still eating.
author: Richard H.

description: The food is pricey but delicious, I'd probably just go on special occasions. Portions are small, but the food is definantly good.
author: Anna T.

description: The food here used to better with better portions. Now the food is jumping up in price every few months and the portions are shrinking.  The last time I had some food here is was very skimp.  The beef was chewy like gummy worms. All and all the place to me sucks now they are all about the money and service and quality went out the door. There are plenty of other thai food places that are better tasting with better customer service at a reasonable price. I probably wont be coming back any more. I also hear that the one on folsom and 3rd sucks as well. So save your money and go some where else like king of thai where the service is always better.
author: Art N.

description: A lot of hype for this place, I used to think this was the best but there are other places better now. The best thing about this place is they're open really late. But because of the hype they're always crowed too. They have good thai food, nothing really special that you can't find anywhere else. Go here for late night meal.
author: alfred k.

description: beyond gross.  not safe for vegetarians, they assume fish sauce is OK and you will have one hell of a stomach ache the next day.
author: Noel J.

description: I love this place.  The food, the quick service, the cheap prices, the late nights!  It is sooooooo good!  I'm a big fan of their Pineapple Fried Rice, just can't get enough.  And seriously, how cool is it that you order and  in like 4 minutes your food comes?  Of course, it's not always the case, but it has happened!
author: Michelle B.

description: A bit pricey (for this class of Thai restaurant)  but very good food.
author: Tinou B.

description: Wow... this place really has great flavors and the prices are good and the food comes out quick.  The hours stay open very late for those late nighters.  If you like hot & spicy, then you'll love what they can do for  you.
author: Jenn C.

description:
i am not a fan of osha on valencia street (you really pay mostly for the decor), but i do like this tendernob osha every so often.

i usually find myself at thai house express on geary & larkin, but will venture to this osha for the curry dishes. there's a mixed seafood chef special w/red curry that is delicious! i'm not into the papaya salad, but ordered the one w/salty crab, which is different from the salty shrimp style i usually get. the thai iced tea was exceptionally good!

late night, take out, comfy and efficient service.
author: Antoi C.

description: The only Osha in the city worth going to. Real authentic Thai food versus the yuppie-fied Osha's in the Mission, Embarcadero and the worst offender SOMA. Try the pad see ew (noodle dish), larb (meat salad) or i'm always down with the egg omelette. Open late and won't break your wallet! Don't mind the TL.. people aren't gonna mess with you if you don't mess with them.
author: ed h.

description: One of the best thai restaurants everrrr!! The service is fast, the food is great, it's cheap, and they even open late!! There are 3 Osha's in the SF area? Something like that.. I suggest try them all..
author: Rochelle F.

description: Late nite + slight intoxication + good Thai food = content belly.
author: Gary L.

description: Osha Thai has seriously gone down in its standards. Very disappointing because it used to be fantastic. the curries are tasteless, and the food is just drenched in oil. I think opening up so many branches has brought down their management standards.
author: Antara B.

description: This is a great place for large groups. I had my bday dinner here and it accommdated a group of 14 people and a normal time (between 7-9p) no problem. The food is good, great for sharing, and the prices are really good. This place also has really good/trendy deco. Overall I really liked the place
author: Susan L.

description: One of my favorite stops for a late late dinner after the clubs!  The food is always good!  They have Thai Style Suki Yaki!  What's not to love about that since unless you're in Thailand, it's hard to find places that serves that.  The only drawback is the parking which is a b*tch.  That really has nothing to do with the food, so the stars remain!
author: Andrew N.

description: This is the perfect spot for some delicious Thai food and fairly hip crowd. I like the new decor, and the ever-changing menu. Tonight the service was a little slower than usual due to their being so busy, but the papaya salad was fresh and delicious, as was the seafood clay pot with rice. I swallowed the meal down with a thai iced tea, which was sweet and strong. The bathroom looked like it needed a good cleaning, but what can you do about that?
author: David G.

description: don't get me wrong, I love various branches of osha thai.  for their wonderful atmosphere and great food, however this particular branch does not compare.  I ordered the crab fried rice and the crab comes out burned.  the atmosphere is also lacking.
author: Sydney L.

description: Very mediocre Thai food.  Cheap, but very plain in taste and rough in cuts and seasoning.  And this one is not as cutely decorated as the one in SOMA, and in a sketchy neighborhood.  I do not plan on coming back any time soon.
author: Jiajia C.

description: Delicious take out!  Fried rice is great!  Seafood was pretty tasty too.  Reasonable prices make it a great place to grab lunch, there or to go.
author: Levi B.

description: This is my favorite Thai in the city because it is very reasonably priced and their food is delicious. I always get the fried tofu and the Pad See You. Come with a group and share several plates! The parking is pretty much non-existant in this part of town, but there are scattered garages in the area.
author: Lindsey G.

description: This spot is just like the Osha on 2nd St. but with less of a fancy decor and this one opens late. The feel of the place is liek a diner/cafe so its cool if you want to grab a quick bite. I usually get a noodle or a rice dish.
author: Roger Y.

description: I had a late lunch consisting of pork satay skewers and the papaya salad with salty crab. I usually hate papaya, but the salad came recommended by a friend, so I had to try it. To my surprise, it was DELISH! The skewers were also delicious, but nothing groundbreaking. After visiting their website, I'm surprised by how plain the decor of this location is. I know it's a more casual cafe, but a little more knick knacks here and there wouldn't hurt.
author: Christine N.

description: This Osha Thai is great because the food is spicy, quick, and cheap.. we had the green papaya salad, yellow chicken curry, and the garlic pepper beef and some singha beer to balance the spice.. i must warn you though, if you ask for your food to be really spicy you're in for some tongue s&m, the food will literally hurt soooo good... overall great place before or after hitting the bars.
author: Genevieve A.

description:
uhh, i think this is the location i went to.

but.

this is the best thai food at 1:30 a.m.

and the best leftover thai food at 1:30 p.m. the next day.

try the combination fried rice.  i was told this is the only location that they have it listed as a real item, and the other locations just make something up if you ask.

or maybe that was made up..
author: stefanie h.

description: I often call this place "that Thai place run by high schoolers" since the staff seems so young. I guess that means I am really old. It is open late with party music. I prefer nearby Thai House Express, which is pretty similar.
author: Amy E.

description:
what happened to the good ol days when there was only one osha? when regulars walked, the owners remembered your order, and sat you immediately. oh yes, new owners...
now, don't even bother to order anything vegetarian to go because there is a 50% chance there'll be some chicken sprinkled on top of it.

thai house express is my choice now.
author: Linda T.

description: I came here a number of times and ordered the same thing.  You have to try the spicy spaghetti...YUM!
author: Rose E.

description:
yummmmmm..............

what more can i say.

i first tried this place with one of my girls, actually enjoyed the dish i ordered. ever since...THE BEST THAI Spot in SF! they stay open really late and they make the food pretty fast. Only down  fall no delivery and limited parking nearby in a semi ghetto area (tenderloin/lower nob hill)  =(  but if you call in your order while youre on the way, you can usually get your food in about 10-15 minutes.

definitely an eattery for the late nighters after hitting a club, or a movie.
author: Tiffani L.

description: Oh, Osha Thai- how you disappoint me. The last 3 times I have visited your land and ordered my once beloved Pad Thai (without chicken) you have heaped on more sweet sauce than is usually found on a fried banana. I now have to rethink my Pad Thai needs and remind others that the Osha location in the Mission is free of such criticism. Wah.
author: Megan W.

description: Went here with some new acquaintences and we all ordered a dish a piece.  I ended up tasting seven different dishes.  The servers were very friendly and quick.  There was someone at my table that ended up drinking about 10 glasses of water!  The Pad Thai was subpar but everything else was pretty good.  Nothing here really made me go WOW that's fantastic so I'm giving it a 3 star rating.  For the price it was fantastic.  A table of 7, ordering 7 dishes the grand total was $10 a person.  That's including tip!  I would definitely go back.
author: Ken W.

description: Went back and finally had the courage to try NAKED PRAWNS (  raw prawns with a very spicy chili sauce) yum.....Still thinking about it.
author: thuy m.

description: this location is pretty good. the pad thai is right on. the angel wings are great. panang curry and pineapple salad was great too. the food is quite tasty and addictive. wonder if it's just that tasty or if the food has too much msg??
author: NY Y.

description: I enjoyed this place. After watching a concert at the Filmore I stopped by this place; it was after midnight and the place was just about full, but I was seated as soon as I entered.  All I had was the fried ice cream (coconut) but it was delicious! The out side shell reminded one of the taste of an apple fritter doughnut, that combined with the ice cream made for an almost unsurpassed dessert taste!!
author: mike c.

description: Mmm, pad see-ew! Good for late night snack. Aim for a booth!
author: G. J.

description:
i dont know what it is about this place...but it is the best thai food around. and the chill environment rocks my world. i dont like how swanky the other locations on valencia, union, and embarcadero center are..but the food is still good.
parking is a lil annoying around here, but never too bad to make us change our mind and go somewhere else! 
enough said.
author: Bee B.

description: Pad See Lew with duck, DELICIOUS.  get's too crowded get it to go and they jacked their prices up.  really good Thai one of the best in the city.
author: erik e.

description:
Best Thai Food ever!!!!! Yum.

I used to live a block away form this restaurant so every Friday night I will get together with my friends or family for a treat!

I usually order the Pad See You (spelling?) or Seafood with Chili Sauce over rice with Thai tea of course =) 

The price is pretty high but for good food it's fine with me!

Staffs are nice
Area is nice
this place is AWESOME!

FYI; it is usually pack on a Friday night so try to come early before 8pm or if not, learn to have patience =P
author: Jessica L.

description: so i got to try the one near the financial district off howard. The food was great as always. The decor and overall feel for this one is much better. It's way bigger, open and spacious. Large open windows and a bar/kitchen along one side.
author: Diana Elena B.

description: Pretty farking good, if I do say so myself. Service here was very accommodating and nice despite the fact that I came in like 5 minutes before close (sorry). The food was damn good too. I got my favorite thai dish, I think it's called pad gra prow or somethin like that. I just know that it's the spicy thai basil and peppers dish, this one was daaaamn good too, and to put the icing on the cake the guy made me it with sliced beef instead of ground how they normally do it! 4 stars well earned my friends!
author: Tommy P.

description: When we arrived here, the outside didn't have much going on and I was a little put off by the mismatched decor of the place. I didn't find the plastic bubble seats too appealing. When I started looking at what people inside had on their table, I began to look forward to my meal. Upon reading the menu, I found the prices to be a tad on the high side for Thai food consisting of a few veggies and one meat. $9 for an appetizer with 6 skinny prawns. The prawns were delicious though. We decided on the Pad Kee Mao?, Spicy Green Beans and the Pinapple Fried Rice as our main course. The food arrived quickly and was very good. The green beans were not what we expected due to them being short cut beans with a bit of sauce and not much spice. We are used to whole green beans with some flavor and heat being served when they are referred to as "SPICY" The rest of the food was delicious. Some of the best Thai noodles I have tried yet. Pinapple fried rice was really full of big chunks of pineapple, which I appreciate, due to other places serving Pina Rice with paltry Pina and mucho rice. It would have been at least a four star if prices were a tad more reasonable for portions of food served. Then again, it is the city and almost everything is priced high out here. For the money they are making per table on simple ingredient foods, maybe they should invest some of it back into better seating. The wood chairs look as if a Komodo dragon spent the evening scratching the laquer off the wood of the child sized seats.
author: Zac O.

description: Love this place! It has an amazing ambiance and the food is delicious! The salmon sashimi salad & papaya salad are my favorite! They are the perfect place to have a quiet lunch, but a busy social scene on the weekends. The food is well priced but adds up fast because you want to try everything. The food presentation is nice and the staff is good. The expirience as a whole makes it a place you must try!
author: J G.

description: This is a late night spot after some fun. It's cheap, fast, and good after some drinking. I usually stick with the regular pad see ew and chicken pad thai.
author: Da H.

description: Cheap Thai food for your late night munchies.
author: Daisy C.

description: At this point, I have been to this place a ton of times.  Great for a quick sit-down dinner.  The food is pretty good.  I am partial to the pineapple fried rice.  The soup is really spicy!  Watch out.
author: Joanna S.

description: We went here for a quick dinner a couple weeks ago.  The place was nearly full, but we got a booth right away, and food arrived very soon after we ordered.  The portions were large, and the food decent, but not spectacular.  Sort of salty.  We'll most likely sample the other Thai places in the area before returning here.
author: Suman G.

description:
what the? cheap? for this kind of food? no way. first, the yellow curry was loaded w/sugar...it was SOOO sweet! BLEH! the fried rice was so greasy that i couldnt even taste anything but the oil. had a chicken dish which was dry and some seafood dish which was also too sweet.

overall...i would never go back!
author: M L.

description: Yummy Thai food, reasonably priced, and conveniently located for a pre- or post-theater dinner.  I liked all the dishes I've tried here, and there were many.  Try the mango sticky rice if you still have room after the main meal.
author: Stacy L.

description: Cheap Thai food and a good atmosphere make this place one of my top favorite restaurants. For my date and I are meal with apprizer was under 25 which is hella cheap!  See ya there sometime!
author: Rob P.

description: The best Thai food in the city, Period. Open late, prices are reasonable,  and they play great dance music to boot!
author: Susan L.

description:
this place has nummy, affordable real late night eats.

note: good asian food if you're starving in the city late at night & it is definitely better than denny's

good luck getting parking!  one of the many times when carpooling is a very good idea.
author: Anita J.

description: Osha is a place I can go for brunch, dinner or late night hands down. No need to open the menu, I usually have crab fried rice, pad thai, papaya salad, spicy green beans, fried wontons and on occassions fried tofu or fried wontons. (of course with other people).
author: Marie G.

description: Love Thai food.  Okay, basically I love food, period.  But, here I have to say the food is average.  I'm not impressed.  I've had better.  I give it three stars because the waiters are nice and they stay open late on the weekends.  That's about it.
author: Magdalena ..

description: This is it peoples!  The one and only Osha Thai that should exist in San Fran!!!
author: Keika L.

description: I've been going here ever since I moved to Nob Hill years ago and haven't had a bad meal yet.  Noodle soups, Pad See You, Green Curry are all delicious.  Best 2 am meal place.  Best "I  don't wanna cook" place.  Best Thai food for under $10 plate.  Best Thai Iced Tea and Iced Coffee.  I've tried their newer restaurants on Union and 2nd St.  Just didnt taste as good and the prices were much more expensive.  This one on Geary had a facelift.  Kinda miss the old hole in the wall atmosphere.
author: Angelique B.

description: For late night Thai, I will drive over the bridge for this.  Fast, usually no wait, inexpensive and consistently good.
author: Jones D.

description: I've been to two of the locations.  The food isn't bad, but the portions are small.  It has a nice feel and I like the decorations, but I was expecting better food.  I still go because my friends all like the place.  It's also nice because it's open pretty late.
author: Peter W.

description:
food is fast, cheap, and decent.  of all of the osha's in sf, i think this one is the best in terms of price and quality.  of course i think there's better thai food in SF, but that's not the point of this review.

especially great about this place is that late night there isn't hardly ever a wait, and the service is fast.
author: Jason J.

description:
thai restaurant open til 3? SOLD!!!

roasted duck curry? or something like that. sooooooooo soooooo soooo good.

their sticky rice with mango has a bit too much coconut milk.. but it was good none the less, far better than many other places.

forgot what i had for appetizer but i do remember it being awesome. 

definitely recommend this spot.
author: Michael A.

description: This Osha is consistently good and the staff is very efficient and friendly.  I have been here a few times and had good experiences each time.  It's always lively and it's always open a bit later than the other restaurants when you want to/have to eat dinner after 11 on the weekend.
author: Rise G.

description: great place to meet up centrally, overall above average thai food but nothing memorable. good for a quick fix of your standard thai options (pad kee mow, vegetarian green curry, fried tofu etc) , they are accomodating other spots are with no fish sauce etc. service is spotty but nothing that was terrible.
author: sue c.

description:
among my favorite flavors, thai tastes are held close to my heart.

if you're reading reviews on yelp, chances are that you're looking not just for great food, but somewhere with good vibes to take a friend or someone special. 

upon entering, one of the first things that i noticed was that Osha's atmosphere is definitely not your average hole-in-the-wall thai goodness. its very mod, and pseudo-elegant with interior design that piques at color collections. if you're into indian-style seating they have platforms with cushions available, which is always good if you've got time to burn to kick back and chill with some drinks. 

the presentation is also pretty neat. we order a tuna/mango/avocado appetizer that looked too beautiful to eat (but we ate it. haha). definitely will impress and provide some good vibes for a date or something similar.

the food is priced affordably. dishes cost anywhere from $8-12 which is not bad for the seemingly upscale atmosphere. however, if you're used to eating at hole-in-the-walls, its not quite the same taste. dont get me wrong, osha tastes great, but its definitely not as heavy as some of the places i've been to. its more of a fusion-esque taste with smaller portions (ex: the tuna/avocado/mango dish).
author: brian p.

description:
Good consistent food at a good price. They are open late until 3pm so its great after a good night of dancing and drinking. The pineapple fried rice is a must!!

The decor always changes so the place looks great all the time. Service is not the best but the food makes up for and the service is quick, by far this is the best thai place to me so far....
author: muhdee h.

description: So there are multiple Osha's and I'm not sure if they all are as good as the one in the Tenderloin. I had the Pad See Ew and it was absolutely delicious. The menu here is fairly price and they give you a good portion! It seems like this location is probably the crummier of all the locations, but definitely still worthy of a date perhaps? Nice place to go after you have been bar-hopping all over SF.
author: Dave Y.

description: i've been here twice, once during the day when its not too busy and another time late night where there was a line outside the door. the food wasn't that great, but it wasn't something that i would make a note of. there are definitely better places for thai food around sf but if you want something that opens late, this is the place to be.
author: Gilbert G.

description: All I have to say is this is one of the best places to get great Thai food. And especially after the club , this place is open till 3 am.. lol thank u osha for all the late night food!!!
author: B G.

description: If you like your Thai food hot and I mean really hot this is a great place to go.  They also have mild stuff for those with a sensitive tongue.  Service is quick and menu is fairly large and varied.  Decent prices and located in the lovely Tendorloin.
author: Derek D.

description: Authentic Thai food that is done up cheap and quick, Osha is open late and tastes great.  My favorite dishes here are the Larb Gai, Som Tam, and Crab Fried Rice.
author: matthew w.

description: I think this is one of the best Thai restaurants in the city. Yes, it's in the hood, but it's worth it.  Great service by a bunch of young hip Thai-sters and more importantly fantastic food.  Try the larb, it's great.  Yes, they have a sister restaurant in the Mission, but it's just not as good as this one.
author: X Y.

description: Food is good, price is cheap and it's open til 3am. Need I say more?
author: melissa g.

description:
Oh yes Osha. This is the place. Not because it serves unbelievable Thai food - because it doesn't. It's the ambience of the border-line Tenderloin that does it for me.

Actually the only time that I go here is after a night out of hanging out, partying, or drinking. Usually Ruby Skye, Swig, Rye since they are close by. 

At 2AM, you can't beat a nice plate of Pad See You or Crab Fried Rice. The food itself is quite good for the price, but even better for given the hour that I'm eating it. 3 Stars for the food + 1 star for the ambience of the tendernob. Really I like seeing people in candid moments and the Tenderloin doesn't ever disappoint.
author: Larry F.

description:
the absolut best thai in san francisco. 
i just wish they were open till 2 every day not just the weekends.
nothing is better than osha at 2am after a long night of drinking!
author: Ryan B.

description:
osha on geary and leavenworth is definitely the speezy.

i can proudly say that i have been eating at this location since mid 1999, before they added the "downstairs" section (unngghh, take that pookie), and i have remained totally faithful, amidst all the fancy ones openning up for the yups outside the hood. thank God for their fried chicken over fried rice, as pad see ew can take its toll on the sensitive stomach. 

if i had to mention a downside, it would be that the waitors are all too anxious to get you out of your table, regardless of if it's even that busy or not.
author: Daniel C.

description: I love my thai food, and Osha has become a big favorite!    The pad thai is saucy, but their seafood dishes are excellent.  This please offiers a consistently good culinary experience  The curries are good too.
author: Kirk M.

description: Thia spicy pan fried noodles with tofu... so wonderful!  you just have to be very clear that you want it spicy, not by american standards... Thai Iced tea is always worth ordering and if you are in the mood to splurge try some coconut fried ice cream... delicious!!!
author: Joy C.

description: Inexpensive and delicious. "Cool" decor.  Try the pumpkin curry.
author: m t.

description: One of my local favorite Thai spots, especially since they're open late night. The crowd is quite lively too.... alot hip pretty Asians peeps. So, I stick with the crab fried rice and basil duck and never been failed since 99'. I haven't been to the new locations in the Mission or Downtown yet.
author: Peter Y.

description: Delish pad thai! Big chunks of tofu. Definitely cures my work hangovers!
author: Mokita s.

description:
I think most people dig the late hours, bustling. The place looks okay, clean (not super into the futuristic look)

Good
- duck noodle soup, mighty tasting good (although there's an instant noodle that has that flavor.. duck broth?).. the duck can be a bit fatty sometimes; I like egg noodle, my friend likes rice noodle
- pad seow
- cheaps

Okay
- fried chicken (hmm lotsa batter) over fried rice
- beef and veggie over rice, good flavors but the beef is tough, the veggies kinda bitter haha

Hmm No
- tom ka chicken soup (super coconutty)
author: xo x.

description:
I wish I could give 4.5 Stars...

Modern decor, plenty of seating, fast service, good food, and average prices make Osha an all around solid choice for Thai food. Check it out!
author: M. W.

description: What the hell is volcanic beef? It sounds like something that's going to give you a volcanic you-know-what, but tastes like pure goodness. I like the origional Geary location first because of the people who come here, and second, because all the other locations are pretentious as hell. (OK same thing, but whatever) And that's all I'm gonna say.
author: Adrienne F.

description:
Oh Osha, what has happened to you.

For two years I counted on you as my late night snack drunk food, quick and easy take out, and cheap pad-thai that I can have in under 5 minutes.

Until a couple weeks ago, when you changed your menu to be like your other locations.

WHY OSHA, WHY!?

Now instead of $7.54 (including tax) for a combination pad thai, with chicken, shrimp, and tofu, it's almost TEN DOLLARS, for pad thai with JUST tofu. If you want shrimp, it jumps to about $12.

I finally broke down and got it last night, and I have to say I was not impressed. It wasn't bad, but definitely worth the $10 I paid for it, especially considering that I was pay $2.50 less for the last two years.

So Osha, you have gone from 5 stars in my book, to 1. That's what you get for thinking you can charge Marina prices in a Tenderloin location.
author: Brian S.

description: I walked in recently and noticed the shrimp tom yum soup I always get had increased in price by 50% from the month before. Let's see with tax and tip that's $15 for a bowl of noodles in a hole in the wall Tenderloin spot. Goodbye, Osha Thai...
author: Nick C.

description: Osha is great,cheap place in SF for real quality Thai food. Don't miss their green papaya salad!It's out of this world!
author: Alokenanda L.

description: The food is great especially late night.  However, the staff need customer service training.  But I still go back for the food.
author: B A.

description:
It's good if you want fast Thai food. Other than that, when you go in it's like you interrupted the staff and act like you're bugging them. 

It's like you walk in and they rush to get you in and then out. Of course, there are so many Thai places now, the food is as overrated as sushi.
author: C C.

description: There are multiple Osha locations in the city, while this particular location may not offer the best menu, the taste is authentic, and the price is right.  This is a great place to go to satisfy your crave for thai food.  They open until 3am on Sundays!
author: K L.

description: Great food at fair prices. At 8:15 on a Saturday night, we had about a 15 minute wait for a party of two. (Caution: the tables by the doors are quite drafty.) For appetizers, the fried spring rolls and taro thingies were delicious. We had the spicy beef and the house duck curry, both of which were really tasty. All of that, with one Thai coffee came to $45, not including tip. Next I really want to try the crab noodles, green curry and pumpkin curry. Be very cautious of the bathroom, though, it's loaded with urban graffiti on the walls, doors, ceilings, toilet paper dispenser, soap dispenser, and paper towel dispenser. Really trashy.
author: Ice Cream Truck I.

description: This is the best Thai food we've had in the city.  The duck pad thai is to die for!!!  My boyfriend and I get reallllllly excited when we talk about the possibility of ordering this for dinner!   The one downside?  The service pretty much sucks!  You may or may not be acknowledged in the first 20 minutes after you sit down and they always bring out one person's food before the other's (we hate that) .....but, a simple solution, we just call in our order and get it to go.   Win-win, we get the best duck pad thai EVER and get to eat it on our comfy couch instead of hard wooden bench seats!
author: Erin M.

description: This is the best thai noodle house in the city.  Great for an inexpensive lunch, but you still get the taste and quality of the Osha restaurants.  The Pad Thai is  very tasty, on it's own, or with chicken or pork.  It's a bit of a hike if you're working downtown, but the well worth the walk into the Tenderloin
author: Maryann R.

description:
After loving the SOMA location we decided to try our neighborhood Osha but everything went terribly wrong: first they tried to give us our check after our appetizers, then the entrees came out wrong and tasteless, and to top it all off they charged the credit card $35 more than we owed. Never again!

Update: They refunded the $35 and gave us a $50 gift certificate (to be used only at this location) for the trouble= 2 more stars
author: JA C.

description:
pineapple fried rice and a thai ice tea!!!

it's the best
author: Sunny M.

description:
I'm taking away one star for their new attitude.  The more popular they get, the more pretentious they become. Sigh.  The food is good and the staff is mostly nice but since they started having to wear uniforms (all black??) they've become a little stuffier.  This is always my back-up restaurant of choice whether it be lunch on a work day, dinner any day, or as a post midnight snack.  

P.S. Their pan-fried noodles are the best.  And medium spicy is actually really spicy!

Can you handle it?
author: Del N.

description:
That photo up there is incorrect. That's the storefront for the Osha on Valencia! Grr. I hate mistakes even though I often make them. That doesn't mean anybody else should make them too. You should all be PERFECT...like Joss Whedon....

Anyways. I like this Osha better than the one on Valencia. Too bad they don't deliver to my place.  Sigh. Why do they have the same name anyways? They are like good cop bad cop - complete opposites!

Spicy spicy! Yum! Kinda dirty but what do you expect? It's the Tenderloin.
author: Tracy Y.

description:
the food is just alright. the only thing good about this place is that it's open till late and when i'm hungry at night, it's pretty satisfying. i think osha thai is highly overrated. they make thai as well as the chinese place across the street makes "the best burgers"

the osha thai in embarcadero is much better
author: Katherine F.

description: This has to be the best Osha Thai in the city. I was recommended to this place by some Thai friends. It's doesn't have the best atmosphere but the food is excellent and the prices are decent. I've been to some of the other Osha Thai restaurants but for the food you want to go here.
author: Sunny K.

description: Great spot. Pineapple fried rice..mmmmmm. open late for people who either work late or play late. Only downfalls are no parking and crowded as all hell.(so i had to take away a star)
author: Jonathan B.

description:
duck curry was waaay too sugary, tasted like dessert. 
fish cakes appetizer was uber yummy.
nuff said.
author: Dana D.

description: My fave thai place. I've loved everything I've tried here. Especially papaya salad (don't ever ask for med--it's spicy!!) and green curry fried rice. Have been eating here a long time and have to say the price increase and redecorations were not to my liking. The new table are so low you can't cross your legs! And they're hard and uncomfy. I want the old booths back!! Service can be slow too, but who cares when it's a good price, portion and yummy!
author: Heather K.

description: I been a fan of this place for a few years, the food is so good its worth the drive into the city from the east bay just to get dinner. highly recommend it. Prices are affordable and the quality is good.
author: Salvador O.

description: I'm from Thailand and this is my favorite thai restaurant in SF.  I love their no fuss atmosphere and speedy service.  Especially since this place opens late, I love coming here after midnight for a quick meal or dessert.  My favorite dish is the duck curry and rad na.  You've gotta try the coconut with fruit ice cream!
author: Amy T.

description: It's open late for after the late night drinking. Good food and fast service! 'nuf said....
author: Marc P.

description:
The best Osha of all the Osha chains.  I've been to several of the Osha chains and I say this place is the best.  The food comes out fast and it's good.  I think this Osha is better then the rest because it actually has taste.  The other ones are drenched with soy sauce and your practically paying double for what you can get here.  It's located in the Tenderloin, so becareful where you park.  Parking sucks around here.  Their noddle soups aren't the best, so I'd stay away from that.  Everything else is good.

Can get loud in here because the restaurants small.  The bathroom always seems to have grafitti on it.  They should install another bathroom because on a busy night I waited 10mins for the bathroom.  They open late on Weekend nights so come in when your drunk and need to sober up.

I would recommend this place.
author: K T.

description: There glows a beacon in the Tenderloin, where a campy exterior meets a warm and chic womb. This polished pebble amongst sand dirtied by pollution is OSHA Thai. The dark wood booths sacrifice total comfort for aesthetic which is often the case in the battle for visual appeal. Any sense of displeasure is eradicated as promptly as the service, both in waiter presence and food preparation. Through semi-broken English, an indication of significant authenticity, the waiter took our order and, like a successfully dieted Thai Santa Clause, double checked it. The food was delivered, minutely staggered, on white plates with artistic intent: a surprisingly pleasant presentation. The taste and quality of my Volcano Beef and her Spicy String Beans with Chicken matched the intriguing appearance. The meats were prepared with skill and were tender and tasty. Added to these were Aztec temples of rice that were sadly moldered over the course of the meal. A fair price of around $35 for two entrees, tea, a deceptively classy looking Sapporo, and leftovers. OSHA Thai is a good stop for lovers of Asian food and gleaming dish ware.
author: Sam V.

description:
Overrated and overpriced, if you like being treated like dirt by people who fetch noodles for people with real jobs then you will love this place

Worst service ever!
author: Adam L.

description: Five stars for nostalgia! I've been going to this place since '98, back when they had only one side of the restaurant. I can't remember how many girls I brought here late night throuh out all these years and brought home afterwards for something hot and spicy as well. MOOWAHAHA! But seriously, you guys need to check out the Naked Prawns, which is a plate  of RAW fresh prawns covered with layers of garlic, cilantro, and other sweet and tangy flavors. Did i say RAW? Yes I did, but DAMN its so soo so damn good! And their Thai Ice Tea is always perfect, sweet but not to0 sweet, and with a nice tall glass, not like those small tiny ass glasses that you get at other Thai places.
author: Run Sing M.

description: My friends dragged me here.  Seems to be the ultra trendy place to be.  I am no slob but I am not a Metrosexual.  I just did not fit into the scenery really well.  Food sucked.  Lot of rude people.  Just give me a small out of the way place with good food.  Not a trendy pickup joint.  Sure it is what lot of people are looking for in SF.  How things have changed.
author: mike p.

description:
Decent food, but I don't think I will be going back, if only for the reason that they are the only folks open so late, and down the street from the apt.  The seats aren't too comfortable and the decor strikes me as being kind of awkward.  The service was all right.  

I've eaten there twice, but I suppose I might give it one more try..
author: John C.

description:
sweet memories - first place in the city I went to with my boy friend...
simple decoration and nice food...
author: saroj y.

description: The original Osha... open late (very late!) and food arrives FAST.  In fact, we call it fast-food Thai.  For taste of the food, I prefer the nearby Thai Stick on Jones/Post... but Osha is a fun quick meal.  Note: this Osha doesn't have the swanky decor that all the newer Oshas offer!  It's in the Tenderloin, after all!
author: Kimberly M.

description: Osha, Osha, Osha! I have to admit, I'm no Thai food connoisseur...but the food here is damn good! Before I started coming here, I felt pretty indifferent about Thai food generally speaking but now I find myself frequently craving it! Bonus points for that fact that it's a just a block away from my pad and more bonus points for the fact that it's open late. One of my favorites here is the volcanic beef. I always order it "very spicy" but it never strikes my taste buds with enough heat. A new plate I tried is the crab fried rice -- I was definitely pleasantly surprised because I could actually taste the crab! My go-to dish is the duck pad see ew. I've never had pad see ew before in my life and I fell in love with it as soon as I tasted it. I've never had any of the other meats but the duck is so good I can't help but order it every single time. One thing they could do without here are those ugly white plastic chairs...other than that, I think I'm falling in love with you, Osha.
author: Novi M.

description: Great thai curries, their tom ka soup is delicious, their praram is swimming with peanut sauce. The downside? it's ALWAYS packed in here (except at 11am when they open.) The service is good but they're always super busy and won't smile or be particularly warm to you. If you're like me, you find the 10 minute intro speech at corporate chain restaurants much more annoying. Still, I recommend them as a great take-out spot more than anything.
