author: Mollie A.

description:
The best of all of the Osha locations. Excellent prices, greedy portions, open late, very clean. The wait staff essentially forgets about you once you sit down, but with thai this nice, I can easily overlook this. 

To be honest, I wouldn't even recommend the other Osha locations. They are pretentious, crowded in the worst way, expensive, and poorly portioned.

Osha on Leavenworth and Geary is easily my favorite thai in the city. This includes Chili Cha Cha.
author: Kelli T.

description:
I used to go to the original on Geary 
it was a dumpy place with excellent food . Now its a nice place with dumpy food and dumpy service
author: roger d.

description: A little bit pricey and I had to wait awhile before we got seated...during lunch time it can get busy. Delicious food though.
author: Melissa D.

description:
a little above my minimum wage price point, but i will do just about anything for a red head. so it was well worth the interest now building on my credit card. cocktails are delish, the pomtini wasnt quite pommish enough for me, but it did the trick. plus, after a few of those, you can't taste much any how. the lychee martini was by far the most delicious but, be careful, it tastes like candy and it can sneak up on you.
the food was amazing. i love seafood and if i didn't, i dont know that i woudl be as enthusiastic about the menu. the chicken curry something was good, but lackluster. the chicken and beef dishes, while pretty, did not measure up to my incredibly high thai food standards. but enough about the turf, the surf is where it's at:
two words: tuna tower.
i was in love from the moment we met, tuna tower, and now you're all i think about. served with crispy deliciousness.
the shrimp dishes were excellent, perfectly cooked, and tasty. 
coconut juice was yummy and good for the kids or for adults who want something non-alcoholic, plus it comes straight out of the coconut!!
good for a nice date, or a rowdy, mish mash, hodgepodge group of young native san franciscans. 
over all, a crazy, booze-filled, scrumptious evening.
author: Monica M.

description: Excellent cheap Thai food. Expect a wait if you go prime time Fri/Sat. Love that it is open so late. I thought the green curry was excellent, loved the Osha pan fried noodles although I wish there had been a few more noodles in the dish. The fried taro appetizer was also very good; crispy and not too salty with the contrasting soft texture of the taro inside. Papaya salad was crunchy and tangy. Parking is a nightmare, although so is the 38.
author: Liboo K.

description:
it's kinda hard to find parking for this place !
unless you get lucky ....
might have to circle around the block a couple of times :(
But the Thai Fried Rice is really Good 
and for desert --- Fried Banana's with ice cream - Yum
Really Good combination  
and to wash it all down ---- Thai Ice Tea ! 
which looks like Carrot Juice to me ... Orange color to it 
i wonder what makes thai tea that color ?
author: Roy L.

description: The food is greasy and the staff has a bad attitude. Their Chicken Tom Yum Noodle Soup is pretty good. I ate at their other locations, much better than this one. Seriously, what is up with the mean looking girl at the counter? Smile.
author: Chris B.

description: I went to osha late last night and was really impressed - the food is great: a Thai friend of mine was impressed with the menu and suggested dishes to us that we all liked - i tried the crab fried rice, which was great.  The service was good - water glasses were refilled quickly, which is my test. And I should probably mention that while it's clearly a perfect place to go after a night of bar hopping, the food's good even if you're sober (as we were, late on a friday night of all times)
author: Joe S.

description:
good for a place that serves late at night. 
it saved me from my hunger!
i like the coconut soup, in particular!
author: sarah m.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place.  I've tried a few different meals and they've all been delicious, but I usually stick to the tried and true: my favorite pad thai in the city and curry puffs to start.  It's usually crowded, usually loud, you're never really sure who your waiter is, but the food is fresh, hot, fast, and affordable.
author: Amy L.

description:
too bad that the food doesn't match the look of this place and the convenience of the location. it's not the taste but the cleanliness of it.
 out of 5 visits over 2 years i got sick twice! and i'm not a sissy regarding food hygiene....
just go around the corner and look at the ventilation opening of the kitchen..... 
 i guess all the effort goes into the other 2 locations.
author: bmwcafe c.

description: The food here is always great! When I used to eat chicken and beef my meals were delicious and now thats its tofu its still just as tasty :) The decor, seating(hard benches?) and size of the place kinda suck. But the food and prices more than make up for that. Plus its open pretty late.
author: Elise D.

description: This is a great place for delicious Thai food even late at night. When nothing else is open this place will still be packed with people until the wee hours of the night. This food tastes authentic and with a great punch of flavor. The downfall is that it is crowded almost all of the time and that there is normally a decent wait for a table. The servers are pretty quick with the orders and are nice. They are normally bustling around serving tables. It is not a romantic setting, but a great casual place to relax with great food and even better company.
author: Mary D.

description: The food is extremely well prepared here.  I like that I don't have to wait for a line and that the prices are cheap for the quality of food that the serve.  Just be wear if you are not prepared to eat spicy food don't ask for the dish to be really spicy because the first time I went here I was crying halfway though my meal!!
author: Jacqueline F.

description: It's been a year since I haven't been but all decoration and wooden tables are all the same. The prices are just up!!, a dollar more last time but same potions and presentation for the food is clean, nice A+. Their special Crab Fried Rice is the best of all, also squid salad as well good appetite:)). Like most people write about this, open late night is so so awlsome. But last time, I kind of disappointment about their rice. We ordered side of steam rice for my gal friend and came out hard (looks like leftover rice). It doesn't look like jasmine, really bad quality one. I understand that u need to overnight to make fried rice but u have to serve good quality one to customer. She didn't even finish her food becuz of that. Not only hers, I check others whose order steam rice couldn't finish either. The bottom line is as of high quality food and good reputation, needs to check these matter for sake. Dining service is average and hope to see more improvement in future.
author: Daniel D.

description: i tried this place again after a fun night of clubbing and the waiter wasn't such a jerk this time. food was delicious and the portions seemed to have grown. still not one of my favorite thai places but not bad.
author: Jenna N.

description: Great Thai food! Loved it and the relaxed atmosphere. Will definitely be back and am hoping they deliver...
author: Sara B.

description: Late night munchies?  Go to Osha on Geary.  Fantastic.
author: Dev K.

description: I love this place! yummy Food, yummy yummy food... great service and the atmosphere is awesome! Just asking whats good and the servicer will help you. We ordered some curry that was out of this world. Brown rice and Pad See  Ew.... it was all fastastic! LOVE IT!
author: M E.

description:
Great, fast, cheap food in the wee hours of the morning! The original is the best and not as expensive. The place is usually busy at night, but it's well worth the wait. Usually it doesn't take longer that 15min for a table to free up. You can listen to the house music thumping while you grub on some thai food. Service is excellent. 

The bathroom is pitiful. It's in the 'loin so the neighborhood isn't the safest. There also is very little parking.
author: FU Y.

description: I surprisingly had a bad experience with this place. The waiter was very rude and spoke very rudely with me. I being an Indian, felt discriminated in some places. But at an Asian place, this was the first time an asian waiter treated me this bad. He was very rude with me and my friends. i dont want to go this place again. Maybe others are good, I dont know, but this guy was very mean and nasty to us. Nobody even bothered to fill our water or drinks or even ask us for anything more. I am very disgusted.
author: Anish K.

description: Just moved to the neighborhood & I love this Thai place!  yum!
author: Melissa S.

description: I've been to this place several times with friends during late night drinking and after clubs, as it is open till 3am during the weekend.  And I must say, if you can make your way in, hands down this place is a refuge! Being that this place is open late and has the quality level it is, be prepared for this place to be packed. So if it's not obvious already, later in the night, this place is not quite fit for family dining.  The ambiance is loud as it is often full of a lot of people from the local bars or clubs.  The food here is fantastic, with a wide array of dishes, not to mention the fresh ingredients and fare prices.  It really doesn't surprise me that people come to this place from outside the city to partake in this San Francisco delight.
author: Erik P.

description:
The food here makes my stomach happy.  The girlfriend and I find ourselves coming here at least twice a month.  The service is pretty fast considering how busy they are and the food....D E L I C I O U S.  The pad thai even tastes great re-heated the next day.  

They have several location as well but this is more casual dining here.  I highly suggest the duck curry here.  The morsels of ducks are flavorful and the curry packs just enough heat to tease you but not so bad that you'll be sweating buckets or your tongue losing it's taste buds.

Ahhh...all this writing about Osha makes me want some for dinner now.
author: Michael R.

description: this is some good ass Thai!! My woman took me here when I was up in SF recently and it was damn Delish,  the vibe & price are right. no frills, good thai. if your in the area and craving for some tasty Thai cuisine, do yourself a fav.
author: Felipe Giovanni I.

description: Inexpensive, fast, delicious, consistently great. One of the first restaurants I ate at in San Francisco upon moving there, and now the last. The service is no fuss and all business...you sit down, you get your drinks, silverware, your order is taken and finally brought steaming and tasty to your table. The ambiance here is like the food: sleek, unassuming.
author: Justabroad A.

description: Pad Se Ew was delicious and had lots of fresh, crunchy vegetables in it.  The lady who helped us was beyond sweet and helpful - great service for a takeout order!
author: JC G.

description: one of my favorites for late night memories and noodles in gravy
author: Josie M.

description: this place has OK food. 2.5 stars. it's better for late night if you are drunk and starving. the last time i went here, i was sober and got thai fried rice... and it was not very good at all. the food is served amazingly fast and most of the dishes are decent. i would save this place for late night though and go to a better place for dinner.
author: Geoff B.

description: Sorry 0 stars outta 5 for this joint based on my LAST time there!! (but darn I had to put atleast one for the review to post--someone needs to change that!!) This USED to be my all time Favorite Thai place (great food, great prices all around good and FAST service but...)...until the last time I set foot in there. I'd been coming in for about 7- 8 years and the last time I was in there I was treated like a criminal!!! It was the strangest thing to have my waiter lurk around while I ate...literally stand around and watch me!! Like I was going to do a "dine & dash" or something. It was the most unpleasant feeling ever. Also it was cold that afternoon and in the second section (they expanded a few years ago) there is an exit that always stays locked but it has a small window above the door (i forget the name for them) and I had asked that it be shut because there was a terrible draft coming in right to where I was sitting. They begrudeonly shut it, but half way through my spicy string beans and chicken dish they opened it up again. How rude!! it wasn't even hot and it wasn't busy either (sometimes the place is packed) and I can appreciate it--if it's stuffy or hot but it was neither. I ordered dessert, the Mango with sticky rice and I never tasted anything so gross! They apparently used the same knife for onions as they did for the mango and it tasted as so--YUCK!!! I left it uneatten. I think the waiter caught on to my dissatisfaction and offered a lame comment like "sorry we are changing shifts" or something to that effect...I guess his whole reason for lurking was to get me to move along...it worked... I moved along alright, right out the door never to return again. Don't say I didn't warn you!!
author: Mira L.

description: i got a bowl of noodle soup here and it was hotter than the fucking sun.  its my own fault for haughtily disregarding the waiter's warning.  and even though i got the wrong soup (full of seafood, which i am not all that into) i tried my best to finish it because it was damn tasty.  i couldn't make it, too hot.
author: Markus B.

description: this place is yummy & cheap. from what i hear, it's a little less "fancy" than all the other osha locations, but it's the o.g. of em all. it's located on geary and parking can be a pain at times. the place is always packed, but the waiting time isn't too bad. service is okay as it can sometimes take a while for them to take your order. but besides that, the food is great. the tom yum soups are good. only problem of ordering soup is that it only fills you up for a couple hours. other recommendations would be their fried rice dishes. they have 3 levels of spiciness - mild, medium, and hot. because my tolerance for hot food has gone down considerably, the mild is still pretty spicy. good place to eat in sf if you're up late. plus there's some cuties ;)
author: Darren W.

description: The only reason I am giving it five stars, it's because the food is SO good and it comes in great portions.  Oh yeah, and it's always open hella late.  So, in other words, if you are one of them folks that likes to get their money's worth, this is the place, you'll get good food and a good helping of it... but not only that, you'll get a little something @ no charge.  What is it?  You'll get a complimentary BOWL OF ATTITUDE server to you steaming-hot from an arrogant waiter who doesn't give a rat's ass if you are enjoying your meal or not, and sometimes, depending on what time of the month it is, you may not even get a water refill.  I've promised not to return every single time that I've visited, but the Vegetarian Pud Thai and the Green Curry Fried Rice keep me coming back.   I only wish the walls were as colorful as they used to be back in 2003; or that the waiters had as a pleasant an attitude as the walls.  :)
author: Inked I.

description: i ordered this silver noodle dish. my god it was very salty.  I also asked them to make it extra spicy for the tom yum soup,. it wasn't spicy at all. food was below average and the price was more than average. i will never go back to this place again.  oh yeah. customer service is bad too.
author: Tracy L.

description: YUM YUM YUM! I've never had a bad dish here, the lamb, the chicken noodle soup, the pad thai, spicy beef, and papaya salad!! yum! and their service is great, the food always comes out fast! i don't really like thai food, but i've been coming here for years because their food is great!! It's way better than the one at embarcadero too!
author: Esther Y.

description: this is one of those late night staples after a crazy night of partying.  crab fried rice.... mmm.... the best when slightly buzzed.  if you danced all night and would like to reward yourself with fried chicken + fried rice, go for it. it's yummilicious to the max.  ordinary thai food with late night options is worth 4 stars in my book.  parking horrendous.
author: Peggy W.

description: $10 for coconut soup with prawns?  give me roast duck wonton mein any day.
author: Pickle R.

description: mmm...nothing beats hot soup on a cold day during the foggy sf summer.  the tom yum rice noodle soup w/ prawns sure hits the spot.  my hunan/szechwan background means i can take a lot of heat, and when i asked for the soup spicy, i was not disappointed.
author: Helen T.

description: nothing better than spicy, yummy eggplant chicken, pad thai, deep fried tofu appetizer, and thai iced tea after a long night drinking and dancing at the club. you get your food pretty quickly even when busy and they have large tables to accomodate your whole drunken crew.
author: Brokester C.

description: even though osha is a chain and osha is kind of trendy, their food is surprisingly very good. i always order pad thai and the fried rice. it seems like they get the texture of the noodles and the rice just right. they're open late night which is great after a long night of drinking and it beats getting some jack in the crack, but don't get me wrong jack in the crack is pretty awesome too.
author: Chris O.

description: I orderd the Volcano beef dish and it served with rice. The beef texture is so tough and hard to chew and we  notified the server and mgr. They did not provide any explanation and they dont seem to care. ( i was very polite) I returned the order to them and we ordered another dish. we were charged full price for both dishes and No apology at all . To the owner of this establishment, your staff needs some basis restaurant 101 training.
author: eric t.

description: I don't get the hype. Is it because this place is open late? Shit, 7-11 is open late too, but that doesn't mean their food tastes good--although a case can possibly be made for the nachos. I've eaten here at least three times, and every time was pretty bad... Anyway, I used to walk past this place every morning when I worked in Nob Hill, and almost every morning, they had a ton of food/ingredients sitting out on the tables. Ugh, that always struck me as gross as all hell. Thai House Express is much, much better.
author: lex c.

description: Pretty much as good as it gets in the way of cheap Thai in San Francisco (at least that I've come across). They're open really late, and have killer curries and amazing vegetarian options (pretty much on the menu can be meat-free).
author: Mollee P.

description:
great place to eat at 3am! 

....or b4 then cause thats when they kick u out. actually, they were shoving the bill in our face at about 2:30.... kinda RUDE, but there were loads of ppl there so perhaps they were trying to preempt the really hard time they will have at closing.  

the service is mehh... i was here for lunch w/ a party of 5 and charged us that GRATUITY in the bill, which i also didnt appreciate.

but i still give it points cause the food is good and the price is right. not to mention it's one of the few place open for after clubbing grub. decor is nice too, has the appearance of cleanliness...

the PAD THAI hasn't failed me here.  the PAD SEE EW is loaded w/ veggies, the way i like it, but a bit on the greasy side. the something something (forgot) FRIED RICE is good too.  the PAPAYA SALAD was voluminous.  

all in all, i'd be willing to deal w/ the service to eat here again.
author: Christina L.

description: Service is fast, food is inexpensive and great here, but the ambience is so-so.  Its open really late, until 3am on weekends and 1am other days.
author: A A.

description:
TERRIBLE, TERRIBLE, TERRIBLE!
Osha was my favorite restaurant 6 years ago when I used to live in The Bay Area. I always brought my parents there when they came to visit us from out of town.  My Dad loved it!  Now I live in Seattle and I arranged to come to San Francisco again with my parents for leisure and we all looked forward to going back to Osha today for lunch.  I went around the block many times and had a hard time looking for a parking.  Finally, I found a spot and went inside Osha and asked the staff to give me some change for the parking meter.  They exchanged 4 quarters but it was only good for 40 mins.  We waited a looooooooong time for them to take our order.  They were not busy but the staff were cleaning tables instead of taking our order.  Since our parking meter was running our of time and we haven't order yet, I asked the staff if they could exchange me more quarters since we don't want to rush our lunch.  The staff said that they have no more quarters and told me to go across the street to the cigarette place to get change.  I believed the guy but it was impossible and not safe for me to go to the cigarette place with my 6yr old and my 1 yr old daughters, so we decided that we have to eat our lunch very fast.  We were looking forward for dessert but didn't have time.  They NEVER served us water and never came to asked if we need anything.  When I went to pay the bill, I noticed that their cash register was FULL of quarters and the bottom of their fish bowl dish where they put their tips also had a lot of quarters.  If they don't provide parking to their customers, they should at least help that their customers park their cars safe.  They had no consideration and they were basically LYING because they didn't want to exchange me some quarters.  I was patronizing their restaurant and they should at least ensure that we have time to enjoy our meal.  That should also be part of the service.  The food was not better than other places I tried since I left The Bay Area and the washroom was disgusting!  This restaurant has grown so fast and expanded so much that they have developed an attitude.  I would NEVER recommend this place to anybody and I'm sure that there are lots of better places where the staffs are friendlier and appreciate our business.
author: A C.

description: This is the best Thai restaurant in town for me: I eat there at least once a week and I have tried a lot of the things in the menu: everything is good and I was never able to find better anywhere else. Also, prices are average, the service is extra-fast, the presentation in white dishes excellent and you still can be served past 11PM, maybe later on week-ends.
author: laurent m.

description:
so i came here with the expectation of eating the "best Thai food EVER".. i was told "you haven't had Thai food until you've eaten at Osha." - eh.. the food isn't why i gave them the 4 stars. the food itself probably deserves a 3. i've had my share of Thai food, maybe i'm just not that into it... 
since there are 212 reviews (and counting) for this specific location... i'll get into 2 things worth mentioning:
-the restroom is NASTY... but in a cool kinda way... well, not really.  i know that people go to osha's after drinking/partying etc, but damn.. does the floor really have to have a bunch of black puddles and paper everywhere? the restroom is one thing that really gets me when it comes to eating out... too bad i went to wash my hands before we started eating..
-BUT.. there IS a reason for me to come back and the what brought the stars back to a 4... dude, the ice tea... the Thai ice tea.. I seriously have to say that they have the BESTEST ice tea that i've ever had. i'm not one to really indulge in something even if i really really really really like it... but i had a couple at the restaurant and left with one to-go. i'll be back for more too.... i'm actually thirsty right now.
author: Anthony S.

description: yummy. fast. cheap. pad thai + thai iced coffee: totally not adventurous, but delish comfort food.
author: Jacqui M.

description: So, I'm guessing this is supposed to be the same Osha as in the Mission or SOMA, but this one is a little different than the others. Mostly cuz it's in the TL, which means you get bums asking for money every 5 seconds while you wait for your table outside- "Friday night, help me out with some change?"- gets a little old after 20 minutes. But I guess that doesn't really matter cuz the food is worth it. The interior is indicative of a TL restaurant as well- no frills or atmosphere to speak of- hard, wooden booth or flimsy plastic chair- your choice. But again, the food is good, so who really cares. We saw this fat lady eat it on her way into the bathroom. There was gnar-gnar water all over the floor (from the previous flusher, i'm guessing). Gross. But so what, the food is good. At the table next to us, this girl had passed out mid-meal and had her head in her BFs lap while he ate and conversed loudly with his annoying friends as if nothing was out of the ordinary. But, you guessed it, who cares, the food is good. I guess what I'm saying is this: you want atmosphere, there are two nicer Osha's in the city. You want some extra TL flavor, this is the place for you. Either way, the food is good.
author: Billy L.

description:
to start this quaint review, this osha slam dances tarantula style over all of the others, especially the newer one in glen park.

staff is a little impersonal, but i am let to believe its because they  food within 5 minutes of placing your order. oh, and the food is 99/100 times a hit. for the food, speedy service, late hours, and price, i cannot recommend better thai restaurant in the city.
author: Dayman D.

description: this place is off the hook! the neighborhood isn't the best, and there are few decorations, but you don't come here for all the above. you come here because it's open super late on weekends (good for drunken munchies), the food is good and cheaper than the other locations, and it's always bustling. not all the dishes are good, i would recommend the noodle soups and rice dishes.
author: Andy P.

description: It been few months I try Osha Thai. What a disappointment it was. They used to be the best fry rice in town. The rice is too soggy and with no taste or flavor to it. We needed to add alot of Fish sauce to make it  eatable.  For my friend Pineapple Shrimp fry rice only got 2 shrimp on it. And the price increass 30%.
author: jason C.

description: This place is top notch at 2am after crawling out of the local bars or clubs. Overall I am please with the soups. It does get packed and I enjoy slurping the soups while watching others pass out into their soups. LOL it is classic viewing. I will have to give it 4 stars cause the food is above the avg spots, but I wish I could rate it 3 1/2 but oh well the extra bump goes out to you for staying open so damn late.
author: Jay D.

description: So my friends & I came here for some Thai food, & looking outside with the crowd, I thought it would be pretty good . We got seated & started looking at the menu . From a previous review I read here, there's gratuity charge for 6 people or more . ( We had 5 ) We waited for SO LONG for the damn waiter to come & take our order . Holy crap, that was the longest 20 minutes of my life . After we ordered, my food came first . I ordered the Green Curry with Chicken over Rice . First thought that came to my mind was, "Wow, pretty f*cking small . Cheap asses !" The taste was aright . It wasn't the best curry I've had in my life . Their Osha Spaghetti, however, was pretty good . My boyfriend had the Pad Thai & the noodles weren't really done yet . Anyway, then the bill came & there was a gratuity charge . In no way did they deserve 18% tips . -___-" Also, their bathroom is horrible . YUCK ! All in all, this Osha is alright, but I probably wouldn't come back again .
author: Jenny Y.

description: open late, thats fantastic! spicy stuff that goes in hot and leaves just as scorching, well, not so fantastic, but the trade off is fantastic! thai food, fantastic! quick togo orders, fantastic! grubbing food, especially when youre drunk, inebriatedly fantastic! frou frou decor and table settings, not so fantastic, but what the hey, im just a hoser! ah fuck it, this place is fantastic!
author: Darrell L.

description: v rude service. always. if you don't mind that, the pad thai is pretty good.
author: tulipa L.

description: I was at this place last night for the 2nd time...good place, the friend lamb ribs are CRAZYlicious...my mouth's watering just thinking about them. I have a love/hate thing with lamb, but this dish is bomb. Not impressed with their minced basil chicken, so we skipped it...the red curry (beef) plate was good, the "BBQ" chicken is sorta bland--just grilled chicken served with sweet spice sauce. We had a dish with stir fried seafood which was really good. Service is decent, good music in there, prices are fair & parking for a Sat nite was nice and easy, found a spot first pass.
author: Steve K.

description: Osha Fried Rice, Crab Fried Rice or Pineapple Fried Rice all Medium Spicy. Awesome!
author: J N.

description:
it really breaks my heart to write a less than glowing review of the tenderloin osha thai.  this used to be my favorite quick fix, cheap, eat on the run late night bite restaurant in the whole city.  if you came here 4 years ago, you would agree with my thai friends that this was the best thai food in the city.  

now, 2 makeovers and 2 menus later, the food is mediocre at best.  less flavorful, less fresh, pricier and at the end of the day, no where close to what it was in 2005.  believe me, it really was that much better.  if anyone knows of another thai restaurant that could match osha thai circa 2005, please let me know.
author: Christian T.

description: Went to the 2nd street location after work with a friend I hadn't seen for a while.  We expected to talk.  When we heard the noise level, we would have left if there had been a suitable place nearby.  The restaurant started pushing drinks and appetizers before we got our jackets off and continued throughout our meal.  I ordered a dish with spaghetti and duck, which would have been OK except for one thing - the duck.  The very small amount of meat was freezer-burned.  There was lots of tough, soggy skin and fat - one piece as big as a cell phone.  They started clearing dishes before we'd finished eating.  When the after work crowd thinned out and the noise level went down, they turned up the music.  This is mostly a fancy-drinks-after-work place.  The food is OK but nothing special.
author: Carl L.

description: i still love every dish i have had here. this place is open til 1am on weeknights. i brought my gf from singapore, who was craving for good thai food here....and the food was great. the spicyness level of the food is authentic.. but please keep in mind this is a little hole in the wall...the service/ambiance is not the best.
author: C M.

description:
when it gets late, it's a pain the ass to get a table in here, especially with all the drunks.

i prefer to go here for dinner around 7 or 8. the crowd is thin and the service is just as quick.

the food is always good except when i ask for spicy and they actually bring it. then i prove myself to be a sad man.

the point- good food, quick service, lots of drunks.
author: Saikat P.

description: The food is good, the portions are generous, and once you order your dishes are served fast.  The place can get crowded so be prepared to wait for a table if you hit it at a busy time.
author: Roy L.

description: I guess Osha has branched out all over the city now.   I just paid a visit to the one on Second street recently.  The Geary location seems to be the only one that matters in my life.  It's the one I frequently visit to dine in or just get take out when I'm headed cross town.  I have spent many an evening enjoying the atmosphere and taste of Osha with some of my theater friends while studying  and living in the area.  My favs are the Pineapple Fried Rice and Pad Thai see eew ( I know I spelled it wrong).   I've sampled many other dishes as well and I have to say that I have never tasted anything that did not have a knock out flavor to it.  The vibe in this place is also important to the dining experience.  It seems to always be teaming the young artful energy of the Tenderloin and Theater District.  House Music or Electronica playing just loud enough and CNN on mute on the big screen behind the register.   If you are in the area for entertainment, opt to check out Osha, if not Thai Stick just a couple blocks away.
author: Brad C.

description: this is the spot after the club! ive been to the other osha and people say that this osha is better but i cant compare, it both tastes the same to me. and the one on valencia never gets busy while this one you have a wait! crab fried rice is a must!!!
author: emily p.

description: Once in while, we suburban go out to the city look for something interesting, young & hip place to eat.  This time we check out Osha on 2nd.  It's contempoary, it's dark, it has young crowd.  It certainly gave me the "in the city" feel.  The food is Thai fusion.  Our goal is to make sure we didn't order anything that taste aweful, we are not looking for traditional or authentic Thai taste.   And we weren't disappointed and let's just leave it at that.  Papaya salad (Som Dum) were not really taste like the real som dum, nevertheless it remain quite refreshing.  Tung Yum Gon was far from spicy or has enough kick to it but it was still a decent spicy sour soup.  The fish cake probably taste closest to the fish cake you do get in Bangkok.   Then there are lamb and sea bass while taste good but nothing Thai about it.   Their late hours on the weekend I am sure gets interesting after 11pm but I would never know.  Come here for decent food and dress hip to see and be seen !
author: CAScuba Y.

description: I don't get it... why does everyone give this place such high reviews?  The food here is incredibly mediocre.  And where the hell do you have to go to find rude Thai wait staff?   Other than a few surly BKK tuk tuk drivers who had the temperament of a soi dog I've never even met a rude Thai outside of this restaurant.  This place was once wonderful (like 10 years ago) when it was a tiny little dive catering to a mostly Thai clientel.
author: Bob D.

description: Scrumptious, fast and cheap. Perfect for a weeknight meal. If you have any craving for Thai, this is the place to go.
author: T D.

description: i love this place. only a couple of blocks from my place. it's open late too; however, i've never eaten here late - but it's nice to know i have that option. i usually get take out (i've only eaten in the restaurant a handful of times). i only give it 4 stars because i haven't tried many items on the menu. however, what i have tried has been awesome. the yellow curry chicken is amazing. it's spiced just right and they put just the right amount of coconut milk to give it that savoury sweet taste. i've also had the pad thai - which was also good, but it's hard to "f" up pad thai. also try the fried wontons as an appetizer ... delicious! there was a time where i'd get take out from here at least once a week. i got a little burned out on it ... but i'm gearing up to return soon. enjoy!
author: James J.

description: I think the possibility existed here to have a truly great meal, but it didn't come together for myself or my fellow foodies on this particular evening.  All three folks in my party had heard good things about this place, so I was excited as we made our way there after a show. Not too often you hear of a thai place being open until three o'clock in the morning, but this place was pretty hopping. First impressions were that the staff seemed cranky at best, the benches were terribly uncomfortable and that they we'd be subjected to some horrible run of the mill dance-y pop music for our meal. The menu was varied and of a good size, but there was little decision as I ordered my standard tom ka gai and panang curry with thai iced tea. The tom ka gai was well put together, nice mushrooms and the chicken was still tender. A little annoying here that I had to order a nine dollar pot for the table and couldn't get an individual appetizer-style order, but I rolled with it. My table-mates felt the soup was too spicy, but I thought it wasn't overpowering. I like spicy food, and so when they'd inquired as to the appropriate heat for my curry dish I went with "hot" as my reply. I regret that now, because the chile flavor was so overpowering that the dish was essentially ruined- and the same fate befell my friend's green curried rice plate. As someone who cooks for other people on the regular I feel like that's a pretty big boo boo. We packed them to go after accepting that they were simply too hot, hopeful that once refrigerated we'd be able to handle them better. I just polished my leftovers and found it still wasn't entirely enjoyable because the heat overwhelmed the other flavors I'm looking for in a curry. So ten dollars for a dish that could essentially be replicated by dumping too much hot sauce on white rice. In spite of this and the uncomfortable seating I'd still put this place on some sort of list for latenight post-concert eating- beats jack in the box. I'd have to go back and have another quasi-crappy experience to fully rule this place out, at least. But the quest for a fantastic thai meal continues....
author: Greycella L.

description: open late night with decent thai.  despite the other reviews, i actually enjoy the service at osha b/c it's no nonsense.  they take your order and less than 5 minutes later, they'll bring it over.  my friends and i think the place is run by the thai mafia and they insist on playing that insane techno music in there to make you eat faster.  plus, anything on the corner of geary and leavenworth is an adventure in and of itself.
author: Janet K.

description: This place sucks. Food is mediocre, service is wack. not recommended
author: Wats C.

description: i've only gone to one restaurant in san francisco.  osha thai.  i've been there 75 times.
author: Charles C.

description: I love this location. I'll preface that I've only done take out because I don't like hanging around the area too late at night. This location is cheaper than the others & tastes better. ITS TRUE~! EVERYTHING tastes better in the Tenderloin than everywhere else. I like how it is spicy (not as spicy as Thai spicy, but spicier than American spicy)...and tastes fresh! Pumpkin curry is good, salads are good, oh i guess almost everything i"ve had here is good.
author: Jeannette L.

description: pineapple fried rice and bbq chicken ftw!  consistently excellent
author: Alan V.

description: try the pumpkin curry !! great place to bring friends/family visting the city
author: Annie C.

description: Trendy and re-engineered Thai, but fresh and tasty.  I'm usually found at hole-in-the-wall joints, but this place reminded me that even hip and trendy places sometimes serve really good food.  Wish they the music were less aggressive, though.
author: Andrea P.

description: Yay for pumpkin curry and tofu! I have been to a few of Osha's locations, and food is always spot on. The ambiance varies by each area though...
author: Kristina G.

description: This place is always yummy.  Lighter than most thai food which is why I like it,  not so much oil in the cooking.  For the price definitly one of the better place you are going to find.  A definite recomend from me on this one!  If you are a fan of Pad thai this place is for you.
author: Chris M.

description: I love the food here.  The vegetable spring rolls are crisp and taste great.  I've gotten everything ranging from currys to pad thai to the green curry fried rice and it's all been good!  It is, however, sometimes hard to find a table here when it is busy.
author: Michele Y.

description: Completely different atmosphere, food, and prices compared to its sister restaurants also by the name of Osha.  This is my fall back spot, especially for late night.  It's fast, inexpensive, and always hits the spot.
author: LT B.

description: It was okay. This one in the TL is cheaper than the one in FiDi. Pretty good..nothing special though. The place looked clean and spacious, and the service was pretty fast.  Good place to go to if you want decent priced Thai food I guess.
author: Connie Y.

description: Although I use yelp a lot to find places to eat, this is the first time I'm writing a review. I went here for lunch today and ordered Thai Boat Noodle Soup. I took a bite and noticed it was minty and thought maybe they put mint leaves in the soup. I took another bite and something didn't feel right so I stirred the noodle and found chewed up gum throughout the noodle. GROSS!!!! I spit everything out of my mouth and showed the waitress the gum. She didn't seem too concerned and took it back without saying anything. I asked her how that could happen the next time she came around and she said she didn't know. The last part of the whole gross experience was I asked for the check and she charged me for the soup!!! I refused to pay made her take the soup off my bill and now I got home and I can still taste the gum in my mouth. Needless to say, I won't be going there anymore and you might want to look in your soup for odd things if you eat there.
author: Candy A.

description:
we had the angel wings, green curry, crab fried rice & spicy green beans.  the spicy green beans were great!  everything else was pretty good.
we did take out but next time, i think we'll eat in - it looks a lot nice than the pics posted here on yelp (? recent redo)
would recommend it if you're looking for yummy food not far from union square - especially late at night
author: j k l.

description: This place ROCKS!!  My favorites are the spicy chicken (or any meat) string beans over rice, chicken noodle soup (extra garlic and silver noodles on mine), and curry puffs are all so good - I'm about to drool now.  They have a lady cook during the day, I call her Mama and another cook at night but they both hook it up.  The food is prepared really quickly and gets to your table pipping hot.  I could really give a s*** about the decor and what color the chairs are. The food is so good that they could have me sit on the floor and I'd do it because the food is awesome.  I've tried other Thai places and the food is either too greasy, not spicy enough, or something just isn't working but not Osha Thai.  The fact that it stays open till at least 3am (!!!!) is super cool on its own.  Every time I go, which is quite often, considering I live in San Ramon, I ask the staff "When are you opening a location in the E. Bay?"
author: Roxy I.

description: Great food but it is a fish market, cant really talk. The ambience is good but then there is a lot of noise to really enjoy it.
author: Rags G.

description: their noodles and curry are not distinguished from other thai in the city, but some items that i find that im fond of are thier osha sausage appetizer and the crab fried rice.  open quite late on the weekends makes it nice for when youre hugry after 2am.
author: christopher a.

description: Great Thai food for a good price. I have only been to the location on 2nd street, and have yet to be disappointed.   It can get a bit crowded during lunch time, but relaxing atmosphere in the evenings after most people who work in the city go home.  The green curry is excellent and the service is excellent as well.  Be careful where you sit, however, as I had a little bit of an embarrassing experience when I brought some people from work there and we sat next to the group of elephant statues....yes, next to the statue bearings his large...you get my drift.  In all, a great place to have a relaxing meal!!
author: Jeff M.

description: Probably still the best Osha Thai.  Tried their other locations and I always come back here.  The flavor is pretty consistent and the noodles never disappoint.  Get it spicy!
author: Sandra G.

description:
overall, delicious.
number 32 is almost always on point, with egg noodles.
cashew chicken is a must as well as the fried won tons.  and you cannot go wrong with the pad thai.
only thing i've had that i didn't enjoy were the silver noodles.  kinda gross.
viva la osha!
author: Karl H.

description: the food is good here and the fact that they are open late is awsome because I hate burgerzzz.
author: Yodel P.

description: I came here recently with some friends from out of town, and I would definitely second the complaints about the service - the whole experience was cold and rushed, not  the sit-down pleasant meal you want to have with visiting friends. The Valencia st location has a more pleasant ambiance, and better (but more showy) decor. This place is neither stylish nor homey. The food is pretty good, definitely abundant and very filling, the ingredients are of good quality, but it lacks the extra attention or care that would make it something really worth going out of your way for. I would stop in if I'm in the neighborhood and starving again, but wouldn't choose it over another place otherwise.
author: a r.

description: This place has the best Thai food in town. The food is excellent, cheap and served quickly. Not to mention there's often good music playing. I have never had a bad dining experience here and get carry-out on a near-weekly basis. Now, if only they had some more non-fried appetizers...
author: Elise U.

description: good food... bad people. Once I got a metal thing in my food. I didnt complain to much....but got a free $8 dollar. Thank god I dindt choke. I still go back though.....
author: jon w.

description: My cousine read about this on Yelp and we decided to check it out on a night out with all the cousins during winter break. They have the best lamb dish.... I HAD TO GO BACK THE VERY NEXT DAY to get another nite...lol Their pepper friend lamb is ther best thinf on the face of this planet. It sucks that i live in the east bay and the are all the way in SF, if not i'd be there trying each and everything on the menu. Theri fried coconut ice cream and sticky mango rice is a delight for dessert. I love the fact that they are open late into the night as not that many places are. However it does get a little crazy with an influx of the nightclubbers.
author: ash n.

description: This use to be a restaurant I frequented a lot a few years ago, but the last time I was there which was about a year ago it just wasn't the same as it once was.  Back when this place was a tiny hole in the wall the food was great and their pries were reasonable.  Now they've expanded into the next door unit and went through a couple of remodels and I will say that the place does look a lot nicer than in the beginning, however their food isn't so great anymore and even though their prices are still reasonable I won't be coming back because of the downgrade in the taste of their food.  Their Pad Thai was always way too sweet for my liking and I have ordered that dish from time to time just to see if they adjusted the amount of sugar they put in that dish.  Still that dish is way too sweet and a disappointment for my wallet.  Service was always just ok, but the food does come to table very fast and is typical of Thai restaurants anyways.  Parking is a challenge since this place is in the heart of the Tenderloin and near the theater district.  Place is open late night so this good for weekend club and bar hoppers.  How does the saying go again?  "if it ain't broke don't fix it and if it is please do"
author: Adam G.

description: My favorite place, better than all the fancy sister-restaurants which boast the same menu but somehow lack the charm of this gem in the middle of the 'loin. Open till crazy late, fast service, and some freaky customers after midnight. But best of all the greatest Thai in the city at impossibly low prices. MMMM.
author: Alessandra I.

description: God I love Osha! I seriously come here like every month.  I heard that this one in the TL was their first location.  And then it caught on.  I try to always eat at this particular osha because it has the most character.  However it is not as classy as some of the other ones.  The food is really fantastic, and usually everyone that I go with here ends up liking it as equal as me.  Stop in and grab some!  You won't regret it!
author: Jeremy V.

description: pretty delicious, but my curry was all sauce and not anything else...kind of expensive for some curry sauce ya know?
author: Chris H.

description: i love this place.  the food is the best.  it is affordable and it's open late.  the only thing i don't like about the place is the service can be hit or miss.  been there a bunch of times and had great service and been there a few times and waited for a beer until after the food was almost done.  another thing is that it is so loud it was hard to get a hold of my waitress/waiter.  i would recommend the fishcakes for an appetizer.  maybe the best in the city.  overall one of the best deals in the city.
author: Anthony Y.

description: always cook everything perfectly - even at 3am.  and very speedy.  pad see ew was great
author: tal d.

description: the food was pretty good...but the time when u go inside the rest room...ugh..so smelly!!!!!
author: mark k.
